gKkJ06cL9YFeVI2Uc8M3iQ.text: The Adobo Fried Rice. Omg. So good! Well seasoned and hearty! I ate half of it there and the other half later. Just thinking about it is making me salivate. The only problem was that it took a minute for me to finally dig into it when it was delivered to my table as I sat there with no utensils. My server walked by me. I was hoping she noticed I was just sitting there staring at this delicious looking/smelling goodness that I could not eat. Nope. So I had to ask. Maybe she was too busy?   Anyway, I paired it with the red velvet pancakes. It's as amazing as everyone says it is. There were many other pancakes I wanted to try. I was actually torn between ordering the red velvet and the Orange creamsicle. Feeling like I had to make a decision, I chose the red velvet. After that, I decided I wanted to switch to the Orange creamsicle. Yes, that is annoying, but I decided I wanted to try the Orange creamsicle more. I asked if it was too late, and she straight up said "yeah"... Um... Ooookay then. While the red velvet was in fact tasty, I wasn't satisfied. I was filled with regret of not being able to try the Orange creamsicle.   My server was really nice, but I wish she was more accommodating about me wanting to switch my pancakes. I did enjoy my food a lot tho. Definitely obsessed with the adobo fried rice! I wanna try more of the pancakes so hopefully I'm back in the area again soon. I guess next time I'll come in with a game plan of exactly what I want.

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Adobo Fried Rice.

b2aoaSDqBUsElPYf8BY8zQ.text: Always crazy busy.  I don't like sitting at a 2 seater table. I like having space to move. Such a spoiled brat am I. Lol last time I was in at this location and at another location I wasn't satisfied with Lolo's Adobo Fried rice omelette. So, I got A Veggie Garden omelette which was good but nothing to rave about. My niece got the cookie butter pancakes. Mmmmmm..... Move over red velvet, cookie butter is in the house! That was good! Next time, I'm doing just cookie butter pancakes.  Mediocre.

tY015GOHQl0m2nQsv4AyCA.text: Ironically enough after eating at their location on Buffalo just yesterday, a friend asked me out to breakfast today at Babystacks at the Stephanie location. Just as much as I regretted eating there yesterday at the Buffalo location, I regretted coming to this one even more ((if that's even possible)). Upon walking in, the decor in the restaurant is very tacky. It looks like someone went into the cheesy home section at multiple Walmart and picked out sets of decorations (signs with tacky quotes like "peace, love happiness" and a clock with rainbow mustaches on it on the opposing wall... just to paint the picture..), none of which matching each other. The service was some of the worst I've ever had. The server with a giant red hairspray Afro came to our table maybe once the entire time. I specially asked for syrup and butter for my pancakes when I ordered them because I learned my lesson from yesterday In the fact that they don't bring you anything you need to dine. When my order came out, surprise! No butter and no syrup FOR MY PANCAKES. They're pancakes!! How can you forget that? Our server was no where to be found, shock! So after waiting 5+ minutes I had to go up to the bar area and ask someone to bring some out and by that time my pancakes were so cold that the butter wouldn't spread, *sigh*. The awful service was then followed by awful food! In my first review of the buffalo location, the tasty pancakes saved them from being a total waste of time but this time, my red velvet pancakes tasted super dry and the chocolate powder they used seemed like they got to the bottom of the barrel and sprinkled the left over crumbs on my pancakes. The sausage tasted awful, like someone literally made me microwaveable sausage. Overall the terrible flow of the restaurant, awful waiter, and terrible food was enough to make sure I NEVER come back regardless of what location it is. Safe yourself the time and go literally anywhere else.

3ZXHHq8ZoZtsi3fY1xVM6g.text: Been here a couple times and they have so many menu options. I tried the kalua pig grilled cheese and it's the one menu item I always order. It's filled with so much meat and cheese in just the perfect ratio. The pancakes no matter what version you go with is always light and fluffy. My go to breakfast spot.

M_Z4GeJ7VJCKzGal7V-9lQ.text: Been here probably 4 times. Its our go to brunch before leaving Vegas. Pancake was superb and the loco moco chili is delicious. Also try their adobo burrito something like that is also good. Its crowded in the weekend but weekdays has no wait or maybe 5-10 mins wait. Be back again on our next Vegas trip.

AJrqRHLAJLQaa7PS8JrbDg.text: Expect a long wait but it's so worth it! We had the breakfast burrito with Portuguese sausage and Loco Moco. Both were delicious! Also had the lemon ricotta pancakes which broke da mouth! So ono!!!

JsQ_CigG2vXuYA9y28yKnQ.text: Tasty breakfast. Service was fast and attentive. I would have given it 5 stars but we had a seat directly behind the patio door. So close that the door blocks you in your seat when it's open. There was a near constant stream of people in and out, and a hefty whoosh of cold air along with it. Breakfast was colder quicker than it needed to be, and the cool breeze in the morning became pretty annoying by the time we left.   The pancakes were delicious and tasted like pancakes should. It was obvious they were freshly made. The breakfast scramble I had included "crispy bacon" according the menu - and it was! I wondered if it would really be crispy when I ordered and was happy to see it was. The avocado on my breakfast was ripe, the potatoes crispy and the egg cooked just as I ordered it.  Coffee and drinks were promptly filled and tasted freshly made.  It was a little on the noisy side, with so many people in a fairly small space.  We'll be sure and visit again - and sit in a different spot next time.

WH5AdICmRcIL71Qbw4FOpA.text: Watch out I hop here comes babystacks!! I rarely go out for breakfast but when I do , it better be good. Baby stacks was just that, great pancakes fair prices and huge portions. Had the banana pancakes full stack which were amazing. Syrup is sweet but not too sweet. The full stack was gigantic and was enough to tide me over for the whole day. The place gets VERY crowded on the weekend but it's great food so that's to be expected. All the staff was very friendly and provided prompt service. WILL GLADLY GO BACK for their red velvet pancakes.

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Banana pancakes full stack

C8ya8ouTfWXD0gpIuF6PZw.text: All I can say is Yum!! Polynesian food and breakfast with an American punch! Seriously the only downfall is the size of the Resteraunt! It's always packed so come about 1 hour before you are actually hungry! I had the eggs Benedict and Lemon ricotta pancakes and I was in heaven!!! I always recommend Baby Stacks when family comes into town!!!

bNy4kbx8yBeYt4-qXlvVfA.text: The food was delicious! We got so much food for a really good price. I left the restaurant so full and satisfied. There are so many varieties of just the pancakes alone that it was so hard to choose what I wanted. Everything sounded so good!  Their corned beef was delicious and my egg was cooked perfectly the way I ordered. I got the white chocolate pancakes--they were very sweet and incredibly delicious. It makes my mouth water just thinking about it!  The service was great, and everyone was incredibly friendly. They were happy to answer all of our million questions! I really enjoyed our experience there!

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. White chocolate pancakes.
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States

-JrJBsQym-xQaKxIZ7uNvw.text: Absolutely loved the food and service at this little trendy restaurant. There was a 30 minute wait, but it was on a Saturday morning. Hostess' at the front were apologetic and did their best to make sure we were updated and happy. Great customer service all-around. Girlfriend and I ordered Red Velvet pancakes and Port. sausage plate, both were delicious and fairly priced.   Will definitely be coming back!

VV4IKgL90nbvFNmpYzIU_A.text: We go here all the time, so much so that one of the servers, Efrain, recognizes us. It makes the experience much better when someone asks you how you have been and takes care of you the way he does. He makes you feel relaxed and smooths over any issues.  The food is always good and as non-believers in red velvet cupcakes, we are in love with the red velvet pancakes! Definitely our regular spot!

OKO5WclUVcjyg53C8Ob2Nw.text: I usually go to the Buffalo location but this time I went to this location with my sister. The wait time was about 15 minutes which I wasn't surprised because Babystacks is always busy whenever I go. The food is amazing. I usually get the Huntington Omelette with red velvet pancakes instead of regular pancakes. It is an extra charge but soooo worth it. The Nutella crepe is pretty tasty as well.   My husband and I did go to the Buffalo location and they did let us add different stuff to our Nutella crepes which was really nice cause sometimes places don't allow it or they make a huge fuss. Just the only down fall usually after 10am it's jam packed. If you've got the patience I highly recommend!!

X_LAhC_0-NmmN3Xg7CMSvg.text: Liliana our server was awesome !! Amazing customer service . Staff very friendly, and most importantly the food is amazing . It was me and boyfriends first time here,  we come from San Diego.  I really recommend this place.  Delicious,  thanks Liliana for the amazing service. We have been having horrible service everywhere else , we will definitely be coming back .

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States

hPOLaiw1qic3MkIsBPEeNg.text: The food is AMAZING!!! Let me stress....AAAMMMMAAAZZZZIIINNNGGG! My friends have been here a couple times before and raved about this place so it was our first stop after landing. We ordered 2 Loco Mocos, 1 Lolo Rick Adobo, 2 Macadamia Nut Short Stacks, & 1 Banana Foster Short Stack. Everything and I mean EVERYTHING tastes like a slice of heaven. Think Sarah Michelle Gellar cooking effect in Simply Irresistible. The food puts you in a joyful trance where the taste is so amazing you cannot find the proper words. I never would have thought to smother eggs in gravy layered above beef patties and garlic rice. It was savory. Then you mix the sweetness of the banana foster pancakes. Man oh man! Life doesn't get much better. The waitress was nice. The only negative is it too a while for us to get our food. People who were seated right before us and even some afterwards not only had their food way before us but by the time we got ours they were finished. We are already making plans to return. Also they have a good selection of music flowing through the speakers. I normally do not pay attention to that but there was one song that got my attention. I am not sure of the name but it was reggae style.

cawzgWAX-QDrCAFRfy0K3A.text: Every time I visit Vegas, I have to come to Babystacks with my family. It's a small restaurant that does not take reservations, goes on a first come, first serve basis and your whole party must be there in order to be sat. Understandable. I put my name down for 5 people, the hostess told me it was a 20-25 min wait. 15 mins later, she asked if my whole party was here yet. I responded "They're exiting the freeway right now so probably another 5 mins." The hostess looked at me with a disgusted expression and blatantly rolled her eyes. I know your whole party must be present to be sat, so I would have understood if she had to skip over my name. I totally get that it's one of your busier days but the level of customer service that I received from the hostess was unsatisfactory. My server was really nice and attentive so it really made up for the shitty hostess. Hopefully next time I visit, she fixes her attitude.

JrEC9rnSWEMgPPPyuwQTaA.text: Best breakfast place for pancakes! I'm not even a pancake person, but I love babystacks!!

ttsSdHvuK7VTRmFkSX55oA.text: Cute location,  great food.  It looks super small and busy,  but we didn't wait too long for a table.  It was worth it,  because the food and service was great. I will be back!

_ali9ec3agx07WxqArP0dA.text: The food was okay. I got buttermilk pancakes, house potatoes, spam and eggs. The spam was waaaay over-fried and too crispy for me. The pancakes were good but dry. Make sure you have a lot of water when eating one. I usually say breakfast food is hard to mess up, but in their case, they somehow didn't get it quite right.

SLn6syeUjBYqNYzdLHejkw.text: Probably the best stack of pancakes I've ever had. I got chocolate chip. The chocolate was not so overpowering. It's been over 24 hours and I'm still thinking about them ahhahah

gND3SLKkFiiFIqf5vkJTGw.text: Skillet breakfast w/ pancakes - both were exceptionally ho-hum.  Service was noteworthy: it was worse than the meal.  I'll stay home next time (my pancakes are world class) or go back to the best breakfast joint in town - The Original Sunrise Cafe.

R2IZeAXKIaIUUHEyvcHNhg.text: Food and service were excellent. Didn't have to wait for a table, everything was delicious, friendly staff, good music, pleasant ambience, and they had the World Cup game on tv. I had the two egg breakfast with strawberry pancakes. The whipped cream & syrup tasted incredible and fresh, pancakes were delicious, seasoned potatoes were delicious, waitress was attentive, I just wish I had ordered more pancakes :)

UtcVVOx1Gfqd86l58CtqsQ.text: We went in on a Sunday, apparently a very busy day. We were told the wait would be 30-35 minutes. No big deal.   It was hot/stuffy in the waiting area, which is one small bench and something like 3 chairs. It was difficult to determine if people were in line to pay, put their names in, or were just waiting for seating. Additional seating for those waiting might be a good idea - like some benches or chairs outside, since there is no room inside.   They turned tables fairly quickly, so that was nice.   We were seated at the table that is right at the end of the wall separating the dining area from the waiting area. It felt a little awkward to be sitting in the seat just past the wall... but that could have just been me.   The server came by and was friendly and efficeint.   I ordered the bacon and eggs meal with garlic rice and a side of pancakes with peanut butter (not the chocolate chip peanut butter pancakes). The portions were nice - satisfying - I didn't feel like I would be overeating or having to decide which portion of the meal to take home and eventually waste (I'm weird about leftovers).   I didn't feel like the garlic rice was as spectacular as others have made it seem, and I definitely don't think adding a few pieces of onion and a little garlic is work an extra $1, but I am admittedly cheap.   I also had to ask for more syrup, as the amount they give you is maybe enough for 2 bites, not 2 pancakes.   I don't remember what the husband got, but I do know he felt it was a little pricey for the amount you received.   Ultimately, it's a decent breakfast place and I'm sure we'll be back from time to time, but at the moment it's not a "top choice" list.

flFhN5_8PR3uqMh7M960Bw.text: Their pancakes are always amazing & the sizes are perfect for a side or a full stack as a meal. Each pancake is about the size of a coffee cup saucer. The locations are fairly small and can have up to a 30-45 min wait on weekends. Get there early in the morning or around 1 and the crowds are pretty low.

j69JIfkmTUDSB9ZwqEYvmA.text: I've been to this place a few times now and have not been disappointed yet.  The food is great and definitely enough to fill you up.  The service as well is good in the place I would have to say the only downer is that sometimes there is a bit of a wait...But other than that its a great place to go to for breakfast (only times I've gone is for breakfast).  The pancakes they have are very flavorful as well as their skillets.  These are the only things I've ordered so far because there's so much variety just within those 2 things.  This place is a must go to.

hxVtbOYFe-KXlFXCur6r0w.text: I stood and waited to be seated for more than 5 mins while multiple employees stared at me. Shitty customer service, I came in at 1pm where it was not busy at all

GPOpvO5ALwdCzcaN6PkdpA.text: I almost hate to recommend this restaurant because it may make them too busy! Their food is amazing, service is always great and if you are a breakfast lover this place is a CAN'T MISS!

V7s83xuEUVCH4K_X5U7mmA.text: Our fav breakfast place-always worth the wait! German chocolate pancakes are dreamy/delicious/amazing!  Very moist and melts in your mouth. My man enjoys the loco moco and I also enjoy the spam eggs on garlic fried rice. They need more locations in Henderson or a larger restaurant.

28XxUC7Wp9EppQiwUK4vlg.text: Had Sunday brunch here with my girls, restaurant was packed but we managed to get seats in 10-15 minutes which wasn't bad.  Waitress was quick to service us, my friends had red velvet pancakes and crepes.  I went for the Hazelnut pancakes which were amazing!  I like how there is a hawaiian selection on menu like loco moco and adobo!  Will definitely go back to try it again next time I have people in town visiting!

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Hazelnut pancakes with strawberries

bl_azU1q12TNQMeGgWgOTg.text: I'm guessing I had all my calorie intake for the day... Definitely worth it! Red velvet pancakes were amazing! Guys up front were friendly, our waitress was great. I'd definitely have breakfast here again. Cons small place but again it was great! Packed.

OYyhr-gzR-nTrU77NVKz4Q.text: I'm so excited literally never had these feelings about a restaurant before so I apologize if this is frantic. We are waiting for our food now--holy cow it just arrived!! Okay I'm going to eat it now. Stay tuned yelp! Dangggg it looks gr8

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Taking orders like it ain&#39;t no thang--what can I say, top-notch, baby-caliber service
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Baby&#39;s tacks is poppin!

w3WHOlHpd0cwLSh9gynNCQ.text: This was our first visit to babystacks and we will definitely be back. I thoroughly enjoyed the corned beef hash and my poached eggs were perfectly prepared. I also had the carrot cake pancakes and couldn't recommend them enough. My wife ordered the club with some stellar fries. Seriously,  those fries were the hit of the table.  Where this place really shined was the service. Valerie was excellent, and ensured that we had an amazing dining experience. Even the cashier struck up conversation and had a smile on his face throughout the transaction.

F9r9LC1X5z71MyMrhP5Kuw.text: One of our favorite breakfast places to go. The smores pancake is really good and one of the best. The Adobe fried rice is really good too.

kCy81kgbXOEcAAAA8QpHGA.text: Ordered the piglet skillet, with the buttermilk pancakes.. Quick Carlos was on point this am.. Great service, great breakfast. Calm, laid back atmosphere, accommodating. Get there early for a good seat, not a really large place. Been to both locations and the signature dishes are all pretty good.. I'd recommend for a great early am breakfast, keep it light and keep it moving!!

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Leftovers, lol

D5DEvWrqPy4t9ogCKDGBZA.text: This is my second time going to a Babystacks, the first location I went to Durango and it didn't think it was horrible so I wanted to check out the location in Henderson.   I feel like the long wait for a table on the weekends are inevitable, so be ready to wait and make sure that your whole party is there so once the table is ready you can go party with your pancakes and eggs. The food was OK, nothing extraordinary but I do favor their pancakes AND I'm a waffle kind of girl, so it's a kindaaaaaaaaa a huge deal!   The decor is quaint and some tables are wobbly but their workers are sweet and very friendly and when you've been waiting an hour to sit down, those are the kind of people you need to be serving you. Overall good experience, and I definitely recommend their pancakes & adobo fried rice

SZhoTr1I_Su2rbcfbfpNkg.text: Great food, comes fast once you order. This is now the 3rd location but the first in Henderson. There is usually a 25-30 minute wait no matter which location you arrive at. Very much worth the wait!

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Outside pic of the Henderson location on Stephanie

XLqeRhgxsCMAhOLao8fCXg.text: Let me start by saying how thrilled I am that there is another excellent place in Henderson to have breakfast.  I was most impressed with the extensive and creative menu.  I enjoyed a pork Benedict, while my girlfriend had a very nice omelet.  I'm already looking forward to our next visit and trying out perhaps some of their other Hawaiian oriented things...maybe a little Spam and Eggs ;-)  The service was excellent, the place was clean and prices very reasonable.

DicOiB3L1zonXe8l_VxBDw.text: This is A must for me at least once a week! Huevos rancheros, phenomenal. So many different flavored pancake choices it hard to chose!

XRCgMSIv7rSD3rfb9KX5WA.text: Greatly little breakfast place. Nice variety on the menu, everyone got what they wanted. Service was great and we even enjoyed our servers pink plume hair style. Will definitely visit this place again.

HyfKtZ_LFkYWyzUW4Ahi7w.text: We went here for breakfast and of course I had to try the red velvet pancakes I kept reading about. They were definitely good. Friendly staff. It was a little busy when we arrived. I would return and try their other items.

Urvmqy0rt3ukxw-K1bP88A.text: The hype is real lol. Great customer service, even though we waited for about 30 minutes for a table the staff made sure that we would be seated soon and even though they were super busy somehow they still had a smile on their faces. We tried the adobo fried rice, Loco moco, red velvet pancakes and their cookies n cream pancakes. The adobo fried rice was flavorful, you can taste the traditional adobo flavors and the garlic fried rice. I'm not a huge fan of red velvet BUT I'm glad I tried it, you can actually taste the red velvet flavor and it wasn't too sweet even with the cream cheese frosting on the side. The cookies n cream pancakes tastes exactly like an oreo, you will not be disappointed. The Loco moco was okay, maybe we'll try the chili one next time. If you want a filling meal away from the strip you must stop by here, they have multiple locations!

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Lunch time

0HzUIwJh5hpGNiyokMdvxA.text: Had a wonderful experience at Babystacks. We were lucky enough to score some seats at the breakfast bar, so we didn't have to brave a wait. I'd like to start by mentioning that this spot is very family friendly. Which I love. We were greeted by our server and he quickly served us our coffee.  () We had strawberry pancakes which were delicious. My daughter got buttermilk pancakes which were also super tasty. I'm personally not huge on sweet breakfasts, but I can honestly say I really enjoyed tasting their sweet treats.   I ordered the breakfast burrito and replaced the meat with refried beans. I choose the green salsa to go with my burrito, and seasoned potatoes as my side. Let me just tell you guys- the burrito exceeded my expectations. It was super delicious. The green salsa is literal perfection. Seriously, I wanted to drink it. Okay, not really- but I actually ordered another side of it so that I could put it over my seasoned potatoes.  If you order more of a savory breakfast I highly suggest ordering it with the green salsa!   The service was prompt, the staff is friendly, and the food did not disappoint. We will absolutely be back for breakfast.

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Breakfast burrito, substitute the meat for refried beans. Super yum.
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Strawberry pancakes!

ZkU-ndFjVmWEY9ezrBYXeA.text: Found this place on yelp before our drive back to Cali. Glad I found this spot. The wait was around 20 minutes, the service was great and the food was delicious! I ordered banana pancakes with chocolate chips inside, seasoned potatoes and coffee. Everything was so good! I would definitely reccomend this breakfast place!

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Banana chocolate chip pancakes and seasoned potatoes, so delicious!

7SW9Y-NgjMgSBq6BM44NPg.text: Cabbage sauteed in butter, eggs over medium, ham, bacon, Portuguese sausage, and avocado smothered in hollandaise and coffee with heavy cream. A PERFECT KETO breakfast created from the sides menu for under $20 and everything was super delicious! Definitely coming back!

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. AN AWESOME HIGH-YIELD, POST WORKOUT KETO BREAKFAST created from the side dishes menu.

-neWTbTBljEdOFyNq1K0Ww.text: The food was delicious. I tried to schedule a reservation but they don't do reservations. I waited 10 minutes but it was worth the wait. I went with my girls and the customer service was friendly and the atmosphere is fun. We really enjoyed the food. Our waiter was Juan and he was the best. I loved his enthusiasm. The food was just to die for. Definitely would come back here. It does get very crowded but I see why.

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Huevos Rancheros* Beans are hidden under tortilla
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Breakfast Burrito* with extra side of Seasoned Potatoes
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Cookie Butter French Toast with side of (3) Bacon

K3L_sYoGwM1EenxDR9D5ww.text: This spot has been consistently good to me and my family.  Portions are huge. Service always comes with a smile. The locals who come here are so sweet.  Everyone is so nice.  This past week when we last visited, our waiter was excellent. I'm just sorry that I didn't catch his name. Anyway, not only did he make some great suggestions and provide us with great service but he also did a wonderful job at making sure that we had everything that we needed for our daughter to be able to enjoy her dining experience as well.  He bought out extra napkins, a few spoons, water without any ice, etc.  This spot gets pretty full.  I have come in the middle of the week and on weekends.  It has always been busy and there has almost always been a short wait.  The longest that I have waited is about 15 minutes.  The menu is extensive and I'd suggest that you take a peek at it while you are waiting.  The fact that I can always upgrade my pancakes to a speciality one for such a tiny cost, I have beeb meaning to try more and more of them.  This time around I had their strawberry pancake. I know it sounds super basic and I guess you could say that it is but damn was it good!! Our eggs and bacon were cooked to perfection. Everything was so delicious. You can tell it's a real family spot.  Others dining in the restaurant are all so friendly, waving at other people's children and saying hi and what not. My daughter got a bit restless and wanted to take a lap around the restaurant, no problem. She did and waved at almost everyone there if she didn't give them all high fives or fist bumps. What can I say? She's SUPER social!  Anyway, they were all friendly and returned the gesture. Some asked her how old she was, what her name was, etc.  To me, aside from the good food and the great service, having the best customers with awesome attitudes is what makes the restaurant a real gem. See you soon!

8AvD-3txTTrt1Mm7Qfz_JA.text: This place is amazing ! The steak and eggs I had were cooked perfectly. We also ordered the Nutella strawberry banana crepes, they were SO delicious! I will definitely be coming back to try more of the menu options. They have such a wide variety of food! The food came out so fast considering it was packed with people. The only reason this is getting 4 stars is because of the fact that the place is really small, crowded, and extremely loud, and they didn't wipe down our table before seating us, just cleared the plates (they were extremely busy though). Other than that everything was amazing.

SenHzmAg7ypYZ1b1D_c9Qw.text: Something I do not need... True dat. But, man are they good??? Naw. That's not the word. The word has to Awesome! I have to say, you guys have it going on. And the worst thing you can do to something that works is to try to fix it. Right?  Please stay just like you are and you'll never have to worry. You carry yourselves well....

Laarl-oZ7CdxbHGZTi0SNw.text: Stopped here today with my cousin, ordered the hmf omelette and the red velvet pancakes. The omelette I could take it or leave it but I'm giving 5 stars bc of the amazing pancakes. The softest fluffiest pancakes I've ever had. Heaven in your mouth. If I was a Vegas resident I'd be here all the time.

SMl4gbuyVSt_uB8HLWMyUQ.text: The banana foster pancakes were yummy.  Everything we had was good.  Service was fine.We had a nice experience. I would go back.

NvnCmpPKaBxikMLoCVNUQQ.text: In Henderson for a soccer tournament enjoyed Baby's two days straight. Awesome service, numerous breakfast selections and delicious food. Too many pancake, benedict varieties to list. House made hash rocks, red velvet, buttermilk cakes fluffy, just get toppings on side to control sweetness on the specialty cakes. Service is great, with a friendly attentive wait staff and even wait times are minimal. Nice twist on breakfast, just good food.

FviCOAUVMuM6QW_wXZniGg.text: The restaurant is very clean. The front was a little congested but it's a small building and it's understandable. We received our food so fast and I think I ate it just a quick. I had the cookie butter French toast and a short stack of orange creamsicle pancakes! Service was great! Smiles and made sure we were all set and was very efficient! We will definitely be back here for sure! The baby cakes were the best. "They were so fluffy, I thought I was going to die!"

A7xwqNcUin1wX-t9nv2PTQ.text: I use to travel all the way to the southwest side of town to visit baby cakes..I'm glad they have one close to my place but just wasn't impressed.the service was good but my Benedict's was swimming in hollandaise sauce. I have been to the other 2 locations and their food is way better.

yeVG7V_wk_Tc_PeVbLz9Fg.text: Oh babystacks how I love thee! Pancakes of all sorts to satisfy all tastes. This is a breakfast place but all of the pancakes tastes like dessert so much that you forget you're eating pancakes. So if you like that kind of stuff, do yourself a goodie and go here.   Prepare to wait to be seated at any of the locations. Servers are excellent and other staff is friendly.   Too bad this place is not in LA yet- they

sfWXeLd36AyAITHcEQDdOg.text: Place is good, way too small, you have to wait way too long just to get a table. I feel like once you get seated they try to rush you out.

ycnZifgfAzxd1rq_V89uZg.text: Nicole is a terrific server.   I was craving a breakfast burrito,  I'm always concerned about the burritos sizes.   All I can say is I was full after my breakfast burrito, I got sausage for the meat part.  It's delicious I'm happy with my overall experienced, I also love the fact that Nicole came up to me and asked if it tasted good. Two thumbs up!!! That shows me that she cares about how I'm enjoying the food which makes me feel welcomed and loved!

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. It filled my tummy up and it tasted good that all it counts!!!

ZP0_zLpbzITeun9SAS0fSQ.text: If Yelp had half stars, this review would be 3.5 stars not 3. We came in on Sunday morning & waited for about 20 minutes for a table for 2. Our overall experience was good and our server was nice & checked up on us with good timing.   The reasoning for my 3.5 stars is -1 star for the Crispy Buffalo Chicken Sandwich.. it wasn't very good and was more like 2 (not so crispy) chicken strips smothered in buffalo sauce & thrown on the bun.. and the lettuce they used was all chopped up so everything was falling out. The sandwich was just a let down and it basically ruined my whole meal because I was getting so frustrated with it.   BUT. We also ordered Lolo Rick's Adobo Fried Rice, which was amazing!! And we upgraded the side to the White Chocolate Chip Macadamia Nut Pancakes, which was also good!   -0.5 star for someone who forgot our extra plates. Why ask us if we need anything else if you don't plan on coming back? I won't point out who, but prior to coming in I've read a couple of bad reviews directed toward this person already.   All in all, I would've gave the 5 stars if it wasn't for these issues..

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Lolo Rick&#39;s Adobo Fried Rice (must try), White Chocolate Macadamia Nut Pancakes (yum), and Crispy Buffalo Chicken Sandwich (don&#39;t bother)

fSp5VLsSee8T6SOVxM6Sxg.text: If you're awake for breakfast, brunch, or lunch, I highly recommend this place! They have a wonderful huge selection on their menu, including island type breakfast selections! (Ex. Portuguese sausage, corned beef, loco moco!) They even have an immense variety of special pancakes such a red velvet, cookies and cream, banana's foster, etc!   I come here with my brother and we like to get an entree order and substitute regular pancakes or potatoes with their special pancakes. If you're like me and some other out there that get rice with their meal, they have an option to sub regular white rice for Garlic rice! Such a good switch!  Overall delicious food, fast seating wait times, food comes out at a normal wait time, simple and sweet decor, nice island music feels to get your morning going, and well priced! Try it out :)

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Breakfast burrito with potatoes and green sauce !
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Loco moco &amp; pancakes on the side!

K6D6_12Lo-oj_-VwtLiFSw.text: Babystacks one of my favorite favorite breakfast places!!!!!!! We are always seated fast, food comes out on descent time and no problems with their service. Their menu is great with a lot to choose from. Their pancakes are a must try!!! I've gone to both locations Centennial and Henderson a couple times and I have no complains. :)

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States

f0c9x3MkH9k-BVisnrsUJg.text: This place is the bombbb! Best pancakes hands down, I have been here so many times and you just can't go wrong. I love their special seasonal flavors, definitely recommend trying something new!

aMajiR8aLaCWLJcWyMqe3A.text: The service at Babystacks is usually really bad, even on weekdays. Go to Egg Works instead! Egg Works has comparable food and way better service.

4fnwtXM3-aXtRcCI50fmIw.text: Babystacks is an amazing cafe! I come here every weekend with my family :,) it is an astonishing atmosphere!

qv3l4b1mui4kEf1AwcdMeQ.text: My entree item: Lolo Rick's Adobo Fried Rice: "A traditional Filipino dish with marinated shredded chicken and rice. It is all wrapped in omelette style eggs!" It definitely is good! *All entrees come with macaroni, potatoes, or upgrade to the baby stacks.*  I came in a party of twelve today at 9:40 am and it was a packed house! Wait time was about 25 min.   At the time the a/c was broken, but they advised us before sitting us. It was 86 degrees inside!!! We should've just ate somewhere else at that point.   PANCAKES: They are great though! It's two slices with most of the flavor on the top piece while the second one is just a plain pancake. (I upgraded to the Red Velvet Pancakes!)

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Egg Benedict (3/5 stars)
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. The delicious ChiliMoco
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Adobo Fried Omelette

2-kQCFyMCxbdxqGcuqBdkg.text: I'm super plain Jane when it comes to pancakes BUT the red velvet pancakes are absolutely amazing. They made it work. Service is also great. Phone died so no pic or check in yet.....but I'll definitely be back

XNeGdS8Q8uiAKcexkUBC1A.text: EHHH, I have definitely had better.   Before we left Nevada, we wanted to grab some American breakfast. My friend lives in Henderson so we decided to give this place a try 608 reviews, 4 stars, whoa. We came there around 12 PM and did not get seated until 1 PM for a part of 4 even though we were told the wait time was only 30 minutes. We noticed there were outside seating and asked if it was quicker to sit outside, the hostess stated yes but that was False. I find the way they seat their guests is extremely flawed which is why the wait is so long. Instead of sliding two tables together to make a table of 4, they would go through the list and seat those whose party is only 2. So they decided to sit all the smaller parties first after pushing a bunch of tables together before seating us. In the end, they sat us at a table that were pushed together. If you were going to do that then why did we wait for over 30 minutes to get seated AFTER you had already sat everyone else who came AFTER us? Makes no sense.   We sat down and the waiter took a bit of time to get to us. We ordered the Banana Cream Pie, Hawaiian Macadamia nut pancakes, Lola Cora's corned beef hash and eggs , loco moco, and their signature adobo fried rice, hash browns, and potatoes. I was told by our waiter that everyone seem to prefer the Lola Cora's corned beef hash and eggs but I didn't see the hype. The corned beef was not well seasoned and tasted very bland. I ordered it with garlic rice and the rice came out soggy and bland as well. I felt the need to drench it in soy sauce or add my own pepper and salt seasoning or ANYTHING because it was so bland. It came with a baby stack of original pancakes which was good. Their signature adobo fried rice was wrapped in an omelets and it came with the options of country potatoes or hash browns. The hash brown was delicious! It was crunchy and fried to perfection. The adobo fried rice itself was okay. There wasn't much texture to it. The banana cream pie was super buttery and sweet. The Hawaiian pancakes were a 3/5 since I have had better. I wish they had added bananas because it would have definitely complete the dish. The loco moco was a huge disappointment. The sausages were a little hard and as previously mentioned, the garlic rice was super soggy. The gravy sauce that came with it was good however I wish all the other components on the plate was equally as tasty.   Overall, I don't see the hype. Customer service were nice however the wait made it not worth it. Food was mediocre.

TFAlj26Bu51T5qggJcIkbg.text: Great food and service every time!  It keeps me coming back.  The pancakes are amazing and there is a variety of flavors and toppings to choose from to satisfy whatever mood you're in.  My favorite is the chili moco with garlic rice and a short stack of their delicious pancakes!  I wash it all down with either a cup of coffee or a tall glass of OJ.

tUXqVSg4H1uNPUtAqPmMYg.text: This is a great breakfast place.  Lolos Adobo Fried Rice is their signature breakfast dish.  This time I ordered the huevos rancheros with carnitas.   It was just ok.  My friend ordered breakfast burrito with chicken and bacon and he said it was very good.

IILJM0BkCdJcL0MB4Q2M1g.text: Good and bad. Good: Food was good, had the Piglet omelet with a babystack side. Omelet was pretty good, a little over done, but it was still good. Pancakes were very plain (I didn't order any fancy toppings) but I really like them that way. I'm kind of a purest in that sense. Stood on their own well. Service was fine. Neither good or bad.  Bad: This location felt REALLY dirty even at 8am and they had only been open an hour. Music was a hair too loud and was like a dance/hip-hop/rap mix. Kinda odd. Bathroom actually made me gag when I walked in there. I had to cover my mouth/nose with my shirt. Coffee was not good either. I have a REALLY low bar for coffee, especially at restaurants like this and this I couldn't drink. I kept sipping it hoping it would get better, but it was awful. I'm not sure how coffee can go bad, but that's kinda what it tasted like... dirty pot? Reheated from the night before? nasty water? I don't know, but I'm honestly not a coffee snob but this was really bad. I wouldn't NOT go back here (or try another location) but based on this experience it would not be my first choice.

_Rd3yyg4weeNhAZyR-GA0A.text: Rating would've been and 3 but they don't take Amex so that drops them down a full star in my reviews.  Wake up people it's 2017 you need to accept Amex!  This location wasn't half as good as their location in Summerlin.  Service was good.  My pancakes didn't come with enough syrup and were kinda dry.  Real skimpy with the coconut as well on my German Choco pancakes

l8YVxPxh0twx6QufuZutWg.text: I was a fan but not anymore. Somewhere between telling me that white unseasoned rice is the same as garlic rice and the flies have turned me off!

edmR3UQmsKeu5Z0TvJTUZA.text: We were heading in to town after a long night of driving.  We didn't want to eat on strip yet, so we found this little place... holy cow, SO worth it!!! I had Nutella crepes, and my boyfriend had a Portuguese sausage breakfast burrito.  We left full and happy!  Service was good, too. Highly recommend if you're looking for a great off strip breakfast spot.

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Nutella Crepes

DxOjKwDzzKAN7oSSTfUzXA.text: The most horrible spot ever. I got the kalbi beef and it was all bone. When I addressed it he waiter said it was all weighed out and he can charge me extra for more. He said  he weighted was the bone and no beef. Being 6 months pregnant I wold like to eat some food for breakfast. They "ran out" of pink lemonade.  The service sucked. I would just go to the one on the Las Vegas side. Way better service and food.

FxzpGR5iW4mpSnug17kfTg.text: This is my go to place when I want a big sweet breakfast. Although the service is average due to that location being busy and next to Sunset Station Casino, the servers do their best to serve you quickly and in a polite manner.  I always order the "Ricks Adobo Fried Rice" and UPGRADE my Pancakes to "Banana Fosters Pancakes" VERY MOUTHWATERING AND DELICIOUS!!!  The restaurant itself is mediocre it is kind of a small area for people to get around when it's busy, and it does get a little bit loud. But it's a great place to eat good breakfast. Bring your family and friends here and you won't be disappointed

U8IwV85dfZFOjVeSd0d9pQ.text: The food is good and had good flavor.  The place itself was really small.  Every time I've gone, there was always at least a 30 min wait. Im sure they'd have more business if they relocated to a bigger space.

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Custom Chicken Skillet. You can add anything you want. It was so good!
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Honey Wheat Pancakes
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Seasoned potatoes

6YvhqPsuzTf8LddWxg93Ng.text: Truly enjoyed the Loco Moco with garlic rice upgrade. A delicious explosion of flavor, through and through. Over easy egg over hamburger steak, over garlic rice, topped with brown gravy.   The regular pancakes are good, the Bananas Foster pancakes were decent, the fried rice omelette was OK, and the chili loco moco was pretty good.   I'd definitely return for the LM and also the great service. Our server may have been the happiest person in Las Vegas. Loco Moco all the way!

9vOB9n4uHc-aBNw2omqv6g.text: Breakfast is the buzz here! and I will keep coming again and again when I visit!  U is for the unchangeable service and delicious food that is served here. This is my third time visiting for breakfast and every time the food quality and the type have been consistent. From the delicious red velvet pancakes to the adobo fried rice and the Portuguese sausage everything is yummy yummy yummy~  Z is the zealous breakfast fan when I am here. The pancakes are seriously divine and picture perfect every time I've been here! The red velvet IS the most popular but that doesn't mean that the other flavors offered aren't good. Where ever your sweet palate takes you go with it! They do have daily specials which are HIGHLY recommended! Though it's not the most manicured nor most appealing on the outside place to eat, DO NOT undermine the yummy possibilities offered here!  Z is for the zZZZz's you will get, the aftermath food coma from the delicious food! The portions here are again generous like the staff and a place to go again and again.   Last BUZZ not least, parking is easy to find. Morning's are busy, so expect a 15-20 min wait to be seated. And always keep an out for their specials, cause they are definitely special and always a good idea!

MXZf6SHqjbq9O1_4A9aDKw.text: Babystacks you did not disappoint! Honestly my new favorite breakfast spot! Can I just say 3 words... RED VELVET PANCAKES! I've been craving these and I finally found a place that serves them! The portion sizes are huge I had the red velvet pancakes, the piglet omelette with breakfast potatoes and some of my boyfriends adobo omelette so good! Prices are very reasonable as well! This place is a MUST TRY! Keep having great service, amazing food, great prices and did I mention the red velvet pancakes? Haha you forever have my business!

npVhA1xEpTMAq52qgvJF0A.text: Worth the wait... and there will probably be a long one. This place has some of the best food I've ever had. Service is always great, staff is friendly, and I've never had any problems. Food comes out pretty quickly, correct - even with custom options, and hot.   I continue to come here because I am obsessed with their Red Velvet Pancakes and insist on sharing them with the world, one breakfast at a time. I make it a point to take visitors here. Weekdays are much less busy, but I don't mind waiting an hour for a plate full of red velvet heaven.   I've had a number of their other breakfast options (various pancake flavors and crepes) and so far everything has been incredible. Thumbs up to a consistently tasty and delicious breakfast spot!

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Red velvet pancakes with bacon and eggs and hash browns :) perfection!
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Cookie butter french toast
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Bacon and eggs :)

sunvmpr1GYypFDHePYrkoA.text: Be prepared for a wait. Pancakes & Nutella crepes are delicious & so was the Hawaiian Benedict. We are taking bites from each other's plates.

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Delicious banana Nutella crepes and Kabila pork benedict

jTCIdp1bB6sSur-fKIRt7A.text: Go at an odd time or get take out!   The times I've been here, albeit during prime brunch hours, have always had a long wait. 30-45 minutes usually but I can imagine it being much worse. (I know it could be worse)  That being said and you being warned, Babystacks is a pretty decent place to grab brunch/breakfast in Henderson!   Located in a strip mall and adjacent to Genghis Grill, their menu has typical breakfast items and has a Hawaiian flare as well with items such as spam, Portuguese sausage and Pork Adobo Fried Rice.  Now back on that Pork Adobo Fried Rice. It's the fried rice wrapped in an omelette. If that sounds amazing to you, it's because it simply is. I've ordered this twice and enjoyed it everytime. It comes with a side of mac salad and your choice of hash browns or seasoned potatoes. You can also sub the sides for an order of pancakes (some may include an extra fee)!  The red velvet pancakes were ok imo. Mine kind of fell apart on me when I tried to cut them and their tastiness was because of the cream cheese syrup.  My one gripe about this place is the early closing time.  2pm everyday?? (3pm on Saturday/Sundays) But still.. I love having breakfast foods throughout the day so that's the bleh part for me.

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Yummy yummy pork adobo fried rice omelette :O
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Take out and eat in the comforts of your own living room to avoid the long line!

LZT1Fc-MzqpE3l-fbiq-DA.text: Baby stacks was delicious!  I had spinach Benedict and loved every bite of it. I'll definitely be going back. The servers were all very friendly. The only thing is the restaurant is small.

4n5xys_lfVMXso8SwwTZvA.text: Some of the best pancakes in the Vegas area, try the peanut butter pancakes with bananas. With so many different pancakes to try you can never go wrong! Great food all around, but really, you come here for the pancakes.

pk2z6tEOpsFYzPdHDPqWtg.text: Delicious, as per usual. I love the variety of eggs benedict offered and how you can add your favorite pancake to any order! Hazelnut pancakes are a must! Nutella makes everything better....right? The staff is always helpful and friendly as well. They treat you like family. :)  My only complaint, my boyfriend got the kahlua pork grilled cheese - it was more like a kahlua pork sandwich with a little cheese added, and the chess wasn't melted.

Mg7g36wB9G-J3kS2tRIEXw.text: It was a good experience. Met a friend of mine and sat at the counter and ended up getting into a conversation with the manager, I think, who was very nice and made some good recommendations. The Mexican skillet was delicious and my friend had the mocoloco, which he swears by. The pancakes were good as well. I got a buttermilk babystack and he got the lemon ricotta which looked tasty, although I didn't try them. My one critique is that the coffee is crap. Breakfast places without good coffee are doing themselves a real disservice in my opinion.

3ORNa7x238PnXEccg0GggA.text: AMAZING!!! Really great variety for breakfast! I have never had bananas foster pancakes like these before! Great food, friendly service and great prices!! Highly recommend!

Z3oNxjw-hPwT5e1yn4iwNQ.text: The sitting situation in this place is ridiculous. If u are a two top u get to wait for 40 min and if a four top opens they give it to somebody that just arrived. This needs to change.

AE4GJ0F4p_21gpEapz1giA.text: Excellent service and delicious food! Food is cheap to moderately priced. The restaurant has four locations in the Vegas valley, and they all have the same theme--Hawaiian fusion, with a variety of other foods. A great place for breakfast and lunch.

uBFHmJBGZRWYQkRjfL46Pw.text: This place has a lot of hype about it and maybe I missed the best stuff on the menu, but I don't think it is anything special. That's just my opinion and clearly other people love this place but I just think there are better breakfast places for the money.

LF-KGL4B4gVOBnnv4rM6eQ.text: Excellent pancakes, great customer service, and all around creative menu. Definitely my go to breakfast spot, I highly recommend this place for breakfast and lunch. Ask for the pancake special of the day!

eZiKHp7a7czQnCWWwc9lWg.text: One of the best breakfast places in the Henderson/Las Vegas area. Prices are better than reasonable and the service and wait staff are excellent. Menu includes many different variations of pancakes as well as great Filipino dishes that remind me of the homeland.

eP7yQ8cgnRti-EngHmaUzw.text: If you're looking for a menu full of diabetes stop here. They don't really have healthy options and the pancakes aren't very good for a place called Bandstand. I wouldn't eat here twice in a lifetime.

46HkJ1Vl4NeBe3O9DtJ1xQ.text: I love this place!!  I've eaten at the buffalo and smoke ranch location and both locations are great!!  I love the potatoes I don't like eggs so I just order the Mexican skillet without eggs and it's delicious!!  My boyfriend always orders the Huntington!!  We come here at least once a week!!  Definitely one of the best breakfast places I've found in vegas!!  If you come early enough you don't have to wait but plan on waiting a while if you come around noon!!  It's worth the wait anyways!!

WKwrP1v78P29DXnV-ty3Cw.text: This place is a decent weekend breakfast standby when on a pinch, or craving cheap & dirty eats....by "dirty" I mean the aftermath of consuming highly processed food. For those who aren't health conscious, there's a line out the door.

zfyPIW3nPg8uvIq8pElj4A.text: My wife and I ate breakfast there on Saturday.  My pancakes were good, but my wife was disappointed in here crepes.  The AC was down and it was getting warm, and the soda machine was now working.  We most likely will eat there again, that might have something  to do with how close it is to our house.

p-qhAvygDgf6YLcZsf8QFA.text: Absolutely love this place! Service is exceptional. Everyone is so friendly and helpful. I recommend this joint to everyone I know for GREAT breakfast!

5ptxibas88kIgjA259TRbw.text: Consistently excellent food and customer service here. I love their adobo fried rice and banana cream pie pancakes. Servers keep your coffee cup filled at all times--I love it.

GOYm8cdmstaMWUlF9Rf8sA.text: Great food and great prices.! So many different pancake options! The skillets are good too! Even on a busy sat morning, only waited 10 min to sit and received friendly service.

7uLAJU4JGXxtZ1itQyzodA.text: Awesome out of the way breakfast at babystacks. Had Kailua pork eggs Benedict.  Almost too yummy.

YH_q8--fVF_6__FBVVGHVw.text: I've been to their other locations and by far the Henderson Baby Stacks has no sense of urgency and horrible customer service. First, is it unprofessional to be chewing gum while on the job. Second, it took quite awhile to get asked for coffee. In additional, a refill while waiting 30 min or so for our food. Last, the cashier had bad customer service... No thank you, please come back again, nothing. Their staff needs to be trained on customer service or management just needs to get a new set of staff. I rather drive to centennial, buffalo, or flamingo for better service. Yes, it is that bad.

xpRww0HR8yd6Ka3CFylxJQ.text: Arrived at 8:10 on a Sunday morning and speed of service was great.  I had the Mexican Skillet and it was delicious - Marinated carnitas, sliced Jalepenos, tasty potatoes, sour cream and pico de gallo. My guy had Rick's Adobo Rice.  SO good had to steal a few bites.  Finished the breakfast with Red Velvet Pancakes.  Oh my! So good and so bad at the same time. Loved them! All was great! Will definitely be back.

OPx3zqIFvXq5DkaCbGEQLw.text: The service was a bummer part. It was super slow and we weren't getting checked on nor was our table cleared. We put all of our empty plates at the end and our waiter didn't even bother to take them when they passed by. Food was decent and to be expected from a local diner. Also they gave The kids white coloring crayons? Weird.

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States

qeGnpyfU4dN2RInBK9DxjQ.text: My sister and I went for breakfast.We both got the Lolo Rick's adobo fried rice with the red velvet pancakes. It was yummy. Juan our waiter was very nice! Loved his customer service. Friendly staff over all. I'd suggest going really early it gets packed.

HM8kmmLTqxvojKViomEJnA.text: I live relatively close by so I decided to try this place out. It wasnt too busy but there were  diverse groups enjoying their meals(mixed crowd of old and young, lone diners and small families) The food itself was delicious and prices reasonable. My problem was the staff. Our waiter was slow with relatively no personality. I must say even though we waited longer than I would expect (there werent that many customers)the food was warm when we were served. Again, no complaints with the food. When we FINALLY got our check, we went up to the cashier but nobody ever came out to help us. We left the money including a tip at the register along with the bill and left. What was irritating was that as were were getting in our luxury vehicle parked in front of the entrance, a waiter who didnt even serve us ran out and accused us of dining and dashing!!! I told him that we left our PAID BILL AT THE REGISTER SINCE THERE WAS NOBODY AT THE REGISTER TO PAY. Who does that? Perhaps you should look before you make accusations. A large part of why I become a regular at any establishment is the for the way I am treated. It is True that their food was enjoyable but their customer service and hospitality were a flat zero. I will not return.

O7kK8gwnVEiGy-t2yaJOvg.text: Typically I love Babystacks, but today was very lacking.  I was in the mood for something Hawaiian and breakfast at the same time, so they were the closest thing.  I'm a sucker for Portuguese Sausage and Eggs, which is what I ordered. I was taken aback when they don't allow for substitutes, so I ordered on the side kalua pig and cabbage... never felt so "nickel and dimed" when I saw the charge for kalua pig and the cabbage separated haha. I get it since I can sell sides and enhancements for dishes but wow.  Knowing what I know now, they sauteed the cabbage which when I poured over my rice, I definitely saw all the oil run off the plate. I was hungry so I didn't want to waste that almost $4 upcharge. So for future referrence, if I ever want to get my Portuguese Sausage fix, any Egg Works location at least provides a full link cut in half, not slices off of 1 link that looks like they are trying to stretch out. And to get my kalua pork fix I'll stick to ISG because for a couple dollars extra, I would get double the rice and about 3x the amount of Kalua pork with actual braised cabbage and not quickly sauteed on the flat top.  As for their pancakes, I've had better in their other locations. Even though I ordered the PB and ??? as my side for the breakfast instead of toast, it still came out very dense. Not their usual fluffy pancakes in the past.  Also, I didn't appreciate my server "Nicole" - I found her name on my ticket - giving me the check a couple bites in to the meal. Also didn't care for the pancakes coming out late. I would prefer to have everything served all at once. I get it if that's what their manager expects out of them, but by dropping the check, what I feared would happen did happen: She never checked on me again. I had to flag down the guy that was their busser who was polishing silverware in front of me to get me more water. She even came back from break and still didn't check on me afterwards.  And another thing,  I get not everyone is accostumed to foodies taking pictures of their food. But be more conscientious of your surroundings. You can laugh at them in the back service area, not in front where customers can see your busser and the male server with the very big afro style haircut snickering at the two ladies taking pictures of the food that was sitting next to me at the counter. Common sense not to do it where other guests can see you pointing and snickering at them. Do the polite thing and talk "shite" about guests where they are out of eye and earshot. Just like in the movie "Waiting."  And yes,  I lied to my cashier when she asked me how everything went and I said okay. I didn't want to run the risk of being late and I for sure didn't want to bog her down with the points I just pointed out above.

PHT9LslGtbIU-ckmQDvsMA.text: So my mother had heard great reviews about this place and I have to say it did not live up to the reviews. I was expected these fancy pancakes but got the normal buttermilk pancakes with toppings. The service was subpar I sat without a drink and silverware for a while. I actually got up and got the silverware from another table.  Overall the food was just ok normal breakfast food. The lunch food looked like it would be good maybe next time.

ZeU0vp_5tOJpBJEY-g5MPw.text: I ordered a Nutella crepe and a latte. The crepe was okay, nothing other restaurant can't do. The latte was awful. Worst I've ever tried by far. Even vending machines can do a much better job. No microfoam (or just any foam) but large bubbles which after few seconds vanished. The taste was bland and the texture was too liquidy (didn't seem they used whole milk but possibly fat free or something else less creamy). My friend tasted it too and agreed with me. I just took a sip and didn't touch it again. I didn't bother to complain since this bad experience made me upset but instead went to a coffee place to revindicate my day.

LCN3fvUPuVilORCOIKHLAg.text: Yummy yummers yummiest, if yall want breakfast at a good price with big portions this is the spot. Red velvet pancakes come on, you can't pass it up. Awesome fusion of Pacific islander breakfast.

NU4diycqwas1QZxOsoTucA.text: I'm so happy that they open a restaurant in Henderson. I dont half to drive 45 mins to eat at this place.

BqKxMo8ZU8SY9NqSf5grzQ.text: You never get disappointed with baby stacks food!!! It's always 5 stars!! but I have to give the review a 4 star, because I honestly have no idea what's up with you guys water! It's absolutely disgusting, and it's every babystacks. I've been to almost all locations, I don't get it. So you guys should work on that.  But the food is life!! Don't change that!

61bEdkmUEUN_rkM5KJcwZw.text: This has been our favorite breakfast spot since we first tried it. LOVE THIS PLACE! We have been back several times... And, plan to return.

Mzs_YGOzZdIuhQRxukTCiQ.text: My favorite breakfast place for my sweet tooth! I order The Cookie Butter French Toast topped Nutella & whipped cream almost everytime! Its soooo good and the toast is thick and it holds all the gooey deliciousnesswith every bite. I do love their buttermilk pancakes short stack too!

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Cookie Butter French Toast drizzled with Nutella &amp; whipped cream
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. The Best Pancakes in Vegas &amp; Henderson!

1gm8hZuRHGEbDN4-y-korQ.text: Great breakfast! We were seated fast and taken care of quickly. The lemon ricotta pancakes were to die for! New favorite breakfast place to go to when I am in town.

WCV1CaDVmos8sfezrCRKMQ.text: Love this little gem!!! As the name suggests, they are known for their pancakes but that have tons of delicious skillets, omelettes, benedicts, and nice lunch items as well. I got the lemon ricotta pancakes with cream cheese syrup. AMAZING!!! Their little blonde hostess is such a sweetheart and will make your day. All the servers are very attentive and awesome. We love it here and will be back.

vV0WPadYRLziCVhwdka6NQ.text: I come to Vegas a few times a year to visit family. I try new places to eat off the strip every time I come here. This time I decided to take my family to this spot for a late breakfast. The interior kinda reminded me of a daycare for kids and I thought it lacked excitement. The staff was VERY polite. From the hostess to our waiter, I was very happy with. The food wasn't bad nor it was great. The potatoes lacked favor, the garlic rice was basic but their Portuguese sausage was fantastic.   I would probably return just based on their hospitality alone.

zxQbofbrjfScN-TFEbT2Aw.text: One of the best brunch spots in Vegas! Everything I ordered was delicious and definitely left me wishing I had leftovers to bring home and indulge in a second time.

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Spinach Benedict with potatoes and a single Nutella crepe with strawberries

9mvhKmvCDVCircWqkUocEw.text: I am sooooo full. This place was so good that I had to write the review while still here !! I had the Huntington omelette and the banana cream pie pancakes and O M G.... everything was soooo good. The pico de Gallo on the side was a perfect addition to the Tabasco sauce I added but those freaking PANCAKES!!! Wow. This is probably going to be my go to breakfast spot from now on. Service was quick and friendly and the food was amazing.   Give this place a try!!

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States

EOoJKR4-nXw325VjaK8QoQ.text: Wow, I came in at the right time this morning. There were several tables being used and the restaurant was fairly busy in general. But there were still a few tables open and the counter was completely open. This is where I sat. By the time I was done the place was packed. The tables were full and my newly vacated seat was the only one at the counter. People were waiting in the entry for tables. I beat the crowd today for sure.  Babystacks has an extensive menu. One whole side is nothing but pancakes and omlettes of a varied nature. The other side has sandwiches, burgers and other entrees. This is where I looked for a meal.  There were a lot of choices that looked intriguing but I chose loco moco with garlic rice and fried potatoes. There is something disgustingly pleasing about a hamburger patty with egg and gravy over rice. I asked for my eggs to be cooked sunny side up. I'm not always a big egg eater but when that yolk and gravy gets down into the rice, oh baby, its good. Get a bite of everything on one fork and watch out. Its a flavor bomb. Add in Babystack's perfectly seasoned and browned fried potatoes and you have a starch packed breakfast for the ages.  Service was fairly effecient given how busy Babystacks was this morning. It was not overly attentive service but my food and iced tea came out quickly and I didn't have to wait more than maybe a minute to get my check after I finsihed eating. I had a good and filling meal for a fair price.

789exP71EfTzPbljYihoAA.text: Always enjoy this place  great customer service... Sundays is usually packed so call ahead

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. BYO omelette
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States

vupVkPmhQy8AoanylMGRXQ.text: First time here. The food was okay. I had the Hawaiian Bennadic and everything was okay but the bread was burned. They covered the the burned part with the spam and eggs and gravy. It tasted all burnt with the bread. Other then that the service was perfect.

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States

bW0_aQTxDF9tpwtX7LnkTA.text: I've been going here for YEARS..my kids love it here. And today I decided to try their Kabi beef combo for $12 and some change, i took it Togo right before closing..sounded like A great deal but unfortunately the Kalbi beef was dissatisfying. My first bite was horrible, it had a spoiled taste and smell to it, I started checking the other pieces and they were all SLIMY!  I decided to call and complain I spoke with Clarissa (Manager) and I told her the situation she said she couldn't do anything for me until she spoke with the Owner..like, do you not have that power to refund or exchange my meal, as manager I'd imagine you would. She called me back after speaking with the owner and they decided that they couldn't do anything for me. Not even an apology. She advised that I email the owner and wait to see what happens..fuck, I dont even know where I found the time to write this, they expect me to email back and forth with this owner for something worth $12.95 for. Waste my time and money going here today. I AM VERY DISATISFIED! as a repeated customer for years. They lost my respect and I cannot continue to support a business that is not will to supports it customers.

insdV23yKRamiNPO3UJstA.text: Came here with a huge appetite, and did this place ever satiate that need. I ordered a simple egg and bacon breakfast. The eggs, over easy and cooked perfectly. This time I didn't order any pancakes because I wasn't in the mood for anything sweet. The orange juice was good too. :P  There was a good wait, and I'm actually glad I had the patience and waited. The service was really good, polite and very attentive. Drinks always full and our every need met. I would recommend coming here at least once. The restrooms and restaurant is clean, busy but it's all good.

LL10uTlhlMBmnaVNdT5KTw.text: Not to bad for breakfast. They have a lot to offer which can be a little overwhelming when it's time to order. Ordered the adobo fried rice and biscuits and gravy. Let me say they serve a lot of food... definitely full after. Will go again and explore the pancake options next time.

FMoFmLDC4a2ZE_StQCHUxw.text: Delicious. Well rounded menu, very large variety of pancakes. Everyone was happy with their meal. Huevos Rancheros were a hit with the hubby. I enjoyed the specialty of the house, adobo chicken rice omelette.   Service was friendly, quick and accurate! Prices are good and you get what you pay for.

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Adobo chicken rice omelet. Yum!

y07Iva6i242OLd-u5eioEg.text: This place is amazing !!! Small but great breakfast place I got the red velvet pancakes with homemade cream cheese spread , it's to die for!! Service is fast , atmosphere great and it's homey and comfortable with great food , this is my second spot to stop for breakfast besides the cracked egg. Give it a go and you will not be disappointed !

G-IUSN-7WqEUWQ4DDnDJhw.text: I got huevos rancheros no it says it comes with beans but look at the pick. Literally this i how the beans look when I got my plate and moved my tortilla. I had to order an extra side.  not a place I would recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States

JsscAY_MPO1-JMxUH8B6LQ.text: My favorite here is the adobo fried rice omelette with a side of babystacks German chocolate pancake!  I love that you can get any pancakes on the menu for your side.  They can get really busy even the weekdays but you will get seated within 5-10 mins.  The servers are very friendly.

1DYUkpNnbpbX7hFH4gwuNw.text: Decided to try something new today. This was definitely a huge hit for us. I had the Ham and Eggs platter which came with 2 buttermilk babystack pancakes. My husband had the bacon pancakes in a short stack along with Sausage Links. The Ham came out extremely greasy and needed to be patted down with a napkin but it had good flavor. The egg platters have an option of being served with hash browns, seasoned potatoes or rice.  The bacon pancakes are garnished not only with bacon but have bacon bits inside them too. Everything was excellent and we will definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States

XX3xnwYUNIhPmaBiKMzhqA.text: First time at this location and it was such an awful experience I won't return to any of their others.   Arrived Sunday around 1PM was told 25 min wait so I put my name down and told the girl I'd be back in 20. I returned in 15 mins and she notified me my name was called I'd have to start the wait again (WHAT). So we waited another 12 mins and finally get seated. We placed our orders after being seated and waiting another seven mins. Our food took 23 mins meanwhile I see our waiter standing near a shelf enjoying his lunch. Once our food does get there (delivered by someone other than our waiter as he was busy snacking) it's all wrong. We had a cold omelette missing avacado, a side of pancakes that was half there. We were told the order is for two pancakes but only one of them is done I'll get the other one soon (it never arrived). Not to mention the one pancake arrived 11 mins after the rest of the food. We then get the bill go pay at the front. This might be more annoying than everything else mentioned, I signed the check for $40 even but I get a receipt for $42. I tell the girl and she says, "oh uhm I can void if you'd like". I said well yes I'm not tipping what you think I should tip after the experience we had and she says ok and voids then re does the transaction.   Not only was the wait forever, girls at front counter were crabby, food was incorrect & cold but then they try to pull a fast one and have me tip more than I opted for. No thank you, I loved the centennial hills location but this experience has ruined babystacks for me. Never again.

pFhAhYsuOe6_dFa3b4SCPg.text: I won't be long winded. This place is great! The variety is awesome, the portions are generous, everything tasted great, and the service was excellent. Don't hesitate trying this place.

JQKrRfiiBL7MrkyHqXonpw.text: Wonderful food!  Pancakes of all kinds are on the menu.  The Ortega Skillet was yummy, I subbed bacon and sausage for the chicken.  Tropical Island French Toast was amazing.  Lemon Ricotta pancakes were delicious.  Will come back next time I am in Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. GG loved the sweet cream crepes.

CGW_w56ow8tCNooJzk9NUg.text: Came for breakfast during the weekday. Always busy and food is amazing. Small place though, need more room. Kinda pricey but worth it

PB6hoxL5TgBmD2vC-4Wn9A.text: Good food ok service try the bacon pancakes.  Good place to go Sunday morning.  Didn't like their coffee and they don't like short and to the point reviews

Xe8cp1sgIDE1xSuWsjOAvg.text: I love having breakfast here during my Vegas vacations. Weekends are busy  expect a wait. The loco moco and pancakes are worth. We had great service. Orders came out fast.

5-NKzkVac7SwMPgno2MlIg.text: A tiny place to the west of Sunset Station Casino,   off Stephanie Ave. In Henderson, NV.  It is sharing a parking lot with Burlington Coat Factory.   I really needed a map to find this place as I had passed the area a 100 times and didn't' know it was there ...the building is not facing out onto the road so if you are not looking for it, you will pass it.  At 1:30 p.m. (they close at 2 p.m.) there was one waitress, running around for the other 10 customers....she was sprinting from table to table and finally got to us...I should have lowered the checkered flag, because that's how fast she was running...    I ordered Loco Moco a scrambled Spam, with Rice and added carrot cake pancakes, my guest ordered banana foster pancakes.  My eggs and rice were ok, they needed something else, because they were so dry, I got a side of Pico de Gallo.  The pancakes were good, not fluffy but not raw, either, so just right.  Cream cheese  frosting was the syrup.  I could see little carrots in the pancakes.  The Banana Foster Pancakes were very sweet, not my thing, but the guest loved them.  Tasted like a little rum flavoring and lots of sugar and cinnamon were added.  I'm a pumpkin or buckwheat pancake, kinda person and they weren't on the menu.  If you like sweet, gooey pancakes, this is the place...they had some interesting Hawaiian breakfast selections, too.   But I'm looking for the perfect plain, buckwheat or pumpkin pancakes.

rjSq971LaWDS1ZGkTsgh1w.text: Met a friend for breakfast not too long along ago.  I enjoy the consistency babystacks offers as a brand.  I haven't had a bad experience at any of their Vegas locations.  Came in on a Friday morning and it was fairly busy but we opted to sit at the breakfast bar.  Service was food and the food came out quickly.  The bacon was a bit over cooked but nothing to deter me.  I will certainly continue to recommend babystacks as a great breakfast place.

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Pancakes with strawberries and cream

BQGzUfgD1XOTV9jBsrSiuQ.text: We came in with a party of 12 for my nieces kindergarten graduation. It took us about 30 or so minutes to get seated as expected for a big party. Our server Valerie was so nice and patient with everyone. The food was great, my brother in law order a plethora of pancakes from salted Carmel pretzel (a group favorite), red velvet, orange creamsickle, and PB pancakes, cookies and cream, bacon and banana and a German chocolate--- oh man, they were all so delicious! If you have a sweet tooth, definitely check this place out!!! Everything here was great!!

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Yay for pancakes and kindergarten graduations!!

QV8pFsNexanK6W4ZTowyxg.text: I LOVE BABYSTACKS. Customer service is always great. On sundays they get really busy since it is a family breakfast place but they still do try their best to serve you as quickly as possible. It's just the sitting that takes an awful long of time. Food is amazing with the price point. Definitely try the adobo fried rice and red velvet or cookies and cream pancakes. These pancakes give me life and makes sense why their name is babystacks!!'   I have tried all branches all over Vegas and food quality and people always exceed my expectations.   Better than hash house a go go hands down

lS-dLd6Arnh1AXvwxIl50g.text: Cute place. Get here early cuz it gets packed quickly. The menu is alright I guess they are known for their pancakes. I tried the red velvet and it was good. This is a TMI moment so feel free to skip the next few sentences. The aftermath after eating red velvet, you seriously think you are dying. It take a couple days for the red dye to leave your body.  The rest of the food is ok. It's nothing spectacular but it is nice to have something other than Ihop or dennys. The staff is very friendly but don't come here if you are in a hurry. It takes a bit to order and get your food.  On a plus if you are military they give a 10% discount.

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Spinach benedict
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. S&#39;more pancakes

_mayTFukN9ebrua3E_3aJA.text: I have to admit I haven't been the biggest fan of Babystacks, so when my OG wanted to check this place out now that they've opened a location closer to him, I was reluctant, but always up a food expedition.  We arrived on Memorial Day and it was not busy. We were seated quickly and I decided to finally order the adobo omelet I've had my eye on for a while. The rice was flavorful, but just a little on the dry side. I would have probably preferred if it was just the rice and skipped the egg, but I enjoyed it.   I also ordered the red, white and blue pancakes that were on special for the day. Topped with blueberries, strawberries and whipped cream, I wish I had gone with my first instinct and asked that they forego the white chocolate chips. The pancakes would've been better without them. The pancakes were good, but like the other locations, they are small and not very fluffy. They did taste good, however.  We had a good meal and I got to spend time with some of my favorite people, so that's a plus. It's a good addition to this location and I see them being successful here.

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Buttermilk pancakes
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Two eggs and potatoes
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Adobo fried rice omelet
