6rwda24lLJc8_fp0YZYfnQ.text: I have been to the baby stacks on the other side of town and absolutely loved the red velvet pancakes.  My family was in town so I told them I would have to take them here.  The service at this location was top notch.   We had a very tall thin girl with reddish hair who was outstanding and I am a huge critic to service.  This location is not as busy as the others either which is nice.  They ensured my coffee was never empty and the food was absolutely amazing.  My family from out of town said it was one of the best breakfasts they've had!

WvAiJce1TOipLk1ZiqsleA.text: I dont normally like pancakes.... but I love Babystacks. Bless them for adding a Henderson location! They have a very diverse menu. Just know their bacon is turkey bacon. They even have cookie butter french toast! Treat yo self  by coming here for breakfast!

2DFBa3RZU3c2Kp3E2N9vpQ.text: I had to update my previous review! Although my star rating hasn't changed (still 5/5) I wanted to change my comment of referring to the wait staff as mediocre. My boyfriend and I have been regulars here almost every weekend (it's THAT good) for the past 10 months and the service has been excellent. I love this place. It's worth the wait!!

QBIMV11l7bgzzN8E4Guqkg.text: Hubby and I first dined here some months ago.  The food was fine but I was put off by our food arriving in stages instead of all at the same time.  My entree came without the toast.  After 5 minutes  or so my husband's meal came, without the toast.  We had ordered a short stack of pancakes to share, and those came some time later.  Our toast came after we had finished everything else.   Since the food was good, even though the service was not, we decided to try it again yesterday.  We each ordered egg entrees and a short stack of pancakes to share.  When we ordered, we specifically asked our waitress to bring out all the food at the same time.  She agreed.  While we waited I noticed the couple at a neighboring table going through the same thing we had experienced on our previous visit....the woman had her food and the man didn't.  After a long wait, our egg entrees were delivered.  We had to ask for butter and jelly, which was finally brought to our table halfway through the meal.  Our pancakes did not arrive.  Our waitress said she would bring them "shortly."  We waited and waited.  We finished our egg entrees, still no pancakes.  Finally the manager stopped by and announced that the pancakes had not been prepared yet but we should " be patient."  Really?  How long does it take for a pancake restaurant to make pancakes?  The manager did not offer to take the pancakes off the bill or compensate us in any way.  As soon as we decided to leave, the (cold) pancakes were delivered to our table.  There are too many places to eat in this city to waste your time here, spend your money where the service is better and your business is appreciated.

drpfrhDYw23rEC0AnryvKQ.text: Little bit of a wait, but where isn't there one on a saturd a morning. Had a couple specials with some short stack specials. Great variations in flavor for the food and the stacks, definitely coming here again!

y1x-sh_8R5tpF0hfuCMdEA.text: We were a party of 4 with 2 kids not Greeted pleasantly by the host.  She seemed unhappy and not even smiled at us.  We ordered our food and waited and waited after 30 minutes half of our food came out.  We waited about 8 minutes for the rest of the food to be served.  This is not acceptable as far as a breakfast timeline.  I've been to the other baby stacks location and their service is great.  This is the second horrible experience at this location.  Sad that the food is great but the staff needs to be reevaluated.

wcOknFuxpSAEdjGW4RZQ5g.text: I guess I just don't get it. Was looking for a place to have breakfast. Nothing special. Nothing over the top. Just plain breakfast. This was not the place. This is over the top eating. All these fu fu foods. Chocolate chip pancakes, red velvet, lots of fluff. I ordered a simple senior breakfast. Brought me a short stack of pancakes with 1 pat of butter. What the heck??? The pancakes were nothing special.  These people are looking for the 20-30 something crowd with kids and an open wallet. Won't be back. By the looks of the line out the door, they won't miss me.

gS0QaBW2cHMmVnJqwVSf1g.text: I could write a book on how good this place is. Menu is flawless.  I've had almost all of it.  Love all of it.  Garlic rice is my clear fav!!!   You just gotta trust me and go and get some

056eFm_jcKi_9K9jdH-_DA.text: This place is delish! Every time we have family or friends visiting vegas we take them here on Sundays. Red velvet pancakes are amazing! I only gave three stars because compared to the other babystacks their Adobo fried rice omelet is on the salty side, too much to bare. You need to drink a ton of water or eat more rice to balance all the salt intake. I thought it was only one day but been there several times and still so salty. Wish they took reservations or possibly putting our name on the waiting list as we drive there. Oh well. Guess that's how they make their money. I still drive to the original babystacks to get there adobo fried rice omelet. Just waiting for the Henderson location to get it right. Otherwise everything else is yummy!!

42Q2zlxNNMvrsaLuXgAy7Q.text: Great service I would totally recommend this for breakfast or brunch . I would eat there every day if I could.

lSB0zPaZ_Ng0JHNnbdJ7Jg.text: Found this place today and decided to give it a try since it had pretty good reviews... Very impressed!!! Great variety of foods and great service!!! Loved it!! Totally recommend it

w2wg9xLe6Cu99rXQDUEdNQ.text: The pancakes were fresh and tasty. Those are what they are known for.   The rest of my breakfast was merely ok. Scrambled eggs were a bit burnt, not yellow and fluffy. The potatoes were under seasoned and appeared to be the cubed frozen kind.   Coffee was just ok.   I may come back to try the pancakes again. Service was quick and the host was super nice.

P5E3FWycMCr7hg1gQibh9w.text: Very good. People are nice. Definitely need to come when your visiting in the area. The place is small looks like it could get busy but we came around 11:30 so we were seated immediately. Again the people here are very nice. Food was good and served hot. My boys loved it.

TjvRsjMFYOfmg9N3zie1Vw.text: Awesome food little pricey for breakfast food but good! Eggs Benedict has to be my favorite

1hl7lypecHgwf3nxVsxrFQ.text: Overall the food is pretty good ... I've been to Babystacks three times now, and consistently they have had service issues to where all the food, particularly pancakes and toast, is not served until after we have finished our meal or even forgotten ... The joy of pancakes is eating them in combination with the savory taste of eggs and bacon ... We had lemon ricotta and blue berry and there were only 2 blue berries in the small stack. The restaurant has some work to do in terms of their food processes during busy mornings to ensure the dining experience is not frustrating.

f_kHDIJW5uNMnJisYVO-EA.text: Isn't the best I've had. But it's definitely good. The service is great, and the food comes out quick even when it's busy.

IYYef0yvbikD8C1m9D4tBw.text: Wanted a non-chain breakfast place and this was a fabulous find. Prices are acceptable, especially for the quality. The menu is extensive with lots of quirky originals as well the breakfast standards. Had corned beef hash that was fabulous!! My toddlers kids meal was huge so I also got to graze from hers :) Service was great and the music playing was so happy-go-lucky I couldn't help but smile.

QdGI_P21Dc6YejQJvb5q4g.text: We were here in 2014 and it was bad then, thought we would try it again and it has not changed.   The staff is rude, and very slow.  We waited for at least a half hour and when we were finally seated, it was at a table that had been empty for at least 15 minutes prior to us being seated.  In fact there were several empty tables and many people waiting to be seated.  The cashier was very rude and the entire staff just seems to not care if you are a happy customer or not. Food is fine, but just ok.

Gw0n5IMKW9LUGUjJVXn2sw.text: Delish!  Happy it's opened early for early breakfast risers ;). Had their go to adobo omelette and red velvet pancakes! Hands down a must if it's your first time.  Portion was good enough that it became my lunch too (leftovers).  Coming from SD chee hoooo for this breakfast spot! Will come again :)

Lle5xFGLdBlNP1XRKTgfUw.text: When the other day for breakfast and had the cfs and wife had an omelet with a side of banana cream pie cakes. We loved the cakes

8rhR1w3Kyg6o5MPfks72Pw.text: Adobo fried rice is too salty.  I get the Mexican omelet.  It's spicy and full of taste.

BPlmufx8NoQouf7Do6W14g.text: Always delicious and service is pretty good too. Never have had a bad experience or item that I ordered I didn't love. Definitely a place I recommend!

suSZ3qgkhmI0ww6BU98uEQ.text: I am willing to give this place another try.  With my first visit here i am still unsure.  I ended up getting the country bene with the addition spam and the gravy on the side and an order of the mac salad.  The eggs where poached nicely which is hard to find a good place to cook them right.  The sausages patties where pretty flavor full along with the biscuit that they place it on.  I am glad i asked for the gravy on the side since that needed some flavor same goes for the mac salad.  Needed some more acid in the mayo mixture.  Overall it was a decent meal for the price.  I was shocked that it was cash only with a little sign tapped to the counter near the register, Good thing i had cash on me.  Service was good food was hot.  Like i said before i will give this place another try maybe for lunch.

PF-eJ4H4JQwpu9V1kspYOg.text: Not worth the wait not worth the food, IHOP pancakes are much much better, pancakes were not tasty and they were dry. Won't be going back here anytime soon

IOo0iWG2O9wBrNEap-B-nw.text: Baby Stacks is a good breakfast spot. I was not overly impressed. It was filling and we were seated promptly and had attentive service. I am a bacon and egg guy mostly. I had the Chicken fried steak. It seemed like it was from a frozen bag of CFS's and the gravy was not mixed well. So far 2 Baby Stacks and I am not seeing what the hype is.My meal came with standard pancakes that were dry. Others in my party swear by Baby Stacks but unless you are a pancake lover maybe it is not for you. I can say the staff is friendly and they serve you well.

5KLZghrSHop06-QNzYWSwg.text: I wish I could live even closer and I'm only about 3 minutes away! This place is amazing. I'm a big coffee drinker and even their coffee is good. This time I tried the carrot cake pancakes and they were delightful! My partner had some French toast nutella and honey butter thing and I didn't know if I should trade or just eat BOTH!

u3CdqbwkwHw9b1JfFx2Jpw.text: I've tried the hash and chicken fried steak...and recommend the steak. You can actually get extra gravy if you want it. I just order the eggs (poached), garlic rice and pancakes in 3 separate boxes to go, as the steak is plenty for one meal. Later I mix the rice and eggs to make fried rice, maybe with oyster sauce and even more fried onion. One pancake is a quick meal, so that makes 4 in all. I won't be going for the sweet stuff, but this one dish is all I need. Best CF steak I've found here...

ii0-MbxsmHtsZMlCCQQs2Q.text: Sorry babystacks! I love you but I gotta give u 3 stars for now! We got there at 11 and told that there will be a 20 mins wait, but we got sat down 10 mins early.. Which is good. Then we started ordering at 11:10am and we got our food at 11:42.. Really 35 mins? and the funny thing is that the people got there 10 mins after us got their food out first. yup! but hey don't get me wrong i love the pancakes! best pancakes in vegas! ill never get tired of going to babystacks! ;) it just that it happened for the first time that i got disappointed with the service, and pls always check your customers needs!

QZWSe0h6MNSy8t9ayFkhQg.text: This place never disappoints me! The staff is always attentive & the food absolutely delicious! I used to go to the location on Flamingo/Buffalo but sometimes the "wait" could be a bit long - so I make the trek to Henderson on Stephanie/Sunset and I walk right in!

ZeBM_mDU9xchgwRkNQJlXA.text: Love this place!  If you're in a rush then don't go.  It may be crowded as in many other reviews.  There is a reason for that.  As far as portion size goes it's more than fine.  The food is eclectic with an as close as you can get island style.  Those from the Aina understand this place.

y-LP25v9nU-xduVmaSInPg.text: I was actually disappointed by this place after hearing great things about it from friends. The waiter was...different and really unfriendly. He didn't smile once. The food was okay. I had a scrambler sort of thing with a side of pancakes. The pancakes were very good though. Disappointed they had no gluten free pancake options. My mother-in-laws fruit came out spoiled and even when we asked they didn't take it off our bill. Not sure if I'll return.

mYgaR8suNXLWuSSPX3uIdA.text: Loved the breakfast meal that had the Hawaiian chili mmmmm! My husband and I love this place only been once, and it was really good!

DfTvJ8B7cRv3mQYRtwdHjA.text: I went there for my birthday, and it was the worst breakfast I had ever had at an establishment. They first sat us down at a table that wasn't clean,  we then ordered our food and it took them 45 minutes to bring out my friends meal, she ordered  the banana foster pancakes, (their were just two of us eating) and forgot about mine. I ordered the eggs Benedict with spinach and mushrooms and the eggs poached hard with a sided of Portuguese sausage. 10 minutes after my friend receiving her meal, they brought out mine. The eggs were running which I specifically told the waitress that they needed to be poached hard and she also forgot the sausage. When she initially came out with my food she placed it on the table and ran off, so I wasn't able to correct it immediately and she then disappeared for an additional 10 minutes. I had to flag down another associate to get them to come down to my table and then tell them about how my meal wasn't done right. They said they would get my waitress, so again I waited an additional 5-8 minutes till she came around and I explained how they messed up on my meal and she wanted to argue with me about what I ordered. She said, " You know the eggs are running for the eggs Benedict." I told her "I know that but I don't eat them that way, "and she said "she well that's the way the normal do it." I understand that, but as a customer, I'm not asking for much at all about them poaching my eggs longer so they are over hard. After that she grabbed my plate and I told her I was done and that I'm not going to wait another hour to eat my meal when they brought out my friends early so she already ate and it was done along with her forgetting the sausage. The long and the short of this is that the meal was mediocre, the service was horrible, and I don't recommend this location.

vqZA-9VJoQh8jlWmxPwQBw.text: Babystacks is located across the street from Sprouts and I noticed the now open sign a few weeks ago. I love breakfast joints, and though there are several awesome diners in Henderson, the idea of a breakfast spot specializing in pancakes was appealing. I finally got to try it out this morning.   All I have to say is BEST PANCAKES. EVER. Seriously. I ordered the Red Velvet pancakes and my fiancee ordered the carrot cake. The carrot cake pancakes actually had pieces of fresh carrot in the batter, and both plates tasted like moist cake in pancake form. Both were also served with cream cheese syrup, which was amazing. I usually don't order pancakes for breakfast, partially because I hate store bought syrups. Babystacks makes all syrups in house and all batter is freshly made.   I know some people in the reviews complained about the portion size, but I was actually grateful that the portions were reasonable. I got a short stack of pancakes, and as much as I loved them, I personally couldn't have finished my plate if the pancakes had been ginormous. I hate food waste and appreciate when food is high quality and a normal portion size, not crappy quality in giant quantities. For me, I left pleasantly full, not overstuffed and sick.   I also thought the food was a good value. For two plates of pancakes, a side of bacon and coffee, our check was under $20. Again, I'm not really sure why some people are complaining about the food being overpriced.   There are a lot of breakfast places in town, but Babystacks has done a great job of setting themselves apart with a gourmet pancake menu. I will definitely be back to try more menu items.

zlDE61bNzMnD-ldTqR3L6A.text: I ate here late one weekday morning after picking up a friend from the airport, so it wasn't exactly primetime for them, but they still had a good bit of business coming and going while we were there. They seemed well staffed for it, although it did take our food a long time to come considering we had a couple eggs a piece, bacon, and pancakes (no steaks, omelettes, or anything too taxing).  Everything was very decent: not amazing, but certainly not terrible. It was plenty good enough, although maybe not up to the rave reviews I'd heard from other friends about the place. My hash browns though; those were awful. I specifically ordered them burnt. Not crispy - burnt. I do that everywhere I go in the hopes of actually getting crispy hash browns. The ones I got were soggy, limp, way too thick, and a bit sickly looking. I would have sent them back if we hadn't already waited so long for our food that we were ready to eat and get on with our day.   Overall, the food and the service was decent. I would go back with no hesitation if someone I was with wanted to, but it probably won't be my recommendation for breakfast anytime soon.

O0f3Fu6RW3zsFgqUX-tABA.text: Mmmmmmm food delish! I had the kalua pork grilled cheese with garlic rice. The grilled cheese with the juicy kalua pork was amazing. My husband had the huevos rancheros scramble and ate it before I could try it, (he liked it) but shared his macadamia nut white chocolate pancakes....holy heaven:)))) The service was great, friendly, attentive and helpful as it was our first time. My new favorite breakfast spot:)

_hOARX0a0KORa1pfmJ8Zuw.text: Everything is awesome here! Adobo fried rice is amazing and the crepes and pancakes are to die for. Sometimes there's a wait for a table, deal with it! Totally worth it.

TSRw0eyebMZOIae_SY-rEQ.text: Terrible service. We entered and waited for over 10 minutes to be seated and not one employee said hello or welcome. They had 1 waitress and 1 cashier. We ended up leaving since no one was being seated although several tables were available

SjpE8PbSDo-9BNGA-bpgKA.text: Awesome food and service. Waitress with a fantastic sense of humor.  We ate here several times during a week of vacation. Highly recommend it!!

BkSFcZuK-txblm5AvQqlhg.text: Fantastic selection of unique pancakes. Fast courteous service. Try the orange creamsicle pancakes

W9JDNbNrXsTWCfJ30d09zg.text: I would have given them more stars if there greeters would have greeted me.  I had to interrupt them chatting with each other to ask to put my name on the list.  Banana cream pancakes were amazing and so were the red velvet and Rick's Adobo fried rice!  We love this place!

XKIZdH6zmkjI0BPPkWeC0g.text: If you have never been here it is a must when in Vegas.  It's in Henderson but with the trip to have breakfast!!

o7n0O5Tqg1Vj52UvJY7Z0Q.text: Babystacks Cafe is most definitely a morning staple! Great food and good service is what you consistently find. The wide array of pancake flavors is great and every thing that we have tried has been delicious! My husbands favorite is the red velvet stack, I like the bananas foster. We have basically made our way around every skillet in the menu with the Huntington or the HM1 being our top choices. Keep in mind to arrive early and plan on waiting to get a table. Just know that it's well worth the wait :)

dcF261Ow4hIC9Ay_uHzJcQ.text: No amount of great food can make up for TERRIBLE customer service, inconsiderate and ridiculous  policies, lost my business over a stupid seating issue when your place is dead at the time with no one in the restaurant. Denny's has nicer employees down the street and faster service

XJ5Lm-D_ZJ1Q5I0bGw607A.text: Stacks and stacks of stacks. Delicious!   We met some friends here to try out their breakfast.  I had read it gets quite busy on the weekend so I avoided that.  We were seated immediately and didn't know how I was going to make the choice from an extensive pancake list.  Luckily my husband and I split one of the pancake choices and one of the omelettes.   Our choice was the Cinnabun pancakes and the Mexican omelette.  The Cinnabun pancakes is a sure winner.  You can't go wrong when you combine cinnamon, sugar and pecans.  Plus the full stack is huge and was glad we shared! The Mexican omelette was good and almost too spicy for me.  Their hot jalapenos and marinated carnitas were a great combo for sure.  It was good but would probably try a different option next time.    Service was good and very friendly.  Our group had a great breakfast here and would be happy to come back.

Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Country Benedict with seasoned potatoes

mSDhca-Ur3nL4TlGRa1D3A.text: The service and food was great.  We were a party of 5 and they gave ups updates often on the status of our table.  I had adobo fried rice omelet which was delicious.  Just the right amount of tangy to adobo.  Kids has red velvet regular stack that they shared.  It was way too much, definitely gonna get a short stack next time.  They also had Kalua pork grilled cheese and Portuguese Sausage sliders with fried and mac salad.  Kalua was great, not too salty which tends to happen sometimes.  Didn't realize the sliders was and omelet in buns.  But is was also really good.  And Mac salad was just like home (Hawai'i).  Husband had the Chili Moco which was also delicious but he said it should have had more chili.    Service was great!  We were greeted and offered drinks as ion as we got to the table and they refilled water and coffee often.  We'll definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States

y1TEWkEtcPcwGVc_e_7GEg.text: The food here is so good that you have to wait for it. There is almost always a line but it is well worth it. The place is a bit small which means you unfortunately can't help but hear the conversations at the table next to you. The red velvet pancakes more than make up for it though and the selection of pancakes is huge it will take you a while to get through them all. Service is wonderful and everyone is very nice. Definitely be back for more stacks!

WC_GLox0qx2eq4LXXcl3qA.text: Fast friendly service and the food is excellent.  We keep going back because there is so much on the menu we want to try!!!

MQWAwhp7wCxJ1a4IokvEDg.text: It was ok.... small place so the seating is easy to close to each other.... staff was friendly, pancakes were like any other pancake place lol

byjickcm38vYTErW48qx3g.text: Mmmm pancakes!!! Each time I've come here I've had an omelette and substituted for the lemon baby stacks. So. Freaking. Delicious.

5Id4szbih2WwNrVJ_EU1ng.text: I was sooo hungry and I thought this place could accommodate my food allergy. But NOPE. I left hungry and disappointed. Nothing gluten-free. I usually don't write negative reviews however for this I will make an exception. Nothing here is gluten-free. Sooo hungry! Maybe even a tad hangry.

Cy_f6A2mqVhWxfsmcSj7Jw.text: If you like breakfast you will love this place ! Nice menu from a huge variety of pancakes to omelettes, including a great lunch menu.  This was a great find ! Yelp hasn't failed me !  Thanks Yelp !

0xtDDv_S4vqg4-mQ80Spvg.text: An impromptu Vegas trip brought me to this marvelous place of brunch goodness. With island staples of Loko Moko and various Kalua Pig dishes on the menu, this little hole in the wall brings tasty Hawaiian dishes with a brunch twist. They also offer "normal American breakfast items" on their menu, but definitely try the Hawaiian fare!  Seemingly the weekends are busy, so be prepared to wait. The actual place is relatively small, so that also contributed to the wait time. My personal wait ended up being around 30 minutes but well worth it. The service was on point, and the time it took for the food to arrive after being seated was waaayyy shorter than the actual wait to be seated.   I will be sure to stop by again when I am hungover and leaving Nevada. Mahalo Babystacks Cafe!

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Loko moko was crazy good!

AsUct7IJeMmpTyl53ERRNw.text: Love this place!! Being from Hawaii it is a sweet reminder of home, think Cinnamons, yum! They have an extensive list of specialty pancakes, including a white chocolate macadamia but one. I've tried a few and you can't go wrong! Very well priced. Around $8 for two egg breakfast including potatoes or hash and a speciality stack of pancakes. Good portion sizes - I always leave feeling stuffed!

uHZeNRMbNUpN9Tur963qAQ.text: YAY a BabyStacks in Henderson!!!!     I enjoyed BabyStacks with my PIC a few years ago when we did a Vegas trip. When I came back, I told my Mom and baby sis, you have to come here! I didn't know they had one in Henderson until my mother told me they had one when they moved out there themselves. They're anti Vegas so this was perfect and even more perfect that they're only a mile from my moms house.    I have no clue how I was able to be alive for this breakfast since I woke up at 3am and drove to Henderson with my girlfriends and never took a nap LOL. But my hunger was soooooooo strong, it overcame the sleep deprivation HAHA.  Surprisingly I wasn't even hangry especially walking up and seeing the crowd of people waiting. No biggie, put my name on the list and we sat on the bench at a neighboring eatery. I will say, for the most part, the service folks out here are really nice because, while we were waiting a staffer from the other restaurant greeted us even though we weren't there for them . We thought we were going to get the boot lol. So we get called and the guy asked if it were ok to eat in the patio. No problem with that and that was for the best because being a party of 2, you're seated earlier and inside is cramp for my taste so my mom and I actually had privacy to eat like pigs if we wanted :D The service here is great and they keep it together even with the crazy breakfast crowd. I don't recall our servers name but she was one of the sweetest servers ever and did so well with a party with 7 kids!!!!     Ok now for the food. You have A LOT of options , so if you can't find something, something is wrong with you.  I didn't want to go overboard like I did when I came to the other location with my PIC. So I kept it simple with a straight forward breakfast. This came with sausage, hash browns topped with pepperjack , scrambled eggs and two naked pancakes with a side of butter and syrup. My mom ordered egg whites, cheddar hashbrowns, toast and Portuguese sausage . It was a nice out and we only waited a few minutes for our food. Food comes out fresh and hot. Looks great! We dig in and everything tastes so good!!!! The pancakes were good but Snooze am in San diego is number one for me in the simple pancake category :) I'll still eat their pancakes all day! Their sausage patties are my favorite kind, nice sharp taste of fennel and so juicy mmmmmmm.  My mom LOVED her food, it was solid.     We didn't go fancy schamancy like most people do when they come here, all those pancakes loaded with rich toppings and or heavier breakfast items. We wanted simple and we got that and thensome. So good and hit the spot.  We left more than satisfied and I went home and took a nice loooooong nap :D  I'd come back to their small chain everytime I'm in the 702 :D

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Sausage breakfast
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Portuguese sausage breakfast

3fkiOGECuQ_62ACNKUNDmg.text: This place definitely has amazing pancakes. Their garlic rice is also great as well!! The only thing I wish is that they had a bigger restaurant. It's TINY and it gets PACKED in there.

GGVOYEB73LW_5_3kfOPtAQ.text: Delicious breakfast with incredible service! The cafe was super busy when we came in on a Sunday morning, but we didn't have to wait too long. I got to try the Nutella pancakes, Portuguese sausage dish, and spam dish, and all were spectacular. Service was fast with friendly employees. I don't live in the area, but would highly recommend this delicious breakfast spot in Henderson.

9OhsxGQ4SqqOwoZeku-tEw.text: On an early Friday morning, I made the trek out from the land of Providence to fulfill my obligation of the other half of a Chevy recall.  With GF in tow, together (but in separate vehicles) we battled time, traffic and distance to return to the kingdom of Hendo.  After dropping of my V-8 lama, I hopped into the Irish Pixie for one of the most serious conversations one can have..............."Where do you want to eat?"  Yelp makes the these kinds of decisions easy, because after a quick search we narrowed it down to two places.  After determining the capacity of our stomachs, Babystacks Cafe (BC) seemed the better option.  I must admit there was some trepidation on my part regarding this decision.  Normally, a visit to a BC can be an exercise in patience.  Not so!  On this day!!  We arrived early enough that a seat for two was quickly had!!!  I ordered up scrambled eggs with Spam and some garlic rice ($1.00 extra).  I could not help myself and so...I ordered a side of Orange Creamsicle pancakes.    While waiting for the meal, I enjoyed great conversation and and always full cup of coffee.  When the meal arrived with happy service, I was happy. I was even happier when I requested Sriracha and it was given.  Everything was (on this morning) what I have come to know of the BC experience minus the lines.

OYvBKIlSS1IrWQQgscpR6g.text: Babystacks on the weekend is always packed! But the food and service is always worrh the wait!

26Bzlmkop8gkjh6ySnAv3Q.text: Holy crap! The food was sooooo good and the service was great too. Kaylah was super sweet and very friendly.   I had the chili omelet with the banana cream pie pancakes and I cannot wait to have them again. My son had the red velvet pancakes and those were to die for too.   This place is a must try so if you're reading the Yelp reviews to help you decide whether or not to check this place out, the answer is HELL YEAH!

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Chili omelet!
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Banana pudding pancakes!!!

E8A8pT3kb8hkEnX7Odo8MA.text: Another hidden treasure in Henderson. The loco plate with the red velvet pancakes is a great combo!!

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States

fvdce03ztonSBktIEYPjHg.text: Omg I would give this place 10 stars if I could! You will wait to be seated but WAIT it's so worth the wait! The food is beyond delicious. I got the red velvet pancakes and they were the best pancakes I ever had in my life! My husband got the shredded chicken and fried rice omelet it was so good! The service was amazing the food is to die for and the prices are reasonable! We will definitely be coming here every trip to Vegas. It is a small place but food is amazing!

AqAw6Rp9CzkFJqRiUydOxA.text: The red velvet pancakes are amazing, as was everything that everyone in our group ordered. Prices are good and portions are large. Very busy little place but the staff worked hard to manage everything. I would highly recommend this restraunt.

amXcMW2aAR-V9DlhvVizLA.text: Love love love the lemon pancakes. I order them every single time. The service is always great and my coffee always stays full. There is a little wait on weekends but that's to be expected at a breakfast spot.

xD8lOAmYxKj7BI36rqLa_w.text: Found this place on our way to Hoover Dam.... will definitely be worth the travel from Vegas everytime I go!! Pancakes were a hit with the family!!

nlb-L45MuyXKXZFl_ZtdNA.text: Yup!  Already planning my next visit and I've told about 12 people how amazing Babystacks is!   I came here with my sister and nephew for a Friday morning breakfast.  There was a pretty large group of people waiting but we were seated quickly and things just got better from there.   I wish I could have eaten everything on the menu.  Like really, everything.  I kept seeing what other diners had on their plates and I wanted that.  And that.  And that.  And that.   I opted for the lemon ricotta pancakes, a solid choice for sure.  Sweet but tangy, with a light dusting of powdered sugar.  They came with this cream cheese frosting/syrup but I left that out.  To me, they were perfect with some butter and the powdered sugar.  I got a side of the sausage pattys and they were stellar.  Maybe the best sausage pattys I've ever had.  They almost had a garlicy taste to them.  Sounds strange, I'm aware.  Just trust me on this one! My sister had a 2 egg breakfast and also proceeded to make a pig of herself (I love her) by ordering a short stack of the pb&j pancakes.  Out of this world good.  They tasted like dessert.  She couldn't finish them but I aint too proud to say I helped her out and we polished them off.  Yum. The little guy got a kid's breakfast and it was a complete hit.  Eggs, potatoes, sausage and pancakes.  He loved it and also appreciated the crayons and picture to color while waiting for his food.   We spent a conservative amount of just over $30 for all three of us.  It was well worth it.  The staff was friendly and the restaurant was clean.  The only drawback is it's size; it's so small!  I wish they'd expand to a larger location but again, the wait wasn't long so it's not a deal breaker by any stretch.  I imagine the weekends are chaotic here so I'd recommend going on a weekday to avoid a long wait.  They do have a small counter that seats about 5 or 6 people so that's an option if you're a solo diner or don't want to wait for a table. There's so much to try here and I'm anxious to check all the options off my Babystacks bucket list.  It's a thing now - swear.  Just go and you'll see why!

wACQdCkMuHr7UOl2pFofRw.text: Oh man, where to begin on this glorious place? I came here for the first time with my boyfriends mom for a girls breakfast. Honestly speaking, I usually don't go out for breakfast. I am always down for brunch (hello, Mimosas!) but breakfast places sans mimosas have never really been on my radar. After coming here once, screw the mimosas. Give me ALL the Portuguese sausage and eggs in the world!! I came on a Saturday morning around 10 am and there was a wait. The inside of the restaurant is small, so that's to be expected. They do make the most of their square footage though and fit as many people as they can inside. We waited about 20 minutes, but it was a beautiful day so I didn't mind. There is a Specials board inside where I saw lemon poppyseed pancakes on the menu, as well as a Portuguese sausage fried rice omelette. We ended up ordering both of these things and my mind was blown. Unlike the normal American breakfast spot, these pancakes were human sized. I could actually eat a stack of pancakes without a problem. The flavor was so delicious I didn't even need to add a dab of syrup. The omelette on the other hand was bigger than my head. I'm glad I had  company to split it with, but it was the best damn omelette of my life. I'm not usually an omelette person because I have had plenty of dried out bland eggs in my day. Well - that is nowhere to be found here. The egg portion of the omelette was so thin it was the perfect "wrapper" (for a lack of a better term) for the contents of the omelette. When I cut into the omelette the fried rice and sausage poured out. All of the flavors blended together perfectly. I don't know why I hadn't thought to make a fried rice omelette before. Usually there is scrambled egg in fried rice, so stuffing it into am omelette is by no means a stretch. Despite being busy, the service was very quick. The staff were welcoming and kind. Even with it being a small crowded place I could easily have a conversation with my guest.  All in all, I will be back to eat my way through the pancake menu. Even without mimosas, this place gets a 5 star rating. If they added mimosas, I'd probably never leave.

VtU9v0YQB3ZY_OV-nckXRw.text: Ok, wow!  Yum!    This is a solid breakfast spot with a very large selection of flavored pancakes.  At first, I was a little skeptical because the menu is so large but the pancakes alone were fluffy and extremely tasty.    I love the fact that they have a lot of flavor profiles that I crave from my childhood.  I'm Filipina and I love the fact that they serve garlic rice here.  I also was telling my friend this story about how in high school there was a special class that sold breakfasts of fried rice omelets and Portuguese sausage and I would be so excited when my class was able to go.  Looks like I have a place like that I can go to now as an adult.  While nothing is too groundbreaking, I think the flavors and quality of food are solid.  We went on a Monday morning and it was actually quite busy but our server was attentive and we got both food, drinks and the check very quickly.

bpeyE-zhB0rhJFqNCx2sjw.text: Very nice place! Staff is super friendly our waiter Eric was super cool dude. We were recommended to try Banana Foster pancakes they were delicious!! Food is so bomb definitely coming back!!!

jLxNq8b678-j6RnuCKU7mw.text: Happy to have had a chance to try this local favorite! It's been years since I've been to Vegas and one of the things my LA friends kept saying is to get the adobo fried rice omelet. From the looks of it, it was a huge portion and I shared it with my petite aunt and cousin with a side of shortstack hazelnut pancakes. It was perfect for us because the Nevada heat doesn't make me too hungry and I certainly didn't want to carry it home to LA.  The egg was cooked fluffy and wrapped around the whole serving of chicken adobo fried rice. The pancakes were light and velvety. My other cousins ordered spam and Portuguese sausage moco locos and I tried it. Also very delicious.  Because it was popular and we came during a hula competition weekend, the wait was 40 mins. I am not sure how it is on other weekends but that is the only thing that I would keep in mind.

KQVHs_rELJ76aylhsB10OA.text: Family owned and operated it seemed. Food was less than mediocre. Too many notes posted all.over can't do this can't do that.  Inefficient staff, was not too busy and service was slow for a pseudo fast food joint.

tLlPYMavVI0gz8ziTBmEWQ.text: Da Bomb...bring your stretchy pants! The fried rice put the 5 star pancakes to shame. I ordered two breakfasts . . . yum yum Gotta get there early tho.

IPRfB95zDyHdAvwzwNazmQ.text: The food is delicious but lacking on service when they are busy. I recommend not going on the weekend if you can avoid it, that seems to be when it's really busy and it's like a mad house in there. Otherwise they serve some delicious food at a fairly reasonable price.

4iB-1fGzhQW5y5nblP7d8Q.text: Great place for breakfast. Their specialty is the pancakes, just like their name. I had the hazelnut pancakes which was so delicious. The Kalua pork Benedict was full of flavor. Love that they are super generous on the Hollandaise sauce. There are also cabbages in the Benedict, which make the texture even better, with a hint of freshness.

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Hazelnut pancakes
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Kalua pork Benedict

XN1PZfyIIDuuxG-PAfdIVQ.text: If you're a party of 5 or more, do your self a favor and go to another place. Waited for 20 mins and other parties came and went and nothing for us. Asked again what was the wait time and they said it could be another 20 mins.

TAK9hUxDXdIR76minoZ6jA.text: Why should I go..... Because you want great breakfast food and variety   Spam scramble:  Basically a spam omelet.  With garlic rice. So good.  Especially if you haven't eaten it in a long time.   Nutella pancakes:  a dessert pancake that never fails to satisfy   Price:  About 8-10.... Fair I guess.  I always want cheaper but eh what can you do

LL9Qq00B7sBuTUAGpNcyCw.text: Great place to have breakfast! Pancakes were just the right amount (short stack =3) of food. There are so many different options to choose from! Attentive waiter and waitresses and wait time for 3 was approximately 30 minutes around 10 Am. It's worth the wait!

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Banana Foster Pancakes

TA7yYKr7BY_CDbgxtu8uKQ.text: This place has been one of the go-to breakfast places in this part of Henderson for quite some time. If you go around the time that they open you'll encounter some long wait times. Normally that would deter me but the food here has always been amazing. The menu has plenty of choices without overwhelming you and you'll find nice little surprises such as Adobo fried rice. The staff are always very friendly and accommodating. If you don't mind the possible long wait times, I highly recommend giving this place a try.

l_WGnxs82UwKfUquYomGaw.text: Fantastic breakfast place! The menu has plenty of options and the entire staff is friendly, efficient, and helpful. It's small inside but that's what makes it comfortable.

UAKqPLeHzX0cLv3G2D3nqA.text: I've been going to babystacks for the past 2 years, I started at the one on buffalo and flamingo and I go about 1-2x a weekend because I loved it so much... the overall service, & food. I recently moved back to Henderson, so started going to this location and it's been such a headache... they tend to always mess up my order.... every time I ask them extra for certain things they charge me but they never do it. The bathrooms are filthy every time I come. I also brought my family and there was a bug in my sisters water. I've decided today was the last day I come here I'll just drive to the buffalo location and I honestly suggest you do the same.

J7ivjCVOCXMFkt_IL_ULCA.text: This cafe is such a cool little place with great coffee. My host was this girl named Tanna and her service made me feel welcomed. The server was a good conversationalist and it was a genuinely nice experience

zrNxNmjtmedwKIgP8i9hAg.text: Amazing place and food! Love every location! The pancakes as well as fruit are amazing!

uZLm3yLC_JouISSu_NiTxA.text: I got my order to go today boy were they super friendly and fast yum yum. Everyone seems to work together so well it's great to see a business that's run like a family instead of a big corporate dragon. I'm so glad to see a place where customer service is important again

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States

28cK7-TS9DrAu16Ld-eddQ.text: First visit today. Service was great - food was fast, hot and tasty despite being very busy. Big breakfast menu and more limited lunch menu. Bananas Foster pancakes were a sweet treat. Hawaiian influenced items like Loco Moco and Kalua pork. Very nice staff. Good coffee! Will definitely go back.

xYba2BF5xmDoh21V2pxAhg.text: Came here early Saturday morning and was the best 20 mins I waited for breakfast while on vacation. Drive in from Vegas after mother saw amazing reviews of Babycakes and people were dead on with reviews. Red Velvet pancakes were mouth watering. Service was great. Takes you back to Hawaii the moment you step inside the restaurant. Get here early in the morning so you won't have to wait long.

0KMkfTBSfW7s0poaaW7igA.text: Great little place. Food was great. They have a lot of different and unique breakfast selections. My daughter got some cookie dough French toast thing. Looked good.

KZNx-AODj7MRRONtfTMmEA.text: Came here for the first time with my sisters and it was a great experience! We got Nutella crepes, huevos rancheros, and loco moco, everything was so good!!

2VVy-G-GlZ64wNwiAwJoCw.text: ...it's alright to good.  It really depends on what you order and the day. The idea of the dishes are often better than the actual execution.  If they used the adobo chicken with their chicken skillet or build your own omelette then they'd have something.

ZIDNb0IedeStPEI3SBi4Zw.text: Great service. Place is always packed but so worth the wait. I love the red velvet pancakes they are my fav!!  I'm glad they have other locations now.

nbsY3R87V0lrFyS_bDkFnQ.text: Very impressed.  Excellent food.  Brought my family.  We had the regular buttermilk pancakes, Cinnabon and white chocolate pancakes.  Also, an omelette and chicken fried steak. All were excellent especially the gravy.  I highly recommend it.

gU2KtVPLpYpzfGPA2SL4-Q.text: I love Denny's pancakes, that's the only place I'll order pancakes from when I'm out to eat, but not anymore. Babystacks has this cinnabun pancake option... fuggedaboudit. So good. Their pancakes are definitely the best thing on the menu and a close 2nd are their crepes. It may be a long wait, but it's worth it.

b_beEL2PgPQhrTqs2N21xw.text: Kaylah was wonderful here at baby stacks! Such quick and friendly service, with a welcoming smile! I'll deffitently be back. Thanks Josh for recommendation!!!

NusclsPGILJ2UuvsVTuuTQ.text: I love their Rick's Adobo Fried Rice and their Red Velvet Pancakes!  They have excellent customer service and everyone is very welcoming.

g3u49ZW2rR3mqa2JOb0oqw.text: This restaurant is 20mins away from my house, but I wouldn't mind drive every morning to get breakfast here. I just want to throw out there that I think everyone that works here is happy all the time. The hostess and our server was super duper happy to greet us as soon as we walked in to the restaurant.   My boyfriend and I came here on a Saturday morning for breakfast. It was predictable to be waiting. We only waited for around 10-15mins when I thought it would be longer. We both got the chilli loco moco. My friends that came here said to get the CHILI loco moco, not the regular one and to add GARLIC RICE. Definitely garlic rice was a life changer. My boyfriend loved it too. I love garlic and rice so it was the best thing in the world. I loved the chili loco moco because it wasn't salty at all. Everything was on point and amazing!  The only thing why I gave it a 4 star was because, the first bite my boyfriend had, he found a piece of hair. Which is totally normal in the restaurant industry. We told our server and he was very apologetic about it. The server took it to the back and made a whole new one for my boyfriend. Our server was very nice about this, because he even gave us a little discount for the inconvenience!   I was too full to get any of the pancakes, but they do look amazing! I would definitely come back here again to try their pancakes.

gM4bXofp1OOcwtJRD4hr9w.text: Great breakfast spot! There were so many different  things to choose from. I was torn between getting a skillet and trying the banana cream pie pancakes! I didn't  want to overwhelm myself with too much food. So my sis got  a skillet dish and I got my pancakes.  Talk about pancakes so fluffy and full  of flavor. You don't  need syrup. To add syrup would have ruined the banana  cream experience!  My sis skillet dish was a chili omelet yes you read that right. An omelet  with chili in it plus hash browns. Nothing short of amazing!  Service was very polite here and the waiter was very attentive. Great place to go when you want a nice comforting breakfast!

e7KZ-uI0bL3cOW6qqFQ7-g.text: This place has AMAZING pancakes!  or babystacks as they call them here.  They have dozens of different ways to have them prepared from sweet to savory.  I cant wait to go back to try more flavors.  I had buttermilk while my boyfriend had cookies and cream.  These are no ordinary flavored pancakes.  Not only do they prepare speciality pancakes, but they have specialty whipped creams and syrups for them.  Delicious!  Additionally I had a breakfast skillet which was fresh and delicious.  You could really taste the freshness in the potatoes and vegetables.  The eggs were cooked well.  You cant always find a short order cook who can prepare eggs over medium, unfortunately but well done here!  My brother had an amazing burrito!  Cant wait to go back!  Also, the coffee is delicious!  Apparently the owners prepare their own brew and their recipe is great.  I couldnt get the staff to elaborate on the blend but I find it has tones of Hazelnut.

1PA6hpnkx0Og_aMI39NR_Q.text: This place is not the best to me. Maybe because I am not a big fan of pancakes. I do like the hawaiian breakfast menu. But my boy friend is from hawaii and I will take his breakfast over theirs any day. It was alright but nothing to brag about in my opinion.

u2f00gXQAQfefYKukdP4fA.text: I've been coming here for a while now and always enjoy. They get busy but the wait is worth it. I've always had great service. The pancakes are amazing. You really can't go wrong there. It has an island themed taste so there's spam and rice. Just wish it was a bigger location.

X78DpHagQ5hK_h1prAYDfQ.text: Came here expecting it to be great since I've been coming to this place multiple times in the past and was let down hugely, pancakes didn't have anything in the batter and my gf's pancakes were under cooked and doughy and they re made it a 2nd time for it to be The exact same way with some green stuff in it both times. Also potatoes and her skillet were room temperature and had to ask for it to be reheated along with a new batch of seasoned potatoes that were hot. I don't know what happened here but DO NOT COME

a99PQJVbNfXAQHLl3VXZvQ.text: Love their food. Service is sometimes slow, but they are very friendly and worth the wait. I have not had something that I have not liked. I wish they would let you substitute some of their crepes, though.

63i8xGSfb1RPgTguF13OKQ.text: this place is so amazing. the food is GREAT. so many choices, the pancakes are great, service is amazing. very happy!

wMWY6_MdiuCEnO7LPq79RQ.text: The 9th Island keeps its food game strong.   Hmmm... I'll have the Hazelnut pancakes with a Nutella drizzle, whipped cream, hazelnut chunks and cocoa-powder and the S'mores pancakes, with marshmallows, and graham cracker chunks and because I need to battle all this sugar with some salt, so I can raise my blood pressure at the same time. I'll get the Chili covered Loco Moco.   The things mentioned above are all real menu items that this crazy place serves and guess what it's all-amazing! I'm not into sweets, but I couldn't stop eating both of these pancake platters. My favorite had to be the hazelnut pancakes; no syrup needed just a healthy coating of Nutella and whipped cream. Food boner level is currently at eleven.   The Chili Loco Moco. Now if you're not familiar with Loco Moco, this is classic Hawaiian comfort food dish; white rice, burgers and brown gravy. Now let's get unhealthy and add some chili to the mix. This is not by any means a refined dish, but when hung-over on a Sunday at 12:30pm I couldn't care less. I could have used a little more chili, but beyond that a great dish!   The service here is amazing and food is stellar for what it is, "Hawaiian Comfort Food". Please Babystacks Cafe, update the decor. I'm definitely over seeing strip mall decor in all of these strip mall eateries.

cjt8dayADvY9iJT8FL7_Yg.text: Good breakfast place with tons of pancake options.  German chocolate was kinda like eating a brownie for breakfast.  Got the kalua pork benedict and the meat was buttery and flavorful, paired well with the hollandaise which was a bit overapplied.

e0BYZrxMOkFrs7o8u_Iygg.text: Was told 25-30 min wait, took nearly an hour to be seated. During my hour wait I was watching other people be seated way quicker than my party of 2.  Once we were finally seated we watched people who were seated after us get their drinks and orders taken before we were even greeted by our waitress. They're struggling to keep up with the volume they have, and service is sub par.  My $10 bacon and egg plate had over cooked bacon and I could have gotten a better plate at a local casino for $1.49. It also came out 15 minutes before my kids pancakes so it was cold by the time I got to take my first bite... not impressed.

zTYoAFmAtHluwcrX9J94Dw.text: With a soft spot for breakfast foods, my boyfriend and I tried this place for brunch. Pancakes?! Why not?   We walked in, the staff was cordial but not really animated. We were not seated as promptly even though there were more than enough tables. With the aberration of the decor, the seating was uncomfortable when we were seated. Also, the waiter was a bit lethargic and nelgected to bring me the coffee I ordered till a I called him over 15 mintues later.   As for the food, my boyfriend ordered the short Buttermilk pancakes and I had the Honey French Toast. The food was alright but the price was bit much for the French Toast ($8.50 for two slices of bread with no sides).   Not exactly the place to be for a returned visit, as we will look to other places to try next. If you love breakfast foods of high cailber, try Squeeze In over by Easter and Pebble instead.

xAEs8lNdFsMUl9JAzEVdwA.text: Recommend. My daughter and I visited on a Thursday morning and were sat immediately. The restaurant was hallway full, and the servers were quietly and efficiently buzzing around. This was my second time eating at this establishment, and was quickly put at ease remembering my first experience coupled with the early sight of thoroughness by the employees. Orders were taken briskly, with no compromise on service. Customer service is absolutely excellent, taste equally pleasing. Portions left a little to be desired, but considering the price and me leaving feeling comfortable, overall my expectations were met. Filipino and Hawaiian cuisine that's very pleasurable.

VgijFuNrUx5uhujMA-sMHw.text: Pancakes are light and fluffy, perfect. Eggs came out perfect as ordered hash browns crispy. Excellent service  I will be back

SWpQk-X5PQc21sixoJZ1jQ.text: This place is really great, a True local delight! The space isn't very big, so expect to wait for a table around peak brunch/lunch time. I can't speak for weekends, but it was pretty busy on Monday at around 12:30-1 PM. They clear fast, though, so it's worth the small wait. The customer service is splendid! I ordered a Loco Moco (which is really delicious) and the eggs weren't cooked right, so they very courteously remade it for me. :D I also ordered German Chocolate pancakes, which has a carmel-y coconut glaze with pecan pieces. The food is a bit indulgent, so if you really want to try the signature dishes, go on cheat day. The interior is homey and very cute, and the environment is very much "breakfast-place". The price is all right, definitely a better alternative to IHOP, if you're looking for a ballpark price range.

A-cz2HHnkHFqDl_Nd1qLdQ.text: I know so many love this place and there isn't much wrong with it but it is very "ok" to me. I'd leave 2 1/2 stars if I could. The staff are fine, the food is a little pricey sometimes depending on what you get.   Sometime there is a wait , the seating is not very exclusive. The Moco Loco was the best meal anyone here has tried. Worth a shot to try out if you are in the area but may not be a favorite in the end.

RQi5IPHJARl5FW-kI2tSCw.text: Let me start of with the red velvet pancakes! It's a must try when you come to Babystacks Cafe they are so delicious!

q8vViMb6vdhbqD4NLKPqJw.text: Very busy! Cant complain it was sooo good!! I ordered the homemade corn beef hash, 2eggs and garlic fried rice! I cleaned my plate out lol. My husband ordered the chilli moco and he also enjoyed it!! Joan and Krissy was awesome!!   I recommend this place!!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Corn beef hash, 2eggs and garlic fried rice. And chilli moco

7_B42ZoWvGM7izLQ7QSxJA.text: Casual and comfortable resturant environment. Good food, polite and attentive staff.  I sat at the counter, because there was a wait for a table and I was eating alone. Most breakfast come with pancakes or toast. I ordered corned beef hash and eggs with garlic rice vs potato's for a small up-charge. They have a good selection of pancake types.  The staff is cordial and frequently checks in on you to see if you need anything. My server JoAnn did a wonderful job, happy to add this place to my regular eateries. The only negative for me was the coffee, either the water is not being filtered well and or the coffee used is not the best or both- This is an easy fix for the resturant. Being a breakfast place they should have a good quality fresh coffee, prepared with quality water.

eX0ttOzsO94odjMY3TiD6w.text: Okay, so I have to start off by admitting that I'm not a pancakes fan - I'll go for waffles or French toast any day. The food at Babystacks absolutely blew my mind, though, and I regret nothing.   I went with the Spinach Benedict as my main item and grabbed a short stack of their special tiramisu pancakes is my side... the portions are generous, the food is delicious and they're probably going to have to grease me to get my ass back out the door after the amount I've eaten.   I'll be back whenever I'm in Vegas, definitely.

RoGbbgmv8M7UE9uimksEFw.text: The service is good and the portions are generous. I like the variety of pancakes you can order. It's a small place that is usually busy so it's best to get there early.

AXCixlWt5B5dfEd95aj0UQ.text: I went inside to get a table for my husband and myself. He was right outside parking and walking in. The guy at the front refused to seat me until my husband was physically standing next to me. He ignored me and sat 3 other parties while I had to go out and tell my husband to come in. By then I was so angry that I told him I didn't want to eat there. My husband asked for the "manager" who was totally oblivious to their "policy" that all people in the party must be present to be seated. My husband explained that he was there outside, and that it wasn't like I showed up by myself and would have to wait 10 minutes for him. You're saying that if people are waiting outside they can't be seated? What a load of garbage considering that place is the size of a small box. The "manager" just glossed over saying, "I'm sorry to hear that, was there anything else I can do?" On repeat while staring off into space. My husband asked for his boss (which I'm assuming is the actual manager) who also sort of admitted that wasn't their actual policy and would need to talk to the staff about it. She offered to seat us, but I certainly would never spend my money there again. Sad situation to lose good paying customers for bad business practice. We never once got an apology for the way we were treated. I've been there before, but I'll spend my money elsewhere going forward.

Ibh3LOxXbqbaRaOJ3o6xeA.text: Been here twice so far and the servers were very nice. Superb Biscuits and gravy! The home fries tasted good when you order them crunchy. Different types of eggs Benedict. You just have to try them all.

jVmNGiH-ovJFk9b8eTbL5g.text: Restaurant looks nice & clean , the hostess & the server was very nice . Food was amazing, great pancake & I love my Crepes

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Nutella Crepes
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Cinnamon bun pancake

27NFscyVIMUYe_xZKacodA.text: In the mood for some good pancakes so I Googled best places and Babystacks came up. Decided to try based on photos and reviews. I had the Kalbibi breakfast plate that came with pancakes and the option to upgrade to specialty pancakes for an extra charge. The Kalbibi plate with the eggs and garlic fried rice (also a up charge) was ok, the meat could have been a little more tender. The blueberry pancakes were not good at all, as one reviewer stated.  I would try this place again but will never try the pancakes again.

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States

2Yi3ZQkRsh-WEPTN5PMm9A.text: It was okay but their pancakes were very sweet and heavy. Their eggs benedict were also only okay; the hawaiian was definitely better than their spinach benedict. The only thing that left me full were the pancakes. I would recommend getting a meal and then the two stack of replacement pancakes unless you're really craving pancakes. I will probably come back but there are other breakfast places that are higher on my list.

Sl4f_nm2gGLzyMs4T-ohbQ.text: This is a great little breakfast and lunch spot to go to. The staff is very friendly and courteous. The prices are very affordable.  I ordered the corned beef hash and eggs with hash browns and Cinnabon pancakes. The whole dish was a bit under seasoned so I had to add my own salt. The pancakes were delicious and very well made.  My fiance ordered the Portuguese sausage and eggs with garlic fried rice and red velvet pancakes. Again the dish was a bit on the bland side, but the pancakes were amazing!   My only real concern is that we had ordered a 3$ cup of orange juice, and it turns out it was an orange juice concentrate so it didn't taste good. I would have really loved to have fresh squeezed orange juice.  With that said I will be coming back here some time in the future.

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Red velvet pancakes.
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Portuguese sausage and eggs w/ garlic rice
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Corned beef hash and eggs w/ hashbrowns and Cinnabon pancakes

j7cfwMyRGqSa0orTg2MHDw.text: Great place for breakfast!! We were on our way to Hoover dam and found this gem! Pancakes are awesome!

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Cinnamon role pancakes
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Strawberry banana Nutella crepe

w66oxFXWlEirNp2XPbJMjg.text: What can I say about this little gem. I try and find a time where I can just stroll on in but they r always packed. No problem say it's a 25 minute wait it's 10.  Definitely worth the wait food is always on point and quick. Can't recommend anything because everything I've had was so good. More of a close your eyes and point and you will be satisfied and full.  Highly recommend eating here

VJKwLLZsvakStsj5VKXT_g.text: This is a great place to eat. The pancakes are really light and fluffy. I usually don't care to have pancakes but these were excellent. They have a great menu to choose from. The omelette was good. The breakfast burrito was more than enough.  The piglet skillet was delicious. Our server gave us excellent service. I definitely would come back for the pancakes.

V5tcW921P41xTfeZzXtQDA.text: This is probably my favorite breakfast place I've been to so far in Las Vegas. The wait time was definitely long and we were waiting for about 30 minutes to get a table for 2 but the food makes it worth it! I definitely recommend getting the hot chocolate, and I got the veggie skillet with the hazelnut Babystacks, and my boyfriend got an omelet with the s'mores Babystacks. We both cleared our plates!

y72BU5rUafl-NVjmNqDN0w.text: Food and service never disappoint. They have a great selection from classic American fare to different dishes like Hawaiian, Mexican, and Asian. Their red velvet pancakes are my favorite side to go with my Adobo fried rice.

IRdoQbSp97j2jnGCPdOh7A.text: This is a stable breakfast spot my family hits EVERYTIME we come to Vegas. So many options every time we are pleased with our meals the skillets are amazing and the pancake options  amazing I like the banana fosters, my husband usually get red velvet and kids find a new favorite every visit.

oiEMk-gFJMte4q5X4xCL7Q.text: Love this place! Kalbi short ribs and red velvet pancakes are a must! Or the loco moco!

FVpeHqbTW2DS5Op1XmCdUg.text: This place is pretty tiny inside and usually crowded but it's definitely worth the wait! If your not willing to wait for a table then I'd recommend going on a weekday. The service at Babystacks is always good too. I usually order the Hawaiian breakfast or French Toast. They are both delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Bacon, scrambled eggs and seasoned potatoes.
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Pancakes with strawberries and whipped cream

CWsTWDtb4_Syk4_zTDjIxw.text: Like my check-in says... this place is overrated. Severely. Ordered the PB and ? pancakes with bananas and I get peanut butter chips; it's cheap and tacky. Especially when the menu says peanut butter. I know I'm being nit-picky but to me there's a huge difference. The food was okay - potatoes came out first, heavily seasoned and my pancakes came out dry, 10 min after. Pancakes were tasty but really dry. In the past I ordered a skillet which was really small and lacking in quantity of ingredients. The service is friendly but really slow... The host takes forever to get you seated and to settle your payment. When it's one thing after the other everything just starts to annoy you and that's the point I got to. I hadn't been here in a while and I remember why now.

J9n0FaBkEXGgLvW0Si3KSQ.text: I love the pancakes ( bananas foster ) and the food is good. But I just wish the serving can be a little bigger. The serving is small for the price . I'm usually island servings are pretty generous. No need to be huge either. But at least a good portion . But then again that is just a suggestion. I still recommend this place to get breakfast if you are not hungry or to get something's small with a coffee. But if you are starving mmmmmmmm maybe elsewhere :)

_hP-5E_oVqdcsseR7R5mDg.text: My husband and I tried their Steak and Eggs with Garlic Rice. It was delicious. My boys love the chocolate pancakes with a side of bacon and hot chocoate. It's a small restaurant so it gets super busy. Be prepared to wait if you get their during lunchtime.

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States

dVRAtKxUSMFsOE7x_wmB4Q.text: I came in around breakfast time and ordered biscuits and gravy. They were delicious and everything came perfectly as ordered. Our waiter refilled our drinks whenever needed and checked in on us throughout our breakfast at the right times. Lovely place to go for breakfast or lunch.

IpkbmHLuaU2DBeM3IL3zGA.text: Always long wait but that's due To the amazing food and service. Great place to come and enjoy a short or full stack. Anything on the menu is worth it!

pnMpkQ3HfSLMQhMn9R_ulw.text: Try the German pancakes! Best I ever had! Great customer service! Calm atmosphere. Its my first time here but I WILL be back! and I'm bringing friends next time!

JmfThC2nmMRX_aWzzDysIQ.text: Great breakfast food! My boyfriend tried their adobo with rice and he said it wasn't that bad. Definitely not the adobo that I had pictured but my boyfriend liked it and it was worth a try. Their chocolate chip pancakes is so yummy! Will definitely come back here!

tergSb9kfD-CpsmLvwQnBg.text: I've been here 3 times now - once for breakfast, once for lunch, and once for a team lunch with work. I think the service is very lackluster. My most recent visit was for an early lunch. Our server brought us the water we asked for right away, but didn't come back for another 15 minutes to take our order!   I asked for egg whites overhard, and he responded, "So you want them scrambled?" I explained what I meant by overhard (strange that they don't know this). About 15 minutes later both meals came out, but without my eggs. He said they'd be out "in a little while". When he finally came over with them, they were scrambled and he asked, "Is this OK? I know you said you didn't want them scrambled." So he basically handed me exactly what I said I didn't want, and asked if it was OK. That was annoying.   Everything here is an add on. Egg whites, upgrade to fruit, upgrade to a flavored pancake, etc. I spent more here on just 2 eggs, a side of bananas and dry wheat toast than I do on a much bigger and more diverse breakfast (that includes a piece of coffee cake) at Cracked Egg.   When I came for a work lunch, the wait staff made a big deal about splitting all the checks, which seemed ridiculous. We are clearly a large party that wants to pay separately, but they were saying they could only do a maximum of a certain number of checks, which I thought was silly.   Good food, and some of their specialty pancakes are to die for, but service isn't flexible and prices are steep. This place is always busy. I'll avoid.

r8Utz6h9-pF0JPlZ2cmrSg.text: If you is Vegas you must try this Restaurant! They have the best food in town Hands down, they are not to pricey! You get good portions and they staff is always friendly and consistent!

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States

ZKuabPobBnfwuuRRmjD_AA.text: I took my friend there past Friday, it wasn't busy yet and the staff was very friendly. The food came out fast and hot and the server was very helpful. About the food the only thing I can say is that it was delicious, we build our own omelette and we had on the side the S'mores pancakes (best pancakes I've ever tried ). Love this place, I highly recommend it

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. S&#39;mores pancakes and omelette so goood!!!
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States

tDaVFurz4PLTu17uqcc2FA.text: Ok, I have officially at all three Babystacks. I have to say the breakfast is very good and consistent every location. My whole family was satisfied with the experience  I'm assuming the owners are REALLY from Hawaii? Cause they have the spam sliders on point! Highly recommend...will be coming here regularly when in vegas. ( all three were in this one trip lol)

RsTPPXrtryldooPAn8Hh2Q.text: Where do I begin... I was super excited to try this place. I've heard and read great things about the food and FI-NA-LLY  I made my way over and it wasn't even packed. Woohoo!  Our server Efrain was awesome! He was knowledgeable on the menu. When we asked for suggestions and which pancakes he personally liked, he was able to tell us without hesitation.   My BF ordered the garlic fried rice, eggs and sausage & Peanut butter pancakes. He took one bite from his garlic rice and didn't like it. He also thought his pancakes were too dry. I got the fried rice adobo omelette and the hazelnut pancakes. The adobo fried rice would be so good if they cut half the salt. It was soooo salty, I could barely eat it. The pancakes...okay so, the pancake itself without all the toppings we're okay. I was hoping to have more of that hazelnut flavor within the pancake which I didn't. When you add back the toppings, it added more of the hazelnut taste. It was okay for me. Meh  I don't think I'll be returning.                                 I'd rather go to Cinnamons across town  #sorrybabystacks #iwantedtoloveyou

tM_omDBCOk1PkOQVVJP7fg.text: We love coming here. Food is great, prices are fair.  However only 4 stars because it generally takes a veeeery long time to get our food.

_oVmB2KLxs8kRC_QDDnvjw.text: Went on a very busy Saturday morning, wait was surprisingly only ten minutes. Service was exceptional and very quick, we were going in n out in about, if not less than an hour. Food was amazing!! I've never had such a good stack of pancakes (cookies n cream), definitely made me want to go back to try all the different kinds they had. Chili omelet was amazing, especially with the potatoes!

RtkXje-MQZVhR55AMs7P9A.text: The service was really great. It's a pretty small place so you feel kind of crammed in but a lot of breakfast spots are like that. I got the breakfast burrito with potatoes on the side. The bacon was not crispy at all even though it specifies that it is on the menu.  It was only slightly cooked but I was (currently still am) hungover so I couldn't bare to wait any longer and decided just to go for it. It wasn't great and the potatoes were barely cooked. I'm a fan of crispy everything so this place was really just meh. The banana foster pancakes were good but I still prefer other breakfast spots to this one. I gave it 3 stars because they have great service and it was fine. I just expect more out of brunch. I'm a brunch snob.  Whatever.
