5vTgcZov2YyVq4AeKSJw5g.text: We stopped by  because it was close and sounded good. It was so excellent! He had the adobo omelet. It was so flavorful! I had hazelnut pancakes. The short stack just the  right size. Service was friendly. I was surprised at the line but they kept it moving. When we travel through Henderson, we'll stop here again!

cnmbJGpaU4KsywSme8E8OQ.text: I had the chocolate chip pancakes and corned beef hash and my wife had the bacon pancakes and sausage links and eggs. I think everything was incredible. My wife also loved almost everything. Except that the potatoes were a little over seasoned. All and all We will def be going back soon. Thank you for the great service and excellent experience. Fyi don't be shyed away by long lines. They move fast.

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Mmm Mmm Mmm. Great portions and great food

a5CQDtF0Iymz2Gv7Uxve-g.text: Love this place!!!!!!t Best pancakes in town.. The pineapple upside down cakes are the best.

zxCI9whOvO1Y53drnwu2Yw.text: When it's busy, and they put your name on the list, watch like a hawk. Maybe photograph your name on the list. Waited the half hour we were told the wait would be... then had the same guy that wrote my name down, ask for my name to put it on the list; because it was. Not. There. Are you freaking kidding me?  We have gone to Babystacks twice now, both times had a fair wait before, which we expected. What was not expected, was what I mentioned above. We walked in, were in a line of people getting their names on "The List" of people waiting for a table. The younger guy asked if we wanted a table, of course we did, so we said so. He asked how many, and for a name. We told him "2 - Chris" - His reply, "Ok, it should be 25-30 minutes," Said while he wrote down my name.  Half hour later, we're sitting on the bench waiting patiently, he walks up, clipboard in hand, and again asks us, "Did you want a table? I have to put your name on the list."   Blank stares.  Yes, we would like a table, that's why WE GAVE YOU OUR NAME HALF HOUR AGO. He glances at the list, said we weren't on it, so we would have to go to the bottom of the list. His co-worker sensed our instant, growing anger, and said we would get the next table. Thank you, ma'am!  A couple moments later, we were seated with menus.   It took a little while, but our server, the same lady as our first visit, walked past, said hello and she would be right with us. Six back and forth trips later, she dropped off some water, and eventually stopped by to see if we wanted more than water, and to take our order.   Now, I have been known to be hyper-logical in the past, so when reading the menu, I had a question and asked the server, who, one would think, would have at least an attempt at a satisfactory reply.  My observation / question was thus: Order of Biscuits & Gravy: $6.50 Order of B&G with 2 eggs: $7.50 Order of B&G with sausage: $8.50  Order of B&G with 2 eggs AND sausage: $10.50  Why is it four dollars more to get both items, when individually, there is only a three dollar increase in price?  Her response? "It might be a glitch in the menu or the computer."  What?!  I instead, went with another item, and tried their chicken fried steak and eggs, with hash browns, for $11.95. When the food arrived, it was a small serving of hash browns, a standard, frozen/fried CFS, and some watery fried eggs (not sure if it was water, they were very wet, and not from grease/butter/oil - or the standard egg goo).  Either the gravy, or the CFS was rather... floury. Most likely the gravy. Which, by the way, was not the best gravy around. I've had better (at Carl's Jr no less), and I have had much worse (pretty much everywhere).  For twelve bucks, I would have liked to feel full after the meal, or at least, satisfied. It was mediocre food overall.   I may go back and try the pancakes themselves, when I am in the mood for pancakes. Otherwise, there are tastier, more inexpensive places to get a good breakfast in the morning.

IQe2w_4gLvoCHKuRuM6mTA.text: Red Velvet Pancakes $5.75  Banana Pancakes $4.75  Rick's Adobo Fried Rice $9.25  Cora's Corned Beef Hash and Eggs $10.95  If anyone from Waipahu knows Rocky's cafe, Babystacks is like the new and nicer version. I've been here twice: Once to order a take out and the other time I ate here with my wife. The red velvet and banana cakes were really good; very rich, sweet, and filling. The adobo fried rice was one of the best I've tasted. It wasn't too salty or greasy like some other versions i've tasted. The corned beef hash and eggs were simple and good but not worth the price. If you're looking for some good pancakes and Hawaiian kine grindz, Babystacks is the place to go.

EFxZe3uK-KRTDUJj29r2vw.text: This is my favorite breakfast place, but I have to say that the inability to split checks makes me never go here anymore. My friends and I used to meet up here all the time for breakfast but it's just SUCH a HASSLE to not be able to pay for our food individually. It's so much easier just to chose a different place to meet up. PLEASE CHANGE THIS POLICY!! I miss my red velvet pancakes.

LL6ZXXXjx8kucqM3fmirlg.text: I have been to Babystacks and tried their short stack banana cream pie and the red velvet pancakes.  They were both worth the visit.  The serving size was very filling.  I only did the take out, so I can only speak to the service at the register.  I called my orders in and they were on time with the prep time.  The people at the register were pleasant.  I would recommend eating at this location.

Qa4dY5BfxUJOLAqf2LzjLw.text: Fir a first timer, I had high expectations because of the reviews from my friends. The place was kind of dirty for being so new. There was dry food on the top of the salt shaker. The food was just OK! Honesty, I prefer IHOP. The service was lacking, the noise levels were out of control,

B1CJwvjCF7IjTRTa3tC30w.text: This place is dangerous! It's a good thing that they are not open during the evenings, because I might double up and have breakfast and dinner all in the same day. Being from Hawaii, I appreciate their 'Hawaiian style' and breakfast fusion. Their creations are delectable and filling. Flavors are amazing combinations, textures have been perfect on every visit. Thank you for bringing a little piece of breakfast into Henderson!

sTbJqjIYUNY47e15CG4x0Q.text: Yummy.  My daughter, who is 20, loves this place. We frequent multiple locations.  The quality of food is consistent and good. They don't provide a lot of seating so you will see and smell what the table next to you is eating and how they eat it. The tables are close. The service has always been good. My daughter's favorite is the red velvet pancakes.

nINFYPq8Qnr820CZ023Pog.text: Friendly staff, good food, and prominent menu selection. The staff could be more enthusiastic, though.

zrUJst-AfQYyEWuKOTh5cQ.text: So to start not a fan of having to wait to eat at the bar when there is obviously chairs open. Then it took about 45 minutes to get my food. I ordered the omelette with the pasilla chile in it and chicken; however I switched the chicken for thier pork carnitas. It was decent but definitely not as much flavor as I expected. Best part of the meal was the cute waitress with a nice smile.

92A3LSPnexJrU-hnA5q3UQ.text: Don't know what the fuss is about here. Breakfast with co-worker and it was ok, not delivered hot and was very bland. Server was very good though.

YnLeHWsSguqQJFAlhMldWQ.text: First impressions are everything!!!    The host (a younger male) doesn't smile, doesn't greet you, doesn't thank you, and makes you wait to be helped while he hangs out in the back.. The servers are great, but the host needs training, and manners!

0bivbsP2nR9AeWJT_DFElg.text: Loved it!  Great prices and great food...can't get better than that.   Had the Adobo Fries Rice Omelet & Banana's Foster Pancakes. They were AWESOME!  Can't wait to go back and try the Kahlua Pig Grilled Cheese and the Red Velvet Pancakes. Definitely our new breakfast place.

zYlZbHAbyKhhS_2M3rmt_Q.text: Holy cow! It was an amazing breakfast! Loved the chocolate chip pancakes. They have a great staff with welcoming smiles!

4QZqFQUSniZF3CnZwv8WUQ.text: Service is friendly and quick. Restaurant was clean and had a nice atmosphere. Enjoyed the red velvet pancakes. With the whipped cream and cream cheese syrup? with every bite it was delicious. Crunchy bacon and decent loco moco as well. Can be a wait to eat sometimes but I consider that a good sign of a great place!

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Yummy red velvet pancakes!

fHjO89tTEoMLWS0VAiQ8Gg.text: Babystacks is my favorite! Eggs Benedict is always delicious. I love that they serve shredded hash browns when it seems like so many breakfast places go with ranch-style (cubed) potatoes. I order them crispy and haven't been disappointed. I've tried several of the fancy pancakes and liked all that I've tasted (red velvet, carrot cake, bacon, cinnabun, original, cookies and cream, and so on). My favorite is to upgrade to the banana foster short stack for "dessert" after my eggs. My husband is over the moon for the adobo fried rice omelet that is bursting with flavor and big enough to share. The coffee is pretty good and the service is pretty much spot on every time--friendly, gracious, helpful. Mmm, I can't wait to go back!

ByGitXqK-wIGe_fumOdbzg.text: My Mom and I recently had brunch here on a Saturday afternoon.  It pains me to only give them one star, since we enjoyed our food.  That is, until my Mom found a short and curly in her pancake.  We arrived around 1pm and it was not busy.  We were lucky to find no wait and were immediately seated.  Although it was not busy, it took our server about 15 minutes to approach us.  Although we were ready to order food, she only took our drink orders.  Once we eventually placed our food order my Mom even commented "I can only imagine how long our food will take after that."  Yikes.  Luckily, our food did not take near as long.  My Mom ordered the senior breakfast with sausage links, eggs over easy and a short stack.  This is a decent deal and was far too much food for her. She actually gave the eggs and hashbrowns to me.  I ordered the banana cream pie pancakes, which were really delicious.  The short stack is plenty filling.  I loved the sliced bananas, whipped cream and banana cream sauce topping.  Other than the slow service, everything was great....until my Mom discovered a hair (that didn't belong to either of us) in her pancakes.  We were both almost done with our meals and immediately lost our appetites.  We immediately cashed out.  I would normally inform the manager of the hair, but we were in a hurry and hadn't expected breakfast to take as long as it did.  I know this happens from time to time.....I would still go back, and will update my review accordingly after that.

kjp8GdJ269IngKKDwKVWXQ.text: Found this place while looking on yelp for breakfast joints selling Portuguese sausage. It does not look like much on the outside and there is limited seating inside. We waited roughly an hour to be seated. It was well worth the wait. The pancakes are delsih!!! I tried the banana fosters which they don't have on the menu, you have to ask for it and it was amazing. The Portuguese sausage wasn't the same brand that everybody in Hawaii uses but it did its purpose and made my tummy smile. Prices were very reasonable and I highly recommend this place if you are looking for a good breakfast place.

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Portuguese sausage with garlic rice
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Banana Fosters! Out of this world..

A1vx4ktJ8ydGpaenvIE2Ug.text: Came out to Vegas for a birthday trip. Always love trying local spots. This one had some amazing reviews and whelp it lived up to them. Pancakes were fluffy and delicious. Garlic rice brings back grandma memories so that was also a plus. All in all a great spot for some good breakfast. When we come back this will still be on my yelp list to come back and try

d6edO55ivED0aop1GRvYfg.text: Oh so full...pumpkin pancakes, banana & peanut butter pancakes on the side with veggie omelette and potatoes. Potatoes not homemade fresh but my brother had hash browns that looked homemade.  He had ranchero omelette and inhaled it so must have been good....he said needed more spice.  Excellent server Nicole.

mD_lhzdDjvwQYYOwa84mfg.text: Babystacks Cafe makes good tasting breakfasty brunchy type food. If you're in the mood for something breakfasty or brunchy then you should give them a try.  More specifically they make good tasting variations on traditional egg and pancake dishes mixed with some Hawaiian style recipes. Delish!  The service is always pleasantly friendly and the cafe itself is a comfortable place to have a meal. It does get busy, so there is a possibility you'll have to wait to be seated.

Y4gs5qVXlJMmEW784iSzdg.text: Coming from Hawaii (and being a frequent bruncher), I was so excited to find a breakfast restaurant in Las Vegas that served "local" food (read: food often found in Hawaii rather than authentic Hawaiian food).  Plus, I have non-Hawaiian friends who have enjoyed this restaurant so I had high expectations.   My friend and I arrived around 1:30 in the afternoon on a Saturday and were pleased to be seated right away, despite a nearly full restaurant!  The service was attentive, although the server did make some strange comments and seemed absent-minded at times.  However, the server was extremely accommodating and felt comfortable providing recommendations to us, which was helpful.  I ordered the Kalua Pig Eggs Benedict - a favorite from back home - without the cabbage.  Being a huge Eggs Benny fan, I was disappointed to find the English muffin was rather soggy. The rest of the Benny was scrumptious!  I wanted a side order of the adobo fried rice, but when the server told me that wasn't possible, he recommended the garlic rice. I did not enjoy the garlic rice at all - it was just rice soaked in oil, butter, and garlic.  I'm a fan of garlic, but it was very bland.  My favorite part of the meal was the red velvet pancakes!  It is not as sweet as you would expect and is much lighter than actual cake.  The cream cheese sauce topping was also perfect!  All in all, I would probably return again in hopes the soggy English muffin was just a bad batch.  There are also other menu items that I would love to try!

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Cookie butter French toast, pork adobo fried rice, banana cream pie pancakes, and kalua pig eggs benedict!

JIJ5OmcYqfdLJZfmdHIgUA.text: Perfect place for breakfast! Came here this past sunday. Hostess was a little snobby for some reason. They had a 15 min wait  which wasnt bad for a sunday. Today i got the portugese sausage w egg and my boyfriend got the pig omellette. Food came out quickly and service was good!

wJywjCMIJzljJPw7R9eFLw.text: The wait here was about  30-40 minutes on a Friday morning but well worth it . We were seated and it  took a while for us to decide so I think our waiter forgot about us so someone else was kind enough to take our order . I ordered Lolos adobo fried rice and it was yummy . I got a side of mac and German chocolate pancakes to go . Hubby got Lola's corned beef hash and he said it was ok but he did like his Nutella pancakes . My little one got the kids breakfast with an egg , sausage and hash and an Oreo pancake which he polished off in a matter of minutes . My other boy got a 2 egg , sausage and hash brown plate with 2 bacon pancakes which took a very long time to come . I think when they made the pancakes they forgot to add the bacon so they ended up sprinkling the bacon on top . Nevertheless , he liked it . My other son got the 6 s'mores pancakes which he liked . Everything was yummy and we will definitely make this one of our stops every time we are in the area .

en4YXahGk16wK1XbuYD80w.text: This place was wonderful. I strongly recommend the adobo omelet that is filled with fried rice. The overall place is wonderful for breakfast or lunch. My little sister and friends loved the pancakes. How you can choose different flavors for the pancakes than just buttermilk. Such as strawberry, blueberry, many many different options.

30l2C77De1i439LDZDOWWg.text: You can never have enough of a good thing in life! I have always been Huge fan of the Babystacks Cafe most notable for the Red Velvet Pancakes. Really comes too breakfast foods or a recovery meal after long day of training for triathlon. No other spot look forward to refuel. Besides the fact can get some local moco, portuguese sausage, spam, and all kine local grinds takes me back to 808. I never been too this location before use too another location closer too home on the other side of town. I was excited too hear about this new location because its closer too the Lake and the perfect spot on the way back from training can get my recovery meal in. Just so happen my review for Babystacks Cafe was for day of training but not at the Lake.  Naturally you would expect lot of similarities between all three locations. I have only been too two of the three. Coming to this location felt like everything was just as five star experience at the other location. I love the decor from the speciality board when you first walk in. One that most people forget too check out. Some days that pancakes specials make my favorite Red Velvet not sound so Ono. Make point too check it out! They have little coffee bar area so if eating by yourself perfect spot chill get your breakfast on. The tables are little tight packed so depending on the crowd feels like in on the next table conversation. Really not that bad. The service I read some review that felt like the service was slow, poor, and not very good. I got here little early but they still went ahead and sat me. Once I was seated got asked what like to drink very quickly and waitress greeted me. She was very nice since I was waiting on friend. She like take your time and no problem. The service was awesome!   I mixed it up this visit. I ordered the Huntington Omelette. I substituted egg whites always feels make any omelette better. Not normally Omelette guy but love the fact that nice size one. It packed with filling everything and the melted cheese on top with sliced of fresh avocado. You put some of that pico de gallo sauce on top brings it all together. The seasoned fries for my side delicious. It really is the prefect hearty breakfast of champions!!! One that not matter the menu selection spot on delicious!! Happy that now have one on each side of town get my Babystacks Cafe on........

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Strawberry Lemonade Pancakes with side order Portuguese Sausage!
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Huntington Omelette! Substitute egg whites. Seasoned potatoes

D7ahC2p52yVwk9Nh2TlZ6A.text: This is my first visit here and I loved it!!  Breakfast was amazing and the staff was super nice.  I will definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States

dXu2X5vqzZPcKy3w1372Ew.text: We ordered lots of stuff from the menu...Lemon Ricotta Pancakes, Garlic Rice with eggs and bacon, Red Velvet pancakes, and Mexican Skillet.    The garlic rice was ok.  Kinda harsh garlic flavor.  The Lemon Ricotta Pancakes were great.  It's thin and more like a thick crepe, but the sauce was awesome.  The red velvet pancakes were even better!!!  I would definitely come back for them.  The pancakes come with a cream cheese frosting that isn't too sweet.  Perfect.

More trials and errors. location is very convenient for my family and I'm a big fan of breakfast food but I'll let them workout their kinks. Let the cooks get familiar with the menu items..etc.  Definitely worthy of another visit but would like to enjoy a dish to it's full potential.

vNIVlC8PYTZMbzjBWlwUPw.text: Absolutely inedible. I was so disappointed. Pancakes were dry, coffees were cold. I was hungry when I left. Then waitress are oblivious and barely checked on us. She had no reaction to giving us out check with 2 full plates of food.

ErbGJiv5ZtMb-u2pekC3Lg.text: With so many locals from Hawaii living in Henderson, it's so awesome to have this place open it's doors today.  Loved hearing Hawaiian music flow through the restaurant.  My husband and I ordered the Kalua pig benedict, red velvet pancakes and loco moco. Our waiter gave us the option of how we wanted our eggs cooked, which was different.. I thought a loco moco had sunny side up eggs but a little variety is cool.. And aren't eggs Benedict poached eggs?  I guess it would be cool if they were scrambled. Maybe. Anyway, both dishes where awesome. The red velvet pancakes and cream cheese syrup weren't too sweet so I actually enjoyed them. Next time, I'm definitely gonna hit up the Zippys Chili plate!  Only reason I didn't give it 5 stars was because they weren't all that ready for their first day. They only accepted cash today because their Debit/credit card  system wasn't up and running yet. It's a good thing I had some cash. I'll definitely be back so maybe then, I'll update the review to 5 stars. :)

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Kalua pig Benedict
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Kalua Eggs Benedict, Red Velvet Pancakes w/cream cheese syrup &amp; scrambled eggs loco moco w/Mac salad

X_91_YNGBUpIjrnS67Z8MA.text: It was a seemingly normal Friday morning when everything changed. My daughter and I strolled into BabyStacks by chance and although there was a wait, for some reason, we knew it would be worth it. We agreed to share the seasoned potatoes. She ordered the seasonal Easter Pancakes which were just as adorable as they were delicious. And I had the Bananas Fosters Pancakes. Hands down, some of the most decadent substance to ever enter my mouth. With each bite I took, I wanted more and more. I was hooked. I wish I had some in or around my mouth right now. That's what she said. Ha! I can guarantee you, if you eat here, your stomach will thank me. And it's moderately priced, so your wallet will thank me too.

_Kl2nyuuPDdSQfqQyNzhEg.text: For some reason, the food isn't as amazing as it is on the west side, but hey... I love the location. I got the banana cream pie pancakes and my boyfriend got the loco moco. Something we always get at the other babystacks location (on south durango). My pancakes had some little tiny green stuff in the batter that I don't recall ever seeing before...but I ate it anyway... The whip cream isn't as fluffy or good. It was melting. The other location's whipped cream always came out thick and fluffy and didn't melt the way it did at Stephanie's location. Maybe it just wasn't good that day, I don't know. But sucks because I always get extra whipped cream. The loco moco patty was kind of hard (too well done). The other location's is softer and more like a medium rare. Maybe I'm being a little harsh, but they would need to contain quality control. It should taste the same as if it did at the other locations.   I had a good breakfast with my boyfriend. It wasn't busy because it was at 9am but I know they get super busy as 10-11am hit. Our waitress was really nice and the place was super clean. So that's a plus. Good service. Just not up to par as the original location that I fell in love with.

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Babystacks!

05Fnx5pFmEWPTzJUaFUPkQ.text: Have been eating here since they opened a few years ago in Henderson and have watched the size of their portions, food quality and customer service steadily decline. Pancakes are shrinking, portions of food and rice are shrinking, and every time we order takeout they get it wrong.   Really sad because this place started out awesome!

DcLo2DhRnYe31N-bCGoMEw.text: There's no better breakfast place in Henderson right now. The toughest part about going here is trying to decide just what kind of pancakes to order. I am a self-proclaimed pancakeaholic and I don't care who knows it. My personal favorite has got to be the banana cream pie pancakes though.

FHsiUKkAkBmdQTG3szIBiw.text: Friendly staff, very accommodating. Cute open place. I had the kalua pork benedict, it was different and delish.   They also have a good kids menu, although the chicken tenders could be more bite size for younger kids  Overall it was good.

uGkjjYgojrvwJoRLAZlVXQ.text: I have traveled the world, and I have been to some great breakfast joints but, Babystacks hands down has the best pancakes I have ever had.  This is my second time at Babystacks in Henderson (near Sunset Station Casino) and I can't say enough about this place. If you are looking for an outside of the box breakfast joint, Babystacks is the place to go.   This weekend we stopped in and after much deliberation, I ordered the Cookies n' Cream pancakes off of their limited edition menu. It was one of those dining choices that left you thinking... this is going to be really good or this is going to be really bad.   Well ladies and gentlemen, when these pancakes arrived my taste-buds were doing the happy dance. I knew as soon as I saw them that I would be eating every last bite.   My half stack order of Cookies n' Cream Pancakes came with three (3) large chocolate pancakes with pieces of oreo cookies mashed up inside. I'm really not sure how they did it but the oreo pieces inside were still crunchy. Drizzled on top was vanilla cream icing and topped with homemade whipped cream (as if it couldn't get any better). And instead of topping this creation off with a cherry, they sprinkled pieces of crushed up oreo on top.   One may think the pancakes are super sweet. Surprisingly it is not overwhelmingly sweet. The chocolate pancakes must be made with a unsweetened coco, allowing you to fully enjoy the sweet icing they place on top.  It was a again, a major score at Babystacks. Next go around I will be trying out their red velvet pancakes.  If you're a local or in town visiting, you must find one of their three locations and get in to try this place. You won't be let down, I promise!

c8A6xjHhaOnbyyOVpVdvjQ.text: This place the best sweet cream crepes I've ever had. Ever. I order it every time I come here. I crave them every day. Get them with strawberries and you'll never want anything else in your mouth. Why do they close at 2?! WHY. And why don't they open one near UNLV? I'd never leave. GET THE CREPES. And the seasoned potatoes are pretty bomb.com too.

7YovV0L08PXSwr6GftlMOg.text: This place has really yummy food!! I loove the bananas fosters pancake. Soo good! Adobo fried rice and loco moco hit the spot as well. The cashier can be a little temperamental but our server Valerie [I think] was very friendly.

ZzuOFmgaQLY_BLX_yT-Vuw.text: I recently just moved to Henderson and very happy that I came across this cute breakfast place!  Expect a wait, especially if your party is larger than 4 since it is a small place. They're known for their fluffy variety of pancakes, red velvet being their signature. I ordered chocolate chip pancakes, red velvet, and plain buttermilk. If this sounds like too much, it was and they were all short stacks! Definitely come in sharing the pancakes if you want to have your own sampler. My favorite pancakes were the chocolate chip. It didn't even need syrup because the chips had it sweetened enough for me. The red velvet cakes had its own cream cheese syrup which was pretty good. The plain buttermilk pancakes were nice and simple. They didn't have that baking powder/soda taste that I am usually able to taste whenever I eat pancakes. I also ordered the adobo fried rice which was so good and reminded me of home! The fried rice was wrapped in a blanket of egg and scallions.  Service here is excellent! Everyone is very accommodating and while I was there they offered to make and changes if there was anything wrong with the food. I can't wait to take visitors from home to try out this place!

SFktuW-HS0cEeeYeh6zUPw.text: Decent food. The selection of pancakes was impressive- I enjoyed the gingerbread pancakes for the holidays! Unfortunately our server forgot to put in our order so we had a while at the table before he realized it, but tried to compensate with a discount on our bill.

b9eJwMGj8Co74pRxRhCBeQ.text: Food and service is awesome! The combinations and different fusions really are what sets them apart from everywhere else. However because it's so little, it gets full fast!

pyfeSow7Mwx3UvQqAp93jg.text: Great place. Small and cozy. Worth the wait in line. Much better than IHOP. My husband intrtoduce me to this place recently. Great place but I wish they didn't put this annoying loud mouth girl sitting near us. Why do people think that others want to hear their conversation.? And then she had an annoying laugh

YZA_eN9qmfsh4iBe9DXyzQ.text: Ordered the traditional eggs bendy (9.75) and red velvet pancakes (5.75)This cafe has the aloha spirit running deep in its veins, from the gregarious smiles of the staff to the Hawaiian infused menu items.    I really enjoyed my food. Riding solo at the counter I stretched my stomach by adding the pancakes after my meal. Fair enough, these flapjacks are really dessert anyways. I give full marks for my eggs benny.  Good hollandaise sauce over perfectly cooked eggs. A combo that always makes my stomach very happy. The sweet pancakes were also very delicious, coming with a cream cheese syrup and chocolate flakes. Very fluffy! Service was provided by Kaylah, and she rocked it! I was checked on numerous times and she couldn't be more friendly! At this price point I'm giving babystacks 5 stars for food and service. I believe they have 3 locations to serve u, my review applies to this location only. Mahalo babystacks!

ul3DtT-YpgU8FYT-PPkYBg.text: This is THE SPOT! Id been looking for a breakfast diner to for my family, something everyone would enjoy and BOY, let me tell you everyone cleaned and would have licked their plates the food was soo delicious. I was so happy and enjoyed every bite. The eggs were cooked to perfection. The portions are perfect, the pancakes are to die for. You will have to get there early or just know you will have to wait a few minutes for a table, but you will not regret it. Aside from that the service was very friendly. I will definitely be back over and over again. I plan to try everything on the menu. MUST TRY!!!

u2ut15XGX3Ou3oaR1w16qA.text: Absolutely wonderful experience! We walked in and were told there would be a wait of about 20 minutes to seat the three of us. Not five minutes later we were called as our table was ready!  Service was quick and friendly. The meals were delicious! One must try the signature red velvet pancakes!  We will definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Spam and eggs, breakfast potatoes with a side of red velvet pancakes.  I&#39;m in heaven!

PJ0oYa7ZfSZQiMoLcAfAPQ.text: Easy to see why this place is a 4 cafe. It was easy to see that this is the place locals come for breakfast.  First thing is the choices for breakfast, lots and lots of choices. Mexician breakfasts ever pancake you can imagine and eggs, potatoes, rice, any way you want it.   I had the Huevos Ranchos with the green sauce. Very good.   My wife had the Cinnabon pancakes. Said they were good and cleaned the plate.   My daughter had the Mexican skillet. Shredded pork, potatoes and cheese. 2 eggs and toast. She said the pork was perfect and finished every bit.   The server was very attentive and wanted to insure a good meal.   If the truck stop is full of trucks....it has to be good. If the local cafe is filled with locals, the same applies.   Looking for a great meal, with a fair price, here it is.

FBvf_8XENwou0D_5RdJN2w.text: So this place is amazing my server was great and the food was delicious ...Red  Velvet pancakes people ....

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Omelette ...
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. red velvet pancakes

m15HITE06UQBSVLQ7aFo8A.text: We tried this breakfast spot on our way to the mall one morning and we weren't disappointed. It's a bit disorganized at the front but the food and service was good. We will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Kahlua pork grilled cheese

wGg_8zqPLKyuIHbNLvds8w.text: We are locals here (part of the year here, part elsewhere).  We eat out every single day. We recognize that the restaurant business is a difficult and tricky business to achieve success in. We eat in divey out of the way places and in higher end restaurants (think Hank's in GVR).  It is with this in mind we write reviews.  Babystacks Cafe is a breakfast/lunch cafe offering pancakes, eggs, omelets and sandwiches.  We stopped in for breakfast.  Marginal pancakes that tasted good but that were very dry. Our omelets were nothing to write home about with obviously frozen seasoned potatos. Its hard to mess up breakfast and while these weren't "messed up", they just were not good.  We recently ate at another "diner" near by. For the same money we received an excellent meal, huge and tasty . . . very much unlike that at Babystacks Cafe.  There are too many other better choices to risk another visit.

nOwRvbEI8wVLQzKQO_SOvg.text: Fun, tiny joint w decent service and decent food. A bit overrated (hence the 3-stars), but decent for portion and price.  Benedict: eggs were cooked perfectly, but the hollandaise sauce was tired and bland (needed more lemon and salt/pepper)  Lemon Ricotta Pancakes: great consistency, could have been more crisp on the outside.   Bananas Fosters French Toast: properly cooked, but omg too sweet!   Buttermilk Pancakes: decent consistency, but completely overrated. Not the best in town, but again decent for portion and price  Potatoes: hashed browns or "seasoned" home fries - undercooked and meh

VxksJ9d2t2CS9VNtCTTxbQ.text: Do expect a wait----tick tock---menu looks DEElicious---tick tock---food FINALLYYYY comes. Now portions aren't bad & for the price; good match!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. French toast
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Piglet omelette
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Mexican omlette

G_U26DkfaqwMysZseUN7kQ.text: Food is delicious, and the service is stellar, what else do you need to say. This is my new regular breakfast place to eat and bring friends and family.

j-cNSjwPFdHnHpTV2STm7w.text: An amazing variety of specialty pancakes and Hawaiian inspired breakfast dishes. Decent prices with fast, friendly service. My go-to breakfast spot with 3 different locations!

vuHLZ8-VtdI2zTu_P3_psg.text: This is definitely my favorite breakfast place in town.  The choices for  pancakes are awesome & I like the other stuff such as the skillets.   Service is always friendly & great.   I've been to their other locations as well & they are all amazing.   Great place,  great food,  great staff. Great job.

_SvO-ArNvOaald2X3yhppA.text: This has been a go-to breakfast place of our family BEFORE. But now it had changed, we'll NEVER go back again. We found a small cockroach in my husband's strawberry lemonade drink. Truly, the manager was apologetic, and that we appreciate. But what other flying of crawling objects might be in their kitchen?

KK_l_ow9u_Sqkcj-5OqtLA.text: Finally had a chance to dine here. When we first pulled up, their was a 20 minute wait for a table. This cafe is not super small but not large either. Thankfully, we found a couple of seats at the counter and bypassed the wait. When a place is a crowded as this place was, you know it must be good.  A lot of choices for breakfast from the very basic to some standard Hawaiian staples. Their specialty being pancakes and there are so many to choose from. You have to keep coming back to taste all the flavors. I think I counted 21 different kinds of pancakes! WOW!  We ended up ordering the sausage and egg breakfast which came with yummy potatoes and a baby stack of buttermilk pancakes. This was a lot of food and I honestly could not not finish although I did try hard. Food was very good and the pancakes were definitely the highlight. Super light, not doughy, fluffy and with the hot syrup on top they just melted in your mouth.   I will definitely return here or another location. They were really busy but the servers still were nice and friendly.

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Love the logo!
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. No shortage of food here

Gk-C0-3CeyaObimExQPtpg.text: We came for breakfast and I wasn't satisfied. Plates are huge but again huge doesn't mean quality. It was not bad but it wasn't OMG either. I think for those times when you are just in a hurry or lazy to make breakfast at home you should try this place rather than that just go ahead and stay at home. I had some eggs but not really impressed then I had strawberry pan cakes and I didn't finish them. My mother had Lime pan cakes and she didn't finish it either. We had a great time we went there pretty much to spend family time and that's exactly what we did. We were a group of four and no one complained about their foods but I noticed no ones finished half of their plates either lol. Service was amazing nothing to say about that, even that the place was crowded we always had our waiter asking us if we were okay or needed something but this is Las Vegas so we are so spoiled when it comes to customer service. Parking there's plenty of it. I do recommend it but i won't give 4 stars I will say: to go and have some family time is okay.

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Strawberry Pancakes

Z30L7vJ8Xo2xEQ2fr8reMA.text: Babystacks is one of the most underrated breakfast spots in Las Vegas. It is a mix of Hawaiian fusion mixed with regular American breakfast. This is the second of the 3 Babystacks I've been to in the Vegas area. Again, this place was already pretty packed with a line at a little past 9 on a Saturday. Don't forget to order the red velvet pancakes to go with your meal!

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. red velvet pancakes
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Chili Moco*

7rsY4Vm1ASeiX2leZIgEnw.text: It wasn't until the past year that I started eating at Babystacks as often. I've lived in Vegas for about 4.5 years and I know that this was always a popular place to go to. I was never a breakfast person either, but i'm definitely more open to trying a bunch of breakfast places. Every time I come here I always get the corned beef hash with garlic rice and upgrade my pancakes to the hazelnut ones! Anything with nutella, count me in! I've yet to find the perfect time to go because there seems to always be a wait! Luckily, I haven't had to wait any longer than 15 minutes. The food is delicious! I'm taking off one star because I feel like the corned beef hash might be a little over priced. It's 10.95 before the garlic rice upgrade. I know that corned beef is usually expensive in the grocery store, but I can't confidently say it's 100% worth the price. If you're someone who enjoys fresh corned beef then I wouldn't recommend ordering this. Still good, just not the same. Just the nostalgia of growing up eating corned beef is why I will always enjoy eating it. I always had a few bites of the loco moco and the potatoes. SO GOOD. I love potatoes...so I would honestly come just for that. Nonetheless, I will definitely come back!

4XOhJeN8Cd0sLKU6kEsCow.text: This morning I had the best breakfast I've ever had. Our server was amazing , he was attentive, entertaining & helpful. He is a huge asset in your restaurant & deserves much kudos. I will definitely be back ! My sever was in all black , had a accent & braces.

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Sitting bar side , waiting for breakfast

L-tSCUxPl2V3b39PpL3IXA.text: I found this cafe before leaving for our trip on Yelp. I showed my son and he said he was in. So we decided to leave the strip to try this cafe out and boy did it not disappoint! We wanted pancakes but then saw there menu offered so much more like Hawaiian favorites Loco Moco. I just had to get it. The server asked if I wanted potatoes, toast or pancakes and I was amazed to hear I could choose pancakes! So I got the best of both words. Same for my son who ordered the Kalua pork grilled cheese and a side of orange creamsicle pancakes. I got the side of bananas foster pancakes.   Our server brought our entrees our first and than our pancakes. Tastes my loco moco and it was just comfort food from the start. Rice was perfect, with the right amount of gravy to mix with the egg and a nice size hamburger patty. My son bit into his grilled cheese and all I get is a smile and a giggle and yum. For him to try a grilled cheese with pork was huge and this didn't disappoint. Onto our pancakes I tried the banana foster and they were so flavorful I took a bite and I was like "yum!" He tried his creamsicle pancakes and he was like "wow" and I was like "oh my" and we were like "should we ditch the Vegas buffet tomorrow and it was a "yes!" The orange creamsicle had cream cheese syrup not glaze syrup! You place them in your mouth and it is a flavor bomb.   So the next day I got Lolo Rick's Adobo fried rice which is fried rice with marinated chicken wrapped in a egg omelet so good. The fried rice and the chicken was so good I could just order a big bowl of that on its own. Than I had the tiramisu pancakes and those were soft and creamy. These pancakes are not your typical pancake batter. Each pancake on the menu has its own batter and specialty toppings to make that flavor combination so they really know their pancakes. We definitely will be back the next time in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Mocha pancakes
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Tiramisu pancakes
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Lolo Rick&#39;s Adobo Fried Rice*

YBovh6ReZ19MUGEaun3MgQ.text: In Vegas on business (really, I did a lot of work while I was in town) and had time before a meeting in Henderson.  I usually eat breakfast at Aloha Kitchen when I am in town, but decided I wanted to try something new.  Let me just say, I love Hawaiian breakfast.  Babystacks Cafe does not disappoint.  Their menu is full of so many choices...but in the end, I went with my go to breakfast, Loco Moco.  The eggs were cooked perfectly, the rice was fluffy, the burger was well seasoned and not overcooked and the gravy was rich and thick.  In other words, it was great.  This place is pretty large, with plenty of seating, so when I went there was not a wait.  It was busy throughout the time I was there, but the service never suffered.  Parking is easy with a big lot.  Since this is about 20-minutes off of the Strip, it appeared to have mostly locals as clients, not many tourists, which I think is a plus.  If you're in town and looking for a place with tons and tons of breakfast choices, with some island flare on top, visit Babystack's.  You won't regret it!

HC8T3IEeMmP484jUiqmTjg.text: I've been here three times.  The first time was ok but the Lolo Ricks Adobo fried rice special was dry.  The second time the eggs Benedict was good but we couldn't pay our bill for 10 minutes because they were trying to get someone's to go order out and you can only pay your bill up front not at the table.  I was late for work that day breakfast took 1 hour 20 minutes.  Today i went in and sat at the counter for 10 minutes while the waiter and waitress argued about who was going to wait on me.  No one ever did even bring water or anything.  I'm a 20-30% tipper no matter what because I've been reliant on tips before so i dont know why they didn't want to wait on me.  So today I'm eating at Denny's!

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States

Vzxf7rjuL9uC_AAasSJ8WA.text: Only reason I'm not giving this a 1 Star is because the food is still decent but it may not be decent enough to deal with the cashier guys attitude when trying to pay for your pick up order.  Around 0900 on Sunday August 5th, 2018 I arrived to pick up and pay for my phone order, the guy who had a heavy accent asked if I'd like some ketchup and hot sauce and I politely said yes could I please get quite a bit of ketchup since the amount of food was pretty good for the price. He put three packets which is not enough to eat with just the hash browns so I asked if I could get a few more and he then scoffed at me and put one more, I would have let it go if he didn't scoff but since he gave an attitude and was being a dick about putting a few more in the bag I said, did you only put one more? And he then decided to give the 3 I needed rolling his eyes. After he readied the bag he asked if I would like to leave him a tip which was  totally eye opening as he just gave me an attitude for a few more ketchup packets. I told him not with that type of attitude, if it wasn't for this being my only food I had to take back to work I would have just left but luckily there are other locations with that are close to where I live with better people working. Just be prepared for some attitude from that weird guy that doesn't want to do his

UDlSBYYoucT_2etO9pK4hA.text: Ordered the Loco Moco and Adobo Fried Rice for breakfast and both were delicious! We also ordered the carrot cake pancakes, which were alright. I wouldn't order those again. But for sure will be coming back for the Loco Moco and Adobo Fried Rice next time we're in Vegas! Even though we were out at a restaurant, the food tasted like a home-cooked meal

wNJrpESE-D2Cfu7kAWEKCw.text: Ok, I'd like to add some balance to the reviews on this Cafe. We went to this Cafe today (Wednesday) at 11am. It was quite slow. Service was awful, food even worse. Ambiance worse still. I had the blueberry pancakes. Bisquick makes a better batter! Pancakes were cold,  tough & rubbery. Chinsey on the berries. Ambiance terrible.   See photos

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Lovely plant at check out counter!
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Inedible!

7OIxlY7LNb2Ua9E_mGOzhw.text: This is the perfect breakfast place for me! The menu is huge and all the dishes we ordered did not disappoint. I particularly enjoyed the adobo fried rice and the loco moco. The sauce on the loco moco was perfect! Also don't miss out on the red velvet pancakes - they're a must have! Service here was very good as well, and dishes came out fast. 10/10 would come again.

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Loco moco
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Adobo fried rice

GPi0c4J23_WtiQH04Dsuvg.text: Overall great place for breakfast. Reasonable prices, good quailty food, and good coffee ( even tastes good without cream or sugar). Clean: everything looks clean even the floor and walls. Staff are trained and do a job without being overly friendly. Two things i change: 1) the tables outside never seem to setup or a option to use. 2) there isnt an option to get a pancake breakfast with a meat unless you want aggs and potatos as well. What if i only want pancakes and bacon? I was told to order a side of bacon for 3.95.... So instead i ordered the bacon and eggs meal which comes with pancakes and potatos for about 2 dollars less then pancakes with a side of bacon. Besides the two issues this place os great!

N8YnzYPTlsjb60h38cEcUA.text: This location is always awesome. My little loves the red velvet but all the food is amazing. Their quick and the servers are great.

zILPqxNL52ln4kGeXzLD-w.text: We have eaten at this establishment on two occasions, very attentive staff along with excellent food and average prices. Will definitely return very nicely run keep up the good work

re9vuT7XBaV4WuGRzWpRrw.text: Overall a decent go to place for breakfast in Henderson. Face it, Henderson isn't one of the foodie Mecca's in Vegas. But as far as breakfast and what you get for your money it's decent.  This particular location is busy but not as packed as the other locations. You can usually walk in and be sat most weekdays and a short wait on weekends.  Service here is ok. I think once a section is seated all at once the service tends to diminish but overall decent service from decent people. There have been plenty of occasions where we were never brought items we ordered or drinks filled so be prepared.  Food wise it's a step above the chains in the area. There are some other local spots in Henderson that have an elevated menu but this isn't bad.  Pancakes are most time light and fluffy. The lemon ricotta pancakes are our favorites. Make sure to eat them as soon as you get them. Once cooled off these thin, moist decadent cakes tend to be tough. 5/5 for the ricotta pancakes.  We've tried the omelette. Nothing special. Both times the omelette has been a bit dry and not fluffy, flat actually. 2/5 here.  Biscuits and gravy tho... definitely recommend those. Hardy thick country style gravy. Add the bacon for a real treat. 4/5 for those.  Like I said, overall a step above ihop. Not a bad price point either. Expect to pay around $30 for 2 people.

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Extremely thin omelettes
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Thick fluffy buttermilk pancakes.
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Banana Foster pancakes. Pretty decent.

LjjP1OrEz_6LoQdPvJ_2Vg.text: Go up naked this place is my favorite breakfast house in Henderson. Come early as it gets really pop. Best thing on the menu is country eggs  Benedict

WMWlukcfZ_3cXxbaQhpmtQ.text: One of our new favorite breakfast spots to be at! Brought my girlfriend here a few days ago and she loved it!   The customer service is spot on, very attentive and friendly. She ordered the corn beef hash w/ garlic rice & I ordered the Portuguese sausages eggs w/ garlic rice. For how busy it was, everything came out with in a timely manner.   YOU MUST TRY THE GARLIC RICE THOUGH! Even if it's a $1 upcharge, YOU WONT REGRET IT! Extremely flavorful and goes very well with their plates.   We were so full that we didn't get a chance to try the pancakes but we definitely will next time!!   Thanks for having us Babystacks :)

Lk4WKckh5tPNbCvJnSLiaw.text: The food at Babystacks is a 10/10! It is always fresh and made to order and the flavor is consistently delicious! The staff are normally slammed with all of their customers so don't expect to spend too much time speaking to them. Additionally, the waiter to table ration seems to be too much since it takes forever to get the waiters attention whenever you need something. They move fast and are on the go! The bathroom was alright.. it wasn't the cleanest but not the dirtiest either. If you don't want to wait 25+ mins make sure to come early ESPECIALLY on weekends! The place isn't too big and so it fills up fast! My personal favorites are their crepes with fruit and their Filipino adobo breakfast specialties! I do think for what it is, it's a bit overpriced.. Overall, it's a great place to eat just don't expect too much from the staff and get there early!

7k-VZatgMqq7vWLZQexyzA.text: Decided to come to Babystacks for our party of 12's last meal before our road trip back home. No complaints, delicious food! Excellent customer service from EFRAN! Babystacks was a great end to our time here in Nevada!

goJW5hezQ6wHSlHSQnUwgg.text: Really good food and service. Not too big portions which is good. Because I don't want to waste food. My kiddos enjoyed the food.

Ld79SyAOwSECeix0rkrsdA.text: Update.  I've been back to Babystacks a few more times and have had better service on recent visits, plus the food has been consistently good.  Today, Liliana was our server and she was very nice and efficient.   I ordered the BYO omlette with spinach, tomatoes, ham, and cheddar with breakfast potatoes, and the bananas foster pancakes-$9.25, plus $1.50 for the upgraded pancake choice.  The pancakes were fantastic!  Basically dessert for breakfast.  All that was missing was the table side flambe.  The omlette was good, but I would ask for less cheese next time.  After eating 1/2 the omlette and 1/2 of the pancakes, there was no room for potatoes, but were a little dry anyway.  John had the Country Fried Steak and Eggs -$12.95, he said that it was delicious and would definitely order it again.

Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Country Fried Steak and Eggs w/ hashbrowns
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Bananas Foster pancakes.  Amazing!

tj51AGGYjuWKa0Y9PYyi_w.text: I've finally found my favorite place for breakfast. I had Portuguese sausage, eggs & rice taste like home cooking. I'm glad I upgraded to the red velvet pancakes...it was so delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States

Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Baby stacks Cafe has the best local food. Portuguese sausage, eggs &amp; rice just like home cooking. upgraded to Red velvet pancake &amp; so ono

oGF756XZLHKOI3WxlosYpw.text: Breakfast is so good! They serve up local food and everyone in our party of 8 was definitely satisfied. Great service, too. We will definitely go back!!!

KyIfYRdsgnNLZQyUDCqjpA.text: Ate here once and the breakfast was pretty good. There was a 25 minute wait on Saturday morning at 10:00 which is usually the sign of a good restaurant.   Thought my daughters would get a kick out of the pancake options and tried to place an order to take out. However, despite mine and my wife's best efforts, and two different phone calls with two different people who's IQs must have totaled about 50, we were not able to get them to understand our very simple order and had to forgo the effort.

i9GiTGAXGFufSamEoe2DZA.text: Inconsistent. Have eaten here for over a year and the food is never quite the same as initially. I continue to patronize Babystacks BC when their food is right, it's outstanding.  With that being said, today's visit, was ugh. Ordered my routine dish. My eggs were undercooked and runny, bacon limp, cubed potatoes soft and the pancakes tasted like cardboard.  Thoroughly disappointed. Seems the cook rushed my food out instead of taking the time to make it properly. What about the customer experience?

XKMgsWFdY6q8R0Bl62ARtw.text: This place is so good. So so so good. Order anything off the menu and you won't be disappointed. Go early because it has a small dinning room and everyone goes here.

SLOxF_PTu5bqIK-GzbS6Lg.text: Best thing to get here is their pancakes. The loco moco and adobe fried rice are ok, but after awhile it's just whatever. You can get better of both items in California maybe possibly even Utah. Idk about loco moco in Utah though.   So, since I've been living in Utah for awhile my pancake comparison and palate is going to be in reference to them. The pancake here is light and moist. I'm not a fan of the dense pancake. I do like all their different options. Ive tried the lemon ricotta and banana foster. If you like a more crepe like style and more eggy type of pancake then I would get the lemon ricotta. If you want something a little sweeter, I would get the banana foster.   The next time, I come here I would just stick to the pancakes. I would leave the adobo fried rice to the filipino restaurants and hamburg steak/ loco moco to the japanese places.

Q4s4QCtW3L_A7dh5OhfG7A.text: We stopped here to try the breakfast and it was delicious! I ordered the adobo omelette and my family ordered the eggs with Portuguese sausage and kalua pig grilled cheese. It was a lot of food and reminded me being back home in Hawaii. Only thing is the service was kind of slow and we were in a rush to drive back to California.
