uQ9fuISyIB5LgCh5kzHMYQ.text: I thought this place was okay! Service was good, a wide selection of pancakes they were way overly sweet though! My loco moco was not good. Rice was hard, burger patty was extremely salty, and the gravy was really bad. Coffee was also meh. I'd much rather go to Kitchen Table or Hash House, probably won't be back, but I didn't regret trying it!

ZAZ4dKma46BAPmaTD1da0w.text: First experience at Babystacks.  We came here to satisfy a craving for pancakes -- my GF thought IHOP would be good but i didnt want corp branded pancakes.  First, our server Efrain, was very pleasant, courteous, friendly and hospitable.  (Thanks Efrain!!)  Next, the menu creativity absolutely is True to the food taste.  Besides the "menu of pancakes," the concept of a "Benedict menu" is awesome.  We decided to order the Kalua Pork Benedict plus pancakes.  She ordered the Banana Foster and I had the Carrot Cakes with cream cheese syrup.  Everything was amazing, especially the Kalua Pork Benedict.  Although we came after 10am on Saturday and waited approx 15 minutes to be seated, it was totally worth the wait.  We will certainly return again -- and maybe for lunch as the Kalua Pork Grilled Cheese Sandwich sounds too good and like it would be heaven in your mouth.....

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Hazelnut pancakes (no whip) really awesome!!  Sorry took a bite before the picture

pFj0vIuAtvEScPRJOGnenA.text: Had lunch here today. When paying, MAX was of no help at the register. Rolling his eyes and had an attitude. Maybe he woke up on the wrong side of the bed.

z0uATCkcFxC4LBmEj9ePRg.text: OMG for this place... Fabulous food :o)  Please make sure that all your parties are with you when checking in because they will not give you a table if your party is incomplete.   The food is amazing. Adobo Fried Rice Omelette is absolutely  my favorite. I've tried their Corned Beef, Loco Moco and most especially their Red Velvet Pancakes (yummylicious).  I've been to three of their locations and all locations have same  consistency in their food, service and ambiance. This place is great for families, group of friends and even if you just want to enjoy an Island food flavor breakfast or brunch.   Love this place a lot.

MHCYy4940nVbtpdbuKZoVQ.text: I absolutely love this place!  I've been to the Stephanie location & Blue Diamond location. Lolo Rick's Adobo Fried Rice is amazing! Try the Red Velvet and Cookies & Cream pancakes!

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Lolo Rick&#39;s Adobo Fried Rice &amp; Red Velvet Pancakes

mMF8V-CjJnqbljvr2-1EsA.text: SERVICE 4/5:  This restaurant welcomed us with smiles. The servers were always attentive if we needed anything. Patient and fast.  FOOD 3/5: PANCAKES = OUTRAGEOUSLY SWEET. I got the carrot pancakes and my boyfriend got the banana foster and it was so sweet that we only finished half our pancakes.

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. this is way too sweet.
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. so sweet.

hsrtyiuqGb3qFD8zJNzfxQ.text: We love Babystacks! Everyone there is always so friendly, the food is delicious, the coffee tastes great, and they always have perfect avocados. They have a giant menu of different breakfast options, including (of course) lots of different pancake options. They do have some lunch items, too. My wife and I enjoy taking our 3-year-old twins there to eat since the service is fast and they have a lot of kid friendly foods.  I just wish they'd offer a pancake flight since there are so many flavors to choose from.

FrEi5p6j9DgUsjyrtnOhFw.text: Came in for breakfast with my cousin and my grandmother, waited 10 minutes(If even that long). Eric was our waiter and he was good! I ordered the piglet omelette with potatoes and red velvet pancakes. My cousin had a Loco Moco, and my grandmother got the adobo fried rice omelette. Love the atmosphere in there, we will definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States

OXOVo3ZY6XE_k08gha2nXA.text: I remember when there was only one Babystacks Cafe, the original location near me at Buffalo and Smoke Ranch.  Back when it opened in 2011, there were long waits on the weekends for the renowned red velvet pancakes that were served up.  People came from near and far to eat there and I became a regular customer, too.  Since then, Babystacks has opened up other locations and Henderson finally got its own in the summer of 2014.    I've been to this location a few times now and I really can't see the difference in taste or service; that's a good thing.  I have friends who live in Henderson who never went to Babystacks because it was just too far from them.  When I get together with those Henderson pals, we at least have the option to come here for some of our favorites that Babystacks is known for, including:  the red velvet pancakes as well as the Cinnabun (my favorite); Rick's Adobo Fried Rice; Portuguese Sausage and Eggs; Loco Moco.  There is still a wait on the weekends in the mornings, so be prepared; you may get hangry in the process.

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Blackened Chicken Salad.
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Red velvet and Cinnabun pancakes.

woCaQCxTGAGqM5pXTidmsA.text: Awesome place to eat. Nice area and friendly employees. Will be coming here a lot now since it's near me.

Vvt6b7uS5UnkzIzqmW8nkA.text: I've been here multiple times before. I love that they serve Hawaiian & Filipino foods, because I'm from Hawaii & I'm Filipino. I know this place gets super busy because of how small the restaurant is & how good their food is. Although, one thing that gets me upset the most about this place is that they have a sign that pretty much says "first come, first-served basis." But I can say that that is complete BS! Numerous times we've had parties come in before my family & I, that have waited longer than us, not be able to be seated because they seat people that came in after my family & I. So, that is BS & False advertising. The staff here are very unorganized and need to step their shit up. As I'm writing this, a family w/ the same amount as mine just got seated before us even when they got here just now. We've been waiting here for over 20-30min.

b3TSIK6PwwuQP1KdCA_9GA.text: Wonderful service. Fast and super sweet waitress. Food was amazing! We got the build your own omelet and Mexican skillet. Fantastic! Upgrade your short stack to one of the amazing choices. We got banana and bacon and were not disappointed.

OLC1g_WaxEQ3K3E49kDNvw.text: I'd give them 6 stars if I could! Kristi our server was so attentive and so dang good at her job. My coffee and water were kept refilled and my garlic fried rice with spam was cooked to perfection. It reminded me of my grandma's fried rice growing up. And my banana pancakes were just as delicious. I really wish they would open up a location in San Diego. I'll definitely will be returning next time I visit Vegas.

vDL4DB3msHfehw2irbmLWg.text: If you are going for sugar overload or carb and fat loading (as we did), this is the place for you!  The pancake selections is amazing - pretty much any creative concoction you can imagine.  And the pancakes are light and fluffy besides all the great stuff on top.  I had the Banana's Foster pancakes (only 3, which were huge) and my husband at the Cinabon pancakes.  YUMMO!  The bacon is thick and crisp too.  I had them fry my spam and it was a little overdone, but still wanted that spam.  We happened to go in right after they opened on the 4th of July so there was no wait and it was really quiet.  We have seen the lines outside in the heat when we have been in the area and it is outrageous.  But then it is that good!

7Bb3wu2YhGjsYmYdiBbtcQ.text: This place is amazing. My daughter and I visit often. The bananas foster pancakes are our favorite.

ByJL_Qlr9b5pOrET3fh06Q.text: Website says they take to-go orders before 9am on Saturday and Sunday but no one picks up the one before that.

EdHGbiwwEXmUpaF0OoH70w.text: First time here.  We didn't know what to expect, but were pleased with the fresh food and friendly staff.  It's a great quick stop when you need good food fast.  I would would come back for sure.  Only thing to change is that the eggs were closer to looking soft boiled then eggs Benedict should be.  Good clean atmosphere!

Qpo0ML2hnQQa4sHWg4K2zg.text: Had a short wait, but well worth it. Pancakes were delicious. I got smores and hubby got PB&J. I wanted to try orange dreamsicle, but apparently they are removing that from the menu. Boo hoo.

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. PB&amp;J!
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Smores

h_dM-aH_fYA46RHkVpOnoA.text: I was sincerely excited to try Baby Stacks this morning, we put our name down and waited about 30 minutes. We noticed some people who came after us were seated before us. My boyfriend went in and asked and they sat us down instantly. Once we sat down the waitress passed us twice. No greeting or "I'll be with you shortly" I understand it's busy but customer service is customer service. All customers should get equal amount of great service. The woman finally came up to us. I asked her about how they made oatmeal and she said it was instant and I replied " instant oatmeal for five dollars!" She got offended and made a passive aggressive gesture. I told her we needed a minute and we decided to leave. I will not be returning due to bad customer service

Rr6n6IL70_KuBFEKWLpjlg.text: I love breakfast so I was so excited to find a Babystacks opened in my neighborhood.  Now when I want a sweet sugary breakfast I know where I'm going. The red velvet pancakes are a given, but I really like the lemon ricotta pancakes too and they come with the same cream cheese syrup.  I'm sure this place is gonna get crowded in no time.

TxAbOqOi-cLZpdHR9RjYVg.text: THANK YOU for finally opening a Henderson location! The food was great as always and the service was good also, it was wonderful to avoid driving 30 minutes to eat my favorite breakfast joint in town.

M3U1S0UMCVh04vNZE0timw.text: My Husband and I are in love with Baby Stacks Cafe!!! The omelets and skillets are great with plenty of toppings and unlimited combinations. The buttermilk pancakes are FANTASTIC! The coffee is pretty generic, but still good! We will be returning to this wonderful breakfast shop!

8rPyrxVyr6YMKrWK3iGITA.text: I really wanted to like this place seeing as I work at a breakfast/lunch restaurant as well. Our server first got our drinks and then immediately asked if we were ready to order. Seeing as we have never been here before and we'd looked at the menu for 30 seconds we obviously needed more time. He had come back 2 more times (both about less than a minute apart) before we finally figured out what we wanted. The whole time our server wasn't personable or anything. I felt like I was talking to a robot. Now onto the food... I got the honey French toast which was really good! I also loved the sausage patty. However, the hash browns were cooked only on one side. The rest was completely raw. My mom got the Cinnabon pancakes which she claimed to be good but she's had better. My sister enjoyed her s'mores pancakes, but wished it came with more syrup. I don't know if it's because they ran out of the containers to put syrup in but they came in little to go cups. They gave us the bare minimum. We would have asked for more but our server seemed in a rush to leave our table when he checked up on us. We did receive a discount, which was not explained. I'm assuming it's because he overheard us discussing the raw hash browns. Also I don't understand why there were 4 hosts standing at the front. They didn't have much to do so I think 1 would have been fine with the 15 minute wait we had.

n4ZzUsSJDD9bMqJ9PeO9Gw.text: This place was the bomb! My niece took us here and if it was not for the hour wait I would have given it 5 stars. They overlooked our name and bypassed us so that was frustrating. Not a good place to go if you are on a strict diet but if it's a cheat day order anything. The German chocolate pancake was to die for! It was like being in Hawaii. We would definitely go there again and hopefully the staff doesn't ignore our name.

irNXrH3aSjDLqhTrVP4BJg.text: Very disappointed!! A friend of mine told me to try carrot cake pancakes b/c she always goes to the Babystacks in Centennial Hills. They were dry, the eggs were flat and gross, turkey sausage were indescribable. Service was mediocre... My boyfriend ordered the piglet skillet with the eggs well done; the eggs were burnt... I would not recommend this location.

JH5JIXdjZprUhg8UxeX36A.text: Nice place, fantastic service, friendly staff. I was slightly disappointed with the buttermilk pancake flavor but a lot of other great things about his place made up for it.

ZjwT1E5XXFgrp9ulagj__g.text: The Nutella crepe is my daughters favorite so we came back a second time. I had buttermilk pancakes...flat and dense. Not even as good as a mix. . Hubby's piglet skillet was good but he had icky pancakes as well. The server was efficient and nice but  had so much perfume on I sneezed and had itchy eyes all meal. My daughter said she could actually taste it it was so strong. I don't think I will be back.

tWqVY508kHoMQF5aweSHzQ.text: Mocha chip pancakes were awesome. Hubby had Hawaiian Benedict. It was great. Not to much food, just enough.

yACdpSDrT10xMyGePv9NVg.text: Wanted to try something different for breakfast this am. Fantastic! Great food and great service. There was a line (Sunday morning breakfast crowd) but I was able to sit right away at the counter. Got the Kalua pork grilled cheese with a side of pancakes. The sandwich was amazing AND much to my surprise so were the pancakes! (I'm really picky about my pancakes). Def a must visit!

KTA6APZauC1Q3z5P-ZUedg.text: I left this place smiling for the rest of the day!!! The waitress was such a sweetheart and was patient, helpful with the menu and always around. I've had the red velvet pancakes, the peanut butter, chocolate and banana pancakes (add whip cream) and the kalua pig benedict and all were to die for!!! Who can beat some mouth watering pancakes starting at $4.95?!?! This place might have a bit of a wait but when you try their pancakes you'll have no idea what is going on around you except for what's in your mouth :)

u0pw_DfPXNmOGBCr2c7vUQ.text: Have visited BabyStacks a few times. I like the wide variety of options for pancakes. The servings aren't huge, but acceptable. I think the prices are good for what you get. Love the lemon curd they use, and the cream cheese syrup is yummy! I'd give 5 stars, but the wait can be ridiculous. If we go, we always do a late lunch, right before they close.

0-U5MfhUa_JuTnk_u_UUQA.text: My husband had the huntington omelet & I had the spinach eggs benedict with a side of portuguese sausage The meal totaled about $25. Yes the food was good but nothing to rave about because I'm not a pancake kind of girl. However something was missing. Ambiance, service, decor I honestly can't put my finger on it Enthusiastically speaking Babystacks did not hit the mark.

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States

vf2rqtAk3SRSeNF9xVqDjQ.text: This place is awesome! The food was great their potatoes are so good my family loves them and their portions are just right. The place is nice and clean. We ordered cookies and cream pancakes after the waiter recommended it and they were out-of-this world good. Service was amazing from the hostess to our waiter Gloria she was so sweet. Definitely know why this place got such high ratings on Yelp

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States

4nn4K23zZWBkpNzzL4dYGg.text: First time today, glad we were finally able to get in! Food was very good and the best part is that it wasn't trying to be all foodie, it was all just straight forward good breakfast food. Everything we had was good and filling. We will 100% be back again! Prepare for a wait when you go - it's that popular.

8PqgL3NZXswhOR0D1GKsFw.text: This is probably one of the best breakfast spots in Vegas! The red velvet pancakes are to die for and the Cinnabon pancakes were delicious also. They need to open a location near my house in Silverado ranch!

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Mexican omelette was delicious
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Red velvet and Cinnabon pancakes !!

gUlChQkI595tVNTeSg7b2g.text: Hand down my favorite breakfast spot in Henderson.  This is my go to breakfast/brunch spot to take all my visitors.    If you love pancakes this is place is for you.  My favorite is the Carrot Cake pan cake with the yummy cream cheese frosting, YUMMMMM!  You can't go wrong with the Adobo pulled pork fried rice!  Generous amount of pulled pork mixed in fried rice and all of its juicy goodness, wrapped like a burrito with a thin tortilla made from a fried egg.  Warning: It is very heavy and filling!    If that doesn't tickle your fancy, the Loco Moco is pretty good!  The patty though was on the dry side, but keep in mind, I like my meat medium rare to rare.  Next time I order this I would ask them to cook it to medium.    Ambiance gives a smaller mom and pop feel to the restaurant with homey decor.    Service was excellent, checked on often enough but not intrusive :)  If you are even thinking about this place, GO! You will not be disappointed :)

iORgtqf8QCpijlLiWkjsWQ.text: Taste is a 5/5, I got the adobo fried rice and their banana pancakes, so good! The flavors are so savory and I really enjoyed the sweetness of the banana pancakes. Service was a 5/5 as well, our server was very patient since witness our first time and even offered recommendations. I wanted to mix my food and have something sweet and salty at the same time so he suggested my adobo fried rice and pancakes. Portioning 2/5, the adobo fried rice omelet was small, comparing it to other Hawaiian BBQ places that offer it, the size was on the small end. I was actually still hungry after my omelet but I was not going to pay another $9 for it. The price we paid was worth the quality and taste of the food but I do wish their portioning was bigger. This place is hyped by a lot of my friends but I do not see it, maybe if I tried another dish that'll change my mind?

Ksl_4siLeFo9GcMRdDz48g.text: ****Watch your Food*** This place generates a lot of business, and I was looking forward to a great experience... Until The waiter came out n brought me my plate w/hair in my eggs! Yes hair!!! And when I brought it to his attention he then asks me do I want him to take the food back?!!! WTH!!! The German Chocolate Pancakes were Awesome! But The Customer Service Needs Serious Work!!!

f1zv65aMysid4pDV_-JOgQ.text: i got the piglet omelette with red velvet pancakes,   food was incredible. best breakfast restaurant in Henderson if you like pancakes! they have like 15-20 different types!

Ow5OvIwT8eOFTvilKf6Y1Q.text: Fun breakfast spot.  Staff is cool, nice menu, competetive prices, quality offerings.  Inside only.

w_9uyCEqkcZOqZS1llRbZQ.text: We walked in this morning, placed our names on the waitlist, and sat in the waiting area.  My partner noticed a squashed roach on the floor. I'm a big Dirty Dining follower, so I tried my very best to pretend I didn't see that  poor unfortunate creature. Then seconds later, another huge roach was crawling leisurely like he owns this place to his dead friend.  We walked right out in disgust. I really liked this place too.

I5t2iTM2-CnBEtLZwQzlCw.text: I'd heard great things about Baby Stacks, and the food definitely met my expectations. Built my own skillet - delish! Unfortunately the service was extremely lacking. The server seemed like he didn't want to be there. He didn't check back after dropping off the food, and my toast didn't come out until after we had finished eating. Overall a frustrating experience.

fxR6pMKgVL5sYEYPxOKzug.text: Waited 15 minutes for a table for four. I kinda dig the "small town homey" vibe I got. Everyone who was working there was pleasant. It was a Sunday morning so we expected a slight wait.   We were shown our table and our server was right over. She was very nice. I forgot her name by she's the redhead who was super nice and friendly. Took our drink orders and promptly had them. Kids at Sprite and we had coffee. We both enjoyed the coffee.   We looked at the menu, decided on what we wanted and ordered.   10 or so minutes the food was served. My only complaint was that my wife's food came out a solid 10 minutes after mine and our kids. She was a trooper and told us to eat and not to worry because she would pick over our food.   I ordered the cowboy skillet. Plenty of food as it came with pancakes (or toast). The skillet was very good and the eggs were perfectly cooked (over easy.) the pancakes were delicious and perfectly cooked.   My daughter had a kids sized egg (scrambled), bacon and two sausage patties and has towns. The hash browns were just a tad oily but still very good. The sausage was amazing. Perfectly cooked and seasoned.   My son had the chicken tenders and fries. No complaints there. He ate it all up.   My wife's food finally came. She got the cowboy omelette. She said it was excellent and was only able to make it through half before she couldn't go any further.   All in all a great little place. We will def be back!

AG4EKOa4Qn2DRYO8-IrxNg.text: We had a party of six at babystacks today. The group ordered several different types of pancakes. Everyone raved about his or her pancakes. The fresh fruit cups were just that "fresh & very tasty " the omelette one person had was very good and the other was slightly dry. Coffee & ice tea were also good! The service we received was prompt, friendly & very warm. We will certainly patronize this place again!

qT-6onHTL52tPxWawHAKYg.text: This is such a yummy place!  Very authentic Hawaiian.  Whatever you get get it with the garlic rice. So amazing.  Everything is great here so I suggest it all especially the spam:). It's a cute little cafe with a moderate amount of seating.  Can be a long wait on weekends so get there early. If there's a line it's worth the wait;)

fEJOw06a2a0oRRTvEgKsjw.text: Excellent pancake house meets Hawaiian and Filipino diner food.  It was a bit of a zoo on Saturday morning, but managed to get a seat at the counter.  This location is out in the burbs in Henderson  I went with the LoLo Rick's Adobo Fried Rice, basically a Filipino rice omelette, and some Bananas Foster pancakes.  Both were excellent; I really should not have eaten it all.

hiElMuqWVInQQ42IcRp9Rw.text: Today I ate at a restaurant called Babystacks Cafe. Excellent experience I'd say 9/10. Friendly staff on top of a welcoming environment, combined with high quality food provided an ideal first meal of the day for me.  Hashbrowns 10/10 undoubtedly my favorite part of the entire meal, they were cooked just enough so that they were crispy but not to the point where they would be burned. I ended up getting a second order because of how good they were.  S'Mores Pancakes 8/10 I enjoyed these throughly although I do wish they had provided more marshmallows with them. Nonetheless, the short stack I purchased was more than enough for me, it was cooked well and not burned, and very flavorful.  Overall I would definitely return to this restaurant and I would recommend it to a friend.

Nb6sEUx6-90lkTKWpanJkg.text: The red velvet & the German chocolate pancakes are the bombbbbbb!!! Great portion sizes & reasonable prices. Service is quick !

QJ0BVn3Qu0tM5TskM2JeVQ.text: A friend and I saw the reviews and thought this was a winner. We both ordered the veggie omelet, pancakes and hash browns. Neither of us use maple syrup, so we both asked for extra butter. It took so long I got up to remind and walked towards our waitress to remind her. The hash browns were cold and so were the pancakes. Our waitress offered to re-do the order. This time the hash browns came before the pancakes,  and were still cold. The omelet itself was good, but nothing special. The pancakes were not light and fluffy. Our waitress gave a "military discount" of 10% apologizing that she wasn't allowed to give more. The cashier asked how the meal was and when I told him he too was sorry. So was I - we will never go back

SsH2-tMBE0kJZoUuK4R7-w.text: The food was ok, however the service was terrible. Our waitress was sweet and attentive however the hostess when we went to pay and the manager were very rude. They do not split or give you a separate check so we calculated how much we owed and they ended up over charging us. I am willing to try another location but we will not be back to this one.

oMZXxp7M4gO408lmG3rG4Q.text: The place was good although they made us wait a while even though they had a sign saying first come first serve...didnt make sense that once u leave and decide not to stay n wait  but other people come in and wait the whole time the people that wait that long dont get priority over the people that change there mind n decided to come back anyways also i didnt like that we were sat by the kitchen almostvn bathrom but price was reasonable probably wont come bk

Ln_PqYITE9ghP32vwrH-xQ.text: The red velvet pancakes are absolutely delicious and I am very picky with my red velvet. Not very many people can pull it off. Their turkey avocado sandwich is hit or miss. I order it every time we dine in, and every other time it has been an amazing experience; on the other days not so much. Once it was salty but drinking water really helped. The other time my bread was really toasted (burnt is just too harsh a description) but our server noticed that I removed it and immediately went to the manager to see if there was any way to remove it or give us a discount. Did I mention, we didn't complain about it? Now that is great customer service! Sorry, I didn't get your name though.

H6SeX43dovSp38fgRfu4pQ.text: Late breakfast/early lunch on a Saturday. Place was very busy but got seated quickly. Great service, large menu. A lot of different food than normal cafes with it leaning towards a Hawaiian/Polynesian profile. The selection of pancakes is impressive. Good prices. I will return.

6XLEuu0mhZLeDUIMe2CUWQ.text: The food was delicious and had a different vibe. We loved the garlic rice and the menu had a lot of great choices. We will be back

1krXx4umuokaBgT42H_NLA.text: The three stars are for this location and its service. I absolutely LOVE babystacks ! I've been to now all the locations and this by far was the worst. It's sad because my S.O had never been and he has this location as his first try. The customer service was terrible, as well as the quality of the food. The portions were small and cold, I requested my eggs over medium and they came to my plate runnier than a toddlers nose on a cold winter morning. Very disappointed, my banana foster pancakes had no love in them they were cold and uninviting. I am very disappointed in this location; I highly suggest the buffalo location.

h1LJX9iZF14U3BXOaGUNOA.text: I was looking for a place to have brunch and based on the reviews it seemed like a no-brainer. I will say the service was great! Very prompt, very courteous... not a single problem.   I'm giving three stars because the food was ok. There wasn't anything wrong specifically. It was just eh. I had the Huevos Rancheros with a short stack of Cinnabun pancakes. The entree was decent but tasted a bit bland. It came with hash brown which seemed to have been heated up in a microwave and seared for a couple seconds. Again, it's just my opinion but there's wasn't much about the Huevos Rancheros to rave about. The top pancake of the short stack was awesome! But because they really only drizzle with frosting the top one, the other two seemed a bit dryer.   All in all, the food was average but the service was great... enough to come back and try something else. There were plates I saw being ordered that looked fantastic. So the three stars may go up after an update.   At any rate, I would recommend this place. Your experience may differ.

uv92Ti4H4uuShm8wxYxAkA.text: This place has the best pancakes you can dream of. So many flavors and all to die for! My personal favorite which is not written on the menu is the German chocolate pancakes. Absolutely amazing! If you like garlic, upgrade your side to the garlic rice, you won't be disappointed.  The wait staff is exceptionally friendly and always eager to help you. We come here all the time and can't get enough of it.  And last but not least you won't break your budget with this place. You will get out of there with a full belly and still a full wallet!

Td9TBgqBMyahHrUJ1n_jng.text: Fantastic Breakfast restaurant!  The kalua pork Benedict was Devine also the mocha almond pancakes!  Great service, friendly people! My Husband and I will be back to try more!!

eXNUPe8D0rL8HBW5IVXqTw.text: After being told by some coworkers that I should try this place. I went ahead and did that. We were seated immediately. There are so many options for your pancakes and everything looks delicious. I finally decided on the cookie butter French toast. It was good but nothing to brag about. I ordered some eggs, bacon and potatoes and they were all so good. Can't wait to go back and try the different items on the menu. I gave them 4 stars because there was an inconvenience regarding upgrading the French toast from regular to cookie butter filled. Either way the service was good.

G9vVY30vcw02mlTrxb4Fqg.text: Always friendly and excellent food!! I really like this place for breakfast. You can even get it to go and it's just as good. They have more than one location in Vegas but they all fill up fast so be prepared to wait.

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Strawberry sweet cream crepe!!!

x5U-gwS8JTvn-Zd5XV8DpA.text: Decor: 3/5 -Bright cafe that closes at 2pm -Some of the tables wobble  Service: 4/5 -The food came out fairly quick.  -Service was extremely friendly.  Food: 3/5 -The pancakes were delicious. We tried the banana cream and the carrot cake. The banana cream was rich and sweet.  -Most of my party liked the banana cream more than the carrot cake. I liked the carrot cake more. The cream cheese syrup is mmm mmm delicious. -Rick's Adobo fried rice was my favorite and large enough to share between 2-3 adults. -The loco moco was too hyped up. Too much brown gravy that masked the flavor of the beef and eggs. Wait, there were eggs? All I noticed was beef patties, rice and gravy.  -The Portuguese sausage had a distinct taste however nothing to brag home about. It was also very very greasy.

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Banana cream pancake

vwPCpQIdt7LfnX6mWvJUvg.text: Its my first time to eat here...  came in with my family and was mentioning to them about their other locations.  Big disappointment was the food... ordered loco moco and their hamburger patties was hard as it was just heat up from being frozen!  Second i was not aware that my sister ordered a apam and egg slider and was asking if theres pancake or rice that comes with it... waiter said no but can order it as a side order! Well my sister got a side order of rice.  When her order came in, sister was surprised to see the slider egg and spam, she said she didnt know its a small sandwuch.  Well my sister is visiting from Saudi Arabia and theres lots of food here that she didnt know.  The waiter told her after putting her slider order that the side order of rice will follow!  I got annoyed that the waiter did not even explain to my sister what a slider is... that you dont eat it with rice!   Thats very disappointing!  I cancelled the side order.  Third, my sister is visiting from outside the country and always trying to connect her phone to wifi everytime she has the chance!  She was given a password that doesnt work.  I went to the counter and the guy told me its their wifi sometimes it work sometimes not! I told him its not the wifi its the password... He seems not to care on what i said!  #neveragain #saynotobabystackshenderson

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States

q96bjTHL-spsY4cDahdcXw.text: Service was friendly and attentive.  I heard it gets pretty busy, but luckily we were there on a Monday morning around 8:30 AM, so it wasn't too bad.  Plenty of seats open.  You can tell it's Filipino owned by the decorations, hence the giant spoon and fork.  As for food, we ordered the White Chocolate Chip Macadamia Nut pancakes and Rick's Adobo Fried Rice.  The pancakes were pretty good.  I liked how they topped the pancakes with white chocolate chips, pretty tasty.  I wasn't too crazy about the adobo fried rice.  First of all, it didn't really taste like adobo, and second it was pretty salty.    Maybe it was just an off day on the adobo fried rice?  Hopefully, but who knows.  I'll definitely be back to try some other things, though.

LTXUsA5lyUwCX-Ltgafxew.text: I fully understand they we busy for Mothers Day but the waiting process to seat people did not make sense. We had a party of three waited 40 minutes to be seated. Party of two were seated almost immediately. Three seats open at bar daughter asked hostesses if we could sit at bar, she advise us she was going to offer other people waiting longer, that was fair.  About 15 minutes later three more bar seated opened hostess asked us if we wanted then we said yea after the 40 minute wait. Then same hostesses call a party of four who just walked in and sat them a table. I asked when happened to us, since we would took the bar seats and it was not clean she bypassed us. In my mind we should of been offer the table first before the bar. After I complained we got a table, no apology or anything from hostesses. Great food but getting seated it was a very negative experience. Would of been a four or five if manager or hostess said they we sorry.

4swF5LTN5jIoe-E3deT95A.text: Love love love their food! Red velvet pancakes and kalhua pork grilled cheese are amazing. I tend to go during the week so service is usually good, although slow sometimes. Definitely recommend this location to friends looking for new breakfast spots.

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Red velvet pancakes with cream cheese syrup

COgThRRH1eN5KuWdUfaDzw.text: Had the Ricks adobo fried rice omelet and OMG it was a mouthgasm. The service was so good and food  arrived so fast i could've sworn i was at McDonalds. Go eat there now, the end

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Ricks adobo fried rice omelet

3PgovD6tP95Rut5OKbNXAQ.text: Great spot for breakfast! If you like pancakes, this is definitely a must try. They also make a great adobo friend rice wrapped in egg, and being from Hawaii, I know what good adobo fried rice is, and this I must say is right up there with what we have back in the islands. Customer service is great as well, and service is fast and efficient. Atmosphere is very relaxed, with some soothing Hawaiian music. Must try spot when you're in Vegas! Gotta thank my boy Chris for the great recommendation.

0G41gyJ9hgRmy1ro9jTfng.text: First time ever eating here and had the best dining experience ever! Our waitress Kayla was so helpful and had that True aloha spirit! She recommended the pancake specials....... Bananas foster and German chocolate cake pancakes ! They were amazing! I will be telling all of my friends about this place! Kayla thank you for all of your suggestions and for making our experience wonderful! Can't wait to go back and try the Kahlua pig benedict !

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Bananas Foster pancakes are light and delicious.... A must have!
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Made to order German Chocolate pancakes! Out of this world!

Qz4i1_E-xo16xwsQzo0YQg.text: Stay away. Food okay. Service is the  worst 15 minutes to just order. 24 minutes to get a Coke. An hour to get cold food. Never got check or a refill on coke. Had to eat with no drink. I even went up front and asked for a refill. Still no luck. Go somewhere else. When I went to pay I was told to go back to table and wait for check. I told them no I had been there for almost 2 hours. Let me pay or I'm walking out I didn't have any more time to waste

V8HinTzNxUVmO3n8u3FTUA.text: Love this place. Friendly staff. You must try one of their specialty pancakes. We take all of our out of town guests here.

50z3KTUWOns1VS5i3V49KQ.text: The food is amazing. I had the bananas foster crepe. Yum! They are always super busy and the wait is usually pretty long. At times the staff seemed a little frazzled and checkout is a nightmare. Just be patient though, the food is with it.

cGyv0R4YicCfs5-l2By5Rw.text: Returned to Babystacks Cafe, and my family and I enjoyed these short stacks flavs - pumpkin, s'mores, blueberry & hazelnut, and hubby had Rick's adobo fried rice omelette.

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Short stacks flavs - pumpkin, s&#39;mores, blueberry &amp; hazelnut.
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Rick&#39;s adobo fried rice omelette.

j2JyFTqxhF6m2cAU4Zc5GA.text: Best breakfast in all of Las Vegas. Maybe the state. Possibly the country. The service, the food, the ambiance is outstanding every time I go in. Pancakes tried: Red velvet, orange creamsicle, Easter special ( Cadbury egg batter with toasted coconut and whip cream on top), Cookie butter French toast, and sweet cream crepes. All fantastic. Red velvet pancakes are a must have! And the cookie butter French toast is the guilty pleasure of the century. Entrees tried: Spam scramble is decent. Spam sliders are delicious with Hawaiian sweet rolls layered with a spam scramble and your choice of cheese. Pick cheddar. And make sure to get furikake seasoning on EVERYTHING. It makes the dish 10x better. Kalua pig Benedict is not as good as it sounds. No flavor with a ton of carbs. If you're torn, pick the adobo fried rice omelette (substitute rice for garlic rice, add furikake seasoning) and the cookie butter French toast. Your tastebuds will thank you. It will be so good you'll come back to try the rest of the menu. Babystacks you have my heart... And my hips :')

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Monthly special! Easter pancakes

boDjxhVH4v9BFpsPRq2YJA.text: I came here with some friends for brunch after a night out and I was starving! They have a lot of specialty pancake options which can be added to any of the combos as an upgrade. I stuck with the buttermilk but my friends got carrot cake and lemon meringue which they enjoyed. I also had an omelette which I didn't find to be amazing. It was a little overlooked so the edges were slightly burned and they didn't use a lot of cheese so it was on the dry side. We came on a weekday morning so it wasn't very crowded and our service was quick. Overall, a decent breakfast/brunch place.

rsWKiaCrWJheJHWBqml8cw.text: Love this place! The Aloha is heartfelt and food is Ono! The pancakes were really good. We had the original babystacks pancake, Mac nut chocolate pancake, and chocolate chip pancake. All were really good and fluffy. Good coffee. We also got spinach eggs benedict and spam and eggs. Waitress was very warm and welcoming. We arrived before 9am on Monday and we're seated right away. There was a 20 min wait by the time we left.

_Q8ZlGvaq-aY8LuJ4F1gYg.text: My third time here and I'm trying to like this place as it is convenient, but I just don't. The service is slow, the food potions are small, yet you pay a premium price. Their menu suggests a gourmet breakfast experience with all the pancake options, but the reality of my experiences is the equivalent of a $2.99 breakfast special with a wait and a premium price.   Every time, the food is brought out piece meal, so not everyone gets their food at the same time. The eggs are always cold.   Everyone that works here is super friendly, but there are so many other options where the portions are good and the service is prompt that they can earn my business. It's breakfast, not rocket science. As much as I wish I liked it, baby stacks just isn't worth it.

E6YD4sihCdBEZNnYcRfreA.text: Where do I begin? Well I woke up really hungry. Especially from dieting a whole week, so I though... "I wanna splurge, just a little more, today!" So I was going to go to IHOP, but my brother and his family wanted to eat. And, we ultimately decided in Babystacks.   This place was packed. I'm assuming it's because it's a new eatery and people wanted to try. We waited about 15 minutes before being seated.  I was having a hard time to decide because there was so much in the menu, which wasn't that aesthetic to the eyes. It was hard to understand the menu.   I got spam and eggs with garlic rice and pancakes. The rest of the group got the fried rice, Portuguese sausage, red velvet pancakes and steak.   I like my spam crispy and brown, this was lightly grilled and soft. The garlic rice was better than bland. It had flavor. BUT, it was still pretty bland. I could tell that there was onions and garlic powder but a little salt with the rice would have been better.   Pancakes had a unique flavor. I've had really good, fluffy, sponge-like pancakes at different restaurants, but this was pretty dense and tasteless. (I do have really good tastebuds, that's why I'm on a diet from enjoying too much food.)  I'm not sure what the other Yelpers think is so great about this adobo fried rice, but I've had Hawaiian and Filipino fried rice... And THIS, was not authentic adobo. Instead of adobo meat, it was adobo rice with shredded meat. If you're a shoyu addict, enjoy this meal. It was soaked with soy sauce. Couldn't even taste the "adobo meat," which I think was a pigment of my imagination in this dish. Reconsider the adobo fried rice, and get it somewhere else.   Loco-moco's patties were flavorless, eggs were undercooked, food wasn't treated with love.  For the price of the food here, I would have gone somewhere else. If you're gonna have hawaiian-themed food, have hawaiian sized meals.   I am super sad because I had high expectations. Food is not outstanding. Service was good. Wanted more out of it. I'm going to another place for b-fast.

qqIey_jTRV5pMwoXaztUsw.text: I implore you, please eat here and be blessed. You will thank me, and then want to go back tomorrow.   Baby stacks is an awesome Hawaiian breakfast and lunch joint with a unique flair. Their pancakes are some of the best I've had, and come in a wide variety of flavors. Their Kahlua pork eggs Benedict is my favorite thing on the menu. I literally dream about that dish with a short stack of red velvet pancakes. I tried this place for the first time in August of 2014 and went back 6 times in the next 5 weeks.   Just go.

PmJoyke3BKCusH1Bi8kH-A.text: Calling all visitors who are visiting from the islands to come to this new location of Babystacks Cafe.  This was my first time to this place and not disappointed at all.  I've wanted to try it on my last visit but I didn't get a chance too but on this visit it was a "must".  I was so glad this location had just opened no more than 2 weeks ago!  Location- Easy to find right now only one front sign but adding the second side sign. Inside decoration- Very simple gardening decorations on the walls to me it gives you a very peaceful atmosphere!  Nice clean tables/chairs and 6 counter stools.  Like most local filipino houses guess what they got hanging on the wall? The wooden fork and spoon! Hawaiian/island reggae music playing in the restaurant.  Food- I wanted to try a little bit of everything!  But I settled for these... Red velvet pancakes Kalua pork grilled cheese with fries Portuguese sausage and rice (the rice tasted like jasmine rice) not a real fan. I thought the pancakes was awesome! My favorite! Then the Portuguese sausage just topped it off! I didn't know what to expect on the grilled cheese but I must saw it won my gut! Overall- I will definitely bring more of family and friends here to try it out...Local people will always support locals no matter what.

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. The decorations.
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. If you local filipino you know what this is.
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Kalua pork grilled cheese.

pkqpK_Mgucmx70BIuDJOtw.text: Flavored pancakes - what will they come up with next?   I've ventured to the other side of town to take in the indulgences of Babystacks and was not disappointed with their "new" location on the Eastside. There was quite a wait (close to 30 mins) but it seemed far less.   Red velvet pancakes and a skillet with potatoes, eggs, spinach and cheese were on my side and Orange Creamsicle and Rick's adobo fried rice were on the BFs.

HS98xIaSNQhN5HYXM84P9w.text: I had breakfast this morning and unfortunately I could only give this place 3 stars. The food was delicious but the service was not up to par. The server we had was very awkward and barely spoke . She kind of looked like she was nervous . Maybe it was her first day? Food is good and prices are pretty low as well so it might be worth a try .

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States

7u5rMz0mkru7oSoNgVq-Eg.text: Staff is very friendly and food is good.  The wait is a bit much and some of the "rules", while I get the point, seem a bit much for a small mom and pop shop.  Be aware if the party is not there you will not get seated.  But they do a good job overall.

PnqCoB7Kw9Y3KWLx4Uz6hg.text: I'm giving this place 5 stars because the food was pretty awesome! Not your typical breakfast at all- a twist with flavored pancakes and rice as an option for your side are some of the things that made this place memorable for me. So here's what I say is a MUST- Rick's adobo fried omelette. It was amazing. Mouth watering, and spiced to perfection. Also- the Nutella crepe. It was served at the next table and we couldn't stop staring. We regretted not ordering it. Last, the red velvet pancakes. Everyone loved them, they were fluffy and not too sweet. Other good items were the banana pancakes, garlic rice, and regular omelette. They weren't crazy delicious, just basic and good. So if you decide to go to one of the 4 locations, get the adobo omelette for sure, it's worth the wait and drive.

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Garlic rice as a side
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Banana pancakes

sq33XF8mE9Ub_EmhemqJVQ.text: I was so happy when this location opened! Their red velvet pancake and ricks adobo fried rice are just YUM! Hopefully they can make the place bigger.

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. My favs!

Z381qPLSmPZMrl7ZpQbAKQ.text: Heard a lot of good things about baby stacks.  one opened on my end of town so decided to give it a go.    sat quickly and waited a good 10 minutes for water and coffee/tea order.  another 10 to get the drinks.  food took a whI would like to say the food sat under the heat lamp way too long and was overly dry when it was delivered.  not the case.  it sat somewhere for too long and was delivered cold.  our waitress was great and took everything back and removed the meals from our check.  the kick in the pants is that I still received a bill for one cup of coffee.  kinda bush league...

nUUiOs-zkTPjqYkKYizpUg.text: I cannot believe this place has been down the road from my house for this long and I've been going to IHOP! This place is amazing. Best pancakes ever! I also had an omelette and eggs Benedict - both great!

q-ta4qQsY37hrhEvsojoQg.text: Hostess was not friendly.  We were not greeted.  Once we were seated our server was slow and inattentive.  I asked for crispy bacon w/ my meal, the server said "of course, no problem." it came floppy.  We didn't see our server again until we were about ready to leave.  We mentioned it, she was going to charge us for an additional side of bacon, until she took it back to the kitchen and it came incinerated- like they threw it in the microwave for 5 minutes. The tortilla on the breakfast burrito lacked moisture as well.  The one good thing is the blueberry pancakes.  That is the silver lining.

xJgV5ruPIZBIYnCeRLDdZQ.text: Food was really great!, had the orange creamsicle pancakes that were excellent! the only reason I didn't give 5 stars was for the service, had to ask for a lot of things, like Syrup for pancakes, sugar, there was no sugar on table even after they poured coffee, these are small thing I know, but I still will come back!

6UsRS5ZwxRHLcVF14ucLwg.text: The garlic fried rice is soak in grease. No seasoning. And service is so bad. She didn't even check on us for refills and I have to grab another waitress for a service. Everything Is greasy. I will never recommend the place to anyone.

-1qmbag5pDzRqtppvMZUIA.text: I almost hate to post a great review because then everyone will find out about their great breakfasts and it will be even more crowded!  But setting aside my selfish desires to keep this a wonderful secret, this is one of my favorite breakfast go-tos.  The food is outstanding.  I love the adobo fried rice omelet, the kalbi beef ribs and garlic rice, and of course the red velvet pancakes.  They don't split checks, which is annoying, and there is often a wait even during the week days.  But I keep returning because the food is so good!

urUSYWrxvQhTtpSs7C12Zw.text: Pancakes were definitely a hit for my family! Overall breakfast was awesome. The only thing that needed improvement was the timing of food preparation and delivering to table. My kids had to wait 10 minutes longer than us to receive their meals because of their pancakes.

4yc_vHba_P7rlsOSn4NvLg.text: Excellent place to grab some breakfast! It is open for breakfast and lunch but I have only been there for breakfast and I keep returning. I love the the eggs Benedict as well as the red velvet pancakes.  The place is clean and the staff is very friendly.

WORUHgPYsxMCABPNZn3JDA.text: Food was excellent!! The Bananas Foster pancakes are amazing.   The service however is what made 5 stars 3. Painfully slow and we went during non-rush hour.  The waiting area was packed with several empty tables waiting to be filled. The front counter staff focused more on answering the phone and taking to go/pick up orders rather than the waiting on customers.

0F84WiCsmyotIaUJA6lDoQ.text: The food was good!! I got the steak and eggs also comes with pancakes! Definitely a good amount of food for the charge. Definitely would go back to try out different pancakes.

4U4am8TtZYS9O2TSOt9C6Q.text: Absolutely incredible food! Amazing service! Just an overall favorite place to eat. Definitely something everyone should try!!

OX1cPCG8mfVMRlS2JF1H9g.text: I waited an hour to seat myself and a friend. The food wasn't too filling either despite the price, but the food tasted good. The service was also fast, which makes me wonder why the wait to be seated is so long.  I got the HM1(FMF) skillet (I don't know what that stands for), which contained seasoned ground pork, bacon, green onion, cilantro, and Swiss cheese. The price was $9.50 and the portion wasn't as big as I had hoped. The flavor was fine, but the portion fell short of what I had expected for the price and the quality of the food wasn't that spectacular enough to make up for the lack of portion.  If you're thinking about trying to place, come between lunch and dinner for a shorter wait time.  It's a nice restaurant in the middle of Henderson, but there's a breakfast place across that street that might give you a better experience.

8dsG-bSbfJNym-AkGZ7liw.text: So far, so good. Their omelets are hearty and generous. The potatoes were nicely seasoned and not dry in the slightest.  I've tried the carrot cake stack and cinnamon stack, both great. I definitely recommend the cinnamon one though, they became my instant favorite.  I definitely plan on returning to try some more stuff! I found the location on smoke ranch to have better service. They don't suck, they just weren't as personal. The other location made me feel as if I were at home in my Hawaiian auntie's place! This is a definite try spot, especially if you love to brunch as much as I do.

jSpUxfcnsbxHqI52JsP5JQ.text: I am new to Las Vegas and my friend who has been here for a few months brought me here as a "Welcome to Vegas!" Brunch. It was about a 30 min wait, you could tell this place was a poppin place for Saturday morning brunch. When I looked at the menu I was so surprised to see they had island food! I felt almost like I was at home. I was going to order the spam and eggs, but I decided to go with the adobo omelet. It was amazing... I also had a short stack of the whites chocolate macadamia nut pancakes. Omg... I will be coming back and I will introduce more people to this place. 5 stars, hands down.

oKH-CQlKrNm7p8I6AdtNQA.text: This place will probably have a spot in my heart forever. It's definitely my favorite breakfast spot in the area. It's a good Hawaiian/Filipino/American breakfast fusion place. The standouts, IMO, are their various flavors of pancakes and Lolo Rick's Adobo Fried Rice (which comes wrapped in an omelette). I usually get the Red Velvet pancakes with cream cheese syrup, but they have a huge variety on the menu plus whatever flavors are listed on their chalkboard for the day. I am also weirdly partial to their Loco Moco (both chili and non-chili versions) even though that's not unique to them. Their service is extremely friendly and sweet, if slow at times.   They recently stopped allowing split checks. Keep that in mind if you're thinking about dining here with friends. It's definitely enough of a nuisance that sometimes my friends and I declined not to eat here simply because of that.

ijmvrg5NJtGO4lllGIWvdg.text: Yummy! I ordered the veggie garden skillet and the Nutella crepe which arrived within 10 minutes of ordering. Both were delicious! The crepe did get a little soggy by the time I went to eat it but then again I left it on the side until I was done with my skillet. I recommend ordering it at the end or eating it first. Service was good overall. The guy at the front with glasses and blonde tips was very efficient. He seemed to be seating everyone and made sure my water was always full too.

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Nutella crepe, so yummy!
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Veggie Garden skillet &amp; Nutella crepe

FOrAmEzMcrqGHQmlNnQ_cg.text: Probably the best Babystacks location in Vegas..!  We came here on a Sunday afternoon around lunch time. I was worried it was going to be a minimum of 30 min wait like we experienced in the other locations, but to our surprise we got seated right away!  They were pretty busy today but we got just the right amount of service.  Today's visit we tried the adobo fried rice, sausage and eggs, and of course the famous red velvet pancakes! We left very full and satisfied :)  I will be coming back for sure!

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Adobo fried rice, sausage and eggs, and of course red velvet pancakes!

dGw3W0Kom6lpui_1xLPCaQ.text: You'll have to wait a bit for a table but so worth it! The food is awesome!! If you like pancakes this is your place!

aL_LDysFcCTKjwcNkTZFbA.text: A great place to pop into for brunch! They have a ton of options on the menu ranging from traditional pancakes and waffles to their own specialty house creations. There is a bit of an underlying Hawaiian/Filipino theme to the food and it is excellent! They make a mean Loco Moco - a Hawaiian dish of garlic rice topped with a burger patty, fried egg and gravy. It may sound strange, but trust me, it's delicious!   If you come here on a holiday or weekend be prepared for a bit of a wait. I've never been here when it wasn't packed. Also, if you come with a group be aware that they are no longer splitting checks so you'll need to bring cash or plan to Venmo the person who ends up taking care of the bill.

jP2TqB9S1Tb5E0ylNmOiIA.text: Best breakfast place I have been to. I've been to many especially in Hawaii and this one tops a lot of them. The customer service  was great. The food came out quick and didn't have to wait too long. The food was so much! I had the Portuguese sausage, eggs and rice. They gave so much Portuguese sausage! The cookie butter French toast was amazing! I just wish they had a smaller version because it was so much! My boyfriend had the same as me but with cinnamon pancakes instead of cookie butter French toast. The prices were reasonable.   I highly recommend this place to everyone. My boyfriend and I loved it and will definitely be coming back.

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Cinnamon pancakes
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. So much Portuguese sausage !! I love it
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Happy Aloha Friday

_apanNnAQFYyqMyp_irsQA.text: 3rd time here and can't find what's so great.  SLOW SLOW SERVICE. ..eggs? They cook in 5 minutes why the 33 min wait for food?  AND TODAY THE FANCY MALE SERVER DIDN'T EVEN HEAR MY ORDER...REALLY? brought my daughters pancakes and looked at me like I was crazy. I told him "what to you think? I was just going to watch HER eat?" Not very sympathetic either...very snooty. I was so upset NO I didn't ask for the management. I would of made a seen! Why the hell as a server would you not say....SO your don't want anything?  RETARDED  Ugh!  NOT GOING BACK I was trying to like it. I really was.   DISSATISFIED DISAPPOINTED and frankly sad.  & food is average.  IF it was great I could over look the wait and all the RULES they have.  No splitting checks, sit here, pay up there. Wait outside. Oh I didn't hear you order. FOOEY

YUVxQCYW_aIXBozAWXsLXQ.text: I was looking for IHOP, but feeling a Hawaiian mood. Went Aloha Kitchen, but they're closed still. This place is the combination of both places and has the Aloha spirt in the foods. I looked at the menu and said YES ! Everything I want if I woke up in Oahu!  Come one , come all ! You can have it all !

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Island style decorated

9kz8gkmAv6J4jUFyv4b9og.text: I like this littl restaurant!!! I recommend it! If you love pancakes this is the perfect place!! Good prices! I been wanting to go everyday!! Hahaha So if you're in las vegas stop by! Located on stephanie and sunset
