1l7hf-A5AJoK_-D4yFckuQ.text: Was in the area and decided to try out. Our party of 4 arrived about 9:30 am, and waited 10-15 minutes for a table.  We ordered the Spam & Eggs, Adobo Fried Rice & our kids got LJ's Scramble. The food was delicious and the pancake recommendations by Clarise were great! The staff is super friendly, and the service was great. We'll definitely come again if we're ever in the area looking for breakfast.

2Af2uYkKsUvd8NvwubZ0zg.text: Pancakes were yummy. Only thing was that we were the third table occupied and the lady sat us down and the guy with his bright hair and wonderful eye makeup took our order. Got our eggs and bacon with potatoes and waited and waited and waited, finally got our pancakes and coffee refill. Guess next time we will go to the one in Summerlin.

Mbey1Mi_EV5W3oOkhGjzYA.text: By far my go to breakfast cafe. Really brings out the island vibes with the reggae music and great staff!

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Kalbi and Eggs, just like steak and eggs but ONO edition
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Lola Cora&#39;s Corned Beef Hash with garlic rice and buttermilk pancakes is SOOOO GOOD!

u1G-ZEf_1mvH8EvdQ_GvFA.text: Came here for the first time for bfast this morning. All people in your party must be here before being seated. Luckily at 0900 it was just getting busy, we did not have to wait for a table, although there was a large party who was seated ahead of us.  It took quite a bit of time for our order to be taken, and then some time before our food came. My friend had coffee (refillable), eggs & bacon and Cinnabon pancakes. I had spam and eggs (no eggs, substitute for potatoes), garlic fried rice, and regular pancakes. I did try my friends pancakes and the frosting was delicious! The entire front of the menu was basically all pancakes, if you're into that, this is the place for you. The regular pancakes were ok. They were a little on the dark side, not as fluffy as I would expect. The garlic fried rice reminded me of home cooking. Spam was spam--it's always good!   Overall, if you're a pancake lover -- you have to try this place out because of the tons of diff options. I thought it was a good breakfast place. And I would definitely come back if someone invites me, but don't think this would be a top choice for me for breakfast.

EPIzIVslgrE_M9wmc50WEw.text: Only negative is the long waits for breakfast, but, food is so delicious that it isn't hard to understand why they are so busy.  Whatever you do, make sure you order get pancakes with your order.  Kalua benedict is really tasty too.

XVarf-C0SIGO8GCFOwOqFQ.text: Fantastic breakfast place, ohhh man the bananas foster pancakes are amazing, an I'm not a big fan of pancakes, but hot darn the pancakes make me wanna dance. The wait was pretty average,  but worth it.

hSgvTBNxO59vtV26jW9OWQ.text: Tried them for breakfast this morning, and we'll definitely be back.  I had the Spinach Eggs Benedict and a sweet cream crepe with bananas.  The crepe was amazing!!  I had a hard time tasting the flavor of the hollandaise, but I'm developing a cold, so that might be why.  The potatoes on the side were delicious and the service was great.  My friends liked their pancakes and everyone enjoyed their meals.

jtB2kej2C7x-Nljqx1UCtg.text: The Hawaiian Benedict was yummy! Service was very friendly, and food was great! Also tried the carrot pancakes, which were great!

bkFm37V3r1BW1ET9pbmEKw.text: Best breakfast place ever! Efrain was excellent! I am glad he was our server! Last time I did not have a friendly one in the Centennial area. My wife and I are definitely  coming back :)

wmDEk34b9i9OXZ2eMgdgeA.text: Great food... Orange pancakes were yum yum! Our waitress Kaylah was awesome. Overall very pleased with our breakfast and will be going back to try other flavors of pancakes.

Up0nuwXR95KGDhsoUkkWvg.text: I like to take my grandparents here as there is something for everyone. It's strip mall location suits the fantastic Filipino and Hawaiian-inspired dishes offered alongside creative takes on pancakery. It's just laid back island style made it the best.

v0_8Ts0dABeH0JKT9XFWIg.text: I've been to this restaurant 4 times and 3 of the experiences today were poor. Seems as though they take no pride in their work. I ordered a club sandwich with avocado today and the avocado that was put on the sandwich was completely brown and foul. I was so shocked that I asked the waitress why anyone would even consider put something like this on someone's food...it made no sense to me. She did offer to have it remade but I didn't have the time or desire and just left.

lZICVwkB3SD4i_Hl8STT9w.text: On the plus side: the coffee was very good and they tried to seat us away from air conditioning vents. The place was freezing.   Everything else: not so much.  One order of biscuits and gravy. Gravy was not  hot and had nothing in it but way way too much salt. "Biscuits" were more like dumplings in that they were not cooked thru so that they were doughy.  I ordered the fall special: pumpkin pancakes. They came with a huge dollop of whipped cream and something yellowish that was way too sweet. Glad I only ate one. Within the hour, I was rushing for the "facilities".  Hmmm. Guess we won't be going back.

l1FbKaHtbqIRv0wdCUmb7A.text: Got the buttermilk short stack. Wayyyy overrated!  Dry and not at all that satisfying. Service was really good though. Not many vegetarian options other than the pancakes.  I will not be back due to very average food.

CqzzBLDNjes9qX5fYX632g.text: Everything is always so amazing here and the staff is friendly. Have yet to order anything questionable

q-auNWbTgS74x6Y3919gEA.text: Went here looking for a different look on a breakfast a while back and found it to be pretty overpriced for a pancake place. Service was so so.  And the place kinda had a funny smell like maybe the complex or strip mall there was having issues . Omlete house is always a good choice is you are bummed on your experience here .

yVFqRrNgytQb8sxigJlPKw.text: I have been taking my family about 2-3 times a month since it opened. We loved having breakfast here at first. As time went on we had more and more issues. First of all most of the staff is not very attentive. Don't expect for them to come check on you. You have to make several attempts to wave them down.  The last time I was there I had an empty coffee cup my whole meal then 2 people asked if I wanted a refill just as I was going to ask for the tab. The next thing is the cleanliness. Tables sticky, food under our seat, and something splattered on the wall next to us as we ate that you could see from across the restaurant.  The last thing that is getting worse is organization.  The only way to pay is at the front (common at many breakfast places).   The last few times they seem to wait till the whole waiting area fills with people before they send someone over to work the register. The last time I was there I waited so long I watched my table get cleaned, sat, and the food was coming out for them as I was paying. Part of the reason was a group of about 10 women were instructed to be rung up before me by an employee even though I was in line. they then asked for their check to be split into individual checks. When I finally got to the counter to pay I asked if he was aware that I had been waiting to pay he said "I know you waited a long time and shrugged. paid and then asked to speak to a manager. To my surprise the manager was the man that instructed the group to cut me. The food is good, but it's not worth it because of the cleanliness and the staff. Looking forward to hash house a go go opening across the street.

C0joCmlFUfWXVijiUvkhZA.text: My wife and I decided to try this place out one sunday morning a little while back for breakfast. Fully expecting to have a wait ahead of us we decided anyway to give it a shot based on what we had heard from friends. As we arrived we saw the large crowd that was waiting to be seated yet saw an empty patio and thought "well hell its 75 degrees out, why don't we just sit outside". Once we were able to squeeze our way up to the hostess counter to place our name on the list and asked if outside seating were available we were told that they don't take requests. I was a little perplexed as to what that meant and was informed that they let people choose inside or outside seating once there name is called. The wait was 45 minutes which bothered me seeing an empty outside patio yet packed inside but my wife, being my calm, level headed better half told me to me just calm down and that every place we would go to would have a wait anyway so since we are here we should just tough it out. We proceeded to wait 45 minutes and not once did anyone go sit outside. Once our name was called, we asked the server if we could sit outside and we were told that the patio was closed....The dining room was pretty loud being such a small space with a lot of people and it didn't make sense as to why the patio was closed. They had more then enough staff it appeared, to equip the 4 tables outside but it was what it was. After all that we ended up sitting down and eating a decent breakfast, not terrible but nothing we couldn't have gotten elsewhere. I had the Loco Moco and my wife had the buttermilk pancakes. The pancakes I tried were good but nothing I would give 5 stars to. The service was lacking a bit in friendliness and overall I am not mad at the place for its weird seating policy or its standard food but mainly just disappointed for what transpired that morning.

pRVNLG70Q7kprj5zW6B-Zg.text: The pancakes here really are the best! I always come here when I have family or friends In town and it never disappoints. They offer a huge menu so there's something for everyone. They do get busy on the weekends but the staff are always hustling and getting the food out in a timely manner. If you're looking for a unique breakfast spot with amazing food, this is the place to go!

1bV3p9QvoVTjXJxC-wlmZQ.text: I had the Adobo Fried Rice and my wife Country Eggs Benedict.  Both cooked perfectly, brought out quickly and tasted very fresh.  Waitress checked on us often enough to be sure we were being taken care of but not so often as to be annoying.  They have a very creative menu and you could go there four or five times and order an item not served in another restaurant.  You could also go there and get the Ham and Eggs.  Small restaurant with a very personable staff at the front desk and throughout the restaurant.  I plan to go there next time and have the Portuguese Sausage and Eggs or the Whole Wheat French Toast rolled in cereal flakes.

Qj674FVYilIxaAFlRjFbrg.text: Ok I did not want to eat here.  A friend insisted we eat here.  I laughed when I read the menu "Piglet" i thought what a joke this place is, the waiter asked what can I get you?  I said, "what the hell give the piglet".  It was amazing.  Been back a couple times.  It's always great.

C9Un7Wh2IQpUoSvtSo-Q4w.text: My wife liked it but I was certainly not impressed with the service. We went there twice and it never got better. Long wait and longer wait for your food which was mediocre. How hard is it to make eggs and pancakes? When My wife suggests going there again I always suggest that the service is better at Ihop, and so it the food.

fMVzgLnVM_5avT_8YfVzkw.text: Food value was really good for the taste. Friendly staff and good tables. Kind of small area to wait and had to wait outside for 20 mins before we were seating. Over all great place.

fcehuu3V3wm3HoprPpP7Kw.text: Loved this restaurant. The service was a little slow but I was not in a hurry. Only problem they were out of my favorite pancake. I have been to Babystacks at other locations and they have all been very good.

KuXJGHWSI_zrYys9US-xhQ.text: My favorite place to go when me and my boyfriend have a day off! The banana foster pancakes are my favorite! I've tried almost everything and everything's been delicious!

yIDlJ-PgDT-DliOLfAkHFg.text: Not much of a fan...  The food is okay.  Not much to rave about...  I've been here twice and every time I've been here,  the wait for the food after you order is sooooooo long.    1 thing I don't recommend on getting is their  blueberry pancakes.  It's dry and they give you nasty cardboard like blueberries on the side.    1 thing I do recommend are their seasoned potatoes...  They actually cook them well. They are crunchy and tasty.    Not my most favorite place to go,  but not the most hated either.

0esdZc9Vi-k7HWBkv6M7Ug.text: We were in town visiting friends and thought we would check them out. The pancakes were amazing!! I had the white macadamian nuts with eggs and hash browns. The hash browns were sooo good. The wait staff were nice and attentive. 5 stars all the way!!

0jrkOJLuNXc1J5TWeIO_ZQ.text: Loved the eggs benedict.  I felt their red velvet was more on the dry side though.  However I still would go back to try other items on the menu.

Er33zaz5xax2wYlFSWowqg.text: I love this place awesome people here customer service excellent five stars servers excellent firestar's everybody's friendly very helpful here explain stuff to you let you know there's restrooms here enjoying breakfast awesome place I recommended

Hk9hx1uGcISBLWARmsOfew.text: Best. Pancakes. Ever. They were super busy but  we were seated immediately, service was great and food came out fast. The banana foster pancakes are like if an orgasm was a food. They use real eggs instead of the egg powder places like IHOP and Denny's use. They need a bigger location so I don't have to look at so many other peoples faces while I eat.

Eb_mAFh2mSQe9x9EoEI3UA.text: Love coming here when I'm in Vegas.  The food is so flavorful and the pancakes are great. I love all of the different types of pancakes they have up for offer.  Be hungry when you come....they serve generous portions!!  Reccomended: Nutella pancakes with strawberries  Portuguese Sausage Plate

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Nutella Pancakes with Strawberries
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Spam Combo &amp; Portuguese Sausage Plate

2WJeKMGXZZk4icE3WdY-LQ.text: Small and comfortable atmosphere. Staff was really nice and helpful. We had a hard time deciding and he made some great suggestions. We went with about 6 people and ordered a couple different things and shared, which I think was defiantly the best option because we got to sample a wide variety.

YcmmsUm6zdwAesZCj8nSzA.text: Service is fine. Basic breakfast food is ok but if you're going to make the trip you have to get Babystacks!

n7jgwlLEIXrOZsZhKvIGEw.text: Amazing delicious breakfast. They have a verity of dishes but all taste home made.  Their prices are great too

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States

3oIGPYcYJo49ZykFVoZ_kQ.text: The best pancakes in Vegas the rest ok . Service was good. The food doesn't have any taste & the coffe taste like tea Lol. so basically the best thing was the banana fosters pancakes!

T1dITDoEc5E8GJuoLxI37A.text: I love pancakes!! I consider that to be my soul food. My goal in life is to search for extraordinary pancakes where ever I go. As we were planning our trip to vegas, I had to search for pancakes places and found this gem. Upon entering the place, it looks small yet cozy. We were seated right away and gave our orders. I ordered the banana pancakes and my friend ordered the omelette with potatoes. I was in heaven as I was eating the pancakes. You have the option of a full order or short order. I can only handle the short order which comes in 3 pieces of pancakes. The banana pancakes was very flavorful. I was able to finish my food. I will definitely be back. Can't wait to try their other pancakes. Too bad they close at 3pm. I would have gone here for dinner. Anyway I will be back for sure

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Heaven on earth! My banana pancakes
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Banana Crepe
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States

Pgrpz0vJkCzanMlbf2gxIg.text: BEST BREAKFAST/LUNCH. very island style. Big portions,  amazing food, and the greatest staff! They may be busy and it may take a few to get a table but it's worth the wait, FOR SURE. I always get the German Chocolate pancakes with my meal and they make my day everytime.

zNTvhnPlCnnePl7tnADtxw.text: I have been to this location 3 times now and each time has been absolutely amazing.  I have always had the best customer service and the food has always been super delicious.   I usually get Portuguese rice with eggs and a side of macadamia chocolate chip pancakes(my favorite).  I have tried the orange-cicle pancakes and they are also really good.  It can get really busy here, but the wait has never been longer than 10 min for me.  Definitely worth giving it a shot if you have never been here.  Keep in mind that they close at 3pm, so there is no dinner time.

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Portuguese rice, eggs, and macadamia chocolate chip pancakes.

mModCTzheP2OqL2BPPQK1A.text: Best breakfast place in town. Their original ideas for their "Babystacks" are always SO good! Service is great and quick. If you are going on a weekend morning, be prepared to wait. They are so good that there is typically a good sized line-- but it's worth it!!

N6oyrglDjqj6ScrZHD_3fg.text: This was okay. Didn't want to cook so here we are. They have many choices of pancakes - the menu is vast. I'm not a pancake person but they had other stuff to choose from. My son orders the red velvet stacks and I had the Nutella crepes with strawberries.  My son took a bite and I could tell he was just ok with it. It was quite dense as I had a bite too. Tasty but too thick on my opinion. He said it felt like he was eating a thick cake.  When mine came, I already knew I couldn't finish it. I like my crepes light and thinner. This was thick too and I only managed to eat one and took home the rest. Maybe we are not pancake ppl but should it be so thick. I do like the decor and how the restaurant is Set up. To me that's the first thing I notice when I come in and the odor, which was fine. The food could be awesome but it will turn me away if it's not clean or inviting. It was busy which is also a good sign and no wait .

kwiGffPeoqYKDSAhToDZow.text: My neighbor & good friend told me about Babystacks.  I'm in my first year in Vegas and a foodie. Walking in before 11am there was a entry of waiting patrons & we were seated in less than 10 minutes.  Lot of options on the menu!  My friend got her favorite - Portuguese sausage, steamed rice, over easy eggs & buttermilk pancakes.  Following her recommendation I also got the Portuguese sausage, fried potatoes, scrambled eggs& buttermilk pancakes.  Generous portions-took the pancakes home for later nibbling.  It was fun to see the different dishes coming from the kitchen.  Cozy space and conversation abuzz!  We'll be back!

n2x4DTDRYF7zylzIPX9eOQ.text: Breakfast for 4 on memorial weekend. Super friendly service and can definitely feel the island vibes.   This location is small so better get here early to avoid the wait times.   Kids ordered chocolate pancakes and bacon pancakes. Wife ordered the Portuguese sausage, eggs and rice and I had the loco moco which is rice, a beef patty and eggs cooked the way you like. Decent sized portions and found myself struggling to finish the pancakes that can with my meal also. Place is know for their red velvet pancakes and other island dishes.

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Menu side 2
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Menu side 1
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Loco Moco

mrUQAKozv3MpB82nctO-_Q.text: Came here to celebrate a gf's birthday. They arrive at 11:30 but couldn't be seated until I got there. They won't seat you without your entire party. We were seated right away when I arrived, at a table next to the kitchen. We were told our server would be with us shortly but it did take him quite a while to come by. We put in our order around 11:50 and our food came out at 12:20-12:25. We paid attention to the time because we had to be back at school by 1 PM. We did not anticipate food taking that long to come out.   I ordered the cowboy omelette with a hazelnut short stack upgrade for $1.25 more. Its definitely worth it. Since we were all in a hurry to eat, I gobbled my hazelnut pancakes quickly. They weren't hot when they got to the table, but I didn't care. The flavor was spot on. Whipped cream with nutella drizzle and pieces of hazelnut made it a 5/5. The cowboy omelette comes with ham, peppers, mushrooms and cheese with a side of potatoes and according to their menu fresh red salsa. In my mind I thought it would be something like pico de gallo but it was blended (sort of like baby food) and was a weird orangeish color. The cowboy omelette was good, but was missing some veggies. Next time I'll have to add spinach and tomatoes or something.   One of my gfs ordered the chili skillet, which was potatoes topped with chili and cheese and 2 eggs. She ordered white toast with her entree and it came out burnt. You could not tell if it was white or wheat! Our server did not check in on us after our food was dropped off and he was super busy so she did not ask for new toast.   I really do love their pancakes but haven't been blown away by anything else on the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Nutella pancakes and cowboy omelette

JQPyfmMqyaMZejd1ueD4Gg.text: What a great place to eat. Spam and Eggs! That's the best meal from my childhood that I still eat today. Me and my 10 yr old son devoured our plates. Perfect fry on the spam with just a slight crunch and the eggs were scrambled just right. My daughters white chocolate chip macadamia pancakes were heavenly as she said. This is highly recommended if your in the area. Must go again

sYk8aJ2a5pfbd_BlK_g9vw.text: This is the worst breakfast place I've been to.....  I really wonder why there are so many 5 stars reviews   My friends and I went there at 7:30 in the morning, was hoping to get some decent breakfast, however we end up leaving mad....  The food we ordered is pretty standard, a omelette with pancakes, sausage and egg breakfast with pancakes, and a Mexican style breakfast with pancakes.  First off, their pancakes are so dry, unbelievably taste like the instant mix you can buy in markets.  My sausage and egg breakfast and omelette plate comes with 1-2 slices of OLD oranges.... what the hell was that supposed to be ???!!! I lost my appetite just looking at that. The orange slice is broken, thin and looks Destroyed!  Their seasoned potatoes are sooooo dry, make me wonder if they precooked all of them and microwaved before serving.  Their hash browns are half cooked.... only the TOP side is grilled and crunchy, the bottom half is COLD, cold hash browns ?! Really ?!  My friend had Mexican breakfast and asked for more sauce (they gave us a small tasting cup portion), they brought more without saying anything. later on we found an extra charge on our bill!!!! Is that how you do business ?  well, in that case, why don't you charge me when you refill my water, or when I ask for extra napkins too?  If it's at extra charge, you need to notify your customer beforehand! Plus, portion was so small it's super overcharged.   All in all, they don't care for their customers, just money.... and their food are aweful with I nstant-food taste and texture, especially pancakes are horrible!!!   Go at your own risk!  I wish I went to Denny's instead. Worst way I've spend my $40.

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Why you serve me old orange slice ? Is that a joke?
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Hello, old stale orange slice, what&#39;s wrong with the cook?!?!?!!!
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Stale orange slices again, next to the re-heated potatoes Nice job at ruining my appetite!

bsWSElbFSQXunP-A-7jDxw.text: My wife and I have driven by this place a few times and finally got a chance to go this morning.   You go here for pancakes. That's their signature. I wasn't feeling sweet today, but if you go here and don't get pancakes you're missing out. So naturally I got the sweetest pancakes I could find. The cinnamon pancake were delicious. The crispy pecans on top were a solid touch. The eggs, bacon, and potatoes were all standard. The hasbrowns we're really bland.  The place is pretty small, but they turn out food quick. I'm not sure why the wait is quoted as so long, because the food came out really really fast. The service from the hostess was awful. She was young and she may have been new, but it wasn't good. She stared at us instead of greeting us, no smile. I finally broke the awkwardness and asked, "table for two?" She looked around, back at us, around again, and said, "I don't know.... would you be ok with sitting out side?" We said sure and she responded, "Once you go outside you can't come back in." Which I get what she was saying, but there is 100% a better way to phrase that in a less off-putting way. It took our waitress almost 10 minutes to check on us outside and take our drink orders. Pretty sure she forgot about us at first. The coffee cups are tiny. Maybe 6 Oz coffee cups which she couldn't refill fast enough.   The pancakes were good, but the service was just ok. There are so many great breakfast places within 5 miles of Babystacks that those small differences keep it from standing out. I wouldn't mind going back, but if someone asked me where to get breakfast I don't know if this place would come to mind. Unless, they specifically request creative pancakes.

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Bacon and Eggs*
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Cinnabun pancakes
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Bacon and Eggs*

CwHnkY3-aPIWpTXCPqWfmA.text: Very good  ! I went to summerlin delicious, Henderson also delicious.......what else can I say special dream pancakes very tasty

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Traditional Benedict,  hollidase delicious

h5QZxy-sg5575mY5x5PMlw.text: My friend and I meet up here almost every other week. It's better than "fine" but never rises to "great".  A-OK describes it well - hence the 3-star rating.  Long waits at peak times. Prices are high for what they serve. Service is hit-or-miss. I *SERIOUSLY* dislike having to wait in line to pay my bill at the cashier - after having already waited in a long line to get in.  The pancake portions are VERY LARGE and tend to be very very sweet. Lots of heavy syrups and whipped topping. I'm a big guy, and have never gotten through an entire serving, mainly because they're just too much of a sugar-bomb.  As an alternative, I've taken to ordering the Sweet Cream Crepe with fresh bananas and strawberries - with the "cream" on the side. It's pricey for what it is (a thin pancake with a bit of cut fruit) but I like it better than walking out feeling over-stuffed and sugared out.  The Hawaiian food looks great! I'm not a big meat-eater, so I wish they'd offer a vegetarian-friendly take on the Loco Moco. I know it's not traditional, but it would probably sell.

uwKAnlEZQRrtH-EM-hASPw.text: The best loco moco outside of from Hawaii! Everything on their menu sounds delicious! I can't wait to go back to try each item! The only thing that made me sad was the fact that their spam was so salty. Hopefully it was a one time thing but other than that this place was great and our waitress was soooo friendly!

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States

DTunbCsxQl5AZoKffvTuYg.text: Lolo's adobo fried rice, Loco Moco, Portuguese sausage, Spam, Corn beef, and lots of pancakes. Low key only a few tourist know this place.   service is great, place is big, parking structure is huge, and cost of meal is cheap!   Every time we visit vegas, we always stop by and eat here.

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States

z5392iGIJldRcMBaxsu-aQ.text: Great food and a very welcoming staff. The banana foster pancakes are superb. The vegetable omelette was great. It was a very great experience

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Banana Foster pancakes, vegetable omelette

T63YzznOFdT0_qDap7DZSw.text: FYI: I usually just come here specifically for the chocolate chip pancakes. The pancakes are kind of dry (kind of, not anything big, but it's worth to point out) But they're nice & fluffy!!! And the portions are big!   I've also had the adobo fried rice omelette. The adobo flavor isn't very strong in it, but I still like it very much. I haven't found anywhere else that makes a fried rice omelette that I liked more in Vegas yet.  Out of all three times I've dined in here, service was okayyy?? But I might be biased since pretty critical on customer service, soooo... yeah.   It usually takes a while to get your food, but they're quick with refilling my coffee & water! Just have a nice chat with whomever you're dining with and the time will fly by.  Overall: I still like this place a lot & will definitely continue coming here. (I just did takeout the past two times though!)

-e09DeTTNitHj0SQqVSo9Q.text: Solid breakfast food to be had in the Vegas area.  We were staying near the strip and was looking for local breakfast options.  Read the great reviews on yelp and make the little trek to Henderson to enjoy a Hawaiian style breakfast.  Portions are pretty big at this place, so definitely bring your appetites. I had the portuguese sausage with scrambled eggs and pancakes, and paid the extra to upgrade to garlic fried rice.  Hubby had the breakfast burrito with a side of pancakes. My 6 year old had a kids breakfast that included eggs, bacon, hash browns, and pancakes.    My portuguese sausage and eggs were good, but nothing too outstanding about it.  I love garlic rice and babystacks' version was good, but maybe just a slight too garlicky for my liking.  Pancakes were also yummy.  What bugged us was how the special pancakes were prepared.  Instead of ingredients being incorporated into the batter, they were just topped on top of the regular buttermilk pancakes.  My son had the chocolate chip pancakes, which were pretty much buttermilk pancakes with a handful of chocolate chips thrown on top.  My husband had the white choc macadamia nut pancakes.  Again, buttermilk pancakes with the macadamia nuts and white choc chips thrown on top.    While we did like our breakfast and everything did taste good, I'm not sure I would make the trek out here again if I was staying on the strip.

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. White choc chip macadamia nut pancakes
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Portuguese Sausage and Eggs* with garlic rice
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Breakfast burrito with sausage

f0BNuTYtVnixEV1UPuRm1w.text: Such a cute cafe with a huge variety of yummy food to choose from. The servers were all very friendly and provided prompt, pleasant service

jLszK0VxAR7_Uyo0os5k_A.text: I've been to the Babystacks Cafe on the other side of town & it's always been consistently great. This location on the other hand not so much.   It was our first time visiting this location. We each had skillets which were delicious. We enjoyed those while we waited for our pancakes to come out. About halfway through the skillets, our short stacks (that came with the skillets) arrived. I had the PB & chocolate chips. I split my pancakes on two separate plates & discovered my pancake on the bottom was not fully in tact & were also cold. For a place that specializes in pancakes, I don't find this acceptable.   Service was mediocre & had to call a server over whenever we needed something. Never once were we asked if everything was okay or if we needed anything else. Needless to say, we will not be returning.

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. PB &amp; chocolate chip pancakes

T6ISF71fUrAmEDlP2--uaA.text: Stopped in on our way out of Las Vegas. Small place that packs in the customers. 5 minute wait for a table, but was asked if we sit at the main counter. No problem- but again....packed in. Food was great, service was good too. Price was basically the same as every other breakfast joint.  Besides being small and cramped, I can't really come up with any other complaints. Give it a try, pretty large menu too!

Qq39SWyHCK5WxA9dJv6o3Q.text: Before we left Vegas we stopped at Babystacks Cafe for brunch. They have this cool breakfast slash Hawaiian thing going on that is TOTALLY working if the long wait is any indication!! I will vouch that it was worth the wait for us!! I got the Loco Moco, which was garlic rice topped with a hamburger steak, eggs (I chose scrambled) and gravy. You get to choose between pancakes, macaroni or upgrading to a fancy pancake so I upgraded to the Bananas Foster Babystacks and it was incredible!  My husband had the Corned Beef Hash, and our kids had Chocolate Chip Babystacks and Banana Cream Babystacks.  We will DEFINITELY go again next time we're in town!

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Chocolate Chip Babystacks
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Banana Cream Babystacks
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Loco Moco

ZRSzORHpFlT0J9qI39lzIg.text: Filipino breakfast!!! Loving this great adventure of eating food. I actually ordered "LoLo Rick'S Adobo Fried". Inside the omelet was white rice and chicken. The chicken season was so different. The season will get you so confuse for a minute trying to figure what kind of meat are you eating....That's how good it was!!!! I had to ask the waitress ones again to make sure what Kind of meat I was eating, lol...

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States

SbReG2oH57cg1ugTyT5Whw.text: My son recommended this breakfast place so we went there today 8/4/19 . We sign into the waiting list around 11:20 am and I knew it was going to be a wait because there was quite a bit of people waiting. The lady taking names said the waiting time was goin be about 30 mins or less.  We waited, and waited. 30 mins later I see most people that came after us desapearing because they were getting seated. I go inside and ask if I'm getting close to get a table as I look in the list while the girl is telling me that three more people are ahead of me, I notice that above and below my name a bunch of names are crossed out. I go back to waiting some more and as people are showing up and within 3 mins, they are getting seated at this point it has passed 45 mins since the initial signed in, so I go back in and tell them that there is 3 empty tables outside, I don't care about the heat, we are all hungry and frustrated for the long wait. So I think God was tasting my patients because everything went wrong from there. We asked for water with no ice and got extra ice in it. I asked for iced coffee and I got hot coffee and the last draw was the cashier. She processed the payment and fold up the receipt and dropped it right by register, so when I extended my and to be hand out my receipt she said, there it is! Pointing at it on the counter.  I worked in customer service for 15 years and today these people got and A+ on bad customer service. The food was amazing!!! And if these girls would get customer service trying it would be even better!!!! I'm still going to give them one more try before I can recommend them.

B_W-BWBbMtkSf-U8EtVfug.text: Discrimination. That's all I have to say. It's very sad to say that we still live in a society that looks down upon your social class or race. Trust me, not all Babystacks cafe restaurants are the same. I've had some amazing experiences in the past!! And their food is amazing! BUT, in this particular location, their staff is in serious need of customer service workshops or something. Upon arrival, no one greeted us. We were a group of 5. Waited 35 min.. people that arrived after us were seated first. There was even a group of 5 that arrived after us and they were taken right in.  After that, we asked if we were ever getting a table, the hostess responded with a " oh it'll be a 25 min wait.."  Please, go to the other locations, this one with their customer service alone makes me not want to go back.

B0zQv3KaBEysNtNOYKRkmA.text: Loco Moco? Delicious. Pancakes? Delicious! I've been wanting delicious Loco Mocos and I'm so glad I found this place. It was so tasty, especially adding the garlic fried rice. I got Cookies and Cream pancakes as the side and despite me not liking things that are too sweet, I loved these. I can't wait to try more.

-HprW8ifpSgeWjgP8Y3mLQ.text: Having to come here for many years at this location, I'm giving it a four stars because the wait seems to be ridiculously long and the waiting area should definitely find a way to expand. The review isn't based upon the food or service, just waiting and services in general. Maybe there could be a new waiting/reservation policy that can help people check-in beforehand or receive texts depending on waits past 45 minutes long! But overall, the menu is great and diverse. I've had many things on the menu from the pancakes, to omelettes, to the Filipino dishes-- all prepared to great tastings! I'll definitely come back for as long as it's open whenever I want to have an early catch-up breakfast or brunch with pals, as long as the wait isn't forever.

j8QMd4eMWQ6Hyrvp07aOgQ.text: Loved this restaurant so much! I have the biggest sweet tooth and their huge list of specialty pancakes surely did not disappoint. It was so hard to order, I wanted to try all of them! I will definitely be back to try out their other pancake creations. For those of you who prefer a savory breakfast, they also have a huge variety of omlettes & other egg based breakfasts if you're not a pancake fan! Even their plain buttermilk pancakes are incredible. My boyfriend and I walked in & got seated right away by friendly staff & servers! Awesome awesome place!

0T3KOAUTNk8mrYOCEs-cPA.text: Worst experience I've had, pancakes were burned and hard, ordered a skillet that was drowning in fat.. everyone else at my table got their food 3 tables later I was still waiting on mine. Over priced for bad food! Not recommended

xMwimLxebStv0oafnAoGjA.text: Food is always good.  Banana fosters is da bomb!  My only complaint is that the place is too small so it doesn't take many patrons to create a long waiting list.

_4Og19epkEo5fRs_UoQz7A.text: Sunday was my first visit here. My friends hyped this place up for being "authentic". I really wanted to like it but unfortunately my order was anything but authentic.   I spent many years in Hawaii and Guam and I've had really awesome loco moco and Portuguese sausage.   First off the hamburger patty in my loco moco was not fresh or homemade. The Patty looked too perfect and too proportionate to be fresh ground and hand made. I make my own hand made burgers patties and I know exactly what fresh ground homemade patties look and taste like. I would put my money on the fact that their hamburger patties are frozen and typical processed store bought patties. The kind that look like well proportioned hockey pucks.   Secondly, The Portuguese sausage was more like turkey sausage. It was not authentic by any means. It was dry, lacking in flavor and spice, and certainly was NOT authentic Hawaiian Portuguese sausage.  Lastly, the wait time at this place was ridiculous. Considering the quality of my food, it is not worth the long wait and I would not recommend this place to anyone expecting classic Hawaiian comfort food.   On a more positive note, their red velvet pancakes were pretty awesome. Stick to pastries and baked goods and leave the Hawaiian comfort food to the experts.

5UwBghGPl1XsAFciNilzVA.text: Great breakfast place!  Love to take my whole family!

Zj3P535ErhV8pM9jcbxSYw.text: Usually love this place. The wait can be lengthy, but a weekday morning is not too bad.  Unfortunately, today I was in and ignored by wait staff for 10 minutes. This as I watched others coming in, seated and immediately getting their drink orders.  Once I did get my coffee it was lukewarm at best and water with melting ice like it was poured 30 mins prior.   Finally got to put in an order along with the guest who sat in our lap (sarcasm) with multiple open tables throughout the restaurant.    Good was good as usual so not completely disappointed.

IxBCbIoU3HyMDNjk2B-Uyg.text: Very impressed by this place! Staff was incredibly friendly and made great recommendations. The food was great, highly recommend the kalua pork benedict! Definitely going to make this place one of my regulars!

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Bananas Foster pancakes and Ranchero Omelet... Very good!

i-3fByTcBM5AUNgnEHpmXQ.text: So perfect. We were starving and had Vegas brain but stopped by on way to Hoover Dam and glad we did! Eat a Baby Stack of something yummy, no matter what you order.

zwGIV3cWu7232psPs3Z8Bw.text: Loved the service we received from our kind waitress! The atmosphere was so friendly and the place was super clean! I ordered the piglet skillet and added veggies to it! We ordered our food and it came out less than 10minutes!!! I saw an order of pancakes come out and I was like omg!!! Next time I come here I am definitely having those!!! If you haven't had tried this place...you need to!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Piglet skillet with overt easy eggs and I added veggies!!! So freakin good!

PusH_XQ36qPo3_XGAkXyuQ.text: Excellent food. Our table got skillets and pancakes. Make sure to get the short stack which is 3 pancakes. The full is six. Red velvet are awesome!!

p_bswRM0ZF-QUamNSsf0Nw.text: We will not be coming back here for a long time.  The seating time can take up to 15 mins for 2 people, longer if they are having a super busy day, which is not bad at all. We opted for the counter yesterday, in order to get seated faster. Even though a lot of tables were open, there was a lot of people waiting.   There was NO reason to get seated quickly. The food took about 45 to an hour to come out. Everytime I asked the waiter what was going on and where the food was, all he could say was "It's coming". When we were about ready to leave, I asked again "Can you please tell me what is going on and it's coming?" The waiter said he would go check, rather than coming back out and answering me, he hid in the kitchen for 10 mins and then finally brought SOME of our food out. By the time we got all of our food, parts of the order were wrong, waiter said he would get what I asked for & never brought it out.  Now, I overheard an excuse one of the waiters gave another table and it was "Our regular chef isn't here." I do not feel that to be an appropriate excuse. There should always be back up&back up should be able to do their job too.  Let me say this, the food was still good and our meals were comped. BUT good food and horrible service with a side of comped meals.. is not enough to make a great experience like food should always be. I would rather pay and leave happy.

saytbjza7XLAE62Gpjbsjw.text: Tried serving me old bread . My bun was so hard I could barely cut it with my knife.                                                        Was not happy with it and got my money back.  I won't be back to try anything else.

oJLrURLWhRjeSPaAnwOHkg.text: Food is pretty decent. I ordered the chili moco with Kalua pork added. It would've been even better if they made their own hamburger patty. I could tell it was a premade frozen patty. The husband ordered the Adobo fried rice omelet. It was good and big. I would've like it to have a more vinegary flavor. But I would come back to try the Kalua pig Benedict.

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Chili Moco with Kalua Pig added

41GIDnxfbpppa8f5MDKGnQ.text: This place is great. I can't say that I've tried a lot of things on their menu, but I can say what I've had has been excellent.  They are very well known for their red velvet pancakes and for a good reason. I don't eat a lot of pancakes. Matter of fact I never eat pancakes, but when I come here I always eat their red velvet pancakes. Delicious. First off they are cooked perfectly. They are not too sweet, but if you like them sweeter you add more of the cream cheese syrup or the perfect whip cream.  The adobo fried rice is bomb. Wrapped in an egg it looks like an omelet until you cut it open and delicious fried rice with adobo is inside. It seems like most people have tried this place, but if you haven't then you must.

_qf57Qfgxm50ypdx6ZPfJg.text: Food is always fantastic and service is amazing! I have ventured out on some of the different pancakes that they do and they are just good. They try out new pancakes on their special board as well. I always make my own omlet, which is consistently perfect! I would recommend this place to anyone, but make sure to get their early as they can get pretty busy.

Q0ztxZoXd7d1f8uqJ1RqMg.text: They have a great menu I was sold on the place when I seen they had Portuguese sausage which not everyone has My daughter had there pancakes to sweet for me but she just love them You all need to go here for breakfast pretty damn tasty

i1dlyjwkoLmkIdONZnLnAA.text: Excellent family cafe. Pancakes & omelets are delicious. Lots of pancake varieties to choose from. Excellent & friendly service.

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Red velvet &amp; hazelnut pancakes

p5efYQdzlcZwR5P_Oeh-kg.text: Okay, this place is delicious. First off I had the Mexican skillet which had tons of flavor and good size portion. The best part was the red velvet pancakes. These pancakes are like crack. Eat breakfast here you will not be dissapointed, great staff and awesome menu

kuXRj4P2Q06F7QGTu54d4Q.text: This place was amazing!  Food was delicious, and our server Kayla was exceptional. Her smiling face and personality made our whole breakfast!!  Kudos to your establishment for hiring this gem of a person.  Give her a raise!!!

B33j1JE9rig6h6T0Z2iq_w.text: Nice people and good service however food is disgusting and prices are a little high for the portion sizes. I got the biscuits and gravy which tasted like chicken pot pie. The eggs had zero flavor and the potatoes were average. I don't see myself coming here at all in the near future it was sure a disappointment

ZCYA7wpCE7HH4SY1IqsZLw.text: Delicious Huevos Rancheros! The green salsa they used was amazing. Orange juice was fresh squeezed and tasty. Great Friendly service will be back for sure!

IKc3KR6HJFFI7rGkkHI19g.text: Breakfast was great!  We shared the fried rice omelette, which came with a couple of pancakes.  We upgraded the pancakes to the oreo one.  Everything tasted yummy.  Service was also really good.  I thought the fried rice omelette was a novel idea, and I am gonna try and make one at home.  The fried rice had portuguese sausage, mushrooms and bacon inside.    I wish the ingredients were cut a bit bigger.  They were diced really small.  That would be my only suggestion.  Overall, I think it was a great value and appreciated we could have both salty and sweet in one entree.

n2ukYwZBV84skgHrnHx5eg.text: Not that great it was not worth the price service was bad I got the pancakes not good at all weirs cause I heard good things will never come here again

gcOGy3sxM9TF86A6JZyGPA.text: Pumpkin pancakes we delicious! Spam,eggs, rice, and gravy weren't too shabby. Brown gravy used seemed like any normal brown gravy from a package. Service was really bad. Our server forgot about us. So we sat in a corner for 15 minutes before another server came over and took care of us.

zVXMRX2Ah4b5a5oP5oTp6g.text: Amazing place! Got the build your own omelette with seasoned potatoes. Good service. Somewhat of a long wait because it was sooooo busy. Will definitely return when in the Vegas area.

S7jsiN9UE5IyaGTVWaGRjQ.text: Another regular breakfast spot for us. Tasty tasty pancakes with oodles of options. Great for pancakes and simple breakfast items. Only concern is that at times service can be a little slow.

2Enrn7h2jg7U4HUejQw87g.text: First off....not sure how they got a 4 star rating on anything. Let's start with the awkward stuff...waiting area is small. Staff rarely makes personal contact at the front. Upon moving to being seated young lady in a rush to get back to the cash register to stand and look pretty cut me off....I give her the opportunity to go first because after all I am the customer. They sit us in the very back. Where the AC blows incessantly next to the hallway leading to the bathrooms. Waiter was nice. We felt out of place not being Filipino or Asian....seriously seemed like we were in a foreign country with both staff and customers....don't know why that was. Food less than acceptable. Actually my Piglet skillet was mostly cold. Wheat pancakes for my wife dry and tiny. Overall a horrible experience. Waiter was on the ball but not exceptional. Never visit again...yech

bKXw1nvCilXMbIiAP-GAcA.text: This place has amazing service and food. While it may take a while to get your food out to you when they're busy, the waiters and waitresses always chat with you to make the time go by faster. They genuinely care about you as the customer which is greatly lacking in many establishments today. I ordered and shared three stacks of pancakes with a friend. We tried the red velvet, cinnamon roll/Cinnabon, and white chocolate macadamia nut. Out of the three, my favorite was the cinnamon roll. On other occasions, I've had the loco moco and the portion sizes were generous. The eggs Benedict was delicious for something that normally doesn't suit my palette. Their hazelnut crepe was very yummy and it was nice that you didn't have to order it in a group of three like normal restaurants. The hot cocoa is to die for and certainly is the best I've ever had. I will be coming back to sample more of the menu soon.

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Nutella and strawberry pancakes
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Eggs Benedict w/mushrooms &amp; spinach
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Hot chocolate

xq0imsetu9CtW09oOH2Nfg.text: This place is tiny and there will be a long wait on weekend but it is always worth it. Both their sweet pancake dishes are their savory omelettes, etc. are delicious. This is my favorite breakfast place in the valley!

XAXir0R6ZUbyG4u0q9vFBw.text: First time at this location a few days ago. I give this place 1 star because the waiter was nice. The host/cashier ( young spiked hair kid ) TERRIBLE customer service! Walked in and no hello, hi, welcome.... Just stared at us chewing his gum like he hated being there lol. Got seated ordered adobo fried rice with red velvet pancakes. Pancakes were good till I found a white hair in my food! Yuk! Appetite ruined! Told the waiter about the hair and he said he'll comp one of the meals but when I got the check? It was still there but oh well. I didn't want to make a big fuss out of it since we'll never go back here. Went to pay and stood there in front of the TERRIBLE host/cashier and still no acknowledgement lol so I left the money on the counter and left. TERRIBLE!!!!

9H3fnFxmRq2tPEjz9aht5Q.text: This place is fantastic! I'd give 100 stars of I could. The food is amazing! The Red velvet pancakes are soooo yummy! The servers are so friendly! Everyone should try at least once.

oAlksoBhNWBx2IlGxgTMQg.text: I'm just a plain pancake guy. It was ok but the plain pancakes are nothing special. If you are going try something out of the ordinary.

1Zy3m_LfVaQTS3d0uwUu5w.text: Found this place with my wife about 5 months ago...we now go every weekend!! The service here is excellent! Yes there is often a wait but the reason for the wait only confirms my 5 star rating! The food is fantastic and very consistent. My wife enjoys the rocky road pancakes, while I always get the red velvet!!! Nom nom nom

JzrjOoZ_hWjgUxBHLtlc-w.text: Amazing every time.  Seriously, everything on the menu is outstanding, service is super friendly, I love Babystacks!!!

nsG7a3RMB6bnJAkjQv0yaA.text: Customer service was phenomenal. We got banana foster French toast which had a great sauce except for the whip cream which was gross. Got carrot cake pancakes, very dry. Also got Cinnabon pancakes, they were good.

KtyCvcT-zI3x-2sNvjo8TQ.text: Worse service. I walked out!!!  First of all parties before ours were being seated first but it wasn't until we waited 30 min for 1 of party  to get her food while we were waiting still waiting for the rest of the food to arrive.  I noticed people that were just being seated getting their meals when I finally went to front counter to ask what was going on.  I was told by the Hostess it just depends on "how the kitchen gets the tickets." Is that a concern of mine or management?  I guess what really made the situation worse was the lack of care for the situation. Not even an apology after waiting almost an hour without food. Guess the fact that this place has so many customers who cares about upsetting & losing 1 customer.  Since this is not my first bad experience at this restaurant, I certainly will not be back nor will I recommend it to anyone else unless you have hours to spend waiting to be seated, to get your drink order and to finally eat.

ETUNw4dKhD23ZXAPLwPtqQ.text: Baby stacks very simply put is inconsistent. But, when they are good, they are GOOD.   There isn't a lot of seating and the seating they do have is sorta squished together. They have a bar top which I enjoy eating at and watching tv. Well lit and always smells good.  The menu is a great size and very easy to understand. I have only been there for breakfast. I have gotten the piglet omelet and buttermilk pancakes the times I've been there. The first time I went they were fantastic. The omelet had lots of meat and was a good thick omelet. The pancakes were decent at best (but I don't care for pancakes usually). The second time I went I order the same thing and there wasn't hardly any meat in the omelet and it was a bit runny. I took 2 bites of the pancakes. One was off the side and was hard, I moved to the middle thinking it would be softer but I was wrong. I got my check and left thinking I'd never be back. About a month later my mom wanted to go because someone had recommended it to her so I figured I'd give it another chance. This time was just like my first experience. The omelet was great and the cakes....again....decent. My mom got blueberry pancakes which I tried and wasn't really a fan of, the blueberries were really sour and just ruined the cake. I've never had bad service just bad food. I never thought the prices were unreasonable either.   I'd suggest this place for breakfast, and if it's not good, give it one more chance.  Also, I liked that they had the local zip code magazine.

FfFct8bL76e2qrdnZqHd3Q.text: Food was amazing and our server was friendly and attentive. Kalua grilled cheese and chicken fried steak were great. We had bananas foster and red velvet babycakes. All I can say is wow!

_YxmHrik2o56xP3nc3bQsA.text: Will go back again. What a wonderful find thanks to Amazon Local.  Lemon ricotta pancakes were mire than delicious.  Love the menu, food, decor and the staff were great.

6WFGdVAP27W7lgFyJgY9Ug.text: This place totally sucks!!! Hosts are rude and very unproffesional,watch out for this place...

cw0Z6mjFuOAg93zcbpUgUA.text: Love this place for breakfast. Every creation of pancakes they have on the menu is delicious. This place is worth the wait.

WI4lqbDJavjWN5DEgxuVBw.text: Waitress was great but food was made with little care an sloppy. As if the cook was lazy and just wanted to get the orders out quickly since it was busy. Not sure what all the hype is about, you can make any item on the menu at home and probably better.

nWYuVX3BGrhwIOUbWNY-Lg.text: The food is always amazing. The red velvet pancakes  I have not been able to make or even find any that compare to Babystacks. A family favorite, even when we have out of town guests they want to go here! Very quaint and homey feeling with courteous staff.

-jvKtBf1HUIp9DTJthbYLg.text: The place has a homie feel to it. The people that work there are very friendly. There portion size is generous and tqstes great. Will definitely go back and recommend people.

kbrx5kPU5Jy8lsCw1-VL_A.text: After craving red velvet pancakes for a good week i finally came in and was really excited. While eating them, i was really surprised when i bit into GREEN PEPPERS. There were literally multiple green peppers cooked right in the middle of the pancakes and i had never been more confused in my life. I really wish I had taken a picture of it but I was really grossed out and called my server over right away. He took it away and brought out another one but I didn't really have an appetite for it anymore so I took it to go but it's probably just going to end up in the trash. I don't know if pieces just fell into the pancake batter or if it was a dirty pan but green peppers were the last thing I had expected to bite into. I was even more disappointed that they didn't apply any kind of discount to the bill. I'm a server as well and if something like this were to happen to one of my own customers I would definitely give a discount or at the very least, take the pancakes off the bill. Also the pancake syrup they gave my boyfriend was slimy and had a thick layer of film over it like it had been sitting out for a long time.

a4mUfRIEvyLeCvl6vd1QjA.text: My go to is the Adobo fried rice which comes out in a monster 6 egg omelette! Folded around the delicious fried rice and it comes with a side of pancakes, which I upgrade to the red velvet flavor which is the perfect little dessert at the end of eating that savory omelette. Another favorite of mine is the loco moco add you must upgrade to the garlic rice with this dish. Elevates the flavor to a whole new level!

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Chili moco
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Loco moco

4cJZ4qb3iZR5D3wxWSg2NQ.text: Heaven on a plate!!! Everything is just so good . Had the loco loco with garlic rice it's just a must . Also had the veg omelette and German chocolate pancakes on he side . Sooooooo good

iwr2E28E9vWDAoI3wuydCQ.text: Okay, the food here is good. Let me be clear about that. The pancakes are delicious and their bacon is really yummy. We went here after spending all weekend at a volleyball tournament and really, we wanted some great food. We came straight from the tournament and rushed so we could get there before they closed at 2:00. We get there and one other guy walks in right ahead of us. From where we can see there is one table that needs the be cleared. They tell us 15 minutes because this other dude got the last table, which I get, he was there first, but seriously, we were hungry! I was getting hangry and the teenager was surly she was as so hungry. We see an older couple who look close to being done and we're like, cool, it will be less than 15 minutes. So they finally finish and we  are about the pass out from low blood sugar. The guy pays and the table sits there dirty for a good minute.  Two minutes. Three minutes.  I'm staring at the hostess who is busy with the very important task of putting ketchup packets as nearly as possible into a bin. Finally, the table is clear and I can almost taste buttermilk pancakes but she's still arranging ketchup packets!!! I stared at her again and moved my head from her to the table and she finally got a hint and seated us. As we walked to the table, we realized how big the restaurant really was and there were no fewer than SIX EMPTY TABLES behind the cash register wall. My husband and I were dumbfounded. Why did we sit there for 15 minutes? If I wasn't about to pass out from being hangry I would have said something and gone somewhere else.

YcpBPZ_tFaC_tIbnr3KG8w.text: The staff and service deserves a 5 star rating. I loved how they worked as a team, they were friendly and provided quick service. The food in my opinion was mediocre at best. It was okay but I had better. We ordered the chili loco moco, short ribs with eggs and the banana cream pancakes. The pancakes was the best of the 3 but the other 2 items disappointed. It lacked flavor.

sAGgnT_7431bzkj8uh3dng.text: As always the service is great and the food is freshly prepared,  quick service and friendly service and the place is definitely clean and pleasant atmosphere, and you can get seating right away.  Trying different dishes each time I go, and have not been disappointed yet. Always a great place to eat breakfast   Neat-less to say I shall return.

dy9TREqDXOloCyxeA41mKg.text: I always go to the Babystacks off Durango.  Man, this location is not good.  Been here two times now and the pancakes are not moist or melt in your mouth delicious like the other Babystacks.  Both times my pancakes came out dry and over cooked.  Not coming back here. There's definitely no consistency in the food.  I no longer crave their pancakes because of this.

yllzOvOao3EG_F2nQCkFMw.text: Baby stacks  We saw this place and thought we'd give them a try being that we're from Hawaii. They were labeled as Hawaiian breakfast and brunch. They have multiple locations but we went to the one on 550 N Stephanie St, Henderson. There hours are from 7-2p and parking is easy to find right in front.   We went around 10a and we waited for about 15 minutes. It was pretty busy. The staff is nice and once we ordered, the food came out quick. One thing, I wouldn't really say they're Hawaiian but they do have spam and portuguese sausage.   I ordered the Huevos Rancheros ($9.95) with potatoes (crunchy/green sauce). This was Ono! I really liked it a lot. The meat, beans, sauce and the crunchy tortilla complimented each other.   One thing you have to try are there short stacks. I mean there name is baby stacks lol. We had to try one and we went with the orange creamsicle short stack. This was so good. I'm not a big sweets person but this one hit the spot.   Would I come back? That's a yes! Go check them out if you're in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. I ordered the Huevos Rancheros ($9.95) with potatoes (crunchy/green sauce). This was Ono!

0e65CPyEI5-KUzJBJoUVFw.text: If you are planning to come here to eat, don't think you will be seated right away. This place always has a wait, but the food is worth the wait.  My mom loves this place. Anytime I ask her where she wants to go to eat breakfast, she always says, "You wanna go to Babystacks?" and off we go.   I'm not too much of a breakfast person, so I only order either grilled cheese, or pancakes haha! Whichever I order, I love it. They have red velvet pancakes, which are extremely delicious and sweet. A little too sweet for me, but still good.  My mom orders the senior breakfast, which is eggs made the way she likes them, hash browns, turkey bacon or sausage, toast or pancakes.  She loves her breakfast!   Staff here are very kind as well. From the minute you walk, you are greeted. To be seated, as I mentioned could take a little while, but definitely worth the wait!

mOuzsqrlghK1ZaouyILGCw.text: It's like I died and went to pancake breakfast heaven.  I wish there was such as place.  However, this place will do.  This place made me wish I could eat more and I can already eat a lot.  Luckily this was easy access from the hotel I was staying at and I could justify the eleventy-billion calories I was about to consume a couple days after the World's Toughest Mudder.  I wanted pancakes and French Toast.  Tuesday at about 7:15 in the morning the small little restaurant was pretty empty and I was greeted immediately by a very kind server.  She gave me a few minutes to decide on what I wanted which I had already planned out but with so many choices, I was still hesitant.  I opted for the Rocky Road Pancakes (Half-Stack) and the Cookie Butter French Toast...because who doesn't love Cookie Butter?  Overall the Rocky Road pancakes were really good, albeit they tasted a bit on the dry side, kind of like a brownie that had lost a little of its moisture.  Looking back, I feel like maybe I should have opted for the German Chocolate Cake Pancakes instead.  The Cookie Butter French Toast was fantastic though, and I had no problem wolfing that down.  The coffee was pretty bad though.  Not sure how that happened.  Without sweetener it tasted like dishwater.  Not sure how I know that either.  However, I overlooked that due to the pancakes, French Toast and friendliness of my server.  Babystacks is definitely on the top of my list for breakfast in the area and that's saying something considering my hotel offered free breakfast.  If I need to stay in the area again, I'll definitely be back, I'll just skip the coffee next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Half Order of Rocky Road Pancakes &amp; an order of the Cookie Butter French Toast.  Very tasty.

HJRl_-u04n1oeawh5pR3vA.text: Start off by we were recommended to try the place. Service was slow, Eggs Benedict had 0 flavor, I had the cowboy and never got my side pancakes. My daughter got the club sandwich and the tomatoes were about as unripe as they come. Wont be coming back.

xcltoDPW5kKckKt9M6ayRw.text: This has easily became my new favorite breakfast place. Always a nice and welcoming vibe from the workers even when busy. They literally have something for everyone on their menu including the various flavors of pancakes. I usually just stick with my basic breakfast(eggs,sausage, whatever pancake I'm in the mood for).. Although I've recently discovered the Portuguese fried rice omelet and it has changed the game for me! It's been a while since I've gone to a restaurant and fell in love with something on the menu, 10/10 recommend you try it out. Makes me sad they're only open until 2-3pm because I crave it everyday now!!

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. The omelet comes with Bacon, Portuguese Sausage, &amp; Mushrooms all mixed together with the fried rice.
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Portuguese fried rice omelet paired with Banana Foster pancakes

ob4aQp195WqkyS0Bh1EV6Q.text: 6/18/18  My family and I arrived here at 12:30 pm on a Monday.  We have been here many times and knew this place might be busy. Our party of 10 checked in and we were willing to wait to be seated. The young lady in the front informed me that there was a whole section around the corner that was ready, but that it was closed and we would have to wait 20 minutes to be seated. 20 minutes?!  Really?!  I ask her why, but she wasn't sure so I asked for the manager. A few minutes later a young man with big red hair came over. I've been here enough to know that he wasn't the main manager, but he might have been the person in charge since I know he's worked here for awhile.  I asked him why we have to wait 20 minutes when there was open seating enough for us all?  His answer was because there was only three servers, so that section was closed. I was confused at that answer because I've seen this place packed out before with only three to four servers and today, it wasn't even as busy.  Although the staff was not rude, my family and I weren't going to wait for seating when seating was available. This is VEGAS!  There are way to many places to eat here. If you want to hang on to your customer base these are the kind of thing you need to avoid.  We ended going to Hash House A Go Go were there was no waiting.

KRpFaTRHTikVc8eOGh2A0Q.text: Worth the wait. Chili cheese on rice with spinach and topped off with two over medium eggs, so ONO!  Included two bananas foster pancakes. You better be hungry when you come here. Delicious!!!!

5Zyt4Zh5M78sc-zGXKAn4Q.text: Get that chili moco its freakin lit best meal i feel like i ever had. Cant wait to come back and try the biscuits and gravy!

en7uy3WoDRKRlbUKSrRFaw.text: This is a great breakfast place in Vegas! Small, more intimate setting than the usual spots but still hits the spot. We usually have a decent experience eating here.   It sucks not being able to give this place 5 stars because their pancakes are really 5 stars. Red Velvet, Cookies & Cream, s'mores, all of the ones we've tried are amazing. But their cakes are always better than their actual breakfast main entrees.   I really shouldn't be eating all this stuff anyways but HEY, who cares lol.   I'm docking them 2 stars for 2 reasons.   1) 11/19/16-The corn beef hash had no flavor. And neither did the adobo fried rice when my cousin ordered it 2 weeks ago.   2) 11/19/16-They only have one register. The cashier decided to take a to-go order and instead of writing it down then putting it in, she took up the register which created a line to pay while the person ordering on the phone took forever. Pretty inconvenient.  There are a lot of other spots in Vegas with great cakes. Doesn't have to be this one.

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Red Velvet Pancakes....YES!

Sg2PMtsGGAru6-zXq1LFmA.text: Pretty good the only negative is that the place only holds 80 people so if you go on a Saturday or Sunday your going to wait for a table but once I sat down my food came quick

Ums18JkrdaskOD4dLbHTPg.text: Wait wasn't too bad but it was a Wednesday. The omelet was ok. If you get a specialty pancake share because it's a lot & very rich. They charge for everything. A little table spoon of salsa .75

Dp-iGiSMGt6jyuwzwXqelw.text: I'm surprised I haven't tried this place sooner, the food here is great! Much like other breakfast places, I decided to get a pancake combo. The red velvet ones were amazing, and in a great portion size too.   I do suggest calling in advance to check how long the waitlist is, especially on weekends. The cafe is a little on the small side and that coupled with the fact of how popular this place can make getting in a bit tricky.   Takeaways: Great portion sizes, friendly waiters and waitresses, small dining area, good prices.

LcU9EhJxSBfNtDfs8R3CLg.text: Two stars because the Resturant is clean and I enjoy watching their T.V. I have been a regular here for three years, unfortunately customer service has always been terrible i continuously give them a chance hoping for the best but there hasn't been improvement. Honestly my quality cooking is better than Babystacks Cafe.   One thing I will never order again from here is their red velvet pancakes. Terrible it's not real velvet. It's just pancakes with red dye coloring chocolate chips on top with whip cream served with icing.   I wouldn't recommend coming here the portions are small and over priced.

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Don&#39;t recommend, their red velvet isn&#39;t real velvet it&#39;s just red dye coloring.

1T3dFzdlwjc4sFAAe0d4JQ.text: We were looking for breakfast places away from the strip and chose babystacks based on yelp reviews.  The wait times were real, the hype was not. Both the summerlin and henderson location get really busy on the weekends. The service was slow, but given the crowd, we expected that. The servers were nice and friendly though.   The food was alright. I came here mostly for pancakes, as they have a huge variety of pancake flavors. I got the orange creamsicle, it was alright. While the concept of orange flavored pancake itself is unique, the pancake was just ordinary. We also got an omlette which was served with hash browns, sour cream and some pico. Again, it was good but didn't seem anything special.   Overall, the service is bit laidback, the food and vibe is like that of a chain restaurant and the waiting times can be annoying.

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Orange Creamsicle
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Two-Egg Breakfast*

e14NK0bwHlVghpE5q41HEw.text: A new go-to spot for us on our breakfast rotation! If you haven't been here yet, you're definitely missing out, and probably the only person in and around the Stephanie/215 area who hasn't been. I say this because the crowd is WILD and the wait is wild, but let me tell you, it's TOTALLY worth it!  I've also decided another name for this place should be Dessert for Breakfast. Is it because I love personally love dessert for breakfast? Nope. It's honestly because a lot of the menu contains some really great sweet tooth craving options that will satisfy your taste buds!   We waited about 15-20 minutes for a table and we even went around 11 a.m. on a weekend. I've been earlier but if it counts for anything, I don't think it matters what time you arrive. This place is always a hot commodity and the lobby area is always full of people desperately awaiting their table (or even just a spot to sit in the lobby sometimes). This place desperately needs Wait List on Yelp! If any business owner is reading this, trust me! You for sure need it :)  Now on to the grub! As a personal crepe lover and lover of everything nutella, how could I not go for the nutella crepe?! I think I'm learning my eyes are larger than my stomach and that I can't eat too much of anything sweet. I opted for the single nutella crepe, but they do have them in threes if you want. The single was definitely enough for me. I got some potatoes on the side as well, which were seasoned to perfection. My husband got the cinnamon bun pancakes and a side of bacon and potatoes, too. It takes a lot to fill him up, but he said he definitely was full off of it. Again, I think the sweetness takes up a little more room in your belly if you're asking me. :)  Really love this place. Always get amazing service, too. Again, check out my pictures because if your mouth isn't watering from those nutella crepes, there might be something wrong with your eyes. We'll see you soon, Babystacks!

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. cinnamon bun pancakes
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. single nutella crepe with strawberries and bananas
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. side of potatoes and bacon

c_taEb-54WcG7khwqs-39w.text: Has something ever reminded you of something from your childhood, that you would have never remembered... if it were not for that something that triggered you to remember it?? I'll give you a minute to read that again.   "Lolo Rick's Adobo Fried Rice" did it for me! It reminded me exactly of something my late grandma's used to make, g-d rest her sole. I have never EVER tasted anything ever again like her dish until now. I was not expecting it and it took me by surprise! This dish as Babystacks is basically like an omelette burrito, with the omelette part being the wrap and the Fried Rice being the filling. Except the fried rice is not what your thinking. It's more of of the shredded chicken then the rice. One of a kind taste, DELICIOUS.   Also had the Red Velvet Pancakes. Loved them until I tried my daughter's buttermilk pancakes and loved them EVEN MORE!! Pancakes on point.   They offered kids coloring page and crayons. Total yes.   Final note on the high chair that either could be higher or the table lower. The high chair is not tall enough so my son's head was just barely over the table.   I recommend trying Babystacks. Great for the whole family. Food was delicious and you really get that local vibe.

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. I&#39;m officially up in da&#39; club.
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Kids breakfast, come with buttermilk pancakes that I ended eating and they were on point!!
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. High chair could be higher.

f-amrIghtOk2NOozciM8rQ.text: I am a Babystacks connoisseur.  B-stacks is literally the breakfast spot to go to.  Regardless of location.  I'm usually at the blue diamond one, but location doesn't stop quality.  I ordered literally everything off the menu.  Our server was amazing and she checked in and remembered every detail of what we asked for. She was very attentive. Especially to my coffee addiction.  Great food. Great service.  Try to get in before 10am.  That rush is NO joke

NGF18Yphx3GS72Ctpz3fCw.text: Wow, if we lived near here this would definitely be a go-to breakfast spot for us. We stopped here on the drive from Vegas to the Hoover Dam and did not regret it one bit!!! Where I come from, it is few and far between to find crepes but out west it seems to be a popular menu item so I had to eat ALL THE CREPES before going back home to a crepe-less land.  I got a breakfast skillet and of course a cream cheese crepe and everything was delicious!!! My husband really enjoyed his strawberry pancakes too. Would def recommend this place if you are visiting or local!!

mdT19KtKvl7nRk0POQ-ejQ.text: Nice spot for breakfast. Pretty much any type of pancake you want, they can make. Menu is divided into sections, pancakes, traditional breakfast and local (Hawaii) style breakfast. Spam and Portuguese sausage on the menu. My breakfast for today was the homemade corned beef hash with seasoned potatoes. Also included were traditional buttermilk pancakes (2) or you could upgrade for one of the specialty options.  Pancakes were fluffy and light. Corned beef hash and seasoned potatoes were good. Portion was a bit small but not a deal breaker.  Definitely would go back to try the savory bacon pancake with a side of Portuguese sausage.

s6WzCQ4SoB_tgFTsEXTgBQ.text: What a fun breakfast place that incorporates Hawaiian flavors. The menu looked so good that we definitely ordered too much food. I really liked my crepe, it was nice and thin. The pancakes with bacon was different. We thought the bacon would be in the pancake itself but they were actually presented on top of the bacon.   I thought the adobo fried rice would come with a sauce on top but it was just fried rice in the omelette. It was good, but tasted a little dry.

t6wSE6HiEtt_fuPn7JceWQ.text: No matter when you come, expect them to be bursting at the seems with local patrons. It's a small establishment with a Hawaiian flare and the service and food is always great! My favorite is the chocolate chip pancakes for which I upgrade at every meal from the standard buttermilk.   Since it's on the smaller side for table spacing, we have often had to wait upon checking in. They do have a small bar area with open seating and a small patio area. The waits have never been extensive however and it's always been worth it!

TpnFeCeLQYD6maCn4IANXg.text: Now... I regret the decision to have this meal but I'm also on a strict meal plan that disables me to eat these things. But I also need to treat myself once a month.   Which brings me to my CHEAT meal. I had Portuguese sausage with garlic rice AND bananas foster pancakes. I was in heaven and I smashed it.
