Nr9tzippzlKdq6-RKOO93Q.text: I Read the reviews on the adobo omelette and the banana foster and red velvet pancakes and they are all True!! Gotta try it. I was a stuffed piggy when I left. Will be coming every visit to Vegas from now on.

Q2zM1c68mM8jyTHwewJf4Q.text: So we ended up at Babystacks Cafe mainly because some family were in town and they decided that they had to try this place. It was definitely a good choice. Similar to Peg's Glorified Ham & Eggs and EggWorks this place specializes in breakfast and they do it really well. The place is pretty easy to find and we went around 9am on a Saturday. As expected there was a wait, but it wasn't too bad considering the food quality. The inside is just like a diner and the menu was pretty extensive. Here's what we ordered and what we thought: Red Velvet Pancakes - It was recommended by other yelpers and it was alright and what you expect. Red velvet flavor. A bit sweet but worth a try. Banana Foster - This was very tasty and sweet but not overpoweringly sweet. It has alot of bananas so if you like bananas then definitely get this. Baby Chick Omelette - This was okay, but I don't think I'd get it again. It didn't really pop in flavor. I'd get a different omelette next time. Chili Loco Moco - This thing is great if you love chili. It tasted a bit heavy but overall a good choice. Portuguese Sausage and Eggs also with Spam - It's what you expect. These were pretty standard issue so no additional flavors. Simple. I'll definitely be looking to come back here again as the menu had alot of items I wanted to try. In the hierarchy I would say Peg's and Babystacks are definitely my go-to places. Peg's if I don't really feel like driving too far. Eggworks if I'm looking for a large amount of food, but not quite as tasty. youtu.be/yOBSn-SMERw

KgC6ATGse-5d6P6k8GP2bg.text: This was our first time there. We found baby stacks as a recommendation. We tried their specialty pancakes which is the banana pancakes as well as the macadamia pancakes. We had a regular short stack and a moco Loco. All of our food items were fantastic!! Our total for 4 adults and 1 child, 5 entries and 4 pancake orders came out to about $75. We definitely will be going back. I can still remember how good my pancakes were.

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Lunch

z7GxZnznfSTzy_mR_2d8jQ.text: Compared to their other location that I've tried, this place was not what I expected it to be.  It was not the same.  The quality of the food wasn't what I experienced the first time.  The food was just okay here.    I ordered the Kalbi with Eggs and upgraded the rice to Garlic Rice for a dollar more, which I don't think is worth it.  For the price of the meal in general was not worth it.  If I ordered Kalbi from another location, I would have gotten more kalbi for my buck and cheaper.  The garlic rice was mushy.  I know it said that it contained onion which I don't mind at all because I put onions in my fried rice, but I think the pieces where too big.  They really could have done a better job to make the onion taste more edible, even cooking it a bit longer would have helped.  And the portion and having to add a dollar to it didn't match.    We also upgraded our pancakes to the banana cream pie and the cream looked like it was dried onto the pancake.  Although the flavor was good, we did have to ask for more cream on the side.  Wouldn't be a "cream pie" if it didn't have cream right?  And it was only a drizzle of cream that came on the pancakes.    I'll give this kudos for service.  The server was kind and attentive to us.    So with that being said, Happy Eatings!  Until next time!

DWE6zWYzrTcAl1lIBLadZQ.text: Our favorite is the loco moco and the banana fosters pancakes! Staff is friendly and even when the restaurant is full they somehow always seat us quickly.

d2EJaHXZmd485K2VjfAsBA.text: I've never reviewed a restaurant with 1 star but here it goes....  we looked for a breakfast cafe and searched on yelp.  With all the raving reviews, we came here and we are all SO DISAPPOINTED!   First if all, their name is babystacks, specialized in pancakes... !!!!! PANCAKE SUCKS !!!!!!!! Their pancakes are NOT fluffy, NOT tasty... they are so dry and doughy and it's almost like they served me a biscuit.... pancake tastes like store bought mixture, combined with bad cooking skills, here you go the NASTIEST PANCAKES I'VE EVER HAD....... syrups are thick without much taste and DRIES UP, thats just never heard of....  I ordered the breakfast burrito, it comes with a small cup of salsa (served in the small plastic cup, tasting cup size).  Burrito is nothing good about it, but i liked the salsa, upon asking for additional salsa i got another small cup of salsa.  When i get the check, they actually charge $0.75 for the additional salsa they gave me. Out waitress never said anything, and please don't tell me it's "normal practice" to charge customer salsa without telling them it would come in at additional cost!  THIS IS SUCH A JOKE.  My wife and friend have different complaints about the food they order too...   Will never come back again

6vUa3tO-JXQpLh6MihbNNg.text: Omg. What a nightmare when we arrived. We Checked in with our entire Party of 7. They inform us that they cannot split checks. So two of the ppl in the party ran off to get cash. When it was time for our table we were missing 2 people, so they didn't seat us because our entire party wasn't there.  We were furious, because we were all here originally and their policy is what sent people out for cash.  After we waited 30 minutes for a table, another group of 7 walked right in and was seated right away.  They gave them our table. It was mind blowing, they did this one more time before we requested to speak with the manger.   After speaking with Larissa the manger we had a table within a few minutes.  I have to say Larissa is in the right field. She handled our disgruntled behavior like a champ and diffused the issue amazingly and quickly.   Our situation is different because we were all there and because of their policy we went and got cash so we could eat together.  Guess we should have gotten seated first and then had them leave to get cash.    Afterward we were seated Abbey was our waitress and she was awesome!! Our food came quickly and was delicious!!

wOY3Jov8WMgpW9roVVWFPQ.text: From my two years of living in the Henderson area, Babystacks Cafe has to be my favorite breakfast spot. It is my go-to, most recommended and favorite breakfast to come back to. The staff here is always friendly and works hard to provide the best customer service.   The food here is Hawaiian-American breakfast and lunch with an awesome emphasis on pancakes. I like their menu because it's not too expansive where I get overwhelmed but has all the specialties and necessities you want. Bonus points for the place for having a Senior special which my dad loves. I have tried dishes from their pancakes, egg skillets, breakfast sliders and burritos. I never had a complaint with their food. Maybe some complaints here and there with the wait but it was still worth it. The potatoes are my absolute favorite and if my entree doesn't have potatoes as a side, I will make sure to order a side of it to make sure I get my potatoes fix. The portions are large and I always feel like I need a nap or take some home at the end. The prices are reasonable for that as well.   Because the place is relatively small, just know that you will wait anywhere from 5 mins to 40 mins, depending how busy they are. They also do take out orders if you prefer that. Highly recommend this place for the atmosphere, the service and of course, the food!

veNpOewm_5xwAKbVZTPnkQ.text: Those German chocolate cakes make me wanna scream to the clouds and thank every human being on a FABULOUS day that we are all breathing!!! mlfK_5NL2BUZhDlZMQYAbQ.text: Adobo omelet is not really good. I cant taste the adobo which supposed to be vinegar and soy sauce with garlicky taste. It seems its from freezer.   Best thing is the red velvet pancake.

cTYAK2oEkdl4NbttfrQtbA.text: Man, I love Babystacks! The Summerlin location was created such a great vibe, I was really putting some big expectations on this new location. The best part: it's literally a mile away from my house! That's a score!  Just like the first location, this location is busy! On the weekends (and probably the weekdays as well) be prepared to wait! My wait wasn't bad though, just 30 minutes. There's a hostess station with some seating and lots of standing room outside. When you enter the restaurant, you'll notice lots of table top seating and some booth seating. There's big tvs for the game and some bar top seating as well. The service was awesome. Our server was such a sweet lady. She greeted us within 2 minutes and kept checking back with us. We actually got our food before the guests that sat 5 minutes before we did! Now that's efficient :)  For brunch, I got the Spam Scramble for $7.95. Three scrambled eggs with diced spam, sprinkled with furikake and a garlic rice upgrade for $1.00 more. The garlic rice was cooked with furikake, oil, garlic and onions. The flavors were awesome! I love spam and love the saltiness of it, complimenting the eggs very nicely. The rice was on point, just as I remembered. The ONLY problem with this plate was the portion. OMG, it was sooo small! It took up only 75% of the plate. I ate everything within 2 bites. I definitely think they have bigger portions in the Summerlin location. For my side, I decided to upgrade with a babystack of Red Velvet. Red velvet pancakes, topped with whipped cream and chocolate crumbles, served with cream cheese syrup. OH-EM-GEE, just has I remembered! The cakes were moist and so flavorful, the cream cheese really made the red velvet pop out and the chocolate crumbles accented the dish very well. DEFINITELY A MUST TRY!  I'm so glad this place opened by my place. I can literally come here every weekend without wasting a lot of gas. The next time I come, though, I hope they address this portion issue. Whether or not, I'm still coming back...time and time again!

iR0biQ7OZaD72X0OEdQdeQ.text: I wish yelp had half stars as baby stacks is more of a 3.5 star kind of place. That's not really a knock on this business. The vibe is island style and the restaurant has a relaxing feel. The menu has a ton of pancake options but has other more traditional options like omelette says well as island flavor a like loco moco.   I had the loco moco which was very good. The patty was big and thick and juicy. It seemed to be made from scratch. The eggs were perfectly cooked and the gravy was rich and dark. I got a side of bacon pancakes. I was hoping for better cakes. Mine were flat and dense and slightly chewy. The flavor was there, but the texture was not.   My wife had the chicken fried steak and eggs with carrot cake pancakes. Her steak tasted a bit off although it was nicely fried. Maybe the oil was on its way out. She loved the sausage gravy but was nonplussed by the thick, undercooked hash browns. Her pancakes were thin and tender and had lots of spice. They tasted like carrot cake and were very good.   The service overall was good, yet our food took almost 30 minutes to arrive. The table next to us was having issues too. Maybe the kitchen was in the weeds as it was late morning on a Sunday. Our server did check on us several times and refilled our coffees constantly.   If you like a large selection of "dessert" pancakes then you'll probably like baby stacks. If you're more of a traditional pancakes person you may prefer a different place. If you want loco moco this is your pace!

5Nmbg2gKCyHY6OKCC97Aag.text: Quick, inexpensive, delicious breakfast!! They have plenty to choose from and the portions are generous. Location and parking are convenient!

uvNOmhuwxHmLVvETaAi7bg.text: This is my go to place now when I am in town from the bay visiting my fam. Been here a few times and I am never disappointed. Service is always good aside from a little longer wait when they are busy but it's understandable. Everything is always tasty. My Favorite is their Adobo Fried Rice Omelette , all the egg Benedict's and most definitely their yummy selection of pancakes !!! Everything from the Red Velvet to the Banana Fosters pancakes are soooo yummy it's bad ! I absolutely feel the #fattystatus feeling after eating here but it's sooo worth it . CHEAT MEAL FOR REAL!

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States

Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Adobo omelette

lVuk1cpWXgBUgL_Zp-u9RA.text: Food is wonderful. Never disappoints, came from spring valley location and so glad they opened one here. Definitely seams to be understaffed because I never have just 1 waiter and it takes long just to take an order.

FR6hLGpIB_lDGLa1DoyYLA.text: This location was a disappointment compared to the others I've been to. It took forever to get a waiter/waitress to take our drink order. Then the excuses, we don't have chili, we don't have tomatoes. This is at 9am and you don't have items on your menu? Service was subpar. No aloha spirit. No coming back to this location, I will rather drive 20-30 minutes away for the service and great tasting food in used to from this restaurant chain.

VzCt2zi2-RIbvzpN2xETuQ.text: excellent food, exceptional staff, reasonable prices.... really good local place to have breakfast... will stop in here everytime i'm in henderson...try it, you will not be disappointed.

IzXjFzoE7iegSf1lsxOXiA.text: We just recently moved to Henderson from Texas and were looking for a good place for breakfast. After seeing the reviews on YELP, we decided to check it out and were glad we did. We tried the chili skillet with buttermilk pancakes & sausage and egg plate with pumpkin pancakes. Both pancakes were delicious and there were so many different varieties. It's a little pricey for a breakfast place but service was good and we'll definitely keep this place as one that we'll visit regularly.

xd8u-ypfny-vlrAdQpOOCQ.text: This was probably the worst meal my husband and I have had in a long time. We ordered an omelette and pancakes.  First, if you are going to call yourself Babystacks your pancakes should be amazing.  These pancakes were like eating cardboard.  My husband ordered the plain buttermilk pancakes and I ordered the carrot cake pancakes.  His were cold and burnt.  Don't know how that happens.  I think it could be because they use frozen pancakes and then just re-heat them.  That is certainly what they taste like.  As for the omelettes, they were rubbery and the bacon in it tasted horrible.  It almost tasted like they put liquid smoke in the omelette.  We have eaten at the Babystacks in Summerlin which was terrific, so we were excited about one in Henderson.  Unfortunately it was a big disappointment.

LM4W5vdJ4m8K6UnGxtnP_A.text: The red velvet pancakes were good. I got a short stack. It was a good amount since I was getting egg whites. I wouldn't order a side of fruit because the fruit tasted old. My husband got the Santa Fe ... It was mediocre but not too bad. The meat was dry.   As for the service... It was less than expected. I counted 6 staff members and 3 tables with customers (us being the third) no one came to our table for at least 7 mins to take our drinks. I had to call someone over. No one came to refill our coffee when requested until I had to ask for it again. We asked for butter on our toast and no one ever brought that over until, once again, we asked for it a second time. Our waiter looked like he was miserable...  The only reason why I'm writing this review is because the one other time I went to baby stacks at a different location, this was no my experience. I'm pretty disappointed.

-ZyrHHBuCZ5qqHNWWaDVwg.text: Sadly, I was greatly disappointed with all pancakes we ate; orange creamsicle, Carrot cake, and blueberry. The blueberry was the best of the 3, but I've eaten better elsewhere. The pancakes were overpowered by one ingredient and the artificial flavoring was "no bueno." There was a moment I regretted not getting the red velvet stack, but soon as I saw the next table cut into the bright red center, which screamed artificial flavoring, that feeling quickly left. My sis ordered the strawberry crepe, which had to be doused with strawberry and cream cheese syrups to add flavoring.   IF, I was ever brought back here, I would stick with the coffee (strong like I like it), bacon and square hash browns. Those were good and kept me from leaving the restaurant hungry.   Bottom line: The service was great, but I'm a girl who likes to save her calories and this meal wasn't worth the extra pounds on the scale.

0DfQwm0DWJWOI7PM8JQZzA.text: This place is sooo good if your looking to add a more Hawaii touch to your breakfest! I had he Hawaiian Benedict which had 2 toasted Hawaiian rolls with Spam, poached egg, brown gravy and Furikake sprinkled on top. This baby will fill you right up but if you think you have room to squeeze one more then definitely order their red velvet pancakes that are drizzled in their delicious cream cheese syrup and topped with chocolate crumbs - now that pancake is so one of a kind that even after you read this review your tastebuds will be tingling!

l3B65aiAQU8u7QHU8F9f7w.text: I've been wanting to go here for weeks, so since I was in the area at lunchtime today, I said why not? I like having "breakfast" for lunch or even for dinner, so I ordered an omelette and pancakes. The "Piglet" omelette contained bacon, ham, and sausage with cheddar cheese on top. Now I don't mind a little browning on my eggs, but this was way too overdone for my taste and none too fluffy. And I could say the same for the pancakes. I like my pancakes golden yellow. These were charred brown and flat as.....well, as a pancake! The hazelnut Nutella drizzled over the top and the huge scoop of whipped cream were good but somehow I missed having syrup.....maybe hazelnut syrup? At least the service was excellent. Friendly servers, always checking on you. I never give up on a restaurant after only one try, so I will go back and order something different.

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Piglet Omelette(ham, bacon, sausage, and cheese), Hash Browns, and Hazelnut Pancakes.

IRcMctJq-8w1qLdvIUumwg.text: Well, my family and I went here at a very packed time but we really wanted to try it out. Once we entered we weren't greeted, which is pretty bad especially if you're from Hawaii. If you've been there, the inside has a bit of a Hawaii-Aloha theme going but there was no "Aloha."  Our waitress was very nice though. I would have to say she was the reason that made our experience there just "okay."  We had to wait almost an hour for our food and sadly our waitress didn't keep up with refills; once our food was out we ate but it wasn't much of any enjoyment. The food lacked seasoning and the pancakes tasted really bad!   Sadly, I will not go there again.

DGrvsT9lQLVxGDjOHCD1Iw.text: I've been to this place many times and it's always good. I used to go across town on buffalo just to have breakfast there. Im so happy they opened one in this area which is five minutes away .They have the best red velvet pancakes . Portuguese sausage is really good too. The wait is long sometimes ,  but definitely worth it. Service is ok , friendly and accommodating .

QfIZxT9TxgBLj7FLP1f6OA.text: I've always loved coming to this place for breakfast. But today, I was very upset with the girl at the front. Our server was very good, and he kept making sure my friend and I were ok. But today when we tried to pay, I asked the girl if she can split the check. I know they don't split the bill, but rather, they split the price. The girl working (w/ an attitude) told me to tell her the price. When I couldn't figure it out, she told me "there's a calculator." I was very frustrating to know that I had to do her job while she literally stood in front and just waited.

GNycsL6fpvlqIrLsFFqZqg.text: If you've been to the original Babystacks (nee Babycakes) off of Smoke Ranch, you know there's a price to pay for amazing gourmet pancakes: the wait can be upwards to an hour. But once you're seated, the food is delish, the service is stellar, and the clientele includes a lot of cute Islander boys.  OK, maybe it's just me that noticed that.  Well, Babystacks has a new location off of Stephanie in Henderson. The food is still delish, the service is still stellar, the Islander boys are still cute...  And we walked right in. **gasp**  I went off the pancake menu (finally) and gave their omelettes a try, opting for my beloved chili omelette. They boasted Hawaiian-style chili, which was even sweeter than a Chicago or Cincinnati chili, but still really good. I added a babystack of S'Mores pancakes. If i had one complaint about the place, it's that I thought adding a babystack of pancakes would get me 2 regular-sized pancakes. Instead, they're mini-pancakes.  Boo your face. If I had known that, I would have stuck with the pancakes and tell the omelette, "Excuse you, buster, do you know where you're at? I need pancakes and I need them right meow."  But I digress. That was the only downside to our experience. Elite Emily had the Adobo Fried Rice, which has been widely lauded elsewhere, and she enjoyed it, though she had the same reaction to her Red, White, and Blue babystack pancakes.  Our server was great, and she kept us refilled with a big smile. The place feels new and clean -- a good thing since it just opened.  I definitely will come back. Carrot cake pancakes, you're next on my hit list.

12NjmSqt2LVk659oMDIyig.text: The red velvet pancakes are to die for.  My son ordered them and they were incredible I ordered the Benedict and a Nutella crepe The crepe was really soft I didn't like it  The service was great though Only 3 stars because the foul stench in the woman's restroom  Sewage It was awful

cepxo-r3twtOwlYJNAvDPA.text: I guess this place is known for specialty pancakes but we went after wanting to try this place for a few months. Judging by the wait lines we also see, we had high hopes.  I ordered an omelette, side of hash browns well done and the side of baby stack pancakes. My husband ordered eggs Benedict. My hash browns were undercooked. The omelette was very pedestrian, smallish with tiny pieces of diced meats that were indistinguishable from each other (bacon, sausage and ham). Pancakes were nothing special, actually pretty dry. Black Bear Diner is THE place to go for pancakes for sure.   My husband's eggs Benedict was way over cooked. Eggs were on the hard side, not poached and runny at all. The Hollandaise had so much lemon it, it was almost curdled. This place may only know Hawaiian food but we'll never be back to find out.  Not sure if it's crowded because people are too lazy to drive any further or if they just don't know better.

bzYFkr2t5eLWSnFQDU0mVw.text: The server Valerie was very nice and gave great recommendations! Great service overall! Omg the food was delicious, I had the loco moco and my sister had the banana fosters half stack and we could not be happier. Great seasoning on the burger and brown gravy. Bananas foster was not overpowering with sweetness and was definitely a favorite. we definitely finished both plates. We will be back for sure!!

qYmsV8GUo_ln9VBkClguoA.text: There are two things here that are pretty much must-have's: the red velvet pancakes and the adobo rice.  Most reviews will give you plenty more to go off of.  Also, for breakfast, my bill always tends to run me about $20 more than I expect...but hey, its good.

JPPt7-0INKw67BSYl-7k-w.text: Seriously the best pancake place EVER !!!! I'm obsessed with their German Chocolate pan cakes!! Definitely a MUST TRY if you ever decide to go. I've never had issue with Customer service when I go there, but I do wish the location was larger the wait can be so long sometimes .

0b9ivqodRdZX0gHGyTqxhQ.text: 3 stars for the service, but I dont get what the hoopla is about. The pancakes are just ok, the price was perfect though. I don't think Ill be back, but it looks like business is booming! Cant please everyone

eWApoMrUqSihd5KqzDwDXw.text: My favorite place to go for pancakes, DELICIOUS!  My family likes the Hawaiian influence in their menu.  Prices are great!

p8FUHv7n2IAb0SskkVWc3Q.text: Amazing food! There were just 3of us but we upgraded our pancakes (that came with the skillet and omelette orders) and got the Nutella and Bananas Foster pancakes. My daughter got 2 short stacks of Cinnamon roll and White Chocolate Macadamia. I know I know!!! Way too much food for 3people so no need to judge me. The bananas foster was the favorite. wJS4iAHXDu-Jm-z0fhm9CQ.text: If you're looking for a place to have breakfast, eat here.  Fast and friendly service and amazing pancakes.   We had the lemon riccota and cinabun pancakes.   Perfection!

RAG0XGkfnSOb3DHtM5CiEg.text: A must place to visit when in Henderson, Nevada. The shredded chicken adobo omelette was bomb.com'

VGba72yrhR4Jl7wEpSxD1g.text: We decided to try this local favorite for breakfast and even though it was a Saturday morning on Memorial day weekend if was not overly crowded and the service was outstanding! I decided on the Ortega chile skillet, with bananas foster cakes! My meal was very tasty, warm and lo cal! Just kidding, but our food was delicious! The green chile was medium to mild, the potatoes were moist and fresh, the eggs cooked to a perfect over medium! Our pancakes were fluffy and warm, the caramel sauce and warm bananas absolutely delicious! Kudos to our server Kaylah  she was delightful, very friendly and helpful! Gomer and I highly recommend this hidden gem in Henderson! Have a great Memorial day weekend and Thank you to all who have served or currently serve our great country in the military!

t2QuXbBtqZfvBCyUWYabMA.text: Crazy busy. Luckily there is usually room for one at the counter. Good food so I can see why they are so busy! Decent service. They do close early.

H5gKqsUe8sp_95qWv7gW5A.text: solid breakfast if you want some yummy pancakes.  love the red velvet, Nutella, banana foster... my fave is the carrot cake.  flecks of carrot and the sweet creamy creamcheese icing.  delicious.  adobo serving is enough for 2.  the staff is friendly and food is always good.

f8xaxtDqn2L-0s8rG59Cyw.text: The food is always great and the service is great as well.  The only reason I cannot give five stars is every time we stop in for breakfast we get stuck by the massive sun blinding windows.  The window tint does little to help and this could easily be fixed for a small investment.   We love this place but look else where at times because of the deadly sun.  Please fix this buy some shades for the windows.  I bet the money you save in a/c would pay for the shades in a few short sunny months.

cSI_-lyAPfO7JVTya0Hozw.text: Food was alright. Had the BYO omelet with Portuguese sausage. A little on the salty side but still good. Bacon pancakes were dry and the bacon wasn't cooked into the batter as described in the menu. Service was... let's just say a guy took our order, twice, and still got it wrong. His hair was on point though. He must love Mario bros. Take this review for what it's worth from the opinion of one guy. Like I always tell myself, give any place at least one chance.

k-064W3PCYnBfcQZDDpM7w.text: This place is a must go! The food was amazing and and the service was equally as good. Ask for Efren! Best service I've had in a long time. We will be back.

HsjnSwUYHKeqjajVocD-tQ.text: Top notch breakfast place that has a humongous menu with reasonable prices too. You can upgrade you omelette side of pancakes to one of their fancy pancakes. I've tried the red velvet and the cinnamon roll pancakes and they are AMAZING. Expect to wait for a table on the weekends, but the wait is worth it.

biJMJO1RsWge2fjdBTrbZg.text: The wait is long but worth the wait. The red velvet pancake is yummy. My hubby ordered hazelnut pancake and he said it is also yummy. Will come back here again.

zccHGl8w95LDfc_fY_vfJg.text: Super great food ! Waiter seemed nice nothing over the top. When it was time for check out the hostess taking the payment seemed annoyed that all 3 of us were paying separate and literally gave us a calculator to know how much each of us owed... seriously???!!... I figure the only explanation for that is that she didn't know basic math.

DdPGnUXMlrG0DzMiRCvPPg.text: I wish I could try all the flavors they make and tell you my favorite! So far though the lemon ricotta crepes and the German Chocolate pancakes are my favorite. Though everything I've tried so far is so delicious!!!! My only complaint is that they don't have a pancake sampler, LoL.  Seriously tasty food though! And very friendly, and helpful, staff!!! I will keep coming here!

-gb_ka9E5vESCi5Cz6eT1g.text: DELICIOUS & even when there is a long line, the wait isn't too bad and the food comes fast. SO GOOD.

jkCrPzM2SeO-Ynj3NZUjBQ.text: Food is phenomenal.  Service is almost always great! Except last time the lady that delivered our food (I'm assuming she's either a server or a busser- she had long dark hair in a ponytail) came and told us around 1:30pm that they were closed. Her exact words were "is there anything else you want? We're closed." It was extremely rude and condescending. There were others in the restaurant still consuming their food and I just found it disrespectful.

ZNVwmtYyda3R5ueyFuUBlA.text: Wasn't that great as expected. Food was bland (some seasoning would be nice) & their bacon looked aged & gross... only thing I enjoyed was the single crepe with Nutella & bananas. Overall an ok experience, nothing to hype about.

ymkGIZljOk1Me-JkJkYcpw.text: As usual..food was good, but service way too s l o w.... Server did as good as be could..had WAY TOO MANY TABLES. Why is it businesses want our $$$.. boy they are TOO GREEDY to provide enough help to get us back ?

CsiZfCF2h5t1p4YM1dU_DA.text: Ambience = Meh Cost = Ok Food = Decent Busyness = On Steroids! Service = Nothing special, but they are pushing you out the door... Keeping the flow going Overall = May try again   Maybe I didn't try the most popular items, bacon, eggs, hash-browns, buttermilk pancakes, these items were all okay. Nothing I would rave about. Definitely, a good price for what you are served. I would avoid sitting right around the corner from the entry, traffic there is a beast!!

9WrZUZHyi36RuquQTN9Gnw.text: it's always a toss up when is comes to every else besides their pancakes   service is always very friendly and attentive and food comes out really fast and hot!   the lack of a last star is due to their inconsistent taste in food. we absolutely love the Adobo fried rice omelet sometimes it's good to the last tiny grain of rice full of flavor ... today however was bland and rice to adobo ratio was not good. different cooks I guess.   it is worth a try just for the red velvet pancakes now those are worth the trip. yum!

0sh6MdsKHoOYloAFYn7BIQ.text: We came here based on the amount of reviews and the positive reviews! And we were completely satisfied! It's very well priced and the amount of food isn't incredibly overwhelming but you get completely full and don't need a nap after. We had Efrain as our server and he was very attentive very knowledgeable about the menu and had multiple alternatives for us! We will be coming back!

AqImiB_UJP2hSA8ZgbBejw.text: I've been here 3, maybe 4 times. Each time with regret. I always go for their pancakes because that's what I would assume they're popular for. I've tried various ones and I must say  I was impressed with none and disappointed in all. They are consistent on being dry that no amount of syrup can fix.  I've also tried their biscuits and gravy. Also unimpressive. My husband has tried their country fried steak and loco moco and a few other items and also agrees this place is highly overrated.

W6wH1THt4eavNiTPOMnpjA.text: I don't know why people line up and wait for food here, nothing really stands out. My food was too greasy and had no flavor in  it and service was too slow. I felt robbed and I wasted too much time waiting just get a cup of coffee and after that another 30 minutes for food, what a joke.

bWbwd7NWY3dN6BtqntRS_g.text: If you want to wait for mediocre food and be treated like crap by the staff, then this is the place for you! I realize that Hawaiian style food is their thing, but with my experience from living on the islands, this is a poor excuse for a restaurant.  After waiting for 30 min, our food was cold and tasteless. We also waited for 30 min to get our check which was $47 for just two people. And when I complained to the manager, I wasn't offered a coupon or anything, just a fake " sorry, now pay us the $47 that we don't deserve".  Don't ever go there !!!

PbHaEWCA0M_XyGJ1naQV6A.text: My aunt is a local and raaaaves about this place constantly on fb.  So when we came for a trip I knew I had to go. Holy yum!!! I had the breakfast burrito and red velvet pancakes with cream cheese syrup. They were the best pancakes I've ever had. I'm going back tomorrow before I leave. My God it was amazing!!! Great service and I hear it gets pretty busy and it was a slow Thursday!

R5MPfzytMsnIwteWspoS9w.text: 5 stars for the wide selection and delicious pancakes!!! We ordered to go and loved every bite!!

VWGFwub7sc32rQIvW7xvkA.text: So I was looking forward to trying this place since it's always busy and I've seen and heard many friends eat here. We were terribly disappointed. When we first arrived and went on the waiting list we noticed that there were several seats available at the counter and several tables outside that weren't being used even though there were plenty of people waiting. So we asked if we could sit at the counter or on the patio. They said no, there is a wait for those as well. This did not make sense since when they finally sat us, those counter seats and patio tables were still empty! Next, we were not happy with the food. My wife's pancakes were very undercooked as was her omelette with very runny eggs. My Baby Chick omelette was very bland and overcooked and my Hazelnut pancakes were also very dry. We did not enjoy anything here. It was also so noisy that we could hardly have a conversation. For this type of meal I would suggest going to one of their competitors. Sorry.

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Baby Chick omelette &amp; Hazelnut pancakes.

dbB8BdyTn6-Wy0mivWzqQg.text: This little place is excellent. The omelets were pretty good and the pancakes were sooooooo good! :) Loved this place you should definitely come here. I had the Hazelnut Pancakes and there were also Banana Foster and Red Velvet Pancakes those were also very delicious. AMZING GIRLLLLLLLLLLLO!!!!YAYAYYAYAYAYYAY

ZDRjdYJg3cI376yI24-LsQ.text: Holy YUM! We entered the slightly too cold cafe and were kindly greeted and promptly sat at a seat we preferred next to the window. Right away I was able to get some coffee and water in me and soon after our server came to take our order. What pleasant people who work there! The banana cream pie pancakes were insanely good, and I don't even like pancakes. The Mexican skillet was on point. They kept my coffee coming without a problem. I shared the skillet with an upgraded pancake w another person and we were both full and satisfied. The decor is kitschy and cute in a home sweet home kind of way. I would so go there again and you should too.

TYI7sZbLITgOmUGVP-N-VQ.text: Can't really order anything wrong.  Service  is good, Huevos rancheros were great, baby stacks were great.

mqX3QL2K4ZpgGtjmZBBNfw.text: Really great breakfast in Las Vegas. I had a build your own skillet with scrambled eggs, bacon, mushrooms, and spinach. It's served over oven roasted potatoes and your choice of a side (pancakes or toast).I chose sourdough and it came buttered. It was fresh, hot and delicious! I also added a single sweet cream crepe with strawberries and it was so perfect! It was served with fresh strawberries and a fresh strawberry syrup on the side. The sweet cream is a cream cheese filling that isn't too sweet, but complements the strawberries wonderfully. The other choice was bananas. Chrissy was our server and she was friendly, cheerful and a pleasure. Service is A+. My partner had buttermilk pancakes. They were fluffy, obviously homemade and fresh to order. Overall, we throughly enjoyed our breakfast and we will be back before we leave Vegas!  Disclaimer: I rarely give a five star, so this is in no way meant to discourage anyone  from dining here. I highly recommend this cafe :)

CgFB-byErdFgHol3wZZ0bw.text: First time here.. Wonderful staff, great food, I have not one complaint about this place.

MHInp1xaD25ge3PdpiTsOw.text: Prior to opening this location, we had experienced Babystacks only once before at the location on the other side of town.  That experience had been pretty damn amazing, so we couldn't wait for this location to open up.  And now that it is open?  It's hard to convince my wife that we don't have to eat here every single weekend.  The best selling point of this place are the various pancakes they have, almost all available in half-stacks or full-stacks.  These range from Orange Dreamsicle pancakes to Banana Cream pancakes and everything in between.  The absolute best that they have are the Cookies and Cream pancakes, which are to die for.  I'm not sure why they are on the special board and not on the permanent menu yet, but do not miss out on them.    Everything we've ever tried here has been great.  We've built our own skillets before, we've tried the Kalua pork sandwich - it's all turned out well.  The service is typically good and the wait times aren't too long, though it can get fairly busy on weekend mornings.  Seriously though.  Get yourself some cookies and cream pancakes.  You know you deserve it.

St3gqNyBHzCNzDNnCPIgbg.text: I always get the loco moco and red velvet pancakes! It's a great breakfast place to go to

adXtWYKRSqI1PWOSAb0kbQ.text: I love this place. I'm not a pancake person but I'm obsessed with their pancakes. The food is amazing, the service is great, and the atmosphere is comfortable. Highly recommend it. I will be back every chance I get! :)

wIgMIu5SAVm6L-5xL3cnUA.text: I have never been to any other location of Babystacks Cafe so I can not say how this one measures up to others. All I know is I LOVED the meal I had here over this past weekend.  Allison S. and I decided to have a late breakfast at Babystacks before doing a little shopping. There was a decent sized crowd of people waiting to be seated at the fairly small cafe when we arrived, but the wait was only about 25 minutes.   I was tempted by the red velvet pancakes that Babystacks is known for, but when I saw that one of the daily specials was the strawberry lemonade pancakes (which I had already dreamed about, after seeing the photo Suzy H. posted) I had to order that. I went with a short stack, and added a side of sausage, and it was more than enough food for me.   The pancakes were perfection, just the right amount of lemony tartness topped with fresh strawberries and delicious cream cheese icing, plus a huge serving of whipped cream. I have had fluffier pancakes, but the flavor profile completely made up for any lack of fluff. I stole a bite of Allison's spinach benedict and that was super yummy as well.  Service was spot on. Babystacks remained busy the entire duration of our visit, and while it was clear that our server was working hard, she was an absolute sweetheart and she always had a smile on her face. Our water and coffee cups stayed filled and our food came out fairly quickly.   Overall, I enjoyed my visit to Babystacks and look forward to returning to try some of the other items on their menu.

KduwLvYTzSFrB6cQ0BKagA.text: Been here quite a few times and always get pretty much the same things, but today ordering the Lola cornas corner beef hash was not consistent to the other times I had them. This time once it got to my table the food had a distinctive sour smell. I usually share whatever I eat with my daughter since it's her fave too but once I ate the corner beef hash I knew it was spoiled, I tried again just to make sure probably it was just a different recipe but nope it was a bit slimy taste and sour at the end. And sure thing I had an upset stomach when I got home. This was the first meal of the day for us and everything else was to my satisfactory and our waiter was gladly to comp off the corner beef hash since I did not want anything else but did want to remind them it was not the same taste like always and I know what something spoiled taste like since I have worked in the food industry as well.

yYzbpOY2XDMKNvRqjLcpRw.text: We've tried :  Loco Moco Rick's Adobo Fried Rice Baby Chick Omelette Ranchero Omelette Breakfast Burrito  If you're looking for authentic Hawaiian breakfast, look no further than the loco moco and Rick's adobo fried rice at Babystacks Cafe. The loco moco, served with garlic rice, was oozing with deliciousness and had a brown gravy that was tough to beat. The fried rice was massive in size, only to be matched in flavor.   The intimate setting inside makes you feel like you've left Las Vegas and have entered a little Hawaiian eatery. I will definitely be back.  Aloha!

pjVy7Wu4NbcG1T1meBF_wQ.text: Plan on a wait, unless get there early especially on the weekend. It's a small place but the pancakes are so worth it. I highly recommend the lemon ricotta pancakes. That would be part of my last breakfast on earth if I knew it was coming. Pretty good customer service most of the time as well.

di51plBLcx-QYG3LJNsD9w.text: Very happy and very fast staff - Food was fine, but not over the top. The restaurant is small, so there was a wait - but when we proposed sitting outside, they happily allowed and we were served immediately. Everyone raved about their pancakes - and they were OK, but nothing that special in my mind. .... a fun little place to visit...

M0DQWk9SlPgrVzxinIveDQ.text: This place is awesome. It's small and homely. Tucked away in a shopping center on Stephanie. Great food! Awesome staff! You have to try the red velvet pancakes and/or the Kalua grilled cheese.

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Loco moco...

F98vUv71aNDRmIB9Eu9x_Q.text: Jessie B and I wanted to grab some brunch last weekend. When she said she had never been to Babystacks I knew it would be a perfect fit.   Since it was a Saturday there was about a 25 minute wait, but I knew it would be worth it. When they called our name we were quickly seated. Our waitress was very on point. She never let our coffee or water glasses get empty. Babystacks menu has tons of different pancakes that they offer, but make sure you check out their white board for their daily specials. I finally decided on the Spinach Benedict with a side of their macaroni salad and Jessie picked off the white board and got the Strawberry Lemonade pancakes with a side of turkey sausage. The Spinach Benedict was excellent! It was loaded with spinach, crispy bacon, mushrooms, poached eggs and it was all covered it the best tangy hollandaise sauce I think I've ever had. It had a lemony note that was perfect. Jessie was nice enough to let me try her pancakes too. Let me tell you I'm really not a pancake person and those pancakes rocked! What a great flavor! Lemon pancakes covered in strawberries and it had a lemon syrup too!! ALL the lemon.   It was another great brunch with Jessie B. Babystacks didn't disappoint. The wait sucked, but for the amazing food and excellent service it was worth it. If your looking for a tasty breakfast/ brunch spot this is the place! Yum!

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Spinach Benedict with a side of macaroni salad! Yuuuum!

oZx5Dyt9YubLvu3oRhLg0g.text: On vaca from Cali had the Red Velvet Pancakes, simply amazing 5/5 stars. Ricks Adobo Rice Omelette  delicious, but a little dry. I recommend adding cheese for moisture 4/5 stars.

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Tick&#39;s Adobo Rice Omelet, good but a little dry. I will add cheese next time for moisture.
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Red Velvet Pancakes! Delicious

9BATRuKbcfqaBXKo6t7S9A.text: Place is a great breakfast stop. The adobo fried rice omelet is really good and the red velvet pancakes are of the hook. Great service, staff petty friendly little pricey but you get what you pay for quality! Keep up the good work!

OgcJL7uTOcD1kGTb0JKs1w.text: Flying out from Vegas and stopped at Babystacks Cafe. Everyone is super friendly, but walking in the door, you didn't know if you were waiting to be seated or ordering at the counter. The food was "okay" I wasn't a fan of the omelette nor the pancakes. My wife did not enjoy the biscuits and gravy. On a positive not, both my kids did enjoy. Rate 3 stars because of how polite everyone was.

lU7wFS0IzOIA_OSu70CqIg.text: Friday morning, was really packed---we waited a bit for a table to open up, but singles or couples got seating right away. I liked the long wooden bench in the front. Comfy, could seat many people. Service was very good, everyone's really nice and attentive.   This was our first visit here (Babies R Us/ shopping center), but we've been to their other location (4 total in the valley BTW). I had been looking over their menu since the real first visit, and was really wanting to try their "local favorite" Lolo Rick's adobo fried rice (egg burrito) and the red velvet pancakes seemed very enticing. What the hell, right? We were celebrating our 10th wedding anniversary. Our son had his favorite, sausage links. I didn't get a hot chocolate because I knew breakfast was going to be big. And it was delicious, we split each item, our favorite thing to do.  My husband asked me if it was authentic, and it definitely was (I don't eat filipino food as much because (1) my lola was a really good cook and because of that (2) I am really picky with it. Besides, it is usually high in fat, calories & sodium, too. 5 days a week I am on a restricted diet.) The adobo flavor was perfect (not too much of one ingredient like vinegar), the twist was adding rice, and placing it all inside an egg wrapper which ends up looking like a burrito, mmm, it was hella good or masarap. Hubby liked it so much would conside getting the same, but me being curious, would like to try the loco moco.

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Red velvet pancakes
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Mmm, adobo locals&#39; favorite
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Menu page, as of April 2016

oAIgSjTz4ZjwQVrMhxfPhg.text: From sweet to savory it's all good.  Good coffee.  We had Loco Moco, red velvet, and cookies and cream pancakes.  Five star all the way.  Get here early as it gets packed.

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. 2 words Loco Moco

RcdvAa5XiS3wxITAu99CaQ.text: Awesome breakfast spot for the area. The worst part about coming here will be trying to decide on just one menu item. Before I even ordered I knew that I'd be back again.  We arrived on Saturday morning to a packed restaurant which I expected. We were quoted a 10-15 minute wait, but didn't wait nearly that long. As soon as we were seated our waiter came by to take drink orders. Once he returned with drinks a few minutes later he offered to take our orders, but didn't rush us. Our waiter continued to return frequently refilling drinks and checking in on us. He was friendly and everyone working the morning I visited seemed jolly.   I had the French Toast Combo with Honey Toast, Bacon, and over medium eggs. Yum! The French Toast was perfectly prepared and has a nice crisp to it. The eggs were prepared more on the over easy side, but that wasn't a big deal.  The portion was perfect for me. It filled me up without feeling like I had eaten too much.  My husband had the Banana Cream Pie pancakes, a full stack. The portion was huge and he really enjoyed it. I liked the flavor of it as well. There were plenty of bananas and cream pie on top.  We'll definitely be back. I can't wait to try their Filipino breakfast option!

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. French Toast Combo
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Banana Cream Pie Pancakes

8DjqYRVCAcoV_8nL_lHRXg.text: It was nice to find a Hawaiian cafe in the area. I go to Hawaii quite often since my bf resides there so I was stoked to find a place to feed my Hawaiian food cravings in Henderson/ Vegas area. Service here was superb. The workers were absolutely sweet and accommodating. Food was great-- as if I were enjoying meal in Hawaii. Lol.  Btw, their red velvet pancakes are to die for. So fluffy and flavorful! I highly recommend ordering it.

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Fluffy Red Velvet Pancakes. YUM!

t2Ke2e-F78rzbjCJEeX8mA.text: So I'll admit, I need to give this place another visit soon. The selections on their menu sound awesome, but I was craving a BLT. Great sandwich with Applewood bacon, crisp iceberg and tomatoes. I wanted to keep it lean on my side so I paid additional for fruit. It was a great selection of melon, grapes and strawberries.  The best part of my meal was the service. From the moment the gentleman greeted me at the front door and seated me. To the awesome service I got from my server Efrain. He promptly took my drink order, returned with it, and asked if I had any questions about their menu. He then took my order, served to me in a timely order and checked on me several times. That's great service.  I hope to return soon and try one of their many flavorful pancakes.

bExkEzEe7pcK8btnJ0P9zQ.text: Breakfast and lunch spot in the Las Vegas suburbs.  I was craving pancakes and was happy to find this gem that serves breakfast until 2pm. There were many breakfast choices but I settled on the bacon stuffed pancakes.....Yum!  The waitstaff was very friendly and accommodating.  I'll be back to try more of the pancake choices.

kgOCym3lVz9b5RbcRflHzw.text: My mom really wanted to try this place out so I tagged along with her. Right away we where seated in the back area it seemed busy but not too hectic. Our server took our order, the food came pretty fast and was great! Unfortunately our server did not check up on us at all ( we had no condiments or napkins I had to get up and grab them myself on the shelf by their kitchen) he didn't come by to ask if we needed a refill or anything also this couple next to us you can tell they needed refill because the guy was just sucking his drink with only ice in it lol... overall the food might bring us back but the service from that server could improve!

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Wheat Toast was drowned in butter
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States

fgkHLLejJtYhRaQrfgBBSw.text: On my visit in Vegas I stopped here for breakfast. I ordered the Piglet Skillet that came with ham, sausage, bacon, and potatoes. I added spinach, onions, and tomato (extra charge). The skillet also came with pancakes.  The piglet skillet was delicious, but considering the restaurant is known for pancakes, I was a little disappointed that the pancakes had no flavor at all. I recommend trying the skillets or omelets with a side of toast instead of pancakes.

I0Es449oKUi1I0mVYM1MAg.text: Wonderful little gem! Out of the ordinary breakfast options- such as Loco Moco and Kalbi short ribs with garlic rice is delicious! We are new to the area and this is our go to breakfast place! Super pilot and friendly staff!

a0ZP1LspDPVHL7--klk4jg.text: It feels like home cuz it's Hawaiian built. They always welcome and handle their guest with hospitality. I don't even have to ask for anything when it comes to refills or condiments. They always beat me to it. At least that's my experience.   Of course the menu has Hawaiian style food you would typically eat for breakfast which is always tasty. But the main attraction is their pancakes!  You have to stop by for the pancakes! My favorite is the red velvet and macadamia pancakes!   Everything is affordable to choose from and a family oriented environment.

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Chili moco
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. White chocolate macadamia pancakes

uNQ2Hn5UGQ_dhW9JSJXP7Q.text: Yo real shit first I would like to say fuck bubba gump. Last night I went there and spent $51 for a small meal that wasn't shit, but today......today I went to Babystack's and this place is amazing. I would definitely come back, great quality food, great staff, for a good price.

7k1G2ciyx_OLSeJwY2OhIQ.text: Food is good but being forced to watch UFC fights while having breakfast is an inappropriate appetite suppressant.  Lots of factors go into creating appropriate ambiance at a restaurant.   Here at Babystacks, management has given ZERO THOUGHT to some of the little things that matter a lot ... to customers.
