ZiOH8GjaZ3Qvm-nyNDZq8Q.text: Loved the Henderson location. The ppl are very family oriented and personable! Love Eric Awesome server!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. First time at Babystacks Cafe ,the atmosphere is Great and,the service is Awesome!!! Eric my server Love his hair......Hot Red like mine!!!

YOG6ZxU83tm1bVbP5Vckpw.text: Hubby and I love this place! We will definitely be back again to try all the different pancakes.  We ordered Lolo Ricks Adobo Fried Rice and a short stack of hazelnut pancakes. The fried rice was absolutely delicious and served wrapped in an omelette. The pancakes were absolutely scrumptious.   Our waitress Kayla was the sweetest and very helpful after she learned it was our first time there.   More than 5 stars!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States

ONutfkMffQz76oDRQrVg7A.text: Babystack's original location was one of my favorite breakfast spots back in the day.  I'm happy that they have branched out and there are multiple locations including this one close to me.  For breakfast I usually get an Omelette or Eggs Benedict.  Hubby's go-to's are Loco Moco or Country Fried Steak.  The pancakes are my favorite and even when we come for lunch I have to get a short stack on the side.  While I love the OG Red Velvet, I usually go for one of their special stacks.  Service is friendly and prices are super affordable.  Always check the board in the front.  You never know what specials they might have.

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Kalua Grilled Cheese
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Boston Cream Pancakes
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Banana Foster Pancakes

OVvnaBF_3LzMg_XeF0ll3A.text: Such a great place!! The atmosphere, the service, the food and the coffee!!! SOOOOOO AMAZING!!!! I had the cowboy skillet with the cinabun pancakes and it was incredible!!! Not to mention the coffee!! It was to die for!! I will definitely become a regular there!

1ZUqM24BKThA9v2XrI2j3A.text: We came to Babystacks while waiting for a store at the mall to open. What a surprise. Other reviews said to be patient as the wait can be long. It was 8:30 on a Friday morning. The two of us were seated right away. Yes, they had UFC on the one tv but I love UFC.  We had the Kalua Pug Benedict and the Mexican Skillet. The most difficult part of our experience was deciding what to order. The menu is huge!  We decided, "What the heck!  We'll just have to come back to try more.!"

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Mexican skillet.
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Kalua Pug Benny.

vetIVmbAWAvs0Czo34QhpA.text: If you're leaving after a weekend in Vegas, make Babystacks your breakfast stop before hitting the road! So delicious and a menu packed with plenty of delicious sweet and savory options. My husband got the German Chocolate Pancakes and I had the Peanut Butter with Bananas Pancakes.

0EA0-UuNIC9utYH9aXRskA.text: Love this place! The strawberry pancakes are the absolute best thing ever. It's always pretty busy here but the reason is probably because the food is pretty amazing. If you're in the area I totally recommend waiting for a bit to try this place. Yummy.

m0BLhgVOeet5o7wwe9C7zQ.text: We ordered breakfast to go because it gets so crowded here.  I had the red velvet pancakes and my boyfriend had the carrot cake pancakes.  The side of sausage is tasty too.  I plan on trying some of their other unique creations!

KH4ofdAt5LlYEthCWlUH1A.text: Nope...not even up to the standards of Omelet House over on the Boulder Highway (The one loser to Russell Rd) and Omelet House has much better prices.   And the Pancake House in Green Valley Station puts them to shame.  Banana pancakes should have the bananas cooked in, not on top.  Also served so cold they can't melt butter.   1st and last trip for me.

NZWoBoTkx1JAM_aN3rbayQ.text: Wife called to place an order to go.  First, they put her on hold, then hung up on her.  When we called back, they said "we are too busy right now, call back in 15 min".  Wow, if they can't even take a to go order, I wonder what the inside looks like.

I70JkHAqx3ciUwJ1HFc7ZA.text: We wanted to like the place, but unfortunately we will not return.  I'm giving it one star because the waitress was nice and friendly (although once our food was delivered, she seemed to disappear).  Make sure you pay attention to the wait list as they were calling people out of order.  We asked if we could sit at the counter and were told we had to wait, but then a couple walked in a few minutes later and walked straight to the counter where they were served (even after the hostesses talked about how they were not on the list).  I ordered corn beef hash and eggs with seasoned potatoes and buttermilk pancakes.  This is my favorite breakfast, but this one ranks at the bottom of the list.  It appeared and tasted as though the hash came out of a can with some chopped onions thrown in (do not put onions in hash please).  It was very dry even with the over easy eggs mixed in (I ordered over medium). The potatoes were overcooked and flavorless.  Even with syrup poured all over them, the pancakes were extremely dry.  We will stick with New Day Cafe.

dcY7mwf86X_E8fHgwUu04w.text: With all the good reviews and always seeing a line out the door when driving by, one might think this place is worth trying.  And so we did.  I'm not usually one to wait but we did since we were excited to try a new breakfast place and one with a Hawaiian twist.  Our wait time was about 30 mins but I also noticed new arrivals being seated before us?  Weird. While we waited to be seated we looked the menu over and just couldn't decide, everything looked so amazing.   I settled on 'homemade'corned beef hash with garlic fried rice, my husband had the white chocolate chip macadamia nut pancakes. Well, while the corned beef may be homemade it tasted like the stuff we buy in the can, the fried onions with rice...I mean the garlic rice with onion, whoa!  Hours after eating that and brushing and gargling I am still breathing onions and garlic.  And when my rice has been sitting in my rice cooker for to long the grains on the side of the pot get really hard and are undesirable to eat,  there was alot of those grains in my fried rice. Now my husband's pancakes, underwhelming to say the least, just no flavor and very dry. He was very disappointed and he LOVES pancakes!  He said he'd rather stay home and make store bought mix. This restaurant is named after a stack of pancakes, so why does the syrup come in a condiment cup?  Probably won't come back, which is sad since we love breakfast and especially Hawaiian breakfast (being from Hawaii). Who knows, never say never right?  If we ever do go back and it's good I will look forward to upgrading this review.   Oh wait!  The staff is very friendly however the servers are so busy we only got checked on once and towards the end of the meal... Good thing we didn't need anything. Two stars for being friendly.

N98XFaqLrB9tYL3Ut0qBAw.text: The food is pretty good. The pancakes taste great but are not fluffy at all. Don't expect good service wheb you come here.

pUWTOFQP0e3M7k7iSfjvaw.text: Delicious loved the atmosphere and the food. It was busy but still fast. Would visit again for another delicious pancake.

5sDwAHmb0yoBQ9dpDlA8vg.text: We stopped here for breakfast this past Tuesday, 1/23/18...spent the night at Boulder Station Hotel/Casino on our way to Arizona to visit family.  We googled places to eat before leaving hotel and decided to try this restaurant.  We were both pleasantly surprised to find that they served Island style breakfast (I was born and raised in Hawai'i, part Hawaiian/Chinese).  Anyway I had spam/eggs with rice and sliced tomatoes instead of pancakes.  Later I found out they had macaroni salad...that would have been the perfect Island breakfast.  My husband had Portuguese sausage/eggs with rice and pancakes.  He said the pancakes were a little dense for him.  The rice was cooked perfectly.    Our waiter was very friendly and helpful and we were seated right away...had to move to another table because the sun was in my husband's face.  Will certainly consider stopping here again on another trip to Arizona.

eYQ47xfAQrfwr5aW7Fktqw.text: Ranchero Skillet is the best thing here along with all the fun pancakes. I've tried almost all of them and they are all good. Great portions too, not too much so you aren't too full walking out. One of my fav breakfast spots.

QSqTuWY-ZJ7ebgkS5DZonw.text: Quaint, clean brunch spot that plays great music. The entire staff from the host to busser was very friendly. Our server Vangie (?) was on point. Boyfriend ordered the blueberry pancakes which came garnished with a generous portion of fresh blueberries & I had one of the most delicious club sandwiches ever. We'll definitely be going back.

I0Hcvxvq2u8vbNamv5jHdA.text: First time here! A little small.. The wait was not too bad! Loved the crepes! Can't wait til next weekend to have some more!

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Nutella Crepe!

W2mRQoawDqrrRLZm7V0sJA.text: Best pancakes I've ever had. If you are in the area and looking for a breakfast spot, you found it! Macadamia nut white chocolate pancakes were great. Service was good too.

LMvi7f2zHVpcQ96HhKjzUA.text: I love this place. It's very homey and the staff is very friendly.  The most popular is the red velvet pancakes, but the most to me the best one is the hazelnut pancake. Not to mention their banana foster pancake. Every time I come here it's very hard to decide because I can't decided what to get. I recommend this very time my visitors come here and they loved it.

9IPLF3po-o2c2I9ja_fwjw.text: At this time this particular location is NOT GETTING A RATING AT ALL! My husband & I showed up, let them know we we're waiting on our son & daughter-in-law & THEY REFUSED TO SEAT US TILL THEY WERE THERE! We wanted patio seating, which was limited. Asked for acting manager on duty  & tells us that's their policy & they had no control over it. After I said ' so you're refusing to give us service is what you're telling me by not seating us." He was going to make an exception then another patron sitting waiting for 2 more people decides to speak up saying it wasn't fair as she had been waiting! Needless to say they sat her at a table for 4 where we wanted to sit when there was ONLY GOING TO BE 3 people! We left angry & gave our business to Hash House A Go Go due to horrible policy & service at Babystacks!!! DO NOT EVER GO TO THAT LOCATION UNLESS YOUR WHOLE PARTY IS WITH YOU! VERY POOR POLICY! HORRIBLE!!!

aEefI1Fpk6-RiSKvu9GCjA.text: Great place, right when you walk in you can smell the fresh aroma of pancakes! I had the adobo omelette and chocolate chip pancake, it was outstanding. My mouth is salivating right now just thinking about it. Great service and great staff.

cyzbYchPx4WZkdi9YKEM1g.text: They made up for the last mishap. We were seated immediately and waited on right away. The food came out quit and I must say it was worth the wait. You absolutely have to get the garlic rice with onions Yummmm x2 . I got the baby stacks PB and ?? ...this was an excellent meal for sure.

pjYaE34QOeWKWH7-5_KSDw.text: Slow service, fairly ignored by staff on what seemed like a less busy time before noon.  Eggs Benedict was over cooked, but the pork was tasty.  Kind of disappointed based on reviews I read.  Could have been worse, but could have been a MUCH better experience.

mE2yK_FVOtYpDA9iL6pWFQ.text: Food is delicious and prices are good.  Restaurant is a little small, though.  Definitely worth a visit for breakfast.  I'd most likely go here before an IHOP or Denny's.  Their cookie butter french toast is my favorite.

pLL4CRN3PbhB1mRkAVaXOQ.text: Thanks to babystacks I've found the reason behind American obesity.   AMAZING FOOD AND SERVICE.

I1NIG4olwA8tGZxbFGSQXQ.text: This is basically my go to spot for breakfast.  the choices of pancakes, and I am always a sucker of spam and eggs. It is always really  busy so make sure that if you are going in to eat, you have time to spare.  Usually I get it all to go.  I think the biggest problem is the price point for me.  They charge a fair amount, but for the most part everything is solid.  If you are looking for a sweet Hawaiian breakfast joint with some wild flavors for pancakes, this is the place to go.

8zIGwbybfGNyoJFxm9jifg.text: Quality food good selection of pancakes. Have had the bacon pancakes, few breakfast skillets, and there lemon pancakes all have been wonderful.

UVf8Djt-6-qgla4PtQS3SQ.text: Nice little spot for breakfast. The atmosphere is kid friendly. Food is fresh and there is a ton of choices for pancakes and crepes. The only two gripes I have is the price, and when you order the crepes or pancakes they don't come with eggs or hash browns, so you will end up paying more for sides. The service is friendly. All and all a good place to eat breakfast.

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Kalua pulled pork eggs benedict w/ hash browns and a side of portuguese sausage.

Gg9f2Sz0E2dlhdDXzrVIXw.text: Good food. I ordered the red velvet pancakes. Fresh made to order . I have  to give a 4 star because I was sat near the bathroom and too many people walking past me bumping me while I eat.

ynmoo2uTPGU5qQBhZjXvJg.text: Baby stacks is fantastic. I would give them 5 stars but they do not offer fried rice, which is what I'm used to when I'm in Maui. They do have Portuguese sausage and fantastic pancakes, along with many other Hawaiian treats. The service is phenomenal and I've yet to have a bad me on the place.

IlrKAgWBBR0qUYBUuk-6Cg.text: This place was pretty awesome. Im a huge breakfast fan and pancakes and sweet breakfasts are my specialty. My sister ordered crepes and and got the cookie butter french toast and I didnt want it to end!! My mom ordered the red velvet pancakes and thought they were very thick but dry when I tried hers I totally agrees. Im happy with what I've ordered.

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States

Ij2NV5CoYhhgxDaZ1Cu5IQ.text: We read the great reviews here and decided to give it a try and were somewhat disappointed. Our server was super sweet I think they just happened to be understaffed because I didn't see any other servers except for her and I heard her mention to another table that they only had one cook. It just took a very long time to place our order and get the food. The hollandaise sauce on the eggs benedicts was not runny enough although it did have a good flavor still. We also had an omelette that needed to be remade as it didn't have any cheese in it and it was also very dry with only a couple pieces of ham. My huevos rancheros was excellent. So yea it was a little bit of an underwhelming experience just because I had high expectations based on the great reviews but I think we just caught them on an off day. I would still come back and give it another try.

72mqRKDFVsdqowE3UL1bTQ.text: Ricks Adobo Fried Rice, is my First Husbands favorite.  I'm still exploring the menu! Loved spam sliders, adore the red velvet Baby Stacks pancakes!   Service is sometimes an issue! Something very captivating going on in the kitchen this morning for example.... Almost had to refil my own coffee!

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Spam sliders and fried rice breakfast!!!!
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Serving it up to reggae in the morning!

DqWctvV6XsuCyd837655_g.text: This is our 4th time at BS. We have had NO issues in till todsy.  We wanted to treat our 11 yewr old daughter has NEVER been before.  My daughter and I both ordered Banana Creme Pie Pancakes. I was  enjoying them until i kept finding these little green things in my pancakes.  I asked our server .. who was actually very nice and she said it was because when you put the bananas in the batter it turned green and the batter had been sitting a while.  She graciously asked if she could make another order but  by this time I had lost my appetite  and declined the offer.  After this I don't think I will be going back.

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Green things inside the pancakes as well.
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Here is the green stuff. I have others thst are bigger EEEWWWWEEEEEE.

DUnkCxg-hSLw6V9IVPI51g.text: Finally, a BABYSTACKS IN HENDERSON!!! I disliked the fact that I had to drive all the way to Buffalo for this deliciousness. Now, I am lucky enough to have them close to work and home!  This pancake house is semi Hawaiian themed with things like Adobo Omlettes, garlic rice, and mac salad. All 3, great choices! There are also over a dozen pancake selections like red velvet, lemon ricotta, and bacon. I usually go with the seasonal specials such as strawberry lemonade, and bananas foster.  Never once have I been disappointed. Well, except for the wait time. Unless you go right when they open, or an hour before closing, expect to wait. None of the 3 locations are very big. I think they are going for that personal feel.  The service is pretty good. Not over the top amazing, but quick, decent, and friendly.  If you haven't tried Babystacks, it's worth a wait. Maybe not an hour wait, but this place is popular for a reason.

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. The inside of it
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Famous adobo omelette

E14XDGaUv1kIu4zDyQB4jw.text: So we kept hearing about the this awesome location from friends and from some gals from the Las Vegas Moms Blog. So we took a chance and came, I was so happy that we finally made our way here. The menu has a very big selection on pancakes and they all look yummy. So in our first visit I tried the Red Velvet and it was sooooo good, even my picky eater was curious and he ended up taking my last stack and only left me with half a pancake, I loved the cream cheese glaze, it wasnt too sweet and it complimented the pancake, so I can see why it is there best seller. I also took a chance with the Kaluia grilled cheese sandwhich, and it was awesome. I am not a fan of sourdough but the bread and cheese complimented the pork and added good texture and flavor. So today I am trying the breakfast burrito with Kaluia pork and the bacon on  the side, and an order of cinnamon bun pancakes.  I will update this review once I taste my customized burrito and unique pancake. But so far I am really digging this place it has an american, Filipino Hawaiian twist, and it really works out, especially if the Filipino in you wants rice with your food.

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States

k8VWCLImX0wfg5R7z5AngQ.text: The Loco Moco   Translated from Spanish... The Crazy Booger!  And that is pretty much what it looked like. Unappetizing and bland, it wasn't worth the $10 I paid. With all the 4 and 5 star ratings I see here, I must have caught this cafe on a bad day. But no excuses allowed.  A place better avoided.

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. The Loco Moco with garlic rice for $10. Translated from Spanish... &#34;Crazy Booger&#34;

lBuEtqtIDsHRf2Qsyxz8JA.text: My egg omelette was good with my side buttermilk pancakes. On the other hand, my other half says not to order the ham and eggs with rice. The ham is like sandwich ham and only one scoop of rice. Pancakes were a little under cooked. The worst part of the experience was the service. Everyone has bad days but I think our waiter couldn't keep up with coming back to check on taking our order, bringing us coffee refills, cleaning up a drink spill, bringing back a to go box and bringing our bill. We had to find another server to help us. Guess we have to find a new breakfast spot.

obgJ-hX79zs4cP9Kg2lRuA.text: The restaurant was bustling on Sunday morning, but fortunately we only waited for 5 minutes. We were seated at a table right next to the door for the patio. They may want to reconsider seating guests that close. During our whole meal we were interrupted by gusts of air and people passing right next to us.  Coffee was good, refills prompt.  I had the special for the day: Mocha Chip Pancakes. The mocha flavor was not discernible. But to for a chocolate chip pancake they were good.  My friend had eggs Benedict which was cooked beautifully and the hollandaise was creamy and rich.  Worth the visit, fix the seating and it would be a better experience.

bJUYjBhCrXkCmpsnqDxQKw.text: I will admit they have delicious food. My pancakes tasted fantastic, the bacon was cooked perfectly. Got my food pretty quickly.  I went with a group of friends and at the end of our meal we asked for our checks and he came back with one check. We didn't know that we couldn't split the check in until we got to the register. But bad customer service doesn't make me want to go back.

yO8tEESmiN7CNo2Pap3U_Q.text: We have gone at least 3 times on a Sunday morning and they are usually pretty packed.  We haven't had to wait very long.  I LOVE the German chocolate pancakes!  I think the food is slightly above average, but where they are way above average is the pancakes!  There are so many fun flavors to choose from.  The red velvet are also really tasty.  We usually get a breakfast plate (eggs or omelet) with a side of pancakes and we never can finish it all.  Lots of food!  Unique and delish!

VGiIVxQ_5IZ-iB6c5z1l2g.text: Good food. And friendly service. I will definitely stop by again if I'm in the area in the morning. Their hash brown and Portuguese sausage was really good and the prices are reasonable.

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States

D968KW6hW4TkNqBzI0HMQQ.text: Ok so I have to write a review on this place. One because I have need had a meal, let alone 3 meals that tasted so amazing and two because they deserve it!   When walking in,I didn't know what to expect. A normal diner/ cafe. The host was very nice greeted us with a smile and a pleasant how are you. Table was instantly ready no wait. When seated they offered us drinks. We looked over the menu and ordered! Oh and our server what also nice along with a lady serving us drinks.   So we ordered, German chocolate pancakes, short shake chocolate chip pancakes, and biscuits and gravy( with potatoes, eggs , and a sausage patty). The food came out pretty quick!   Now I'm not much of an egg person but these eggs were so amazing that my family tried and kept picking off my plate. Well I can't complain to much considering I was picking off their plate too! Seriously, all three plates tasted amazing!!! I never had an export emcee where every dish on the table tasted so good. It's usually only one dish that tastes good!   For an out of town experience, I highly suggest this place! Great food, friendly staff, cozy eating establishment, and an empty stomach.

J-FGUkLcaGCQVa1bn8XyfQ.text: I absolutely love the food here, it's delicious. I give the food a 5 star hands down  but the service is not great. I sometimes think then when a restaurant has good food they act like jerks because they know your gonna be back. You can't split your check no more then 2 people, and they are really rude about that. You can see the annoyance on their face and honestly I think that's just unprofessional. You can tell they get annoyed when it gets crowded but it's a restaurant with amazing food of course it's always going to be packed. I worked at a restaurant and I know at times it can feel overwhelming but this is what You signed up for, so if your gonna work in a restaurant treat your guest nicely.

LDkr0x3g6-C7fV4c9a7niw.text: We love coming to baby stacks it's our favorite breakfast spot and the food is amazing the food gets 5 stars and service is usually pretty great as well I give Valerie 5 stars. Unfortunately this time my service was awful!!!!  We got there at around 10:30 we were seated promptly after and greeted by a guy who took our drink order coffee, raspberry tea, a water, and a kids apple juice as we watched him walking back and forth and still no drinks we assumed he had forgotten then he stops again still no drinks and takes our food order and tells us he'll be back with our drinks "ok " 10 more minutes pass by and finally we get our drinks, roughly we waited for drinks about 20-25 minutes which is completely ridiculous! Now we get our food about 5 minutes after finally receiving our drinks and my friend who ordered toast with her omelet asks for jelly he says ok and that he'll be right back with that did he ever come back with jelly??? You guessed it nope no jelly from him I stood up myself and grabbed jelly off the breakfast bar.  now our food is almost gone our plates are piled up he never came back to refill our drinks or ask us how we were doing. Finally my friend gets up to ask the hostess to speak to the manager and guess who shows up at our table you guessed it Erik our server who is also "the manager" we let him know everything that went wrong and before he ever apologized his excuse was that he was busy mind you the restaurant is small and probably has a capacity of  maybe 100 ppl coming from the industry and management 101 your busy is never ever an excuse! You alway always first and foremost sincerely apologize to your guest! Ps to the general manger of this restaurant "Clariza" please be aware of who you leave in charge of your restaurant and get him more training ASAP  It says a lot that the worst service We have ever received came from the manager of your restaurant!!!  Don't ask for Erik aka the manager he is the guy with the colored mushroom on top of his head.  Do ask for Valerie she is awesome!

OkgWzZ4qOHWXKTb88kpZgg.text: Best crepes ever! The strawberry crepe was not overly sweet. It was just right. Coffee was really good. Staff were friendly and efficient.

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Strawberry crepes!

RkHQXvhPgCdtR-gsanofkQ.text: Every single thing was scrumptious-- coming from a person who is kind of indifferent to breakfast foods, trust this review. The table ordered country fried steak and eggs, loco moco, honey French toast, red velvet baby stacks, buttermilk baby stacks, chili skillet, and strawberry Nutella crepes. Every single bite was fresh, aesthetically appealing, and delicious.  We arrived 15 minutes before closing yet there was no sign of disgruntlement from any of the staff. Our server was extremely sweet-- and in celebration of a birthday, we were given a buttermilk baby stack with a candle.   Sweet food... Sweet service...

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Strawberry Nutella crepe!
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Honey French toast
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Red velvet baby stacks

bXveT-1nx_mXzv4HsJb34w.text: Service, wonderful.  Pancakes, leaden, could've been used as a doorstop. Even though the menu was inventive... It just didn't add up.    What's with the cold syrup in the little cafeteria cups??? This is a place that specializes in PANCAKES. I get something poured into a cup from a jug with no flavor? You can do better. What's with the packets of cold butter next to my leaden pancakes? Butter should be soft, pancakes should be hot. This is breakfast 101 folks.  Syrup goes on the table or comes heated from the kitchen.  Pancakes are light and fluffy.   Perhaps the Hawaiian fare is better, but if your star act can't pull off a good show, I'm a bit cool on the understudies.    Not worth the wait.

WYA0V_o7L03oQpvMpuyHyg.text: We decided to order pick up for Breakfast thru phone, gave them more time to prepare for it, when my husband was ready to pick up our order the cashier said that they never receive our order and keeps insisting that we order in a different location & because my husband keeps saying that we ordered in that location they got mad, so my husband said if they can pull out all the orders that they have in there system so my husband saw his number and the order was made in that location.1st of all before you say something to your customer  please double check all the orders!  They apologized because they said that they forgot our order, REALLY? after how many minutes of waiting. Worst Restaurant!

20S-eQJZgbsVgPVTVc2Iaw.text: This place is popping! Service was a bit slow but understandable considering how busy they were. The red velvet pancakes are a must have. Will be coming back to try their other pancakes.

7FSy7TDzRsBwPyJ8w_p-XQ.text: Small portions.  Disorganized but friendly staff. I want to like you but you need to improve on portion size and organization

Y4Nt__idKCkFjjN_3k-EXQ.text: Babystacks is great.  We've been here 5 times and it is consistently good.  Orange dreamsicle pancakes were really good and my kids love the chocolate chip and smores pancakes.  My husband lives the skillet meals.  Service has been excellent,  but come early on the weekends or you'll have a long wait as seating is limited.  Worth the wait though.

RVBO0aUYp0Jnmagak5rEuw.text: The lightest most tender pancakes I can remember having. We got the bananas foster and lemon ricotta. The BF were sublime. Bacon was also perfect. Great service and good atmosphere. The wait is a bit long,  but legitimately worth it. I will definitely be back.

Pe5i7EqaAC_2p8Z1bqakWA.text: I have given this place 2 tries now and think I have a good idea of the restaurant. The food is good but could be warmer, the items don't seem hot just warm. Service both times has been subpar and well, bad. The prices are decent and the serving sizes match. I wouldn't say this place is worth the wait or that anything stands out on the menue. This is a good breakfast joint for the area to avoid the Cafe at Sunset or the drive-thru.

jyISt4tg1ljHtXSQPZTxKw.text: Came here strictly for the red velvet pancakes. Only place in the area that has them available and ready, and not over 45 minute wait. I was pleasantly surprised to see they have a lot of local/Hawaiian options and fusion dishes. I'm a big fan. Try the adobo fried rice, or chilli skillet. Go outside your comfort zone.

aDPaf6vVjrU4OQZPUJ_7CQ.text: I've never been seated right away, but It is worth every minute of waiting. This place is ALWAYS packed because their food is AMAZING! Definitely feeds the soul. I love the Ma & Pop feel to this place, you're treated like family here. Love, love, love it!

CO_cSHp9nLRuf0ou6TF1Zw.text: My brother and the rest of my family demand to come here every time they come to Vegas. It's a cut above everywhere else pancake. If they killed some chicken and waffles (hint hint) I'd never go anywhere else for breakfast!

Fme-FeJC-ppWbJyHtLSTXQ.text: Earlier today I was in Henderson. I didn't want to drive back on my side of town to get to baby stacks(buffalo and flamingo). So I had a 'oh what the heck' attitude and went to this baby stacks.   Why did I rate 1 star? I was very disappointed in this baby stacks. My girlfriend and I ordered 2 full stacks of pancakes. We waited ALMOST 40 MINUTES for our order to come thru. What made me really mad is that we didn't even get any compensation. Like a discount or even free side dishes like hash browns. Even before we could order, our waiter didn't even greet us nor take our order in a timely manner. So after 40 minutes of waiting we finally got our meal. The pancakes tasted bland and they were also burnt. At this point I didn't want to make a scene. So I forcefully ate my burnt pancakes and wanted to leave.   Never again will I ever go to this location. And to be honest, I feel like this place is just hype. Some of the prices for food are just ridiculous for the amount of food you get. I feel like most of the food they serve, you can make at home... Let's be real. For the amount of food they give you, quality of the food, bad service, do you really want to spend your hard earned money here?

WC_pL7Bb4tEFwXAgreMPyg.text: I am so happy babystacks opened up on the east side.  I was driving all the way to Durango for those biscuits and red velvet pancakes,  and it was worth it!!  Luckily that's no longer necessary.    Stop by Sunset & Stephanie to enjoy all they have to offer.   Expect a super long wait on the weekends, go before 9.

L6g1oPHxL0J_mu9B3l3qRQ.text: Great service (cute Hispanic girl) always kept my husband and my coffee filled, great food, awesome menu!!! red velvet pancakes are the biz!!!!!!! My new favorite spot!!!!!!!

LoXx3YpAttpecibDMvAENw.text: This place is a nice, bright, clean place with friendly staff. I had the orange creme pancakes, lovely presentation, very sweet creme and icing sugar syrup. I know I'll be craving more sweets all day, OMG, we are now driving behind a cupcake truck, I'm thinking I can just hop in the back till I just roll out. They also have a discounted Senior special at Babystacks, so that's another good thing

0C6oJiYtX4GsFoJREIBXuA.text: Friendly staff and some unique breakfast combinations. Flavors always pop.  The pulled pork and spam are worth a look!

Db89_XCee7Mzc7VubmjAEw.text: Loco moco was perfect and the macaroni salad was delish! Will def come again. People were really nice.

Qua-nGp7ZAXYAh05u3yTTA.text: Great breakfast place! Wide variety of pancakes, and I always think it's a bonus when you can order Portuguese sausage with rice for your morning. Chili loco moco has chili like Zippy's, for you Hawaii folks out there. Will def need to try that when I go back. Red velvet pancakes are a fan favorite for a reason.

WdoLo1kj2VxvmDCRsy_k2A.text: Their pancakes seem like they might be too sweet but they are really good. The orange juice and iced tea had a weird taste though

wsLT_o1IHO3Q0Ma3C6uAEg.text: The wait staff was good but the hostess and the man working the register are completely incompetent.  Tons of people waiting empty tables and nobody is being seated!!!  This place is a joke!

jr0AOm8h0rPvA--looD5pA.text: I like babystacks for who they are but I think they can improve on the quality of food that they dish out. I ordered the corned beef, hash browns and and eggs. It came out warm kinda like it's been sitting in the open for a while. I wasn't too happy about that. Coras corned beef hash wasn't really special either it tasted and looked like it came out of a can, no flavor what so ever, their potatoes were not seasoned or up to temperature as well basically got a warm-cold breakfast. A breakfast platter from McDonald's comes out hotter than that. so I probably wouldn't order it again. Their specialty is pancakes and their red velvet never disappoints.  I didn't expect much from their other breakfast items.

pSB7Sv2d9pFi-MkyUOTJHA.text: A unique blend of Polynesian breakfast food and specialty pancakes. My favorite so far are the red velvet pancakes! But I've also had the s'more pancakes and they were good too. I would choose a skillet over an omelet...wasn't too impressed with my omelet.

8zjQ0NLbP7kKaDu570FP6g.text: Love the pancakes...I've bee trying some of the different breakfast items such as the Portuguese sausage and the spam and eggs scramble with steamed rice. It is ALL good. If you go on weekends, you are probably going to have to wait, but I have never waited longer than 20 minutes. The service is great also. This is certainly at the top of my favorite breakfast restaurants.

kWBDkdGfZmvFxucdh5n4jg.text: Heard great things about this place so drug my brother in for brunch before grocery shopping. The place is nice a little cramped but clean. However service stinks, oeople that came in after us got served before us. Our waiter was nice, but it was slow and he kept dissapearing. I ordered the kalua grilled cheese my brother the mecican skillet with a short order of carrot cake pancakes. It took 40 minutes for our food. It was hot my grilled cheese was great my hashbrowns perfect my brother said his skillet was ok that he had better. We were both done with our plates and no pancakes. We waited 10 more min the waiter came out with them. His apology "sorry for the wait but at least their fresh" rubbed us the wrong way. I really wanted to like this place but the service stinks. I will not be hoing back.

bX5PMaxr2cIyikuU3CfILg.text: In LOVEEEEEE How many heart emojis can I use to fill up this review????   The pancakes are all dessert for breakfast and I'm dyingggg.. so good!   The Hawaiian inspired food is so unique and ono..loves the kalua pork eggs Benedict and the adobo omelette. Still Drooling

e5Oi3lCVzzCvmM76s5Nr3Q.text: I absolutely loved this place. For months I came here at least three times a week for breakfast. The first thing I will say is that I've never been to a restaurant that many times and heard so many people complain about their food or service around me. They always messed up people's orders when I was in there and they did it to me a few times too. I can understand one or two mistakes here and there but they happen much more at baby cakes than any other restaurant I've been to. The waiters and waitresses always blame it on the kitchen and say they have a new cook. I've heard that one a few times spread out between months of visiting.   The final straw for me was terrible service and attitude from a waitress that has served me many times there. I'm always real nice to the staff and I like all of them except for this one lady. I tip well and I would eat there all the time. The food is good but I'm very picky with who I decide to give my money to. If the service is bad then I will take my business elsewhere. On this particular day that made me stop going my meal had been sent back THREE times for being wrong. In all this time they never even brought my pancakes out. After the third time of having to send my food back I made a fuss about it and said "what's going on back there? I've been here for an hour and a half. The least you guys can do is bring the pancakes out to eat while I wait for my food to come."   The waitress must of had a bad day that day because she didn't give me an apology or show the slightest bit of sympathy. That's when I said it seems like you guys don't even care. You know I can take my business elsewhere right? She said "yes, I know that and that's totally up to you."  That was it for me. I got up without my food and left my money on the counter (plus a $4 tip) and walked out. I'll never go back again. I took over 20 people to this place and ate there more than anywhere else in town. I might check out the other location one day but in spite of how I was treated I will never go to this location again. I hope they get some management in there that actually cares about the customers and quality of staff from the kitchen to the front door. For the record the waitress I spoke of was the only one there that I've seen wearing glasses. Terrible attitude

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Cookies and cream pancakes. Sorry I couldn&#39;t wait..

C1Gy2KS-nu9iVnQ0xVqGIQ.text: This place is typically packed out on the weekends, especially Saturday and Sunday mornings...however, the wait is worth it. The red velvet pancakes are phenomenal!

TfAtvjEIAs2ZPxJBF0ydsA.text: This place is really good. No pretense no fancy flowers at your table just the good stuff. Fair and reasonable prices super friendly wait staff. Yummy pancakes , good omelets, and unique dishes.. But duh get the pancakes they are amazing, moist and absorbs the delish topping. German chocolate taste just like the cake. Don't pretend your dieting you just end up regreting that life choice .

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Omelet love
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Cinnabun
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Chocolate chip

falRknDIM8NJrTHl_oTbMw.text: Server has been great, hostess - disoriented ( placed other couple before us - even though it was our turn) Food is great except coffee(tastes very cheap )

wvjA5w0A-67EJgQ_y99diw.text: The food was incredible! Highly recommend the fried rice, and all of the specialty pancakes. The service was wonderful and speedy. I'll definitely be back!

iRzaiKs7BwBATb1oMMI7uw.text: One of my fave breakfast spot ever since they opened. I usually just get their full order of Red Velvet Pancakes but when I'm really hungry, I order their delicious Lolo Rick's Adobo Fried Rice and just a side of the pancakes. Mmm! *burp*

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States

aSQGgHjcOAYCvSp99d8KxQ.text: Everything we got was great. Banana cream crepe and Nutella crepe were delicious. Carrot cake pancakes with the cream cheese "syrup" or should I say,frosting? Was great too.   Hubby got spam Benedict on Hawaiian bread. He said he loved that as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States

Oqs3ttVughuyMAoZnza_gg.text: Baby Stacks has one of the most unique arrays of pancakes....red velvet ..peanut butter and in pic ( i had to have these) Butterfinger pancakes and yummmmm to these... 20 minute wait and worth every moment sitting down also shown a Cowboy Skillet Chicken Fried Steak plate and French Toast Combo... clean quick and kudos to the kitchen good hot food.. this one is a do again

GK5uxC9fXe47sD40k1PAng.text: Where do I even begin!   This place is so adorable first of all and it just gets better.  The service was fantastic and the pancakes....ohhhh the pancakes = heaven!   I had the hazelnut pancakes which are drizzled with Nutella and have chopped hazelnuts on them and a huge dollop of the freshest whipped cream. Then I had them add strawberries...then I died and went to heaven from my first to my last bite!  Nobody should miss this place!  I will definitely return every trip!

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Hazelnut pancakes with strawberries added

6YWBgx3Uei6mK1YSl62VWw.text: First timers!!! Great food and a huge selection of pancakes . Fast & Friendly Service. Open for bfast and lunch only. Adobo Omelette was delicious and was a huge portion. Red Velvet pancakes was heavenly

B_Sq7SwAtNupdW1KmlyrFA.text: We came when they first opened, it was just ok. Their pancakes were yummy . We came again 6 months ago and they've gotten better! Here again w my son, he wanted pancakes and I wanted something filling. I got my island food and he got his pancakes! Food is getting a little better and I'm glad for their business! Good variety of food here, servers are friendly and I like that they're allowed to have their own style and yet look clean in appearance :) our server had a poofy mushroom shaped hair and it was awesome! Lol.

npSlZUEsQmD6D7lw1-0hZw.text: This is my favorite breakfast place, I always get the s'mores pancakes and the potatoes. The pancakes are super sweet and yummy and the potatoes offset the sweet with the perfect amount of savory spice. I definitely recommend this place for breakfast and brunch!

ujMGYhMGdfaUG-h7NaDDzg.text: Usually very busy on weekend mornings.  If you can wait for a seat at those times...you can have a good bfast.  I find the pancakes can be overpowering sweet on some choices...but if you tone it down and pair it up with some bacon and eggs...its can be pleasant. Seating areas are not very large hence the wait when busy.. Coffee is mediocre.

KzYbYycHutcyVfvT6wnjFw.text: 5 star concept, 3 star food, but I'll take the average.  This place is all about the pancakes.  They do itty bitty pancakes which is great if you want to try a bunch of fun flavors / not overdose on the enormous pancakes that are usually offered at most brunch establishments.  That being said, the food was just ok.  I think it's a great local spot, but not somewhere I'd go out of my way for.  The service was nice but incredibly slow and disorganized.  Our food came out in weird increments (about 15 min apart) so that wasn't great.

B-SSFWrKJ4X57StZ99LAkg.text: Discovered this hidden gem while visiting my sister in Vegas. We went here for our post-Thanksgiving breakfast and it was a perfect fusion of American-Hawaiian-Filipino! Spam and eggs over garlic fried rice was awesome. GO ALREADY!!

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. homemade corn beef hash and over easy eggs over yummy garlic fried rice
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. traditional fluffy blueberry pancakes
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. spam and over easy eggs over yummy garlic fried rice

BKxqMEs4mn5sclFJh_-_yQ.text: I love the plethora of pancake varieties at Babycakes and have had several but I highly recommend the Orange Cream ones they are to die for! The Banana Cream Pies are pretty darn good too! The chocolate ones are too rich for me but if you really like chocolate they will probably be right up your alley!  I usually have a short stack and share a side of bacon with my friend!   The service here is usually really friendly and quick but fair warning they are popular and have a small seating area so you might have a tad of a wait (but they are worth it)!

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. I adore the orange cream pancakes...so so good!

AgGveUOAiORUfmh7i2Js8Q.text: I came with my family since we were in the area for my daughter's soccer tournament. This place came up when I googled "breakfast."  Small but quaint place.  The food is a Hawaiian/Filipino blend, which I liked since I'm Filipino. We had to wait for 15-20, which wasn't bad. The overall service was attentive and fast.    There were a lot of choices from savory to sweet on the menu but the most impressive items on it were the pancake selections, there were so many to choose from since they all sound so good. I went with the German Chocolate pancakes and they are to die for.  I have been craving them since I left Vegas.  I wish they had a place like this in LA.   Now if I go back to Vegas my "must" stop breakfast place will be Babystacks for sure!!  Maybe next time I will try the more savory stuff but definitely will get one of their pancakes choices as well.

ODFrxAywxW-2aGm8XHQ2fA.text: I was just there trying to get seated 10/26/2017 12pm this dude asked me how many I said 2 I asked him to seat me he said no it's against company policy! What the hell is that all about so I said no just seat me he refused until my other guy showed. That's bull shit so I left and Mi Mi's sat me immediately! I will never go back there!

0wB3mQ16y0V0LrWZagg7vw.text: Moved here from Hawaii and was missing home! Came in for breakfast and the food was amazing! Reminded me of home! Everyone is super friendly and the music take me back for sure! Wonderful breakfast spot!

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Spam scramble was bomb dot com

60gsiySUQvMhFrBdKvll3Q.text: I've been around this area a lot and never really noticed this place. Great find thanks to Yelp. I enjoyed everything, the potatoes especially, they have great seasoning. I think they were the best I've tried at any breakfast place. Would definitely come back. Friendly service as well.

ZeP1BEZ1f7IyHTGbVfk59w.text: Be prepared to wait.  They are popular!  Service and food were very good.  Enjoy!

8AvIvvL7fyoYwj6g3C_KpA.text: Acknowledged upon entering welcoming. Sat at A table. Ordered the senior breakfast scrambled eggs sausage patty and substituted the hashbrowns with tomatoes and I ordered a coffee none of it was good. And I mean like to drink my coffee black and only add cream and sugar if it doesn't taste good that didn't help the basic coffee too weak. the waitress was very good pleasant and quick . I did notice a nice Hawaiian referenced menu items so perhaps they specialize in that area. But just the basic type breakfast no. the eggs were not good the sausage was over cooked came with two pancakes so I got to try that they are named for. I wouldn't recommend it if you just want to senior breakfast.

_EkwoPUzvVsoAeIpqxXDJQ.text: It was really bad!! Egg over cook  and cold. No flavor . Hash browns Coke's and no flavor .  Waited more then 15 min when it was not busy.  Don't go.

7XMwNxPhzsfDToA6zbI0TA.text: I love coming here for breakfast. This is a smaller location than the other baby stacks. There will be a line regardless of which location you will go. The longest I wait was 30 mins, but it also depends on your party. Service also depends on your waiter and how busy it is that day. Also keep in mind, this location does not split the checks right now.   The food is delicious. I always get the chili moco and upgrade to garlic rice. It's basically a loco moco with Hawaiian chili on top. You can also upgrade If you are extremely hungry it might not full you up. I also add red velvet pancakes to it. Their red velvet pancakes are amazing. They are sweet, but not overly sweet. The sauce you pour over the pancakes compliments the pancakes very well.   Lolo adobo fried rice omelette is pretty good as well. It is a savory dish if you are looking for something like that. It is the "locals favorite".  I also love their lemon ricotta. The best way to describe it is that it is like a crepe. It comes out on a huge plate. But I noticed the size has been getting smaller over the years. Which makes me sad. But the flavors are amazing and it light on your stomach. One of my favorite items on the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States

D4RS4HBNjRvsgtNzs-fBWA.text: Ya can pretty much bank on the fact that this place must be amazingly awesome....as we have to drive almost 2 HOURS to get there!!!  The service is great, the staff is all so nice, and the food is top notch.  There is nothing better than a yummy Eggs Benedict to start my day with a smile...but at Babystacks Cafe, they kick it up a huge notch by making it with Hawaiian Kailua Pork!!!!  They actually have five Benedicts on the menu, but this is the one that stops me in my tracks from trying any other dish!!!  I would also recommend getting the Garlic rice rather than plain...mmmmmmm!!! My sweetie likes the Country Benedict...and it is good too...but the flavor of that Kailua Pig is totally memorable, and not to be missed!!

Snggx4B8RNgrlUseDjaNVA.text: Love Babystacks, and this was my first time at this specific location. Came for brunch and we were seated pretty quickly. Took a while for all three of us to make a decision, they never rushed us just allowed us to take our time. With each order he went over our options. I had a breakfast burrito with an upgrade of red velvet pancakes. Both were really good and tasted freshly made. Another in my party had Adobo Fried Rice and enjoyed it. The third party had a Piglet skillet. He liked it but said "he's had better.   I felt they were very accommodating and checked on us regularly. I've always enjoyed their food and service at all of their locations, and will be visiting this particular location more regularly from here on out.

EA6r1n-0AwTXLGlYlpynJg.text: Wow everything was so delicious!  My boyfriend and I had been wanting to come here for awhile and finally made it in.  We shared the loco moco with garlic rice and hashbrowns, short stack of red velvet pancakes, and a side of spam.  Our server was also great, unfortunately i forgot her name, she was quick with the refills, checked on us, and brought the check quickly.  She also brought me a togo cup for my soda.  We can't wait to come back to try some more delicious food!

UCYNcTGqTUZANhqE3K_5HA.text: laura our server has absolute amazing customer service, she gave us great recommendations and was super nice and funny! as for the food, i got the bacon and eggs with hash browns and cinabon pancakes. the pancakes, hash browns, and eggs were amazing! not the biggest fan of the bacon, but it was not bad at all! my friend got the country fried steak and the fourth of july special pancakes, the steak is good, gravy is okay, pancakes were bomb! overall, breakfast was great:)

WE6Aws9QCx8bN7gaI_At4g.text: Looking for a great brunch spot, this is the place! The portions are big and if you are craving some good flavored pancakes and moco locos, you need to get them here!  [Environment] Roomy and spacious to walk around; especially during the busy brunch time hours. It can get pretty chatty but you can still socialized amongst your friends and family.  [Service] The staff here is friendly and prompt. Even through the hectic brunch hours they still remain friendly and are patient with you. So don't feel rushed. Our drinks were always topped off and we really felt welcomed  [Food] The food was delicious. I enjoyed my Chili Moco Loco, the portion was really big for the price and had to take some home. The crepes were also yummy, topped with fresh fruits of your choice and NUTELLA! The red velvet pancakes was also yummy! They come out in red and look pretty cool!  Overall, I enjoyed it here and was a satisfied. If you are looking for a good brunch this, this is the place!   [ See it, Taste it, Yelp it! ]

2OmQ-owBUIY3Yxpm5TH8lQ.text: Service was great. I got ribs and eggs.. beef ribs were chewy. But everything else was delicious. Everyone at my table loved their food and would recommend this place

Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Ribs and eggs
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Country fried steak

qstsE_TioBotYl3xO2ny5g.text: Traveling across the states with a hamster... and I get that they don't allow pets inside unless it's a service animal, but really...   Was looking forward to coming here, and it turns out that 2hrs after opening they didn't set up the patio. Asked if they could, and was told no, it's closed. It wasn't busy, they still had tables. Didn't try to help or accommodate; they were not nice about it at all. It wouldn't have hurt to pull out one of their many tables and just 2 chairs for some business. The boy working at the front kept staring at us after, too.   It wasn't like we demanded it, we asked nicely. But his attitude and the way he went about it killed it for me. Bf told me to order to go because he knew I really wanted the food, but the host boy helped me decide that they wouldn't get our business.

1VtsLB_IkgnYTWDlYqcL4Q.text: I still like the island inspired dishes, the chill vibe here and budget wise is great for families . ..but the pancakes, still blah.. :sighs:....   Those drool worthy pix are slightly misleading. Whenever I get an upgraded stack, I ended up wasting 3/4 of it, just eating the topping.  Granted Babystacks comes up with creative dressings, but take all that away and have it plain, you're left with a DRY, lifeless, flat pancakes.  Yeah that's right F. L. A. T.. I don't know why the hell they're described as fluffy. At least it cheap enough that you don't feel ripped off.  With other places rockin Asian Fusion breakfasts, Babystacks needs to step it up, or more like fluff it up.

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Butterfinger Pancakes...looks good.. but really dry..
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Mocha Chip with coffee pancake batter one of the September Specials..

FYlfHcXHT5zkxKeYB5dXpQ.text: Babystacks doesn't and never disappoints !   A local favorite, it's always busy and packed but waiting time is decent and not bad at all.  To sum it up,  it's a good alternative to Cracked Egg or Eggworks, and much better alternative to IHOP or Denny's.  'Nuff said!

o_7Wg_66yn73z6c1plJh4A.text: I REEEEAAAALLLYYYY enjoyed my breakfast here. I found the place on Yelp a month ago & as soon as I got to town I had to try them out!   The place is small and cozy. I opted to see at the island and save the tables for patrons with othet guests since I was dining in alone while waiting to pick up a relative from the airport.   I ordered the German chocolate short order of pancakes & the Portuguese sausage cooked well done. THEY PREPARED EVERYTHING PERFECT!!!!! I'm not a breakfast snob & rarely have to have it, but when I do crave it, I'm ecstatic when they don't disappoint.   Service was just ok. I wasn't wowed. I wasn't pissed off, but it was just ok. I will definitely be going back!!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. German chocolate pancakes &amp; Portuguese sausage

GQMyOi_PVB3Ms9lp_rjd6Q.text: Read a lot of great reviews on this place so decided to check them out since we were staying in the Henderson area. IT WAS AWESOME. If I lived here, I'd be here quite often!  First off, let's not jump to calling this place "Hawaiian" food. Some things in the menu are reminiscent of home... but it definitely doesn't qualify as "Hawaiian" food. Now that I got that out of the way...  Tons of parking in the shopping center. I came around 10am on a weekday and they were already packed. Put out names on the list and waited around 15 minutes. They're quick! The staff is super friendly. The place is clean and well-lit. Menu is super easy to understand and there are SO MANY choices! You can have you classic breakfast, or be a little more daring. I opted for a classic breakfast.   Got the bacon and eggs. You have an option to upgrade to garlic rice... do it! Well, I love garlic so that was definitely a given. It was so good! For my breakfast, I also got to have pancakes or toast. Go with the pancakes. Don't even think about it. You can upgrade to any of their pancakes. I went with the orange creamsicle. I was in heaven! Seriously, I'm not a sweets nor a pancake person but I LOVED IT. So good. Still thinking about it today.   The prices are reasonable. I highly recommend. Highly.   Enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Tea time!
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Bacon and Eggs and Garlic Rice
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Orange CREAMSICLE! So GOOD

TnOrKW078MzAKyHdwUe5cw.text: This place was delicious.  I will be visiting again next time I am in vegas.  It was so hard to choose from this menu because everything sounded so good so my two friends and I basically ordered a feast to share.  From the mocha chip pancakes to the adobo fried rice and spam sliders.  Five stars!

HZaHdhuhGNMlf-VislShJA.text: Long lines but moves quickly.  The buttermilk pancakes were definitely amazing.  All other food seemed pretty average.

HFVtKIbtCIgUm7fG-_BwDQ.text: Babystacks is a Hawaiian/American fusion diner. I always have a hard time deciding on which item to pick since there are a lot of unique and delicious choices. My wife's go-to dish is the loco moco, and I usually get something different each time I dine here. For pancake lovers however, I recommend the red velvet pancakes. As basic as it sounds for you ted velvet haters, just give it a try, it's really good. I'm not much of a dessert person, but I admit they're pretty good.

AhUAueVJl3P0m7T6eLoqAA.text: A must try spot! It can get very crowded, so either come super early for breakfast, or be prepared for a wait! I come for the adobo fried rice! It's my favorite! Pulled meat and rice all covered in omelette style eggs with a side! I love the crispy potatoes! Salty savory goodness!  They also have a HUGE selection of what I call fancy pancakes! The pancakes alone are a special experience!

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Adobo fried rice and crispy potatoes!

zmNl7bfkg1-YeUlKexln_Q.text: I don't love the pancakes but my daughter sure did. I love their garlic rice and Hawaiian specials. A definite must for a unique breakfast experience. It's small and gets packed but worth the wait.

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States

yqtj_9mnhDrg_PjBIp1OGw.text: So many options, so little time. Excellent menu, excellent food. Come early & come hungry. Slightly on the pricey side, but worth not having to peel apart that sticky IHOP menu only to find the same old disappointing options. 5 stars!

rlouskc1aiuLZlIkWDu_xw.text: Bring your appetite and a couple shots of insulin.   Babystacks serves up delicious albeit high calorie pancakes.    Take your pick from Banna's Foster , chocolate s'more, or the one the are known for - Red Velvet.     I got a large stack of those...whew !  too much.   It was like eating a big plate of candy bars.   Tasty but too much.  They have all the other regular breakfast staples including some nice benedicts.    All in all they do a good job.

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States

4kMNyOwmaCoaBbl9rxKn4A.text: I heard so many great things about this restaurant from my husband but when I got there, I was not impressed. The pancakes were great but the service we received today was horrible.   Our waitress took our drink orders- we ordered 2 coffees, one water and one Pepsi. We only received 1 coffee and 2 waters and no soda. We asked the waitress for another coffee and the soda and she tried to correct us and told us we didn't order it. Our table had no sugar so we didn't have sugar for the one coffee as well. 10 minutes later, I received my coffee and my husband got his soda about the same time our food came out.  The food was great and the pancakes are one of a kind! I'm not complaining about that at all! The short stacks comes with 3 pancakes and the regular comes with 5. You may think 3 cakes aren't enough but they're good sized pancakes with toppings on them! If you order a meal, you can add a stack of 2 pancakes for 1.75 more or less- that's a dang good deal too!  Our waitress came back to make sure everything was okay and we said we needed some sugar for the coffee, a to go box and a refill on the drinks... We got the box and sugar but refill. So my boyfriend had nothing left to drink at all. We packed our to go box and our waitress offered us a refill- which was too late because we were already about to leave and pay. We still tipped her the 15%, not for good service but we didn't want to be rude.   When we paid, we told the cashier what happened and he was kind enough to offer us a refund on the drinks or a drink to go but at that point, we just wanted to leave.   All in all, We will return to baby stacks again but hopefully we won't have that girl as our waitress.

jnZsUN-5VWjqetsm67GztQ.text: Small location but very attentive staff.  Coffee was very good.   I had lemon ricotta pancakes; super good. My wife had the German chocolate pancakes.

rWatM1pBNepsmbu_wz7OuA.text: Cool specialty pancakes, the rest of the breakfast was above average. Little pricey for breakfast, but still a good spot (as evidenced by the crowds). Red Velvet pancakes are my #1.

qJR8Nry-ejBydQjCQayQuA.text: I've eaten at Baby Stacks other location here in Vegas in the past and always thought it was phenomenal. But I left here today feeling underwhelmed. The service and our server were both great and she was super nice - the disappointment was with the food. I ate the steak and eggs with a short stack of bacon pancakes and it all seemed to be severely lacking flavor. Everything tasted very bland, unseasoned, and not-so-fresh the way I expected coming in.

dzXuCaMST858E8fQ7oi1Yw.text: One of our favorite comfort Hawaii foods to go to when in Las Vegas. Babystacks Cafe are all over the place and you'll surely find one nearby. All the menus are the same. I usually get the chicken adobo fried rice. The portions are big, so bring your appetite or you'll be asking for a take out container.  My 9 year old son got the red velvet short stack which he said was good and he's a critic like his mom, lol!  I definitely recommend for breakfast and lunch. I haven't ate here for dinner yet, but I'm sure I would enjoy it. Great for the family, we had a party of five. Go early to avoid the wait. This place is popular due to the great food and affordable prices.

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. 03/19/18:  Chicken Adobo Fried Rice Omelet
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. 03/19/18: Red Velvet Short Stack
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Store Front

LJmTcItCtk6Kz-OMGQvwQQ.text: You better come bright and early or you'll be stuck with the 30-45 minute wait! Most of the Babystacks locations are a bit on the smaller side and they won't sit incomplete parties. For these reasons, I only give four stars.   The staff is very friendly and I love the island music they play.   Babystacks is where I became obsessed with country fried steak. It is to die for! Gravy is delicious, steak is crunchy and flavorful, hash browns (or potato squares) are my favorite!   I believe Babystacks is well known for their red velvet pancakes (you can sub your toast for pancakes for a little extra... do it). All their pancakes are delicious: lemon ricotta, white chocolate macadamia nut, s'mores pancakes... you name it!   I've also had their adobo fried rice wrapped in an egg blanket with potato squares! Yum! And their cookie butter French toast is also delicious! You can get anything on the menu and it would be yummy!   I love coming to Babystacks, but I'll only come when I'm able to wake up early.

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Loco moco with Portuguese sausage
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Country fried steak

2svwSSejRIKhOVJYJpX9ng.text: First time eating here and it's freaking packed, but rightly so! The staff here is courteous and very on the ball, and the food. Hot damn! It's delicious! I ordered the Kalua Pig Benedict and 1) we were served quickly, and 2) the food was absolutely delicious! Definitely stop here if you're looking for a breakfast spot and a possible new favorite dish!

EdCsx_tVBxygr_KjSziMPg.text: Babystacks Cafe - Henderson (2017 Yelp Review #236)  I've been a fan of Babystacks since the day I moved here.  Babystacks is very popular, especially during the weekends.  So, expect about 30 minute wait to be seated.  Their known for their specialty pancakes, including their red velvet. It's been a long time since I've had their pancakes, but I remember them to be fluffy and awesome.  Besides their pancakes, I recommend the Portuguese Sausage, the Loco Moco, and the Adobo Fried Rice.  In my opinion, Babystacks serves the best Portuguese Sausage in town.  Prices for everything on their menu is better than average and the service is always spot on.

Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. 6 Eggs &amp; Portuguese Sausage
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Portuguese Sausage

cZ62Rof9FHZROr04n-VNfQ.text: Babystacks is wonderful!! From their omelettes to their skillets you can't miss. Their pancakes are off the chain!! For me, the German Chocolate Pancakes are hands down the BEST!! The service is attentive and fast. I always come away satisfied. Do yourself a flavor and check out Babystacks, you'll be happy you did!!

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States

8xo0cp3PCQbcQ0Br2CcvKg.text: Yummy food and excellent service.  I found the pancakes to be light and fluffy. The servers were very attentive and my coffee cup never got empty.

IrnPg7ovPaWoA6b6XMUP9A.text: Wow...just wow.  Best breakfast I have had in years! I had the ranchero skillet. Chili's, green sauce, chicken, cheese, and hash browns topped with 2 over medium eggs.  Fantastic.  My girlfriend had the county fried steak and eggs.  I tried it and it was fresh and delicious.  Not chewy and tough like other places.  Pancakes are to die for.  For sure go to breakfast spot next time I'm in Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Country Fried Steak and Eggs*
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Ranchero Skillet

yuUFzGtbXh7vuEWqH2zULw.text: Love it when friends take me out to the coolest must eats in sin city.  This was definitely a must try for those out of towners.  And a helpful warning,  come early before the breakfast rush or be prepared to wait because shortly after we ordered,  lines were out the door.  You know the locals have their spot.  Chocolate chip short stack- very good. Fluffy and flavorful!  Regular buttermilk short stack- indeed yummy! Even tho I do like my edge a little crispy   Portuguese sausage plate - really good! Especially if you are a rice eater in the morning (Chel's guilty!)  Eggs benedict - sad to report that it lacked life in general.  No wow factor.  Bland.   Albeit I did love the runny yolk.    White chocolate macademia nut-were ok.  I probably wouldn't order it again.  Red velvet pancakes was my favorite! One of the best I've had.  Fluffy and flavorful.   Served with their cream cheese syrup which I asked for extra serving because it was unbelievably good!  Kept me wanting more and more!!! 5/5 stars alone!!!  Red velvet pancakes will make me come back here again next trip I'm out here.  It's also their best seller!  Service was friendly.   They were indeed short handed for a Sunday?  But I was all good since we came just in time before the breakfast rush and our order came in good timing.  So yey!  #thankful #always #foramazingpeopleinmylife

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Soooooo good!
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Red velvet
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. White chocolate macademia nut

y5mpHYz4qb1OEQxs2e8nLw.text: This place is a slice of heaven!!!  Everything is amazing - food is so good, service is excellent, price is right!! This is my favorite breakfast place!

Hk_0f3WTdTJsGkFixtYJjg.text: Having visited many different breakfast places in the Las Vegas area, we decided to give this one a try. I read many reviews about BabyStacks, and thought it sounded great. I ordered the red velvet pancakes that everyone talks about. I was very dissappointed! They were dry and hard, and not light and fluffy as I have had at many places (I never go to IHOP). I also had a skillet (which for the price) was very small.

2lmgsbFGHkk0743-rIcrjA.text: Wow! This place was amazing! Their food was delicious and such a great value for your money! Our server was top notch and on it! We had the breakfast burrito, chocolate chip pancakes and crepe crepes. I would recommend this place to everyone! Next time we come to Vegas we are coming here again for sure!!! Expect to wait but it's worth it!

DULIzGt1ogeAVCEYe8lDhQ.text: Huge selection of yummy looking pancakes! We had the Lemon Ricotta - very tasty! Good food and efficient service.

F1uv3kogoVqkZSYsTcaYkQ.text: Great customer service, we had to get to go because my boyfriend has work in an hour. The cashier was super friendly and took our order, that was the fastest our food has ever been made! We were only there for about 10 minutes, I was pretty happy about that. I'd be way happier if they'd be open 24/7, either way this place is so golden. Thank you Babystacks, we will be back again soon

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States

vaoI9EnqlFTCI8uJZSxQSQ.text: First of all, glad to have one on my side of town--yay!  Is it as good as the other locations? To be honest...nope! Something is definitely lacking here taste wise. Sadly, underwhelming.  In a couple visits, I was able to order and sample the following:  -Red velvet pancakes, still good, but not great. Cream cheese syrup is a must! -Cinnabon pancakes, nice flavor, but dry texture. -Bananas foster pancakes, my favorite! The sauce was amazing--not too sweet =) -Pineapple pancakes, tasted like pineapple upside cake!  Also, tasted like there was like some kind of liqeur in there...rum? Probably not. Had mine with cream cheese syrup (extra 0.75)  -Loco moco w/ garlic rice, patty sucks...plain and simple. It didn't have any flavor. Seemed like a frozen patty. I thought they made their own? Oh well. Not ordering this anymore. -Adobo fried rice (Our server called it "adoBE" fried rice...hehe). This one was a winner, actually BETTER than the other locations. Massive portion and lots of adobo chunks. Enough for two people to share. -Chili loco moco, pretty good, except they use the same boring patty and really skimp on the chili. Wish they topped the plate with more chili. -Kahlua pig grilled cheese, eh OK. It is missing a flavor profile. Maybe add a slaw for tang and texture or a nice aioli?  No matter what, I will still come here because I really do love Babystacks. I hope the food tastes better tho =X

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Carrot cake pancakes
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Specials 8/17/14
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Kahlua grilled cheese--just OK

OpApL5tUuYgFMOqpMonx2w.text: I've been to the location on Durango a couple times .. You can tell it's def not the same cooks, overall "OK"..  The food lacked a little flavor in the food.. Some salt maybe?   Food items chosen : * Nutella Crepes - simple, thick, Nutella crepes topped with whipped cream and almonds  * Country Fried Steak (comes with your choice of eggs, side potato and pancake) - crispy outside, moist inside, nothing special  * Plain Pancakes - served with butter and syrup * Side of Portugese Sausage - had to get a side of it, who doesn't like Portugese Sausage  \_()_/  * Chili Moco (comes with eggs and side of potatoes) - Loco Moco smothered in chili, at first sounded good but when actually eating it.. It was pretty bland.. I was expecting a more authentic Hawaiian chili and the ground beef patty needed flavor.. Eggs weren't that great but the seasoned potatoes were good..  Expected more out of the items because I enjoyed the previous visits at the other location.. They just need to add a touch of love to the food.   Service was kind of slow but staff were still friendly ..  Maybe the food will get better as time passes.. But will most likely come back considering it's close to home..
