Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States

RTH0uxa3HQI9YErhqVDKpQ.text: Color me a fan.  I never made the trip all the way out west to try any of the older BabyStacks Cafe locations, but now that they're easily accessible to us Henderson-lings, I made it a point to go as soon as I reasonably could. That opportunity came this morning.  Walking in, I saw that it was packed and that people were sitting in the front area. Bit of confusion at the front when they didn't ask me whether I wanted to sit down or make a to-go order, so I asked if I could sit. Most of the tables looked full, and I wasn't sure whether the people in the front were waiting for a table or for a to-go order, but one of the employees told me that they had room at the counter and I immediately accepted.  After agonizing over the menu for a while, I went ahead and got a full stack of red velvet pancakes ($8.95) with a side of two eggs ($2.00), scrambled per my choice. It took about 10 minutes for my order to come out, but I don't mind a little wait when the food is supposed to be good.  Turns out that it was really, really good. What I saw was a platter of six red pancakes, each about four inches in diameter, topped with a huge dollop of cold whipped cream, a dusting of chocolate sprinkles, and a plastic cup of cream cheese "syrup" (plus a second cup later when my server asked if I wanted more). What I tasted was absolute indlgence. The fluffy pancakes with a bit of crispiness on the edges, the cold cream to provide a temperature contrast, and the almost buttery syrup were all enjoyable to the last bite, even after I got almost sickeningly full. Heavenly.  Eggs were alright. Not sure if they were even large eggs, but I wanted some protein so I got some. Maybe I could've added a bit of salt, but no biggie. They served their purpose.  I wish that they'd stay open for dinner, but I'll take what I can get. Hopefully their Hawaiian/Filipino specialites measure up to the luxurious red velvet pancakes. I will certainly be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Specials are posted in the front. They sound pretty good.
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Red velvet pancakes, full stack. Side of two eggs.
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Menu pg. 4

h9a-qkVOAAQAjl7ISVsbPw.text: Well, I found a new breakfast place! Ok, I didn't personally find it but our friends recommended meeting there for breakfast today and I am so happy they did.   Babystacks recently opened their Henderson location on Stephanie. Our waitress was great, very friendly and good service. We were served coffee within a minute or two of sitting down. The food did take a while to come out after ordering but we weren't in a hurry and it was definitely worth the wait (and the calories!)   I ordered their specialty, a full stack (6) of red velvet pancakes. They were served with whipped cream and a cream cheese "syrup" which was more of an icing. They were delicious! The short stack would have been fine but you only live once. We will definitely be back to try some egg dishes or nutella crepes.

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Full stack of red velvet pancakes with cream cheese syrup. YUM!!

jiCxtyzj8j8HIvrZNqEokw.text: Well this was my first time eating there. I have to say even on a Sunday morning with a ton of business it was a good experience. The food was amazing; pancakes are phenomenal and the potatoes were great! Only complaint was on how long it took to get the check

x5oZ1AALqsVugGEJ6ycUyw.text: Wow! Rick's adobo rice wrapped with omelette is a bomb!!!!  The wait is not that bad on a Saturday around lunch time. Food is exceptional! Service is fast!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States

2UO2zGGBpoLUxJiJpNoEAQ.text: They have really good pancakes here I've never really tried anything else there but the pancakes are really good with a cup of orange juice but I always ask for a little extra butter because they use real butter but I don't use all the better but it's really good just try the pancakes you don't have to get the orange juice but try the pancakes and a little bit of syrup it's really good

xuXu1g2GM4BzzCl2yJiC8w.text: My family has been coming to this location since we moved to Las Vegas in 2013 . The wait can make you a little impatient but trust me , the food is worth it ! Our wait is usually no more than 20-30 minutes depending on the time of day . Their menu has expanded over the years with such great choices !  My personal favorite is the Banana Foster Pancakes with seasoned potatoes on the side . I was completely opposed to any toppings on buttermilk pancakes before (I'm plain jane when it comes to seasonings and toppings) but THIS will change anyone's mind ! The pancakes are cooked to perfection and the caramel and banana toppings are amaze . I always have leftovers to take home for later. The service is always outstanding , especially the server with the cool hair !

WGBNqZCwcYEpPGz-GSs-EA.text: Service is friendly, prompt, and attentive.  There were three of us.  It was my daughter's second visit there, first for my wife and me.   The food was excellent with an extensive menu ranging from loco moco, basic eggs varieties, with sausage or spam, to steak, and eggs benedict.  Their pancakes variety is the widest and wildest I've ever experienced.  Out of curiosity, I had the creamsicle pancakes and it exceeded my expectations...absolutely delicious.  It's a "guarantee to return" place.

dY0AptmSgEnhdl-OSZx9dQ.text: Came back the next morning to try different menu items.  This time brought the parents and we were a party of 4.  We arrived around 10am and were told it would be a 20 min. wait.  We decided to go for it since we know it was worth the wait.  We were seated right around 20-25 mins. later.  Normally this wouldn't be a problem as we were told how long the wait was, but we were seeing parties of 2, 3, and 4 that arrived after us being seated before us at 4 top tables.  Once we were seated, we promptly were greated by our server Eric.  He took our drink orders and brought them out fairly quickly.  Our orders were placed and this is where things went a little south.  We didn't get our food until after 11:10am.  When our food arrived, my pancakes were missing.  Eric advised me they were working on them.  In the meantime, my mom had spilled her maple syrup and had asked for another.  Eric never brought the syrup back so she only ate about half of the pancakes.  After another 10 mins. after receiving our food, my pancakes had not yet arrived and I had finished my eggs benedict.  Every one else was nearing being done eating as well.  I flagged down Eric and let him know he could cancel the pancakes.  He apologized and said he would take them off the bill.  The pancakes were actually the side to my Benedict, so there was nothing to remove from the bill and when we got the bill, nothing was taken off.  The time is now 11:35am and we have to be at a noon appointment, so we quickly paid and left.  If this was my first experience here, I would have rated it 3 stars, but because I know service can differ day to day and the day before was point on, I'm only going to remove one star.

_G8jsxaeoyeuxnLALN0RXA.text: 4 of us came in for Sunday breakfast and had just an OK experience. Like several other recent reviews, the service was quite a let-down. They may have been understaffed, however from our perspective the staff were inattentive and slow.   The food was alright -- a touch cold due to everything being so slow -- but, I will say the Portuguese Sausage and Garlic Fried Rice are quite tasty!

-g8kMwxd7nYeDC89xJpw7g.text: I love this place!! I like to order the Hawaiian Benedict. The gravy is so good! I go only during the week as it's a VERY popular place on the weekends. My family has enjoyed many wonderful meals here!!

bfKF4iATy_wFpLILBYZPYw.text: Erik was our server, had the tiramisu pancakes it was amazing and extremely fluffy. Chicken salad was fresh and chicken was cruchy and the ranch dressing is made in house. It was our first time coming here and we will be coming back.

rPoW_sp-RBnDvJZ4v4Ihag.text: Love this place!! I had the Loco Moco and it was delicious!! I have been several times and everything I have tried has been great! Staff is always friendly :) Only thing is, if you go on the weekends the wait is long but that also shows how good the place is.

5q4UFPQOSmmHngu2r5UK0A.text: Been here twice now. Both times the service was great. Friendly and attentive.  The first time, a few months ago, the place was packed. The food actually was better.  This time we were practically the only ones there. The food wasn't as good. I had the Wheat French Toast. It tasted good but was a bit over cooked. My side of scrambled eggs came out cold. My partners egg scramble was also over cooked on the potatoes. Seemed like the kitchen just wasn't on point.

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Wheat French Toast. Looks over cooked because it is!

Fst15_B-dUrEOZMowCi0mw.text: Being from Hawai'i, eating at Babystacks Cafe is like immersing myself back in the islands. The taste of the pancakes here is reminiscent of Oahu's Cinnamon's, and is wonderful! After dining here a few times, I can say that the servers are always very polite and make great suggestions.  In the world of pancakes, I'd have to say that the Bananas Foster was my favorite! My boyfriend however, said that his favorite was the red velvet. We also tried the corned beef hash breakfast and the rachero omelette (pics attached) which were equally delicious. Corned beef hash is such an island favorite! They let you upgrade to garlic rice for $1 extra which is well worth it.   Next time we go back, we're looking forward to trying all the kalua pig options on the menu! Try to go early if you can so you can avoid the line. But even if you have to wait in line, there is a pokestop next door at Mongolian Grill!

1z7EOhtDmYOJrLe_1u9LvA.text: I don't get the hype with this places at all.firstly it reminds me of eating in a high school gym at lunch time during the busiest hours.the owners have have spent very little on decorating the place just put some cheap wooden benches down,and said "we are a Restarant,I thought the pancakes were just ok lacked Fluffiness and father small  My wife's gash browns were way over cooked and her eggs where cooked over easy not over medium NOPE won't be back however try it for urself but it didn't WOW me at all...

eraRZQ1oPm3BXnEuQDy4kQ.text: We put our name on the wait list for 2, then 3 parties came after us, then a young couple came in and got sat right away, the kid working the front then sat 4 parties that came after us, so i decided to look at the waiting list to find our name already crossed out, obviously he gave what shouldve been our table to the young couple that he sat right away, i asked the kid why our name was already crossed out and he had no answer and just sat us right away, wasted over 30mins, i ordered one of the eggs benedict only to have my eggs pretty much hard boiled, the waitress offered to have them remade, but we didnt want to be there and wait any longer and the possibility of having a side of spit on my eggs, so i declined, service sucked and food sucked, get it right the first time and maybe the review would be better

Kg2fb3qdiO-te317KzPC6A.text: Normally love this place. I even tell people about it all the time. After today, I wouldn't recommend it to anybody Cuz I would be embarrassed to. First of all,  I ordered a side of bacon extra crispy for my daughter. When the food came, there was no bacon.  I remember ordering it because I asked her if she just wanted one side or two and she said one so I told the server just one side of bacon. So I had to reorder it and said extra crispy. My daughter finally got her bacon and my son and I were already done with our food.  The bacon was not crispy so she only ate part of the bacon that I paid $3.95 for.  Aside from that,  the guy bringing our drinks gave us one straw when we had 2 cold drinks. We had to keep hunting someone down for a straw. The couple at the table next to us didn't even get any.  Then,  nobody came for refills for coffee.  I finally saw someone come out to do refills but he just talked to the one table he refilled and went back in the kitchen.  I was finally asked if I wanted more coffee when the server came to give me my ticket. We had been done eating for about 10 minutes by then.  Today was really disappointing.  By the way, all that time I was waiting for a straw, I watched the guy bring out every drink and just walked away without giving them straws and he had them in his apron pocket

yBfTnq3CFh8l3tPFh0b2Xw.text: For the past couple of times that I ate at Babystacks, it has been a hit and miss for me.  The last time we ate there, at the Henderson location, our rice was not properly cooked.  As someone who is Asian and having rice as our staple food, we kind of know how it should be prepared.  AND, if an establishment will be serving Island/Asian infused food, they should get the rice cooked properly.  It was annoying having to eat soggy but hard rice with the spam.  Just didn't seem kosher.  So that just kind of put a bad taste in my mouth, literally.  But I still gave them 3 stars because the pancakes are always amazing!

YMjS9GyClQ9XO2GKhvs39A.text: Babystacks Cafe has wonderful service. They are quick, polite, and efficient. I ordered the red velvet pancakes, which were pretty yummy. I am not really a huge pancake fan, and I likely won't order them again, but it was definitely worth trying it once. My boyfriend had the banana cream pancakes, which I liked. yenmvyqZGy83VBFPu3C1PA.text: It's a good cafe, but I wouldn't say it's amazing. I got a skillet and a side of red velvet pancakes (which are their top dishes), and both of them came in within 15 minutes which is pretty long wait for a restaurant. The red velvet pancakes were fluffy and flavorful, but the skillet was like a normal skillet with no special ingredients or anything. I'd come back but it's not a must for me.

2SzCoi4555Km5JbmnMWGiQ.text: We won't go back.   Walked in and were seated almost immediately. Before we even sat in our chairs a server asked us what we want to drink we hadn't even looked at the menu and had no clue what they .  I opted for Diet Coke while my fiance got Dr Pepper which came out clear.  We ask them to check that apparently the syrup had run out. Took them 10 minutes to get another Dr Pepper to us.    In the same 10 seconds that we were asked what to drink we were asked if we were ready to order again haven't even looked at the menu.  The waitress was overly attentive it was actually annoying.  We both got omelettes and to be honest for 25 bucks I could've fed 25 people at my house.  And it would've tasted better.  I can only assume it's strictly a pancake place.    We felt so rushed in there as the crowd started getting bigger waiting to get seated they look at you and watch you eat.  Paying for your meal is a joke took about 15 minutes just to get to the register to pay.  We gave it a try but we won't go back.

v-G-vrYrFfQhGGZH0kWUJA.text: The only entree I order from here is the Loco Moco. If I had to choose one breakfast dish for the rest of my life, this would be the meal. The loco moco is a  definite must try (poached eggs-medium, garlic rice, seasoned potatos).

Ce2NePY3riwwb0KGQxqUiw.text: If you love pancakes, this is the place to go in Henderson.   When ever we are in Vegas or Henderson, we stop by before driving home.   Love the banana foster and butterfinger pancakes.   Wife loves the nutella crepes.   Solid hash and the Portuguese sausage are fun.     Service is always friendly.  For things other than pancakes, the food has a Hawaiian Filipino influence, again delicious and fun.

4fztS5TU_416Kjw5rGlFFA.text: I came here because I was craving for breakfast they wasnt that busy took our server a little more time to assist us the food is okay not as great as other restaurants she only check on us once never refill my water when it was time to pay a Mexican guy was cashing us out and wasnt really happen on the tip I give. If your going to give someone a bad attitude because of the tip you didn't like keep it to yourself. Tips are optional when you get good service. If your money is all you guys care about and not guest service then I hope you guys get more training for your employees

0L-a1F2BhbS19IzfkRjMVg.text: They do not take reservations and there was a long wait on Sunday even at 130pm. Inside waiting area was full and several more waiting outside. I did appreciate the hostess requiring for everyone in the party to be there before they put them down on the list.   Then came an unfortunate bad judgment call by the hostess while we were waiting to get seated.  At some point someone left and when they came back  the hostess gave them the next table. Not fair to those that stayed and were patiently waiting.  It delayed our seating as they already were playing Tetris to fit our party of 6.  Six parties that came in after us were seated (3 of them taking the rare and precious larger tables - but not the patrons fault but they felt our pain - even one person advised that we were here way before them)  Had egg white omelet with chicken spinach and mushrooms. Came with potatoes. No cheese but included for same $9.25 price.  Egg whites are $1.25 extra. Senior breakfast well worth it $6.95 for two eggs, side of meat potatoes and 2 pancakes. Can substitute for toast. Eggs were done perfect.  Server came to the table to get drink order right as soon as we sat down. When he dropped off our drinks took our food order and about 10 minutes later the food came out. Everything the way we requested.  Niece ordered abobo omelet. Was better this time. Last time was a bit salty for my taste but was told that's normal (that adobo in general is slightly salty not that is how the restaurant prepares it)  Food 4 stars Server 4 stars - got everything perfect and technically didn't need anything but never checked back on us Having to wait longer due to bad judgment and making excuses why they thought they had to which will cause me never to come back  0 stars

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Full house at 145pm Sunday! Bring your patience but worth the wait :)

T1uL6lav5hdv_otbchK2aQ.text: My friends and I usually eat at this restaurant and if pretty much had a halfway decent experience! We went here recently and was shown a great deal of disrespect! We were asked to be seated and we're not seated! The restaurant was empty by the way! And they also said that because one person in our group had not arrived yet that they would not seat us! The guy who was helping us was a very flamboyant homosexual and was very attitude e and disrespectful! We are grown men who are born and raised in this city and should not have to deal with this type of disrespect from a little punk! Will definitely never be eating at this establishment ever again! We will definitely be spreading the word of the unprofessionalism of this restaurant! And when we called to ask for the manager the little punk hung up on us and would not put one on the phone!

l_iHVR1fgiFIijJO5PFnGQ.text: I've been to the location at Buffalo but this one was by far more cleaner, modern, and less crowded. As far as food quality goes, it's pretty much the same. They have a great selection of pancakes; from banana pancakes to chocolate mint! They also have a lot of comfort/filling food. They have Loco mocos, breakfast foods such as eggs, spam, and rice. I recommended getting the island favorite, which consist of rice, eggs, banana nut muffin, and porteguese sausage. For pancakes, I really like the red velvet and chocolate mint. The prices are around 10 dollars a plate, the pancakes comes in stack of 2 for 4 dollars each. They service is friendly and they take care of you.  Update: after being here a handful of times, I strongly suggest trying out their skillets, specially the Huntington skillet. Also for pancakes, give their German chocolate pancake a bite!

phX6gbSHAcMzmNhYxEL_0A.text: Went for breakfast with several friends, food was delicious but I had pancakes and hard to eat because the plate, maybe like a salad plate size was the size of my pancakes and so when I poured syrup on them, it rolled off onto the table. Yuck, messy!  Others in our party also commented on the small plates. Also, though food tasted good, very tight seating, not a way I want to enjoy the start of my day.

lGGC76vuI8-9YtllsppmfQ.text: Terrible customer service. Sat us close to restroom & kitchen & when I asked to be reseated they claimed all the tables were needed for guest waiting. So apparently I wasn't a guest that needed to be serviced or made to enjoy my experience.

Qx7RG5Vr2s9-AC5tdmHOJA.text: Been here a few times...Be prepared for a wait on weekends ...depends on the weekdays.   Pancakes are always fluffy and good flavors so if you or someone you know LOVES pancakes this is the number on spot. My favorite so far is carrot cake. I tried banana cream pie today and is was pretty good. It had a whipped topping, cut bananas and almonds. I usually like the toppings but the banana pancake was good on its own.   I had a classic breakfast today- I ordered Portuguese Sausage with two sunny side up eggs and garlic rice. This is the best way to order it cause you just put the eggs right over the rice and yum. If you don't like too much garlic and onions stick with regular rice. You do need a breath mint after eating.   I like the food here and it's good. The price is okay and the servers were nice. You will enjoy this place but I recommend a small group so you don't have to wait too long.

sde88RrrI1bPg6UX-roc4w.text: I really do love going to Babystacks Cafe. It is a nice place to indulge on a weekend when you won't feel as bad for eating a stack of sugar stacked on sugar. Seriously, all 20 or so options of pancake combinations are amazing. What is also amazing at this cafe and that I really suggest every tries, is their Lolo Rick's Adobo Fried Rice, sooo good and flavorful.  The only thing that could be different that would probably be popular with a lot of their patrons is that they do not split checks here! I understand the reasoning, it just can be slightly inconvenient with groups of people.

BbnyVtImwBe_3JWi4C644Q.text: I've been to Babystacks twice. Each time it was fairly busy. People on Yelp seem to like it well enough. I was enticed by the photos of meals and pancake creations. However, each time I've been here, I've been underwhelmed by the main dish I chose (first time was adobe fried rice omelette, second time was country fried steak with garlic rice.) I am pretty particular about my eggs in that I prefer them to be cooked when I eat them. All too often I've ordered a fried egg and they arrive under cooked. While here, I asked for a fully cooked fried egg. The server suggested medium and added that the yoke would still be runny. That's fine with me if the yoke is runny, I'd just like the white parts to be fully cooked. Well, when I received my meal, the outside of the egg was cooked, the yoke was runny, but there was a significant part of the white part on the inside that was still raw. It was more like over easy. I don't like that at all and had requested that it be fully cooked. I don't personally find it difficult to fully cook an egg, even while keeping the yoke a bit runny. So this was a disappointment. The rest of the dish was fine, but not amazing. When scrambled, the eggs here seem fine, but I think a restaurant should offer well served eggs in all variations. Also the garlic rice, which was described as being garclicy with onions, tasted fairly bland. As far as the pancakes go, they have an incredible range of flavor choices, I loved having all those options. However, both times I have dined here, my experience with the pancakes did not exceed places like IHOP or Denny's in terms of fluffiness and flavor. (However IHOP's eggs do not even meet my basic requirements. In fact, my other wanted to go to IHOP this morning, but thinking about their eggs, I Yelped a bit and we settled on Babystacks.) Anyway, back to my review, I couldn't even finish the entire half stack of pancakes before feeling sick. And let me tell you, I am a sugar fiend. Waffles, pancakes and French toast with all the sugary sweet toppings are my jam. Unfortunately, I will probably not be returning here because my experiences have been consistently underwhelming. Please keep in mind, the service was great, and it seems that many people enjoy this place just fine. This is just my experience and I hope it is helpful one way or another.

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States

N_EqZQI_BMuwaMNmi5r1kg.text: Our favorite breakfast joint in Las Vegas! The staff is really friendly even though they're always ridiculously busy! There's always a wait period but it's worth it! You can't go wrong with anything on the menu!

zp8gKWunSarrn-zDfgc4Rg.text: I have been to both locations and the service and food was great at both locations. I love the fact that they have Hawaiian favorites on the menu, such as spam, loco moco and Portuguese sausage. Arrive early cause it gets busy for breakfast.

EtK2KVWc_qlQjTEK6GMeXQ.text: It was a great time. Waited only 15 mins to get a table on a Saturday morning, which wasn't bad at all. Food was delicious as always, I recommend the cinnabun pancake. It was all my dreams came True on a pancake. It brought me peace of mind when I took that first bite. It was HONESTLY heaven on a pancake, but that's just me.  Our waiter was a nice guy and even tho he messed up my girlfriends order a little bit. He saw he made a mistake and took the food away and made it fresh immediately.  I recommend this to anyone with the love for the finer breakfast and brunch places, also low on the price of food. Thanks for having me!

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Biscuits and gravy!
Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. CINNABON PANCAKE WITH RED VELVET!

sX_nACQEvrORYxq4B0cvEw.text: Holy food portions and goodness. While you may never get your bill (???), the food and service was fantastic. The combinations of salty and sweet will cure any Las Vegas hangover!

T-Fflt9B5cPNN5mttQPk3g.text: I heard of babystacks thru a co-worker and decided to check it out with my mom to have breakfast and it was amazing!  Friendly staff to greet you as you come in and we got a table fast didn't have to wait too long. We had Lili as our waiter she had a smile on her face the whole time and was very nice she came to check on us often. Well definitely be back ,try the red velvet pancakes there great !

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Yummy red velvet pancakes

r3Rytw4jVmaXpPbPjpAVlQ.text: I went here for breakfast this morning.  I heard to this place from my girlfriend and she wanted to try it out so we gave it a go this morning.  Upon arrival they seemed pretty busy and I thought we were going to have to wait seeing there were only a few tables.  We got to sit down right away.  I've read all the review about how they had poor service or slow service.  Today or at least with us the service was great.  No complaints in that department.   I ended up ordering carrot cake pancakes and steak and eggs.  It did not disappoint.  The food was nice and hot and delicious.  If I had to complain about anything it would be about how small the restaurant.  I can honestly see Babystacks Cafe outgrowing this building.  If they had a larger building they'd definitely make tons of money because the breakfast was good and I'd definitely go back again.   Babystacks has a Eggworks kinda feel to it but on a smaller scale.  I don't want to say ignore the bad reviews but just prepared for a wait.....and if you don't have to wait then that's a plus.     The employees have a family feel so I was curious and asked if the restaurant was family owned and the answer was yes.  Definitely give it a go and compliment me like crazy because I'm super awesome!

Ir_z8YP8pTr3bvP_gzYErQ.text: If you love breakfast food, you won't be disappointed. We went on a Sunday at 2:00, an hour before closing and they were pretty busy. But we got right in and food didn't take too long either. Lots, maybe too many items to choose from on the menu. My husband loved the Cinnabon pan cakes.

fO1WmJyjZQbcYq1mdGGzTQ.text: This place was recommended to me and I must say...FANTASTIC pancakes! They have such a unique selection. I'd try different kinds but every time I go, I just need to order the banana cream pie stacks. Great food and friendly atmosphere at a decent price.

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Mexican skillet and banana pie pancakes!

3yB_tjfD860Ka3m4po7cGA.text: Finally had a chance to try this earlier and I'm very happy that I did. Ordered the corn beef hash (first time in my 34 years of life) and it was so damn good! Upgraded to the garlic rice which was phenomenal and saved the buttermilk pancakes for last, those babies melted in my mouth. Definitely visiting this spot again. Service was fast and very friendly.

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Cornbeef hash, eggs, garlic rice and the best pancakes I&#39;ve ever eaten.

RCxSjw1Gsl4a5bnEpVEWDA.text: Been here a couple of times and tried different breakfast specials with different pancakes and I must say they never dissapoint. This is one of my favorite place to dine in Henderson. Not to mention the friendly servers that make you feel welcome. Too bad they don't open late but it's definitely worth going there for breakfast or ealy lunch.

gIOKGFW2fqAtyPL57RiUdg.text: The food was good, not amazing (as described by other patrons.) The service wasn't great but good. I don't care for how the food comes out whenever the dish is ready versus the entire order for the table brought out at once. This was our first visit so we ordered things that were seemingly popular. I don't have to have it but I will visit again. Maybe something on the menu will be "amazing".

pFtkL9IDXhvIx3PTTIhOgQ.text: First time at this location. Went here with my roommates and we loved it!!! I got the strawberry lemonade pancakes w/ a side of Portuguese sausage and it was delicious. The pancakes had the essence of strawberry lemonade so it was not overpoweringly sweet or tart. Paired perfectly with the cream cheese syrup. They were cooked perfect (fluffy but with a cake like texture).Everything we had tasted FRESH. Great service as well. Thank you Valerie! We will be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Babystacks Cafe - Henderson, NV, United States. Strawberry Lemonade Pancakes. PERFECTION.

hTv2tGVxasZkqG66omKMYA.text: I love pancakes and anything to do with breakfast. I wasn't blown away by this place. I definitely wasn't a fan of their pancakes, good ol buttermilk pancakes, but I didn't think they were terrible either....just not to my taste. Not sure if I'll return because nothing really stood out to me.

SguyLx7XFFzxISSxM1Dl-w.text: The food was excellent although service was mediocre.  I ordered the omelettes and it was cooked perfectly cooked. We also ordered lemon ricotta pancakes that was so good. We also ordered kalbi steak with eggs and garlic rice and the rice was so tasty. All the entrees came with pancakes and pancakes were soooo good

7zgXvWyaJHnVzkryvEv-GQ.text: Awesome place to eat a delicious breakfast! I had the breakfast burrito , and a side of garlic onion fried rice, I cant complain it definitely made my morning. :) great service also. This is officially my new spot!

bqGKB5TZu0-miwGP0i3ZrQ.text: We were rolling out of Vegas headed back to Phoenix and my wife heard about their Red Velvet Pancakes and had to have some so we stopped in. The place was packed on a Sat. morning but tables were turned quickly so it wasn't that bad of a wait time. I had a chicken fried steak with over easy eggs and smores pancakes-YUM! The wife loves her Red Velvet Pancakes as well. Great food, great service, good prices!

W0Jx7Tf3z6B5Nr5l3hdZdg.text: I don't have to say anything other then...red velvet pancakes!!! Pumpkin in season!!!! No need to order anything else!!!!!

P5flZLDJZu-hJXDVrGEG0Q.text: Service was great!  Steak and eggs were cooked exactly as ordered and the corned beef hash was a-mazing

5BhFdrZqKKHixMv_z_p08A.text: Love this place for breakfast, lunch, or brunch! Too bad they are not open for dinner. :)  The food and service has always been great. But I had to give them 4 out of 5 stars because the wait for our food is a little longer than normal compared to similar restaurants.

OLeyBM0IRULMM-o1hFNdpw.text: Good for one or two people .  They don't split checks other then in half.   Won't see you if your whole party is not there.   Even if you said they are around the corner they want seat you .   They also served cold coffee as well ?  No freshness ?  I know it's just coffee but what's your Standard ? Wasn't aloud to sit outside it was closed because it was dirty they said.  Standards again ?  Place was not for me and my family and friends so didn't want to here any more rules from this place so we left

ekqb_2H14dx-4VrUF5EgXQ.text: I swear, the weekend starts to roll around and I begin fixating on the a-MAZ-ing banana pancakes I had.  Once.  Can't get them out of my mind.  And then there was the adobo fried rice that was recommended to my husband by a friend.  Mmmm....  But back to the pancakes.  Generous amount of fresh banana slices with a banana sauce on fluffy pancakes served with light whipped cream.  Enough said.

j4PwwwwvSXWNyOUVHzZM9Q.text: A great little breakfast spot - lots of different kind of pancakes.  I had the Red Velvet (Yum) with whipped cream and cream cheese icing.  A "short stack" was plenty!!  Hubby had french toast with eggs.  They have lots of breakfast specialties and Hawaiian items as well.

YuiMSWJhNbd6WQHWHav1Yg.text: Wow, this place blew my mind - an attraction off The Strip.  I'm typically not a pancake person, but I ate my whole shortstack and main plate.  Whoops.  So much flavor and deliciousness!  Definitely coming back.

GV_Z9XIxVk2bFDqN0D_67g.text: Probably will never eat here again. This place wasn't somewhere to rant about or even think about going back. Service was ok, but I want the food good also.

bUbT8rRAqN96yl1theTyvQ.text: Been here several times for breakfast.  Food and service is ALWAYS excellent.  Amazing pancake selection.  The pig Benedict and banana pancakes is my usual.

SYJvKhLhIeFBthzuHizKxw.text: my family loves this place! the food is so GOOD and we never have to wait too long. they have lots of creative dishes on the menu for great prices.  the only thing we wish they had more of....space. we love to bring our friends and family from out of town here but the restaurant seems hard pressed to accommodate larger groups. other than that I would definitely recommend you try babystacks!!

nzfN4JsI8ywfE44RpCKkhw.text: My husband and I met to eat at Babystacks during our lunch break from work. We were seated promptly at a table right in the front of the restaurant.   It was a freezing day and every time someone would open the front doors a huge gust of icy cold air would rush over us. It took a long time for our food to come out. Only my Eggs Benedict were served, so I had to eat it before my husband's burger came several minutes later or it'd get cold. Right away I noticed it's appearance was pretty sad. Also, the eggs were hard cooked, not runny at all. I notified the waiter, who asked if I wanted it remade. I had to decline due to time constraints.  Their bathroom was pretty nasty. It was smelly and the grout is disgustingly filthy. Our waiter didn't bring our bill, so we just went up to the cashier and the clerk there printed it up for us. My husband's burger was decent though. The Eggs Benedict at The Original Pancake House (Fort Apache & Flamingo) blows this place' out of the water. 0% chance of ever returning.
